item.dc:creator: A.Barnett
item.content:encoded:
Hullo, blog-thing. It's me again. They're drunk as usual. If you don't know by now, they're my parents. I don't care. I hope they leave me alone this time. I can't wait to get the lock on my door. I can't wait to move out. Angela's mad at me. I'm sad. I'm happy. I'm confused. I wish life were easier sometimes. Of course, now I contradict what I told my mom earlier, but I don't mind. But does that make me a hypocrite? If it does, I'm sorry. And if it doesn't? I'm sorry too. I guess saying sorry is a hard habit to break. Sorry, sorry, sorry. My life is full of sorries and broken things. Look at all the little pieces dear blog, look at them all. Sometimes I feel so broken. No one is helping me aside from sunny. I feel the weight of the world on my shoulders. Sorry, probably my fault. Something has to me. My fault so many years ago for being so innocent and naive. Stupid me who was afraid of storms. And stupid me who thought she could trust. Stupid, stupid, stupid. People have been telling me it's not my fault, that he's a sick man. But I feel horrible. Dirty. I want it to go away. But it doesn't, does it? It never does, it never will. I will have to remember someone else on me. I will have to always see that night so vividly in my mind, I will always, ALWAYS remember it.
And I don't suppose it is fair.
My life? A war. A waging world war three and four. Three with the divorce when my sister and I were the weapons of mass destruction, and now world war four, my sister and I pivoted against each other by a cruel hand of fate. How monotonous, how droll, how unfair and cruel. So much of this war. Is that all I will ever know?
I suppose many must think me sweet and innocent, incapable of committing such heinous crimes against others. But I'll tell you I was a greedy little child, blog-thing. I wanted things like all children do. I will never forget my lies, and the heavy prices my sister and I paid for them. The rivers of tears, the screams, the fits.
Am I going insane dear-blog? Am I going off? I hope not. I think not. So why does everyone stare at me so gosh darn sad?! What s it that concerns them? My eating habits? My scars? My ever ad and despondent eyes so empty of youth and shine?! Or could it be the fact that my childhood was robbed from me? I will ask sunny. She can tell me. She can help me when no one else can.
Oh this horrid thoughts in me. I have half the mind not to publish this. But who cares?! I'm already made fun of! I already can't go outside without Evans laughed at? So why do I care? Oh people who know me or don't know me and read this. I ask not for your pity, so don't give it. All you have read is a plea for help from a child to one's parents, who are too far into their own problems to help.
Yes, don't give me any pity for I will only throw it back at you and smile, smile, smile. I will keep on going,a and I will not crack.
For when no one will help me, do you know what I've got? I've got a drop of sunshine in my pocket. A honey colored stone that reminds me of the sunlight that so warms me.
~Amanda.
P.S. I failed my math test by the way.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Sorry for the non-updation.
Average Yo reporting.
This is because this weekend has not been as boring as normal. Also, the NEW version of runescape is out and I have been playing it. Sad isn't it? Well, let me explain my situation.

On Saturday, I was strapped for time. Here was the situation... My ACT test and Band Concert were on the same day. ACT in the morning, Band after that. If I didn't go to band, my grade would go down. If I didn't go to the ACT testing, 20$ and 2 months worth of studying would go down the drain. As I entered McCutcheon (however you spell it) high school, I noticed alot of other people. I had to leave around noon if I had any chance of making it. I talked to the supervisor and she said that I could not leave early. Anyways, I started to panic. Then I looked at a little yellow book on her desk. It said the test was scheduled to end at 12:30. Now this freaked me out because now I had to make a choice. I am never good at making choices. I either had to choose to take the ACT and not risk my grade, or risk my grade and take the ACT. I picked to take the ACT, and I'm glad I chose that. Well, the test area was shown to me by red placards with little white arrows on them. I just followed the arrows and I soon entered a white cinderblock room. The off-white disturbed me for some reason. This classroom was packed with what I guess was high schoolers. There was a large clock in the middle of the room. Everything seemed symetrical. After all, this is a standardized test. The instructor instructed us with pre-fabricated rules that she read off of a booklet. There were 4-tests and they were pretty easy.

As I was taking the test, time got to be an issue. I was always looking at my watch, my head was filled with hope (what I thought as false hope at that time). I needed to get to the band concert. Then the test ended. We were dismissed at 12:10 and not a minuite too late. I rushed to the car, leaped in, and my family rushed me down to a high school in the middle of the cornfield. In this high school, my classmates were already tuning. Finally, I got to the school and it was a mad dash for the door. I sped in and asked the staff where the my band class was. When I got into the right room, I was relieved. It was pretty close. If I was a minuite late, I might have not made it onto the stage. And it all ended with a happy ending (our band got a "gold" rating.) So, that was my saturday. Well sunday? I didn't do much. I was planning to make more of my movie, but we need a cameraperson. I'm thinking of inviting Devin again so we can proceed with the movie.

I also mowed the lawn. I think it's pretty thereputic. You sit there in the sun, the engine blaring, and just think. I steer the mower sub-conciously. I don't even have to focus, I just steer it into tall grass. Well, that's my weekend.

Bye;)

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Average Yo reporting.
I should be in bed by now, but I just had to update.
Anyways, I am doing this huge "Invention Convention" thing at school. I'm doing most of the work and everyone else is just "chillin". Anyways, I went bezerk while doing a worksheet and decided to go on a freeware downloading spree. It seems exciting, but with a 48k dial-up internet connection, it isn't. I got all the necessary tools like adaware and freshdownload. These are programs that help with downloading. And best of all, they are free! I like free things. Except that candy they give you at Wal-Mart on holidays. Oh yea, I didn't like that free cake they had at Best Buy. I should stop talking about free things before I throw up. Anyways, Karl told me to download this game called "Gun Bound". It's a tank game and it seems fun. Karl said it was simple, and fun. It turns out this "simple" game is 94MEGABYTES! It was a shocker. And now I'm going to have to wait all night for this 94MEGABYTE file to download. What makes me really envious is that with a T1 connection (1.5MEGABYTES per second), I would have to wait about 60 seconds for it to load. I'm waiting 6 HOURS. Boo hoo for me. I have to sleep. I wish I had a T1 connection. You know, all the nerds have'em. Why can't I?

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Sorry for the Non-Updation Bloggie.
I know your hungry so I decided to feed you today.
Anyways, my excuse for not updating? It is that I am "obsessed" with a game called Gunbound. It is very tactical and free and over the internet. Perfect for me isn't it? My connection runs well on it too. The only problem is that it takes up alot of time since it's a turn based game. I was watching "Band of Brothers" last night on the History Channel. I liked it alot. I like to read and watch stuff about wars. I certainly don't want to be involved in any though. I just find all the effort put in by Average people like me into the war effort intreging. I mean, who would want to risk their lives to serve a country? I guess alot of people. Why fight in the first place. I guess it's inevitable though, you know humans. Anyways, Devin and I haven't met up for the commercial and I am in dire need of a camera man and some actors for my movie. Darn, am I angry. This movie stuff gets complicated. It started with a 2 person crew, but now I need more. Oh well...

Anyways, tomorow I have to go to the dentist's office tomorow and it's really freaking me out because I have to leave school early. Unlike most kids I am infuriated when my schedules messed up for some appointment. I think I have some mental problem. Oh yea, I checked my out the MacintoshIIvx that's upstairs and it has 56 MB hard drive space. Sad isn't it. I mean, gunbound would take up 2 MacintoshIIvx's memories. Amazing...

Bye...

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Today was flimsy... is that even an adjective proper for the description of a day?
Average Yo reporting.
Today, Devin and John's cutting has infuriated me to the point of.... Point of anger, I guess. I am going to catch him. And I need some hard proof. My plan? Well, I plan to get my camera, bring it to the restroom. I will hide behind a wall. Well trafficked, but out of site from the line. I will take pictures with my camera of the line every... say 2 minuites. From these pictures, I will create a list of people in line, in order. When John and Devin come into the bathroom I will take pictures of them. When they go out of the bathroom I will take pictures of them. Using the list of names in line, and the pictures, I can then PROVE that Devin and John are cutting. Now, the hard part? not getting caught with my camera while loitering near the wall next to the bathroom. Teacher sentries are out there, but I'm helping them. I just don't have authorization from the powers that be. I'm going to catch those crooks! Let's just hope they cut again tomorow, and then we'll see who speaks last.

Anyways, Devin has been threatening me with a needle for the past week. Today I took it away from him and threw it in the trash. It was illegal anyways. No weapons at school, remember Devin? Showed him who's boss. He's coming over to my house on Monday to help with the commercial. Our project is well on it's way to be finished. We are almost done! It is easier than I thought. Also what I can't believe is how fast the year's been. The years almost ended. And when July comes along, it'll be this site's 1st birth day! That will be a magnificent day indeed. Let's just hope this blog doesn't die. I must keep recording as long as I can. Bye;)

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Sucess tastes like an orange. Sometimes it's sweet, but most of the time sour. Never Both.-Average Yo
Average Yo reporting.
I have got the dirt on Devin, but I might not use it because I didn't get enough dirt. Anyways, it would wreck our friendship (does that even exist anymore?). Anyways, I did 4.8 pushups at this little fitness test at school today. I am now one of the elite. After I did it, people started claping. I was happy. Well, what can I say? Put your priorities streight and you can do it. Now Devin and Shishir want to come with me to the gym. They say they're "inspired", but you need to be more than inspired to get to where I am now. Anyways, summer is fast approaching and that disturbs me because summer is usually boring. At least I have somthing to work on now that I have a movie. All I need is a cameraperson. A cameraperson who can work with me alot. Well, that's my day. I need more dirt on alot more people.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
April 15 as my last updation?!
Wow, now I'm feeling guilty. This is the first week I have gone all out and worked every second I've had at home (I did play a little gunbound). Oh yea, Average Yo reporting,
Anyways, Devin is always cutting in line and I'm thinking of making a website called, "The List". Just a black and white site with the names of people who I've seen first-hand do minor injustices at school. But, who would care? I'm just a no body without any attention.

Oh yea, I forgot to mention that today is my birthday. I almost forgot. This is the first birthday with my bloggie. I think im 14 or something. I don't really pay attention to my birthday anymore. While all those people have extravagant birthday parties I live a humble life. It makes me feel special. Plus, I would rather enjoy my birthday alone than with friends. I mean, that's the kind of person I am. Who knows what would happen if I invited more than 2 friends over. I think that would be apocalypse, not that I'm christian or anything.

Anyways, I watched the last "Matrix" movie on DVD last night. It was pretty good. I was thinking of making a movie about a hamster and his diet pepsi in animation. I was just thinking, this hamster could go have an adventure to find the famous "Diet Pepsi". I don't know though. Through past experience, I have learned that you should have a script before starting on movies. hehehe...

item.dc:creator: A.Barnett
item.content:encoded:
HAPPY BIRTHDAY RYO!!! May your birthday's be many and joyful!
Well howdy duty there blog-thing! Miss me? Goood. Because I have so much to tell you....
Not.
All is stupid in the life of me. I'm sick with a dreadful cold (you can hear me sniffling in China...) and I've had a rather uneventful few weeks other than I have finally solved the problem of getting picked on! If it starts to bug me, I'll just think 'I am a weed, and like the special little weed that I am, when people step on me I will spring back up and bite them in the butt!' MWAHAHA! Take that and suck on it Kingma! And you too Simpson! HA HA HA!
Anyway, not that my little spaz is over, I'd like to conclude by saying; "HAPPY BIRTHDAY RYO! FEEL SpECIAL! FEEL HAPPY! FEEL FREE TO FEEL ANYTHING BUT SAPPY!"
And that, ladies and gentlemen, boys and girls, chicas and chicos, mademoiselles and monsiers, was a sappy birthday poem.
More when my life is more exciting, until next time!
~Amanda

item.dc:creator: A.Barnett
item.content:encoded:
Yay to you Blog-thing, my life is stupid once again. I'll tell you why I am so ticked... Wait..No, let me have you guess? Can you? I thought so, since it's such a reacuring problem. Yep, the parents, namely Mom, are drunk. Yay me. And now mom wont get off my freaking case. Honestly, I can't stand her! Why is she on my case, may you ask? Well, yesterday, after I wrote, I went to go take a shower. What did she do? She waltzed right in! I COULD HAVE BEEN UNDRESSING! OK, so the door was open, but honestly, can't they knock? Can't they? I knock....
I guess it all boils down to this; she cornered me. In the bathroom, in a corner, where I couldn't run. Too many memories resurfaced and I felt just like I was little again. I can't stand it.
Am I going to be like this forever?
~Amanda

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Finally, that Invention Convention is over...
I think our group blew the others out of the water. (A few anyways.)
Average Yo reporting...

I can finally get back to the normal schedule of updating the site. Anyways, I was on the bus ride home and I heard something very sad. A girl's dad suggested they pull a prank on the school band teacher by using plastic wrap and wraping it outside the door. Now, That is sad.... An adult encouraging children to behave in such a manner is unwize and just dispicable. How? I just couldn't comprehend the stupidity of the matter. Then this girl starts telling everyone on the bus. I mean, all the band kids who would not tell. I was in the fray at that moment. Anyways, they were saying how she deserves it and how she degrades everyone, which is not so at all. I mean, these people are going out of there way to get a low salary to teach music to a bunch of ingrates who will hate them if they aren't "cool". I mean, how could these children hate this band teacher so much to pull a degrading prank? Are the teachers really that bad? I think these children should be educated in how LUCKY they actually are. These stupid ingrates do not think with logic, but with variables. If I pull so-and-so pranks on an "uncool" person, I will become x number of levels more popular. A dastardly incentive, don't you think? I think that in this country, people are oddly wired. I mean, I've been living here for 99% of my life and I still can't comprehend how people can tolerate, plan, and execute these ignorant acts of waste and idiocracy. I just can't comprehend how everyone is complaining about rising gasoline and higher taxes when fools are wasting toilet paper on throwing and plastic wrap on stupid, moronic, incompetent, useless, foolish acts. I mean, these people are doing on a MONTHLY basis, maybe even WEEKLY. If these idiots are going into the workforce like the way they are, who knows what the future will bring... Let's all dig a shelter and hide shall we?

Will factories be shut down because workers complain about every possible thing? Will politicts lead to an immense civil war because people can't communicate without AIM?? Will America collapse? I don't know, but it seems sad you know? Sad because the word "cool" sometimes means "stupid". And since everyone wants to be cool, the world will become a place where idiots are rewarded, and logic criticized. These people anger me.

item.dc:creator: A.Barnett
item.content:encoded:
Hello blog-thing.... has my life, I wonder, spiraled so low at home? Today at school it was fine, soccer practice is a blast, and yet, the moment I get home, every time, things spiral down. I want out, yet I find myself locked in. Things children shouldn't hear are a commodity. Worries children shouldn't have are on my shoulders. A mindset belonging to an adult is going to be forever trapped in my body, which is lagging behind. I feel as thought my body is that of a child's and my mind that of an adult's.
Strange, isn't it? So many worries others around me don't even notice take hold of me. I worry about our family budget, I worry about how far into bankruptcy we will fall, I worry about what happens tomorrow; will I find my family dead in puddles of alcohol? Will I find my sister spiraling even further down the wrong path?
I am try, so very hard, screaming even, yet no one, not even Sunny (though she is close) can understand it. It is a feeling I doubt any of my peers will ever know, unless they are older. I look at my school world, I learn, and I grow so much concern. Children, every day, I see them driven closer and closer towards that one edge. The one that so many high school shooting/killings have come from. I see them go into disappear. I see children picking on one another as though they are animals in a hungry fray of flesh and blood. I see the hope vanishing from their eyes, and I can picture the gun, knife, or other instrument of death in their hand, aiming to take another life and get free from this misery. Maybe, some of them will take their own life.
Is there nothing that can stop others from hurting them? I see girls and guys laughing and taking pleasure in destroying others, and I just want to cry, to scream, and slap them-anything to make it stop. But it doesn't stop, does it? Not even if someone gets hurt. Do these people not know what it is like to be picked on? Do they not think it will hurt? Do they not realize?
I'm waiting for answers that wont come. Why? Why in the name of everything good can children do this to their fellow peers? Why?
You see, little blog, in this big world I see things. I see so much hurt in my own family, at school, everywhere. You may ask 'how can you smile so brightly then on almost every day?' and I'll answer that now. it is because i KNOW what it is like to want to end it all. I have the scars to prove it and have shed rivers of tears. I know what it is like to be this way. I know suffering, more suffering than most would even begin to believe.
I have seen good people crumble and break. I have seen children cower, fearing their parents-for I was one of those children. I have seen the damage the wrong path can do to someone. And, I he seen and experienced hate.
Funny ... so funny, you might think, but it drives me near to tears to think of all I've done and have been through. I've lied for toys and money at a young age, become tainted with the hands of my own biological father, and have forever changed from the once happy little girl I was.
The threats I've heard, the pain I've felt and caused...so much. I wish I could take it away, but I very well can't. In this, I must smile. for, I have been told, a smile can be worth more than anything money can buy or money itself, even if it is to one person.
I pray for all those who are like myself and all those who might become like myself. For I know I am not the first, nor am I the last. And that, is what makes me want to cry the hardest anymore.
~Amanda

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
The band trip was a sucess, but the garage sale wasn't.
Average Yo reporting.
It's late sunday night now and here I am updating. Steven Devine was expelled for having drugs in his locker. Fifth one this week. Seems so common now, signs I tell you! Anyways, the band trip? The grueling 7 hour journey was worthwhile. I mean, I got to spend the night in a hotel with HBO! Anyways, That was fun and all, but I have created another movie. It's going to be a series. It's called "Banana Man". My associate Devin and I created a nice 4.5 minute movie. It's great. I'm thinking of making a company website about my production company of 2.5 people and freebie software. My company is "Kow Studios". Nice name for a cheap company. It's the first good movie. Devin is a good actor. I have to go because it is getting late and I have a science test tomorow. I have to put in on my schedule to make a "Kow Studios" website.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I've been working on my Kow Studios website. That's why I've been so busy.
Also, the fact that I was practicing insanely for the band playing test. We have to memorize 12 scales each consisting of 15 notes and playing them in order.
Average Yo reporting.
For this band test, many are getting bad grades. I think you can only blame them, because some didn't even try, or even practice at all. I think Lora Corterbien is the only person I can relate to in band because I think we are one of the very few who actually do their homework early and manage time. I am ridiculed from time to time about how I do my homework when I get home, or how I do it exceedingly more efficiently than many of my classmates. I really don't like it how people ridicule me. Anyways, alot of people got bad scores, but the percussion are going to get good scores.

In other news, I've found my Super Smash Brothers Nintendo Orchestral CD in a drawer near the computer. I immediately burned it onto the hard drive on the computer and I am listening to it right now. I am also downloading a ton of techno to use in the various Kow Studios productions. I hope Devin can show up for our Saturday screening because if we don't, I don't think this opperation will succeed. Thus Devin is crucial to the project. Anyways, my mom wants to get a new digital camera because the one I have is not that great (2 Mega Pixel).

In other other news, I've been playing kingdom of loathing alot. You should check it out if your reading this.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Still working on the Kow Studios venture. Devin just won't get the job done.
Average Yo reporting. He thought that he had a DVD burner but it is just a reader. He is so stupid, ugh. Anyways, I am still obsesed with "Kingdom of Loathing". It's great. Anyways, in social studies, this huge "disscussion" (discussion=pointless one-sided talking) on inappropriate t-shirts and the banning of sandals at school. It was a total pointlessness. I don't see how Lexi can change anything by talking out in social studies. Ugh... A stupid waste of my time. Anyways, it's coming closer to the end of the year. So close...

item.dc:creator: A.Barnett
item.content:encoded:
Hey blog-thing, surprise, surprise! Mom is drunk as heck again. I can feel my patience stretching, tearing, waiting for me to let go or break. I don't know how much more of this I can take. My sister went off the deep end again, on Monday she had the choice of going to jail or a hospital because she was insane. She's been in a hospital for a week and now she'd going to have to do drug rehab. Wanna know what she did? She went berserk, tore up Don's house, and stuck two butcher knives in the mantal. If Don had walked in she would have killed him. Oh, and, she cut herself. Don called the cops on her and they took her away in a handcuffs. Before that episode she tried to run away.... She can get marijuana anytime she wants from either Jenny or Don. And do people do anything about it? No.
Why is my life such a gosh darn mess? I know that answer-it has to be someone. Can I help still feeling trapped? That whole family, whose name I sadly and regretfully bear upon my shoulders, are like mobsters, or even a family drug ring! So many things, so many interesting stories, and I doubt anybody that can do away with it will listen. Lies, scandals...Oh the world I used to live in and am still struggling o completely break free of. But how can I do such a thing when Angela is suffering, and when even the smallest things remind me of that horrible time there?

item.dc:creator: J.Walker
item.content:encoded: Hey, it's me Justin. Yeah, you probably can't even remember me. Anyways, I have to be the worst blog updater ever. I feel really bad and guilty. I'm sorry Ryo, Amanda. Well, today was the last day of school. YAAAAA!!! Well sort of ya. Now I won't see any of my friends anymore. Also, I've just witness the newly featured Banana Man 1 & 2 movies. I have to say, they aren't the best I've seen but it is rather good. I really liked it Ryo, tell Devin too. I just got great news. I get to go to Kings Island this year! I was originally on the waiting list. There's only one problem...I have to go on the Klondike bus. But I will be with my friends Cameron Wilson and Spencer Martin. It'll be very weird though. I'm kinda nervous. Well thats really all I've got on my mind at the moment. I'll be sure to post again soon. seeya.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba

Gosh darn it.
Ok, I feel really guilty because my blog has deteriorated.

Anyways, because of final exams, then a trip to orlando, I have been absent from the computer. Thus not allowing me to update. Finally I'm back. Anyways, my new camera is going to come today! I'm tracking it as of now.

Anyways, Orlando was very tiring. I have a small diary about it on my palm pilot. I hope that I will soon post it up on this blog. Well, summer is here, and that means that I'll be bored. Which means I will have time. Which means... I can update this blog more.
Well, that's all.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Today I went to summer gym.
Average Yo reporting.

There's this kid named, well I can't tell you. And he sits in front of my in summer gym. He's very talkative in a very bad way. It's kind of an anti-social sociality. It's complicated. Anyways, he talks and talks and talks, and worst of all, he has no idea of how to wait your turn. Persay, I'm talking to a friend, and this kid comes up and starts interrupting us and starts talking to us about meaningless topics that don't concern me. He asked me if I liked NASCAR, I said no. He kept on talking anyways about how he was a buick person, but he liked fords too.... and on and on.... and it got to a point to which was agrivating and crazy at the same time. That was like last week. Today, this kid asked me if I had a PS2 and I said no. The kid then starts talking about this game called "Devil May Cry". He praises it and keeps saying its really "good". Very poor adjective usage. Anyways, he memorized the whole intro scene and he repeats it like it's his mission to sell this game and lead me into insanity at the same time. He goes on and on and on.

At least this kid makes summer gym look easy, because anyone would rather run a lap than talk for on and on.

(all trademarks belong to their respective owners, this article is not meant to offend anybody, I just wanted to express my opinions)

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Summer gym is tedious...
Average Yo reporting.

Anyways, I went bowling today. The bowling alley is called "star lanes" and it's in a ghettoey part of town. All around, as our school bus drove by, were abandoned buildings and torn down bussinesses. It was very apalling. We went into star lanes and I did very poorly. This deteriorated my mood for the rest of the day. On top of that, I had to go to the gym. I felt like burining the gym down before I went, but while you do all the exercises, all that rage just somehow floats away, and it's gone. You don't know where it went. It's miraculous.

Anyways, tomorow brings more surprises.
Oh yea, I found out that "America's Army" is a fun game, if you have broadband. It's a game made by the US Army to promote recruitment. Even though I can't join the army (I'm not a citizen) I find the game fun. Too bad I can't play it since the verification servers are down. That stinks.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Summer gym is getting tediouser...

Average Yo reporting...

I did yoga today, very interesting coagulation of embarassment and grace. It was great.

Also, I must resist telling people about this website. At summer gym, I wrote the URL for someone, but quickly remembered to destroy it. Next time it could be worse.

Guess what? I was in classrooms for the more vigorous classes (ie. Soccer, Tennis, Etc.)This was because it was raining today, but that's not the point. Anyways, in the tennis classroom, I noticed cords coming out of the recycle bin (trash receptacle)and then I noticed a keyboard. I was too afraid to ask. I didn't want to be alienated furthermore by giving away my position, but that poor, helpless keyboard, stranded for eventual destruction. It bothered me very intensely. The next class, soccer, I found yet another keyboard. I figured that they were having a hardware renovation, and that they were destroying all of the old equipment. This time, I took inishative(I can't spell) and asked for the keyboard. The soccer teacher said yes, and I was overjoyed. You wouldn't believe my overjoyedness of myself after I got my hands on that dirty keyboard. It was covered in pencil shavings and black ink. I got some moist towlettes and promptly refurbished the keyboard, thus saving it from a imminent doom! I feel good. I'm typing on it right now. I think I'll paint it, then name it!

Anyways, Ryan and I are trying to get an ultralight, but it probably won't succeed and plus, the money is non-existant at this time. Just a silly want.

I am getting worse and worse at mathematic proficiency. My mind is diminishing to the point where it is of equal computational value as my classmates. It's so scary. Help!

Anyways, I got a new poll up, plus a new email adress (these servers are much more reliable), and uhhh... That's it.

Oh yea, I played alot of "America's Army" today. It works! And without much lag! It's groundbreaking, but a timewaster. I really need to learn my html.

item.dc:creator: A.Barnett
item.content:encoded:
Hey blog-thing. Know what? If I hear one more drunken burp I believe I shall go insane! UGH! The parents are drunk, again. Goodness it's getting annoying!
Well, my day was a blast though. I went to summer gym, did Tai Chi and Yoga, which was SO much fun. Then I came home, walked for 64 minutes while watching 'Peter Pan' (lol, I know), and then I biked with a friend, nearly non-stop for about 3 hours! Oh yeah, I also biked half a mile on my own! Tonight I get to look forward to 40 sit-ups, lifting weights, and my wonderfully painful 'ab buster' BWAHAHAHA!
Yeah, ignore that laugh. Operation 'weight loss' is an official go. Everyday I walk for AT LEAST 32 minutes. YAAAAAAY! Usually it's 64 minutes. Then I try my best to do sit-ups and aerobic each and every night for a minimum of 15-30 minutes. YAY! HAPPY HAPPY ME! I can't BELIEVE I used to watch TV rather than take a nice, relaxing bike ride BOOYA! Or, when I'm angry, feeling sad, etc...I can't believe I used to eat @_@ Now it seems to strange. Eating right, a healthy exercise plan, and positive thinking are working! booya!
Anyways, there is my life in a nutshell for a while!
~Amanda
P.S. Here's a fun fact. Did you know my lowest point was 196 pounds? UGH! And now, only a couple years later I'm on the right track and feeling so-so at 154! OVER 40 pounds I lost! BOOYA! ^^

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Average Yo reporting...
Swimming in the morning, swimming in the evening, swimming at supper time... if swiming was on a bagel, you can... Never mind.

I've swam too much today. Once in summer gym, and once in the neighboorhood pool. Guess what? I swim tomorow too! I ran 9 laps in 25 minutes. A NEW RECORD, for me at least. That's 2.25 miles in 25 minutes. Wow. Also, my blogs 1th year annevirsary is comming up. Maybe I should celebrate or update the user interface of my site... or not. It depends on how much time I have and how willing I am to learn how to code new things. I really am bad at coding things, sadly.

Ryan is making a blog... it's funny. I wonder how long it will last? Maybe 1 week? Or maybe 4 days. Most likely 4 days. I can't wait until the weekend so I have time to do things nerdy.

I was at the neighboorhood pool and these high school/colledge kids came up to Ryan and I in the spa. I said we were nerds and Ryan said to speak for myself. I found that humerous. Anyways, It's 9:12PM and I must go to sleep.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Today is Friday, a day of rejoicing!
A weekend of pure non-summer gym is ahead of me!

Anyways, since the non-summer gym activities haven't started yet, let's talk about summer gym. There's this kid who is of large build, blonde, and is white. He has a tan though. Anyways, I was in soccer and he is in my group. It was hot, and he saw that I had a water bottle in hand. He asks if he can have some, and I promptly say no, because I brought it for me! He took it away after I said no so guess what I did. I grabbed the water bottle and squeezed it, thus propelling water toward him and semi-drenching him. Now, why would you ask for something, if you're just going to take it. Maybe it gives him the false illusion that he is being polite. And he's not. If he sees something he wants, he gets it to others expenses. But even though his character justifies my acts, I feel guilty. I am brooding over this currently. I constantly have to brood over something...

Until tomorow!

item.dc:creator: A.Barnett
item.content:encoded:
Hello blog-thing! I have just finished another work out. I did 3 sets of heavy duty weight lifting which included curls and lifts, and then I did a medium set where I lie down to work my...triceps I think. Of course I did squats, lunges, stretches, ab tighteners, ab crunchers, ab stretches, and 40 sit ups. Earlier today I walked for 64 minutes, only stopping halfway to get a drink for about a minute. Then I went bike ridding for an hour or two with a friend, nearly screwed up my knee again, and did 1.75 miles in track. Only 7 laps, oh well...I can always strive for eight.
You must be thinking that I'm complaining, but I assure you I'm not! I don't know what the heck has gotten not me, maybe my self esteem, but I just want to exercise! It feels so good! I forget if I've mentioned it, but I can't believe I used to just sit and eat! I missed out on the wonderful world around me, regrettably. I hope this summer does me well. I even got some special cream that is supposed to help to! Cross your fingers folks, because I'm SO keeping to this plan! lol
Anyways, talk with ya later!
~Amanda

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Ryan is cutting/pasting his way to a html...nightmare. Hopefully, he'll clean up his act and make it more user friendly.
Average Yo reporting.

I didn't do much today, so I'll take out one of my rainy day topics.

At summer gym, you meet alot of people. Most of them weird or otherwise oddball. I didn't know there would be so many.

There are certain people when it comes to subjects. There are people who firmly believe in something because they know alot about it. There are people who firmly believe in something because they DONT know alot about it. There are also those who are just vegetables, rarely thinking of anything besides their girlfriend or another social topic. I have met so many people who are in the second group. Who firmly believe in something because they DONT know alot about it. From video games, to websites, to WWII, and the war in Iraq, there are so many people who don't understand what is going on. They hear something on TV, and they believe it. These people listen to a friend's, cousin's, uncle's, brother's confession to a topic, and they believe it. I hate it. People have no idea about economies, social classes, other reliegeons, and general situations that aren't in the US. Also, they have no authority to judge things, like video games. They say it's "fun". They say this over and over and over again, and to my utter disbelief, they ACTUALLY THINK that I'm interested in the game after they have used one VERY poor adjective to describe a retarded game.


People are also inconsiderate. I ask someone about WWII and they go laugh about how Japan got bombed. They KNOW I'm japanese, they KNOW that millions got killed, but they don't know how to be polite, AT ALL! They laugh, and they don't even notice me not laughing. I don't want to laugh, and I don't see how they CAN. Millions of innocents die, and those ingrates scoff. They should be put through the torture, battles, and injustices past generations have had to experience. Let them grow up, get their jobs at the factory and live in a trailer home. I can't wait.

We went to a bunch of japanese stores and went to Galyan's, which is a sporting goods store. My dad tried on some Aero 9 rollerblades and now he's probably going to buy them on the internet. I have to continue to learn SOMETHING over the summer. It might as well be JavaScript. At Chicago, I also got some nice digital images of planes landing at O'Hare airport. I just LOVE the camera!

Well, I gotta go learn some JavaScript before I have to go to sleep!
Nighty Night!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I've been researching about the "browser wars".
Average Yo reporting.
There seems to have been 2 wars, one between Netscape and Internet Explorer, and one that is taking place now between Mozilla, Internet Explorer, and Opera. In the first war, IE conquered all. The second war is still on the edge of a knife. I use opera. IE definitely should go down, but alas, Microsoft has IE pre-installed on 90% of all computers in the world. If you don't know what a browser is, you seriously need to get out more. A browser is a program you use to "browse" the internet.

On the topic of browsers, I can't get Ryan to stop using IE. It's so frustrating. Oh well, it's not my computer. I still angers me that he has to use it though. Grr...

On the topic of Ryan, he has been on a new diet. It's called the chocolate syrup with nuts diet. You put a bunch of chocolate syrup and nuts on a plate, freeze it, and eat it. Very entertainingly shocking. I thought he liked cooking. I mean, pop-tarts and corn dogs are BAD, but chocolate syrup and nuts? That's a bit too far Ryan. I still think it's a bit odd though. I couldn't stand eating that much sugar. I absolutely hate everyone's notion that they won't get fat. It won't happen to you, right? You're invincible. Just tell that to 1/3 of the adults in the United States of America who are overweight or obese. Were they invincible? Invincible from anorexia, ha.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
New Class Analysis: Very Easy

I thought high school was hard. All we have to do is read some 4 page chapter, take some easy quiz, do it everyday, participate, and we get an A.

Summer Gym 2 is like health. We get textbooks and learn about wellness.

Ok, we did physical testing today. When we got to my specialty, muscle endurance and strength, I got excited because this was where my 1 year of gym work would shine. First, Jon did push-ups. He was my partner. He did like 10 or something. Everyone else mostly dropped out at 20. Then it was my turn to do push-ups, and Jons turn to count. The CD monotonously went "up...down...up...down..." over and over and over. As usual, everyone dropped out at around 20. I kept going. When I got to 25, people were like, "woah" and "that kid is a freak!". At 30, I was shaking, but maintaining my compusure. I lost it at 34 and everyone probably felt inferior to me. Yay. I found out that I only weigh 118 lbs. Of course, the scales are probably extremely inaccurate. I didn't know they still used the manual weight scales. Those are obsolete beyond a doubt. I can't believe that doctors, schools, and other government agancies still use those crap scales.

Well, more Summer Gym 2 tomorow.

That was how bad it hurt. When I got home I tried to jog but twice I got really bad cramps because my food refused to digest. Then, of course, my knee is now swollen and my throat is still a bit sore and I'm coughin. Goodness, no luck for me today. Anyways, it was fun none-the-less. I lost more weight than I had initially thought, so I am that much closer to my goal. I am more flexible than I thought too, and I did 62 sit ups! I'm so happy, lol. I also saw my sister today, she was alright. She got a job at the Pizza King at America's and to celebrate we got pizza from her. .....But it was undercooked -_- And we gave her a tip too... lol. Anyways,that's pretty much my day. I feel bad because I have to take it easy so I wont get sick, but I still did my sits ups and ab buster, and I got in a quality walk with my mom. So all is good with Amanda today. Except that I'm catching something... -_-
~Amanda

item.dc:creator: A.Barnett
item.content:encoded:
Oh my goodness, blog-thing. My dog just got run over by a motorbike. It seems so unreal, I feel sick to my stomach. All we can do is see how she does in the next hour. Kurt thinks it might be serious. It’s almost too much. I can’t bear to hear her crying. Oh my god, how could this have happened? How could this have freakin’ happened? She was just fine this afternoon and now she could have internal bleeding. Oh my god, I have no idea what to think. I feel so sick right now. I wanna cry and I can’t. Why aren’t we going anything now? She’d bleeding, it could be serious! Yet we have to wait! How messed up is that, huh? HOW MESSED UP! My god… this is going to kill me, I know it will. If she does die I’m gonna loose it. I swear I’ll loose it if she dies. Oh my god…Ok, big claming breath. There we go.
______
OK, It’s been a few moments. I had to bike like crazy to find the guy and ask him if he ran Cracker completely over. He didn’t, and he got hurt. Kurt and Mom say it serves him right. Driving a motorbike on any road is illegal. Poor Cracker, thank goodness there’s no eternal bleeding.
Well, that was a couple years off my life…

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Yesterday I was conflicting over if I should, or even could go to the block party next door. My mom said I have to go because there isn't any food at my house and the block party was going to be my only source of food. I thought for about an hour then I remembered. I danced in front of 300 people in a cow suit. Block Party? Piece of cake. I went and ate and even though everyone was either in their 30s or in their 6's, I survived. I found some nice site with a ton of theme song mp3s.

Today I am conflicting over weather I should download some mp3s. It's illegal, so I probably won't, but it's like a million dollars shoved in your face. Take it and take a risk, or leave it and be safe. It's very hard... to resist... I must stay away! Happy 4th of July. Remember that sparklers burn at 1800 degrees farenhiet. That's enough to melt iron. Those sparklers are the second most occurring fourth of july injury. I have no idea what the first most occuring injury is. Idiot indiana laws. They pass incredibly stpuid laws. When you buy illegal fire works here, you have to do some paperwork that says that you have to take the fireworks out of the state to fire them. And on top of that, you have to say that you will fire them at a certified pyrotechnics show. Idiot law. Who's going to do that. If they wanted to ban those fireworks, just make it illegal to SELL them, not illegal to fire them. Yea, a ton of people are going to go out of state to fire their fireworks. Not...

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I went to Summer Gym, and they took us on a "field trip" to International Sports Center ( a local gym ). They gave us a tour and let us try some stuff out. At the end of our trip they gave us promotional handouts encouraging us to come back. I hate "field trips" like these because it just makes me sad that the school doesn't have enough money (or isn't willing to pay the money) to let us go on an educational field trip. They give us a promotional crap commercialized field trip which is really just a long commercial on how International Sports Center is superior to other health clubs. I really want to protest or something, because something is wrong when public schools have to sell their kids out to some crap health club for no reason.

Then theirs this other incident on the bus. I sat next to this kid who was talking about his guns. He was trying to impress these girls or something. He was talking about how he regularly kills dogs and cats with machine guns and pipe bombs, and talks about how he wants to kill people next. I don't see how this is supposed to impress anybody. Do you? I mean this kid is a trailer trash kid, living in the woods with his extended family, with a ton of fire arms, and with obligation to do inhmane acts. Are you supposed to brag about such things? I hate people like him because he can get welfare, social security, and pension plans. How come people like him are citizens and I am not? I will be 20 times as productive as he will in a lifetime. That idiot kid. He bragged about this incident where he stuck a pipe bomb in a dogs mouth and lit it. The dog exploded, decapitated, dead. How could someone tolerate such behavior. He is more likely to be a terrorist than some middle eastern guy. Why don't they start biasing their security checks with the following guidelines:
Observe people for terrorist activities if they are:
1.White
2.13-18 years old
3.Live in the woods
4.Likes to decapitate dogs with fire arms
5.Considers firearms a bragging right
6.Can't pronounce aquire

How many people brag about killing things, possessing machine guns, and smoking? I hate him and I want to catch him like a rat. Let's see what happens when you shoot him with a machine gun. Let's see how fun it is for him to taste a pipebomb.

Let's see him in jail.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I dreamt I was flying. It was so exhilarating.

My dream all started when I appeared in a bus. My friends and other east tipp classmates were all riding it to go to a field trip, except we were all in college. We went to an amusement park and Mr. Pohlenz said that we could each ride 3 rides. We all went on this monorail that was really high in the sky. The monorail went at least 100 mph and we traveled for a few minuites over a senic desert, admiring the view. For some reason, the theme park was cloudy, but the monorail destination was not. Anyways, We all went to this rickety texan looking, rustic, motel in florida. There was this texan cowboy giving us a tour when I realized that I forgot my toothbrush. I asked Shishir if I could borow his, but he forgot his too. We both started panicing. Then we started the tour. After the tour, I went in the pool/hot tub. I was relaxing with some unknown friends (One looked like a fat John Edwards, one looked like Bill Gates, and one looked like Chad Chambers). Then some girls came and I was like, "Do you want to see me fly?". I tried to fly, but the water weighted be down. I dried off a bit and then I raised my arms and said, "Fly". I made it past the roof by kicking, but then I started falling. For some reason I said, "Mach 40" and I started going really fast. This was the flying part. I flew over florida, then the ocean, then I saw some tropical islands like the kind from the movie where Tom Hanks was stuck on an island while working on fedex. Then I traveled over African jungles and the sahara, then asia, then california, then finally back to florida. All of this taking about 2 minuites. I could go up and down and had full control, except I constantly lost speed and had to say, "mach 40" or "mach 20" to keep myself flying. As I approached florida, I saw a apartment/subdivisions with large tall white houses and decided to freak people out so went really close to the ground. There was sudenly a barbed wire strung from tree to tree, right in front of me. I spiraled toward the ground, but I was uninjured. I tried to fly again, but I just couldn't muster the energy. I realized that I was probably really far away from my group so I decided to rest to regain my engergy. I walked over to a swingset, but then from the corner of my eye, I saw a line of army people training for boot camp on the road. I felt as though they might poze a hazard, since I'm just a stranger in someone's neighboorhood, so I just walked cautiously away, trying not to make any sudden movements.Then I saw a road, so I walked on it awhile. There was a large van that passed me that had on it's side, "neighboorhood watch". There was a fat black guy in it, but he seemed really friendly. He asked me what I was doing and I picked up a instruction manual that happened to be laying on the ground. He pulled over in someone's driveway before I could answer, but I went up to him to answer because I didn't want to look suspicious. I conjured up a story about how I was someone's cousin and I had to deliver a garage door manual to a family friend. He then said, "I used to have a garage door manual like that when I was a kid, How about that? Thanks kid...". Then he left in his large white van. I felt good that I was a liar and I beat him, but I knew it was time to get out of the neighboorhood. I raised my hands and said, "fly", then started kicking. With some effort, I got up in the sky, where I said "mach 40". Upon saying mach 40, I realized that I couldn't go as fast, but I had to make it to my friends. I flew for awhile and then I lost my flying powers. Amazingly, I landed in the pool and everyone was waiting for me. They were older and they said that they skipped graduation to wait for me. I felt glad. Then the pool changed to a harbor and there were many large barges near us. The water was stale and black, and we were all freaked out. But we celebrated my return for awhile anyways. Then the nerdy guy said, "I feel some coral underneath my feet and it's freaking me out!". I felt some too, but it seemed to grab my foot and pull me under. All my friends for some reason said, bye in a happy tone, and I felt better as I sank into the harbour.

That was one of my best dreams yet. Maybe it has a meaning. Maybe, it doesn't. Who knows?

item.dc:creator: A.Barnett
item.content:encoded:
Hey blog-thing. I know it seems like I only update when I'm really busy or upset, but the truth is that those are usually the only times I have time. What is the problem now, blog-thing? My sister could be caught up ina  drug trying. Yes, you heard, me, she might be selling drugs. How do I know? For one, she is the only one who could have stolen my grandmothers pills, and two, she was really open about a mysterious phone call. She couldn't tell us about it because she said we'd get her into trouble.
OF course, and I know this seems strange, I am not able to release the emotions I know I have somewhere deep inside. I'm almost scared to think I might have buried my emotions too far...
On other note, I might be starting another story or blog called 'Tales from the current day Mafia'. As that is what I think my old family is. A Mafia, a present day Mafia full of lies, deceit, and drugs. But I will still continue to diligently update.
Goodday blog-thing;
~Amanda

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Alot happened today. I arrived home from Ryan's house and saw Adam Thomas, planned a garage painting project, went to Lowe's to get some paint, painted, and went on a Pocket PC freeware escapade. Oh yea, did I forget to mention my new Ipaq? It's a multi-purpose device. It's going to be more functional when my keyboard arrives. Anyways, my garage is huge and my family and I painted it orange. I can't believe it only took 1 day. I'm tired.

Anyways, you remember that kid that I said liked killing things? Well, I've also found out that he's been smoking since he was 10. I'm not that surprised, and yet, I am. Why and how would someone start smoking at 10. Smoking was for losers when I was 10, and it still is. Amazingly, this kid is pretty nice. He's friendly and responsive, not withdrawed and angry (like some people I have observed). It's very odd how first impressions can be so confusing. I can't help feeling angry at him, but at the same time, I hate him. It's odd. I'm odd.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I thought that you would be happy that someone would smoke since your dad is a lung doctor.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I got the keyboard and SD card. Time to expirament and max them out! Sweetness.

On the other side of news, devin is back. I have Shishir's contact info, and everything is working out well. Tomorow is summer gym. I'll probably be daydreaming about what do write on my story. I've been working on a story. It doesn't make much sense. That's all I can say.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Ok, there's this girl at summer gym.

She was nervous/complaining/agonizing about how she was going to fail the test that we had to take today. By the way, these tests are just 15 multiple-choice questions. She just ranted on about how she was going to fail. After getting kind of annoyed, I inquired to why she was going to fail. She said that she didn't read the chapter. I was thinking to myself, "She didn't read the chapter... Well, even though the chapters are small and you would be stupid not to read them, there has to be a justifying reason to why she didn't read them". I asked, "WHY didn't you read the chapter". Her response? She said, "It was boring". Then it hit me. Wow... If people refuse to even read a crappy baby-easy chapter to study for a even-a-moron-can-do multiple-choice test, then what will our future be like? Will social structures collapse and will people just sit there wondering what to do? "Hey Joe, it looks like the world's destroyed. Wanna rebuild it?" "No way, too boring".

This is seriously disturbing me. How is the world going to continue if these people are so lazy, spoiled, and just... so challenged at such easy tasks. Think about it, these people might be tomorow's dentist, lawyer, or taxi driver. Do you want YOUR dentist to sit around doing nothing because YOUR teeth are too boring? Maybe it's time to buy a bomb shelter....

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Average Yo reporting.

I learned how to rip songs off of internet radio stations. No more idiotic kazaa. I never liked it. Now I can rip a entire genre of songs by pressing a button and walking away. Quite convenient if you ask me. Anyways, now I have lots of DDR, classical, 80's pop rock, and other genres of music on my ipaq. I'm learning new things about my ipaq every day. I've almost maxxed out my 1gb card though. I'm a data hog. He he he...

Anyways, inside me I feel a subtle feeling of impending doom. It's like I know the walls around me are going to collapse on me any second. Of course, I get this feeling around this time of year. It's just my mind's rationalization of high school. Yes, fear is that powerful. Anyways, I try to control it by making myself understand that high school won't be a killer. And yet, that fear still runs rampant through my head.

Anyways, I constantly look back now to my Optimist's Club Speech Contest. It's helped me in so many ways. Stress diversion, etc. It's like... an unbelievebly good effect on my life. I'm positive. I'm not afraid of speeches. But this invincibilty can't last long. And with the feeling of impending doom in my head, I get more insecure. But what am I insecure about? Not my dignity, that's for sure. I lost it last year when I danced in front of my school in a cow costume for the talent show. Maybe I'm insecure about... I have no clue.

Oh yea, in other news, I got Sim City 2000 to work on my ipaq. W00t!
-Average Yo.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded: Right after coming home from Devin's house, I had to go to the gym. Exhausting. Pure exhaustingment. On other news, I went to olive garden, but why should you care? item.dc:creator: A.Barnett
item.content:encoded:
Hey blog-thing! I'm so sorry I haven't updated, in, like, forever! @_@ My life has been so hectic. My little sister has been here a lot, my story is progressing, and so is my exercise program (Which has stopped for a couple of days because I went on vacation, we went to the Zoo, lol) But, anyway, I'm just about to go record what I weigh, I'm crossing my fingers! Anyway, my arms are hurting because stupid my over did her workout last night. Oh, the pain.... But oh well! It serves me right, doesn't it? I can't wait until school starts, and I can't wait until next weekend either. I am one of the lucky few to get interviewed to receive a grant/scholarship for collage! I'm so happy! We will definitely need the help, and I really, really want at least my Master's degree! I always have, ever since I was little.
Anyway, I have to go, see ya later Blog-thing, and Ryo? I hope you had fun on vacation!
~Amanda

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
School, school, school.

That's the topic for all the kids out there right now isn't it? You either hate it or love it. I go with the flow. You can't change the inevitable, so why resist? High school should be a good change of routine for me. I mean, east tipp doesn't have many people to network with. At harrison on the other hand, you can meet new people every day. Plus, I'll have more things to talk about. I mean c'mon, it's pretty darn obvious that summer has been a low-topic time of the year for blogs (my blog anyways). But alas, might as well embrace it. (Is my reluctance showing?) Anyways...

I've been working on a very large stick figure animation. What have I learned? I have learned that my computer can't handle 2,456 gif images at one time. Does anyone here a Catastrophical Error here? My compter ran out of Random Access Memory and had a "catastrophical error" to my surprise. Now I'm going to try to cut my animations into pieces to save the RAM.

Anyways, I registered for school and memorized my classes and everything. I suppose that things will work out all right. But what if they don't? I'll just work it out myself. I was talking to Joe and he was very VERY reluctant to go to school. I mean, it's going to happen and you can't stop it. I'll probably make a TON of bad first impressions and then everyone is going to mispronounce my name, but that's old stuff. I'm feeling optimistic. Are you?

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I'm feeling nervous at this time because of the orientation at harrison. I'm supposed to meet new people and this is supposed to make me happy, but not so at this time. Anyways, I found this nice game that used to cost money, but now the company's promoting its sequel so they made it free. It's called hidden and dangerous. Enough about those evil programs (that I can't resist) called games.

Don't you hate it when people say, "don't use big words on me" or something of that nature? I do. I say a word like, "catastrophe", or "coniferous", or "mammal" and these people explain to me their mental handicap. Instead or making me use the only 7 letter word these people know ("thingie") to substitute for words that are 6 letters and up, they should enhance their vocabulary. And to think, these people are going into the workforce!

Anyways, I might be able to go to the 7th grade party after orientation, but there is a slight chance that it will be too late. Ta ta.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Average Yo reporting.

The orientation was sub-par, just a bunch of inspirational non-sense. He mostly talked about how we were "Raiders" now and that would help us function better. He can't tell me who I am. "Raiders"? I have to know what a "raider" is before joining this supposed group. I saw alot of my old lunch table friends, but otherwise, unspectacular.

Right now I'm at this bonfire party hosted by jessi hoffmann. It's rather large and has a bonfire and all... but everything is terribly dark. I gues it's the new fashon. Dark... grey...darkness. Nothing much color.

On another note, NEVER bring brady to a party!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
The bonfire was fun, but too many people for me. But that 's a personal thing. I'm not much of a sociable person in a "party" like situation. Most of the time I was folowing Devin anyways. There were alot of kids that I didn't know, but they knew me. I also didn't expect alot of people who were there.

The hike was another story though. I loved it. There were huge cliffs and crevasses and watching Devin risk his life was also exciting. You would have never guessed I was excited because I was kind of quiet most of the time, but I was thrilled. I'm a very quiet person. I wish I had pictures of the hike, but I didn't bring my camera to the hike (duhhh, water and dirt) but maybe next time.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Tomorow is school.
Average Yo reporting.
Anyways, I went to the mall yesterday to get new clothes. I was amazed at what I saw there. Everyone was obese and had rolls of fat. I can tell you, if I counted 10 random people at the mall, 9 of them would be overweight. It was pretty tough finding clothes that weren't size XXL. I mean, it was outrageous.

Talking about XXL, I cleaned out my binder (or as they say in Indiana, Trapper Keeper) and the papers were monumental. Just exploding out. Crazy... I found some year old fruit snacks and shards of plastic, warped by my binder. My binder is finally in it's final resting place. In my desk. I might call it to attention someday. But other than that. The news is still school is tomorow.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I had alot of weird people IM me today. First there was this odd person, and in the middle of our conversation (we were trying to figure out why I was on her contact list, she told me to "f*ck off". Then she cut off. Then there was this person who called himself "Milo" and told me that I stole his toy in 2nd grade when he was playing with Ryan Powell. This was funny, because I moved here in 6th grade, so there was no way I could even know him or ryan powell or steal his toy. His accusations were humorous, but he kept on saying that I lost in this "game". I think he is obviously confused. Then there was this other person who knew Kevin Barlow (supposedly) and that is where his contact list came from. This person was very obscene and confused. THEN there was this person whos screen name showed up as AIMAdministrator55555 or something like that. This person claimed to be the co-ceo of AIM Corp. He told me he was Cristopher II or something like that. He said that he had physical evidence (another hilarious detail) of me harassing somebody on AIM. First of all, there is no AIM corp, and second of all, there is no "physical evidence" on cyberspace. This person told me that I harassed this person that I didn't even know. Yea. Hilarious. I don't harass people, nor steal, nor want to talk to these strange and illusioned people. It was very intreguing though.

On other news, I cleaned out my binder and it had alot of papers. Like, enough to make a small tree. I might post some pictures of it later. In the binder I found some year old fruit snacks which were oddly hard and were caked with a white powder. I also found fragments or pens, pencils, and an old christmas card. I salvaged a few things, but most of it was junk. That's all for right now.
-Average Yo

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Today was the first day of high school. Actually, it hardly constituted for a day because it was only for the afternoon, but it was truly a new experience for me, as well as many others. We just went over some technical stuff today. Mostly rules, guidelines, more rules, etc. I have:
Honors Geometry: Probably the hardest class with the most work. I have to brave this to continue through the day.
Band: Another hard-seeming class. This year we have mandatory ISSMA contests and the competition is overwhelming.
French: A fun class with a nice teacher. I will be learning a skill that will be useful. Plus, I have Ryan in my class.
Honors English: Another fun-seeming one with a nice teacher. I got some books that we needed at barnes&noble today. I've been reading one.
Journalism: One of my "extra" classes that I took so I could write better posts here. Seems enjoyable, but has lots of older kids. Scary, older kids.
Lunch: My old East Tipp lunch table groupies got together. Very relaxing.
Advanced Biology: Seemed fun with an intelligent teacher, but she made it seem intimidating. I'm ready for a challenge.
Study Hall: Way too big, plus the popular kids do anything but study. I'm sitting next to Ryan.

Overall, the day went well. The school was extremely crowded and there was much congestion among peers as lunch B was progressing. It was shoulder to shoulder, neck in neck. The pace was about as fast as a rolling banana. One step at a time. At lunch, I somehow found myself with the same people as my old East Tipp lunch table. It was miraculaous. Now I can talk to Karl and Zach and Miles (???) while eating lunch. I saw alot of people who didn't have their friends in this lunch just wandering around the lunch room looking for an acceptable place to sit. I was one of the lucky few who didn't have to do this tedious cat-and-mouse game. Find a table- be rejected- try to find another table-get rejected-get pushed down-get rejected-etc. Anyways, tomorow will hopefully proceed as planned. Oh yea, did I mention that I almost got lost and was unable to find my bus?

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded: This is a last minute post because I should be sleeping right around now. Anyways, There was this kid that was about 10-12 that I saw on my way to Ryan's house. I was just minding my own bussiness, biking my own way. Then he asks me, "Does your bike automatically change gears?". I was like, "No.". This kid goes, "HA HA!". This wasn't just some laugh to joke around with. He was mocking me will full force. I think that he deserves a mention in my blog because he's just a braggart. That complete jerk! HA HA? I just wanted to educate him on manners. That kind of attitude should stay in the slums, or wherever he comes from. Of course, there must be some influence that causes him to be so dysfunctional. Most likely a sibling, but maybe parents. I hate kids like that. Their younger than you, they have no manners, their disrespectful and full of spite, and to top it all off they brag to you. If I could look into the future of this kid, I don't think he's going to get a job, or a girlfriend, or friends for that matter. And why in the heck would I want an automatically shifting bike?

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
We started band today. Today I also found out about Devin's blog. I'm so jealous of his pseudo-intelectuallity and his chick-magnetness. Devin the intellectual chick-magnet, my role-model. Did I mention that he also is musical too? Crazy mad, I tell you. It's so disapointing for me.

Anyways, I had band today. He wants us to practice, but we can't take our music home. How in the bloody world are we going to practice if we can't take our music home? This is outrageous. It just doens't make any sense. You CANT practice if you CANT take your music home. It's frustrating me right now. I'm sitting here with a clarinet, and with no music. Practice? What a joke.

Also, in other news, I have lots of homework, and I am making a movie. Not a good mix. Also, Devin is better than me. And I feel bad... Yea, laugh at my self-pity...

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded: This weekend I went to the Indianapolis Zoo. I've got some pictures for you. I have to get cracking because time is running short and tomorow is school. Anyways, today I worked outside which was a big change, then I went to the gym. I really hate it. I was playing a broken record in my head that said, "get me out of this place" over and over again. But then again, deep inside, I kind of see the advantages of it. I really want to go, but really despise going. It's a complicated emotion. I figured out the intricacies of my pda's wi-fi capacities. I used to have to use a 3rd party software to find wifi and it never worked. Anyways, the next task is to try to sell my 6 extra gmail invitations for some junk, or maybe a cute little monitor pet. Also, I have to add a picture to my profile. I'll probably take a picture of my current monitor pet, a clay scientist owl. Anyways, right now I am transfering classical music and opera to my pocket pc. I love my 1GB card. In other news, I better be in bed right now.
