item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Happy Birthday Blogger.
You're probably thinking, "How does that effect you or me?". Well, if you look above, there are no ads! Halleluiea, I don't know how to spell it. I mean, I'm not religeous. Anyways, I figured out how to post pictures easier, so now I won't have to spend 30 minutes trying to get the pictures to load. I've also noticed that alot of bloggers my age sound alot like me, except Devin of course. They always start out as saying, "Hey, I'm nobody, and no one will listen to me, and who cares about me? and bla bla bla..." Well, I'm thinking of changing that kind of outlook. I suppose if you look above, underneath my title, you see me saying the same thing. I've kept the same everything for a LONG time, and you can kind of tell, by looking at the template. Being part of my template, that sentence is still up there. The sentence I wrote in the heat of the summer. The sentence I wrote more than a year ago. There it sits, conveying my desperate hope of drawing YOUR attention to MY pitiful existance. I read Devins, Kevins, Jessis blogs. All of them plus mine have something in common. They all talk about how stupidly insignificant their little lives are. In reality, they are insignificant and stupid, but you shouldn't think like that. If we little bloggers stood up for ourselves and blogged away on our nerdy machines, I bet we could make a difference. That's what I've learned today. I've learned that you shouldn't go talking about how insignificant you are, because by the time you know it, you are insignificant. If you keep the illusion in your head that you are significant, that someday, someone will notice you... then someday, someone might indeed notice you. Some day..... What a petty illusion.....

Anyways, enough with me daydreaming here and there, and averywhere.It's 8:52 (the clocks wrong by the way) and I have to write on. This is so fun. I just realized that blogging is a hobby now. Over the summer, it got to be a chore. But now that I'm dealing with homework, society, tests, general stress... Blogging is fun. Fun for me, fun for my inner self. I guess fun for other people. Talking about other people....

I noticed that alot of my 7th grade pals are making blogs. The trend spreads eh? Well, I support them and everything, but I feel jealous. I don't know why I feel jealous. I have no idea. I just feel this envy... This sense that if I am not better than them, they will overpower me. I know blogging isn't a war game, but it's just at the back of my head. This immense envy of something that isn't a threat.

Also, I noticed that some of my math classmates are on the primitive stage of compter skills. Their main use for the computer? Instant Messenging. I absolutely hate the fact that they think they are computer literate, but in reality they have no clue what protocols need installing, that their Internet Explorer has so many security holes that it couldn't hold jello, that AIM and AOL are hardware hogs. They just click a button, and the computer either works or doesn't. They just... just... make me want to teach a computer class or something. I want to spread my computer prowless onto these illetirate people. They are deprived with this... and I wish I could give it to them. Of course, they probably don't care. There was this kid in front of me in math. The looks at the back of a CD case and goes, "Woah! Macromedia Shockwave!". He acted like he knew what he was talking about. I don't think he did. Macromedia Shockwave is a common standard in animation. Their flash format pwnz the internet community. Why would he be excited about having it on his computer? Maybe he was trying to act like a nerd. Maybe he just has a crappy computer that can't handle flash. Maybe he's crazy. Who knows.

I've been typing for like 30 minutes now. Ranting on and on. I feel better about everything because of this blog. It's a very thereputic hobby. I love it so much. Until next time, blogger. Bye bye.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded: No time at all, but I felt like posting. I usually don't have time for much entertainment, so this is my only entertainment. Just like in the old days, eh? Well, I'm ripping some smooth jazz. It's really nice stuff. I've got a lot of quiz bowl to study, and I don't have much time to study all of that stuff. I really want to though. Maybe tomorow. My printer is not functioning so I emailed my teacher about my situation and attached my homework to the email in .rtf format. Hopefully it'll work. I have so much going on this meager post is what helps me get to the end of the day. Just to post. Living to blog... sounds like me... nerd extrordanaire.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
As I walked from beige room to beige room... hauling the books burdened upon me to their predetermined destinations... trying to ignore the monotony of the crowd rushing, talking, pushing. I notice this one adolecent. Listening to heavy metal music, he walks slowly, deliberately... This adolecent is rather large and intimidating. The first impression I get from this person is that he is not a good student. Not a very viable impression of course, because many kids listen to heavy metal music. I wonder what made him so noticeable... His dreary eyes? His deliberate walk? I don't think I'll ever know.

Anyways, the inevitability of something going terribly wrong while the day is going on was putting pressure on me. That's when I started listening to jazz. It really calms you down. I was doing my homework and I felt like exploding. I listened to the jazz and cooled down. It's probably a stage. Yes... a stage....

Anyways, at lunch, the people who sit with me (Joe, Eric, and this short kid) always leave me. It's so depressing. I have no where to sit except by myself. Then Brian Durban comes up to me and puts a humerous spin on things. It's not apparent to me wether he is trying to cheer me up, or just insult me in my face. It's pretty hard to tell with Brian. Crazy kid I tell ya... But there are other things... worse things than sitting alone by yourself, with no one to talk to in a crowded lunch room. Things like... forgetting my homework as such.

I have so much on my mind. I have so much.

Anyways, I still live in the same world I did yesterday. Oh yea. I'm glad I finally find a teacher with computer skills! Huzzah! Go Mrs. Schnieder! W00t! Anyways. I'm thinking of making a new banner. What should I base it off of? I'm thinking... My template has to match my banner, so it's going to be pretty hard to decide. I really want to change my template to a bluish greenish, more smooth kind of look. Currently, my template looks like it just came out of the woods like a hobo. Now, is that a good impression of me?

item.dc:creator: A.Barnett
item.content:encoded:
Hey blog-thing. I apologize for not updating, and to ryo too. I've been quite busy with school and all the things I've been doing. I guess I'll let you know about my life. This summer I lost, probably, ten or twenty pounds, and school is going great. In Japanese class I'm the only one who actually complied to mr. Peterson's strong, and most ferverent wish to memorize all the simple Hiragana in about a week. I did in about four days. I'm so proud. All my other classes are great, and being the locker above my sister isn't so bad. I'm trying to make time to post in the blog more, so yay. Next month I'm going to conduct a scientific experiment. I'm going to see how much weight I loose and how much happier I feel if I eat only cherrios for breakfast, a jelly sandwich and some type of fruit and maybe a healthy extra something for lunch, and some sort of soup for dinner. If I get really hungry and I need a snack I plan on getting those energy bars or something like that. I'm then going to keep a log for progress and weightloss. Also, my mom and I might check out International, I'm so excited. I really hope she lets me get a membership. I even have a plan to pay for it! See, since I mow the lawn four times a month on average, all that money can go towards the membership fee. Then, when I do extra house work (ie: vacuuming, dusting, etc...) that can be my spending money! Happiness and joy! I might even be allowed to cook dinner!
So, that's my life in short. I'll try to update later on this week!
~Amanda

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Bound to the shackles of the reverse psychology, I am subtly forced to go to the International Sports Center. Vile... Yet, with this reverse psychology, I can't say no. If I say no, I have gone against my civil duty and thus must commit suicide. Actually, I wouldn't take it that far. No, really. Don't look at me like that.

Anyways, I have to keep listening to music to keep me from exploding when doing my homework. Whenever I have to do homework, and right after that, go to the gym, I feel like I'll expode and just splatter the contents of my body all of the beige walls of my living room. Organs slowly sliding down the walls, pieces of my clothes drenched in thick cherry red oozing blood, et cetera, et cetera. Anyways, I don't want to explode, so I listen to my jazz and everything is happy until I realize that my little bubble world is nonexistant and that I'm going to eventually have to go to the gym and toil and toil and toil, and that's when I feel like exploding again. ANd again. Have you ever thought of double internal combustion? You blow your body up, and then your limbs are left, right? Then like 5 minutes later, your limbs blow up. It's like a double whammy, RPG style. Sorry, I like to think violent thoughts before I go to the gym because I am so angry that the inevitability of going to the gym is just... inevitable.

Anyways, I abandoned my current nerd squad to join another nerd squad, and this takes it to a new level. I sat with Karl at his lunch table. Then a bunch of older nerds came. They seemed nice. They were all talking about the D&D club. It was very facinating. I talked to Karl about D&D club and he said it was fun, but you had to know the rules. I'm not much of a rules kind of guy (I'm contradicting myself again).

Now that I think about going to the gym again, I'm so furious. FURIOUS!!! I don't konw why! Just don't want to go there. Help, I must calm down.

Anyways, I have many tests tomorow and... Ok, let's not talk about tomorow, or 1 hour from now. I must focus on what happened in the past.

Focus... focus...
Anyways, I went to stuff and ddids tuff. Ok, I'm not making any sense. I'll stype typeing befur I nead a stteerees bal.dfgsren

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Mission "Get AOL CDs From Target" was a success. I was able to collect 15 cds in total with my acomplices Ryan, and Lisa. That almost doubles my collection. In addition, I got a new radio alarm clock and it can be run on batteries! W00t. I can listen to the radio while on the computer now. Anyways, it has deachable speakers and looks stylish and it makes me happy. Anyways, I took some good pictures of the AOL cds while at Ryan's house. I'll post them later. Anyways... After the Target escapade, Ryan and I threw the cds at each other and threw them in the air. It was fun, even though it sounds so dorky.

On the octoberish side, I have an idea. I'll dress up as Dorthy from the Wizard of Oz for halloween and go with ryan. Very exciting, don't you think? And do forget my trusty sidekick, "Flashbang". Otherwise known as my Camedia D-380. Able to blind crowds and take a snapshot of them at the same time.

Again, it is the end of another weekend. And the start of another week. I still can't believe this Middle School to High School transition has gone so easily. I know something bad is going to happen sooner or later. Well, I can't really say that, because well, that's not optimistic. And I try to optimistic all the time.

Oh yea, I'm addicted to pogo.com for some strange reason. I know that there is evil lurking in ANYTHING that is owned and operated by AOL, and that AOL in general is evil, I still can't resist playing those stupid games just to get prize tokens. There is something magical in winning prize tokens that is just mezmorizing. Oh yea, I found an article in WIRED news that talks about this site called freeipods.com. You do some offers, make your friends do some offers, and then you get sent a free ipod of your choice. They say it really works, but it smells so scammish. I just does. Well, I have to go tinker with my new clock so... until next time... BYE

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I went to Devin's birthday bash thing. I didn't know that he would invite me. I mean, come on. I'm not the most popular person in the world, if you know what I mean. Anyways, it was great. It really taught me that all you need for a good, entertaining party is Oliver and sugar. Very good combination.

The mystery mosquitos have been biting me. When I woke up this morning, I was covered in insect bites. They itch terribly.

On the school side, I am writing a mystery story which I am thinking about right now. I'm pretty sure it is going to be about a museum in France traffiking art for extra funding money. Yea, that's it. Anyways, I should talk more about Devin's party, but I can't because I have to play my clarinet and because Devin might want his partays confidential.

I'm tired and scared and confused. Another post, another day, another corny speech in the auditorium. Have a nice night people of the world!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I only have 5 minutes to type, like a lot of days this week.

Today I have written a very long story, with the help of Adam Atter. I think I shall post it just for your enjoyment. Here it is:

Plink...plink...plink
This was the by-product of a company party come to an end. Half empty glasses containing cheap wine, crusted with a sheath of white and red from lipstick and a tablecloth that was only half on the table. Only a few hours ago full of fervor and excitement, now the room was only the ashes and embers of the party. The clock slowly ticked to the inevitable strike of midnight, my dismissal. The room was empty, dim, and messy. It was now my time to start working.
Here I was, in this godforsaken party, wondering why I was here in the first place. Some might think I live to clean, wash, and dry. Others consider me the scum of the earth. Unable to succeed in my own art, I did the next best thing. This thing was to become the head janitor in the most famous museum in France. Yes, I have to clean after those who hate me, but it is all worth it because I get to look at the art. This is the incentive to work the night shift every day.
I noticed a glass, tipped over on the table. Its contents dripped into the nearby trash bin. Leaning over to inspect the mess, I noticed a crumpled ball in the corner of my eye. It seemed to be a ball of paper. Upon unfolding it, I found a neatly cut newspaper article. Its headline you ask?

"Government Slashes Funding. Transit and Museums Hit Hard"

Odd... I quickly put it into my large cart full of trash. Next, I folded the sheets of tablecloth and put them aside, along with the haphazard scattering of glasses. As I tried to make order of this mess, the curator, monsieur Pierre, came in. He strutted along, in a slow gliding fashion, as if he were on oiled skis. He is dressed in a fine overcoat, the buttons, ornate in every way. He strutted up to me.
"Janitor, you are dismissed. It is far too late for you to be cleaning!" monsieur Pierre says.
"But sir, there is more to be do..."
"You have done enough. You are dismissed." the Pierre interrupts.
He walked away, assuming that my orders will be executed. He says for me to go home, so I shall. As I walked home that night I thought of how I am just a peon to him... just a lowly janitor.
The next morning, I wake to the sound of a motorcycle. It is cherry red, with a package on the back. The driver I assumed was a courier. As she took off her helmet, her flaming red hair shows off its luster. As she dropped off her package I got a glimpse of her face. It was familiar, but I know that I do not know her, for I didn't know any couriers. It was a new day and I got ready for work.
As I walked down the age-old streets, I admired the rustic neighborhood I live in, Renaissance Lane. Houses fit for DaVinci lined the streets. One house caught my eye. Obviously abandoned and outdated, it suffered from degeneration. I could still make out the ornate carvings on the walls, the gargoyles silently calling for a restoration. The plaque reading 1512 Renaissance Lane still hung from one peg, slightly slanted. I wondered why it was abandoned, as it was a beautiful building.
I finally made it to the museum. I saw the curator arrive in his flashy convertible just as I reach the marble columns that support the museum. Obviously, he has spent more money than usual on his car. As I observed him, I saw him hand something to a courier. A tip perhaps?
I entered the museum, I notice there were not a lot of people. I slowly made my way up to the supply closet where I gathered my supplies. I then took the utility cart and progressed with my cleaning. By the time I was finished, it was evening. I was on my last leg of my cleaning journey. I made it to the second floor. As I was buffing the floor, I decide to take a quick break. Cleaning is exhausting, but I almost got to my favorite part of the day. As I looked down below at the sporadic groups weaving in and out of the exhibits, I started wondering what they are thinking. I see a thick-framed man with blonde hair like a movie star. I could tell that he was American because of his ripped jeans and his gelatinous hair. I also saw a small child. Excitedly running to each exhibit, the child stopped occasionally to glance at a work of art. Too small to understand the meaning of the paintings, he jumped up and down, impatiently waiting for his parents to catch up. Then I turned my head and glanced at the next visitor. This time it was a group of three. I notice one was the curator, the other was a red haired teenager, and the other is, from the looks of it, a wealthy old man. I assumed that the curator is giving a personal tour. It is something he does to guests he has a liking to. He occasionally, he pointed up to a painting and looked to the teenager. She nodded yes or no. I wondered why.
I got back on the job, buffing and scrubbing the floors. A monotonous job to say the least but while doing it I get to examine and admire the various exhibits. Those days it seems like the paintings just don’t have their certain allure anymore. I assumed that it’s just because I’ve was looking at them every day, but it still seemed peculiar that masterpieces I once treasured now do no feel as close to me.
As I walked home that night I noticed that the package the flame-haired courier had dropped off was no longer sitting in the alley it was before. In its place was an old briefcase. There was one thing askew in this picture though. The old briefcase, instead of having old rusty clasps, had brand new locks. Although this was puzzling, I did not let a trivial matter like that trouble me. It was probably a drug-drop; there have been many drug busts by the judicial police, the FJPD, in the past few months. I often wonder what this once charming city is becoming.
The next day at the museum things droned on as usual until about midmorning when I noticed monsieur Pierre hovering about a closed wing of the museum. That wasn’t odd: it happens every day in a different wing so the great works can be checked for degeneration. What infuriated me was that monsieur Pierre was taking pictures of the art. That was strictly forbidden even to the highest ranked officials because the flash increased the process of aging. I went over to confront him and he nearly took my head off with his response.
“Monsieur Pierre what are you doing? You know better than anyone that no photos are allowed here in the museum!" I said.
“I do not need to be corrected by the likes of you, janitor! I know perfectly well of the rules in this establishment. Now get back to your toilet scrubbing or whatever it is you should be doing at the moment!” said monsieur Pierre
“Yes sir,” I replied,”please excuse me.”
I did not report monsieur Pierre because no one would believe me. Yes, there are countless security cameras in the museum, but none of them are actually functioning. That would be much too costly and too much of a hassle to man each monitor. The focus these days was to keep thieves in, not out. If a certain amount of pressure is applied to any work in the museum gargantuan gates slam down and trap the criminal in that particular wing. The only person who can bypass these gates is the curator himself with a special key he keeps in his back pocket.
Later that day I went back and was amazed that monsieur Pierre was again doing something to damage the art. He was taking even more pictures of the art. All but one of the works were very minor pieces, very few people appreciated these works. A few small statues and a couple paintings were all. The piece I was surprised monsieur Pierre even dared take a picture of was “Madonna of the Rocks”, one of the most famous DaVinci’s ever, rivaled only by “The Mona Lisa” herself.
As I was staring at “Madonna of the Rocks” to try to figure out what he was photographing, I noticed something terribly wrong. There was a hair stuck in the painting, actually half covered in the dried paste. This was a very strange occurrence. Many of the impressionists would not even think of working in an environment where a thing as simple as a hair could destroy their soon-to-be masterpiece. As if to prove me right, the hair stuck in the painting was a brilliant red color, not the brown-blonde color historians and art specialists believed DaVinci to have. I rushed to immediately notify monsieur Pierre.
I soon arrived to Pierre's office. Hesitating for a moment to decide if I should continue, I remember that the art is the first priority. Slowly opening the door, mostly expecting to be yelled at some more, I entered. Unfortunately, monsieur Pierre was not present at his office. Being a poorly funded museum, you would expect the offices to be cheap as well. That was not the case for Pierre's office. Ornate carvings on a large marble desk sat in the corner while large brushed metal columns towered over my head, as if they were trying to deter me from going any further. After I admired his room I noticed something on the floor. It was a letter. Of course, it was nothing new. Occasionally, the office personnel drop miscellaneous letters. I am instructed to return them to Pierre's desk for them to be given back to their original owners. But as I was walking to Pierre's desk to lay the letter down, I noticed something very peculiar. The return address was marked: 1512 Reassurance Lane.
There must have been a mistake. This address was of the building near mine. Surely there wouldn't have been occupants inside of there, or have there? I looked inside of the envelope to find a letter reading:
"Thank you for your business with me. I am very pleased with your products. The transactions are complete with the fee you requested below."
Below the letter was a check for 500,000 euros. What product does the museum sell, and why is this product 500,000 euros? The gift store has nothing over 100 euros, and certainly nothing costing 500,000 euros. What is going on here? Just then, Pierre storms in.
"What are you doing in my office?! Why have you that letter!?" Pierre barked.
"Monsieur Pierre, I was just cleani"
"Janitor, what have you read. What have you found out?" Pierre interrupted.
Just then, my brain screeched to a halt. The synapses in my head no longer fired on and off. Complete astonishment and surprise filled my mind as all of the clues came together, fitting together in my mind like an intricate puzzle. The government budget cuts, extravagant parties, the courier, the abandoned house, Pierre's new car, the hair in the painting, all came together to form one big story.
"I cannot let you escape. Thank you for your service as a janitor." Pierre solemnly spoke.
I knew then that I had to escape the museum and notify authorities, before I became a clue myself. I lunged for the door, Pierre grabbing me. Only able to grab my coat and rip it off, he immediately sets off the alarm system, therefore closing the walls and trapping me, like a rat in a maze.
Barreling through the hallways, I manage to reach my utility closet. I immediately locked the door and looked at my options. As I frantically try to find something to defend myself with, I noticed a glimmer. A minute twinkle of light entered my eye. It was utility key. Under the disinfectant, and resting on top of the soap bucket, the utility key stuck out. The utility key was a key that the museum personnel use to open a back door to disable the alarm, in case of a false alarm. I grabbed it and realized my only hope for escape was a back door on the other side of the museum. My heart was a timpani playing fortissimo as I slowly turned the knob to open the door. When I opened the door I noticed that Pierre was staring me in the face as I trembled in terror. He held a crow bar.
"Sorry, but you cannot leave." Pierre muttered.
I knew I had to get out so I tackled Pierre and shot through the hallways like a ricocheting bullet. As I ran into walls and grabbed wall corners to stabilize myself, Pierre chased me with the same wall to wall frenzy. I finally made it to the back door. With Pierre only a few seconds behind me, I frantically stuck the key into the slot, opened the door, got out, shut the door, and locked it up. As I was turning the key to lock him inside, Pierre slammed into the door, cursing and shouting.
Since Pierre was taken care of, I my next mission was to get to the police station. In the parking lot in front of me, I noticed the same cherry red motorbike I noticed before, with the same courier. Was the courier part of this mess? I decided to confront her.
"Tell me the truth, why have you been involved in this crime?"
"I have to earn a living somehow." she calmly said.
She then took her helmet off, and I was astounded by her age. She was only about 16, barely old enough to drive the motorbike, nonetheless able to participate in such fraudulent activities.
"If you drive me to the police station now, I will not tell them about your participation in this crime," I offered.
"How can I trust you?" she asked.
"Just trust me."
She then drove me to the police station upon which I reported monsieur Pierre's fraudulent activities and showed the police my letter. Then, I left the police station. As I walked into the parking lot, the cherry red motorbike and its passenger were absent from the myriad of parked cars.
Later, Pierre was arrested for art smuggling and attempted murder. Another curator was hired and the museum got back its art. The purchasers of the art were also arrested and put in prison. As for the courier, there have been reports of similar crimes elsewhere in Europe, and to this day, she is still missing.

Copyright to Ryo Chiba and Adam Atter.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Roller Coaster Tycoon has some serious drawbacks.

One of them is that it is extremely ADDICTIVE. It has been hampering my blog progress. I mean, you cannot resist playing it. It's crazy.

Anyways, I have a cold and it is bothering me to the point that I have a immense frustration. I've heard from Janet that there is a Klu Klux Klan meeting in Lafayette during the spring. They kill blacks, terrorize people, chant, etc. At least that's what Janet said. Ryan says that there was one isolated meeting 5 years ago when one guy pulled out a gun and shot some black dude. Now, who do I believe? Anyways, I found out that my laptop is actually capable of something. I can Word Process on it and play SNES games. I have found a good use for it, hoorah! Anyways, not much is going on for me, on this balmy labor day weekend. Boring. I turned down my invitation with Ryan to go to Purdue with him this afternoon because I am sick. I think that's proving to be a very bad choice. Zut alor!

Anyways, I'm feeling like uploading photos so I probably will.

Later Homies! (me trying to be cool)

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I'm off to see the wizard, the wonderful wizard of oz. La la la...

What made this wizard so wonderful? This wizard, of course, was a ficticious character in a...

Ok, what in the heck am I typing about. This just goes to show you that I am meandering (I love that word) in my mental habitat. Anyways, I feel like taking pictures, but if I venture from my house with my camera strapped to me, and a tripod stuck in a backpack, I will look unfathomably nerdy. That is good... but you have to consider that I will be living with that impression for the rest of my life.

In quiz bowl, I was unable to answer any of my questions, which really makes me question my mental ability. I also question my future with quiz bowl. I might get kicked out. That would be discouraging. I also might get picked for the team, which would be extrely unlikely, but good. Those are the options fate can choose, the question is, which will occur? We shall find out. Of course, I could always be the quiz bowl photographer, which would be pretty cool.

I was talking to Devin, and I might be able to do something with him on the weekend. That means I gain 5 sociality experience points. Woohoo! I might level up someday to lvl2! That would be 1337. D00d, I w0u1d r0XX0Rz! Ok, enough of my nerdy self.

I have to go find something, and do something. Yea, stuff...

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Ah, yes, five Sociality Experience Points! But...Miniature Golf will soon take those away...

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Hello, due to time restrictions, I am unable to type much at the time. I have to practice my clarinet, and of course, find the nearest NPR radio station and listen to it while reading the latest "Time" magazine, while in my bed. Not that this blog is of lower importance. I just feel as though the most logical choice is to do more of the other than this. I took notes today, of what went on today, so I could write alot, but I suppose that I will do this tomorow. I hope I have more time tomorow, but it seems not, for many teachers are starting on the hardest chapters tomorow.

I just want to comment about how my French teacher incessently sings "Love Potion #9". It's so catchy, I can't get it out of my head now. Along with her extensive plunger collection, this makes her one of those teachers who are very good at teaching, but also very interesting to watch.

Adam is finishing my story in English, so kudos to him and his valiant efforts. Hopefully, he'll do the work, but I trust him.

Another kudos goes to Juan, who lended me his French book in a time of need. He deserves a thanks because he is a nice person (On the outside at least).

And finally, another kudos to my 8th grade math teacher, because I feel like giving him a thanks, just because.

Anyways, I have alot to do and relax and study and, etc. I have so much to write, but not enough time. I shall try to overcome these challenges tomorow to write more. Also, I hope Ryan comes back soon. It's getting lonely on the bus. Bye!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Wow, taking notes on your day so you can write them on your blog. You have advanced to a new level of nerddom Ryo. Congrats.

Oh, and Love Potion #9 is an awesome song. Give some kudos to your French teacher, too. even if she has an...extensive plunger collection

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I didn't know that these gmail swaps actually paid off! I traded a gmail invite with this Jeremy guy and I got this awesome compact flash memory card, for real! The unfortunate thing is that all of my electronics use secure digital. Oh well, I can use it in the future! Anyways, I am really glad, so a kudos goes to Jeremy! That's the happy part of my day.

The angery part of my day is that I can never be able to answer any questions in quizbowl. I'm infuriated by my incompetence in the area of literature and russia. I'm an idiot, and I know it. Anyways, this quiz bowl thing is getting to me, but I really want to be on the team, because it seems to be LOTS of fun because the coaches (Schnieder, Mike) are really hilarious. I really want to be on the team.

Anyways, I am still having troubles opening my locker because it is just so stubborn. I can consistently get it open, but it just takes LOTS of force to do it. The locker handle routinely cuts into my flesh so that the tenderest layer of skin is exposed. My hands are chafed and cut by my locker, but this torture must be endured to keep going to school.

Anyways, I always seem to have someone interesting sit behind me in the bus, and they talk about very socialistic things. Cruel things. Especially the girls. They seem to have their own little society that involves intense social competition, insults, and deep thoughts about people. It's really very intreguing.

Speaking of girls, I was talking to Babbi on the bus this morning and we debated about things until I won. It's not fun when you always win debates. I need someone who's hard headed and has some reasons behind their logic. People these days have NO reason behind their logic. Everything happens a set way just because "god" or a teacher has said so. It makes me angry that reason is not involved in their beliefs. Anger...

Well, that's all for today. Zut Alore!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I hate it when people try to debate me when they have no fact to back-up their beliefs. I mean, they try to denounce something they fail to understand. Since they can't understand the other side of the story, it is not a debate anymore. It's more like talking to a brick wall. Like, when I debate evolution, most of the people who are against me don't know what evolution is. They probably are thinking of evolution pokemon style, which really angers me. I want to smack them in the face, and give them a book. Grr...

Anyways, I aquired some AOL CD's earlier, which roxxors!

Also, I drew a picture. I will post it later. Good night.

item.content:encoded:
My internet connection has been down for the past 4 days, so that's why I was unable to call, communicate to anyone, or update this blog for the past 4 days. The insight BB man said that our Vonage router was not registered, thus blocking our whole connection. I don't know.

I hate it in study hall when everyone is just sitting there, usually talking or laughing, or generally socializing. I hate it so very much. I am working for the full 50 minutes and everyone else is just talking! They make themeselves look so ignorant. I don't think they even have homework. Grrr... The envy is growing in me every day....

ANyways, I have the hardest Honors Biology test in the year tomorow ( I have no idea why this test is so hard, so early ) and I am planning to study full force tonight. I am just really annoyed by those study hall people. Really ticked off...

Anyways, I found this site called www.thisisbroken.com, or something like that. I really like it. I found it in my most recent issue of PopSci magazine. On the topic of PopSci, I LOVE IT! Anyways, I'm thinking into purchasing 3 radiohead cds, but need Devin's advice first. Unfortunately, he seems all but absent from phone, email, and face to face contact these past few days. I can never catch him. I really need his advice though. I trust him.

Anyways, I am just terribly shaken up because of the impending doom also known as my honors biology test comming up, so I think I'll be done posting for the day and study. Oh yea, I have pictures from Chicago's Millenium Park, or whatever. I'll post them ASAP.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I am increasingly intimidated by my peers in QuizBowl. They are obviously more superiour to me. The "cut" will be initiated soon, and I know I will be one of the unfortunate that will be kicked out of the team. Maybe I'll be able to salvage relations at the Buffalo Wild Wings meeting on the West side of town. Hopefully, that will quell their urgency to kick me.

Anyways, I studied studiously for my science test last night, and today I wasn't able to finish the test. All of my peers were able to, but not me. I feel alienated. Anyways, that was a very unfortunate turn of events, because I really want to get a good score on the test (who doesn't?)

I got Devin's advice and got some radiohead CD's, yay! I'm also looking in to purchase some ear plugs so I can block sound out of my head at certain times where it will be crucial to do so (Yard Work, ISTEPS, etc.) Anyways, I've been researching about that lately, but I don't have the time to do so. I've got 10 minutes to finish my research, try to memorize a ton of math postulates, and post this rant.

Ok, I don't have time. I will maybe bring my camera in tomorow to take pictures, but that's if the weather is good. I heard Greenville, ALA took the brunt of the storm. I hope my pals there are still alive. I'll call them sometime.

Anyways, I'm running low on time (aren't I always?) so I have to part with you. Now I only have 5 minutes to study my math. Just great. I better stop ranting and say good night. GOOD NIGHT.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
This weekend was a perfect autumn weekend. The sky was blue, the air was sweet, and the temerature couldn't have been any better. Although, back in 'bama, their still without power after the hurricane past over. The list of activities done this weekend?
1.Go to quiz bowl meeting at BW3's
2.Go to park with Ryan and watch him do crazy stunts
3.Go to Devin's house to meet Nate and go to his mother's birthday party
4.Hang out with Ryan at my place

That's about it, too much social activity for me. I'm not used to going to these "party" things. I mean, I don't even get invited to any social occasions many times, let alone "parties". Call me anti-social, but sometimes "parties" are just to chaotic. I'm not talking about Devin's party, just parties in general.

On a side note, my computer has contracted a very annoying worm that replicates itself and pops up windows and takes up system memory. It also gets me very agrivated. I am currently trying to destroy them, but they just keep propagating. This is probably happening because I was using IE earlier today with ryan. That evil, evil browser. Well, wish me luck on my spyware destroying escapade.

Anyways, this weekend has come to an end and next week is the week for ISTEPS. Yay.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Today was frantic and disapointing.

I got many Many MANY B+,s right on the edge of being an A-, but didn't make the cut. I had too many. In math everyone was getting 99%,s and 95%'s while I got a measly 89%. The conclusion was that I am a failure. Anyways, I had too much homework today so I didn't really get to do anything except take a shower and eat dinner and do homework and type a 5 minute post on blogger. I really hate days like this because it makes me feel like I'm 500 pounds and sinking into the ground. Well, I have to get rested for ISTEPS which by the way are rediculously easy. I have to sleep now and I feel tired enough to do so.
Au Revoir!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
ISTEP testing began today, which is still rediculously easy.

Logic questions were the name of the game, and obviously, many people will get a good grade on it. Except for the essay portion of the test. I saw people just go to sleep, trying to ignore the essay, the impending doom lingering about their heads, while I was feverishly writing my well composed paragraphs. It really bothered me that some people weren't really trying, because these tests don't require intellect or knowledge. All you need is diligence and a pencil. Plus, Indiana assumes that all of its citizens are not so knowledgable anyways. I mean, why else do they give you all of the geometric formulas when their giving you the "Math" (e.g. arithmatic) portion of the test. All you really have to do is plug in numbers, which is hilariously easy. The most unfortunate thing for this test is that we do not get to keep the pretty, neon colored, "Teen Crisis Center Hotline" pencils. I really need pencils. I only have 4.

Anyways, I hate it when you're sitting in supervised study and you are just focusing 100% on your homework, and your just fretting about a question, someone next to you, or near you starts talking about some obcene or outrageously off-topic subject. It makes my homework tedious and annoying. I look back at all of the people who are either sleeping, or socializing with other people, it makes me very jealous, but I eventually get over it and go on with my work. It makes study hall THAT much harder to stand.

I am still entertaining myself with the idea for my English project, a newscast based on our current novel "To Kill A Mockingbird". I have plans for it, even though we haven't discussed it yet. On the subject of entertaining, I am also entertaining myself with the idea of making a website where I categorize each novel I read in a specific format, listing the publisher, plot, author, date of publishing, setting, etc. and getting students to go to it. Eventually, if I had enough readers, I could put ads on the site and make money. My first book to be listed will be "To Kill A Mockingbird". That is, if I even make the site.

I had the whole day free today, which will probably be the only free day in a few months. I think I have done all the homework I need to do. Also, on the funny side, I have a 103% in my journalism class. Previously, I had a 104.5%. It lowered because I got 100%. How am I going to go about keeping a 103% up if every 100% lowers my grade?!

Anyways, Greg the Diving Man emailed me today. I am still questioning my streching abilities, although I used to take part in balet. Yes, the common stereotyped form of dance. And no, I did NOT wear a pink tu-tu...

Well, that's it for the day. Today provided me enough time to type a lengthy post, so kudos to my day. Unfortunately, alot of my friends' blogs have ceased to post recently. Devin's, Kevin's, etc. Maybe it's school. Maybe their not true bloggers at heart. GOOD NIGHT.

item.dc:creator: A.Barnett
item.content:encoded:
Hey blog-thing!
First, I would like to apologize since I haven't posted in such a dreadfully long while. I hope Ryo isn't mad at me. I guess school has gotten its hold on me. I've been studying non-stop it seems (at times, at least, lol) and I've been really caught up in my art project. It's taking me forever, and it's looks pretty good (from what people have told me. I think it looks weird, lol.) Anyways, I shall try to be more consistent with my posting.
Now that I'm not in Honors English, things are dreadfully boring and unstimulating. I am so disappointed. Some of the people in my class can't even read well enough to get through a paragraph without taking five minutes! It's so aggravating. And then, the teacher spoils the stories because some people aren't literate enough to understand the story! GRR! It was so disappointing. We read the Cask of Armontillado (sp?) by Edgar Allen Poe and she just sits there, stops the tape (yes, we're read to by a CD like we're a bunch of stupid infants) and then tells us the ending! There was no point in finishing the story. It wasn't exciting anymore. I just about screamed.
But on the good note, most of my other classes are great. Japanese is the most stimulating, and the absolute best class I have. I am the third student in three years to memorize hiragana in about a week. I was so happy. Biology is alright, except the teacher can't control the students so we get next to nothing done. I feel like I'm going to fall asleep in that class.
Art is alright too, it is fun and challenging. The only downside is that a friend is getting angry at me because she feels my talent outshines hers and all this nonsense. I can't stand her anyway right now, always talking about this boy she loved but is too afraid to approach *rolls eyes* it's so annoying sometimes that I just want to scream at her.
Well, let's get off the subject of school. I have soccer practice tomorrow so I might not have time to update. It all depends. Anyways, in soccer, a team mate of mine (a very ANNOYING one) always hogs the ball. We were divided into teams to scrimmage and she actually stole the ball from me just as I was about to score! She came right up and stole it, my leg met nothing, and so my knee clipped wrong. Man that hurt. Then when we were practicing corners she kept screaming 'pass it to me! Pass it to me!' when Couch told me to fire them into the middle for headers. I think the Couch sympathizes with me, Julia always aggravates me. Everything is fun until she arrives. Then she doesn't play her position, thus screwing the rest of the team up and afterwards complains that her legs hurt. Well duh! I wanted to scream, you only took over for everyone else you ball hog!
Now that I've got that off of my chest, I hope she doesn't show up for a good while at tommororws practice, or I feel I might loose it and pummel her into the earth.
anyways, thus is my life in only a short moments. My back is killing right now and I have to go and do my weightlifting. So, talk later!
~Amanda

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Today was a distressing day, also being the last day of ISTEPS. Thus, tomorow will be just FULL of homework. Even though today was of lesser homework, I started exagerating all of the little homework I had in my head, and by the time I knew it I was totally overreacting and was about to scream at the next popular football jock dude who happened to run over me in the hallway. Fortunately I controlled my anger.

Also, part of my anger stemmed from the fact that my neighboor's (Justin) sister called me the "biggest nerd in the neighboorhood". Even though this fact just might be true, I still think she is very mean. I mean, this 1st grader is insulting highschoolers with no regret or guilt. That is not a good sign. I still feel like everybody's been treating me not so well.

Yea, talking about my social life, I have hardly any inside school. The usual conversation between me and some n00b is me saying "Hello" and them saying "Wassup, your name is so cool" and then me muttering "whatever" and then them telling me to "speak some chinese" and then me going "I'm not chinese" and then them saying some slang term I don't understand and then me going "Seeya" and them promptly saying the same thing. What a social life. I absolutely hate it that every asian, even indians are "chinese". WTF is going on in their minds. That's like saying all caucasian people are British, even those Italians. I think they should try to keep all of their stereotypes in before ASSUMING that EVERYONE is Chinese.

Anyways, today I had a different lunch, thus I was unaccustomed to everyone's table settings, clans, feuds, territories, etc. I searched around for some of my friends. Then I tried searching for aquaintances. No luck there. I finally decided to sit down with Tiffany (Advanced Geometry person/1st clarinet player) and Zach (Star Wars Fan/ Quiz Bowl Aquaintance) and a bunch of other people who I had contact with. The first half of the time proceeded with me sipping on my Chili and crackers and everyone else talking about StarWars or being a tomboy. I sat there trying to act as part of them, but obviously, my emulation tactics failed. I obviously stood out and looked like a total outcast. Outcasted even in the lower tiers of society. That's when I realized my only course of action would be to leave or stay. This was a very crucial decision. If I left, I risked not finding another table and looking like a total loser/idiot when I came back. If I stayed, I would have to be alienated for the next 30 minutes. Which would I choose? I chose to stay because it would be alot more secure that way. Finally, lunch was over and my escapade of lunch alienation was over. By the time I got to biology, I realized I lost my scientific calculator and I got really sad and angry with myself. That is why I kicked myself in the foot a few times. Not the smartest thing to do, but I don't have a stress ball, so I had to do something. That's why my foot is sore. It's late at night, and I am unable to process my anime into PPC format so Ryan will have to go without anime. I am still angry that my calculator is missing. I am really angry.

In other news, my earplugs are here, so that is good.

Night is here. Time to go.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I'm halfway through the weekend.

I have gotten my 3 RadioHead Cd's and thus I have copied them to every possible media. MP3's and WMV's on my ipaq, and pc, extra CD's for Ryan, and lots of burning. Ryan spent the night last night, and he reminded me that I had diving practice on Monday. I am very afraid...

Anyways, today was a very successful AOL CD collecting day. I obtained 40CD's from various vendors. Also, my family bought a fire pit, which is awesome because I get to burn things now. It's oddly satisfying. My primordal instincts urge me to burn on and on. I'm going to a play with Devstar and Oliver tomorow. I'm sure it will be very colorful. Anyways, right now, I am formatting anime for playback on my pocket pc, so Ryan and I can watch them on the bus.

Tomorow I have to satisfy my obligation to go to the gym, which by the way I hate, but feel guilty if I don't go. I just hate it so much, but if I don't go, I just feel explosive because then I just look at myself as a failure. Either way is a burning death spiral to hell, so I guess I'll go to the gym because that's the right thing to do. I've almost finished "To Kill A Mockingbird". I want to finish it so I can start hypothesizing for my project.

On the subject of my firepit, I am in a wood delima. If you know me and have excess wood, please, pretty please email me. Wood is good.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I feel like dead flesh.

Anyways, I went with Devinoid and Oliver to a play which was TOTALLY SPECTACULAR! Not really, but it was very good. Today was a monday. I'm sure you're stunned by my genius observation. As with mondays, I got up, went to school, and by the time Math was over, I felt like a shell of my former self. I guess I was kind of overwhelmed by all the homework and all of my extracurricular activities, my body just kind of stopped working. My dead flesh and the textiles attached to it seemed to move, but it was surreally moving without my control. I just floated over to band, where I played terribly because I was unable to practice lately because of my insane schedule. Our teacher didn't dismiss us in time so my next mission was clear. It was to get to French in time. Unfortunately, I dropped my folders, which spilled the contents out on the linoleum floor, which also happened to trip people, which knocked over stands, which in the end I had to clean up. With only about 3 minutes to spare, my adrenaline was pumped up. The race was on. I sped out the door, checking my pockets to see if my wallet and glasses were still there. With that in check, I rushed up the stairs, furiously opened my locker, slammed it, flew down the stairs, and with a few seconds to spare, I made it to French, albeit sweating and panting. What a rush...

Anyways, tonight I had alot of homework, so this is pretty much my only entertainment, and it should be, because it's my hobby. I learned how to program my cd player in my room, which is a big plus, because I can use it as a sleep timer now. That's very very good. Another thing on this list of things to do is to bring earplugs with me all the time. This is to shut everyone up around me in study hall. Everyone is just a complete annoying biznach, so my plan is to put on my earplugs, forget about all the untamed masses of people who happen to NOT have homework, and just focus soly on my task at hand. It sounds hard, because it is.

Anyways, I am converting my animes for Ryan and I to watch. I think this morning busride anime show is being successful.

Also, when I have time, I must schedule a studio appointment with Ryan and Anna for my upcoming AV project. Very interesting... Another hobby of mine. Movie making.

Anyways, I must remember to get "The Battle of Evermore" by Led Zepplin because Oliver told me to. And you know what happens when Oliver is unsatisfied. He comes at night wielding a giant pancreas plush toy, picks your lock, comes up to you with his pseudo-hobo-imitation voice and starts wacking you with it while you scream in terror as his pseudo-hobo-imitaiton voice starts laughing with audacious insaneness. Yes that's oliver.

Time to go to sleep. Good night.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded: Went to diving practice. Fun. Homework tetris. Not applicable. Tomorow maybe better. No burn. No time.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I was picked for quiz bowl. This is a very, extremely surprising thing. I am so superfragishly happy! It's like... unbelieveable. Undeniable euphoria is overwhelming me. And also keeping me from doing my essay and various other works I have to do soon. I went to diving today, saw Ryan smack the water a few times. He was so red, you could have mistaken him for the Japanese flag. Obviously, I fell behind, but Rachel joined our little gathering and it's all good and happy. Cheeseman... you've gotta love that name!

Anyways, I have enveloped myself in RadioHead. I really need more of a music collection, because sooner or later, I'll get bored of RadioHead, and I'll forget about them. I don't want that happening. I've just got to mention again, my overwhelming euphoria from getting into quizbowl. It's euphoric.

I killed a bug on the computer desk a few seconds ago. I'm begining to suspect that my computer is full of bugs (The ones that squirm around when you slowly rip them apart), which would explain why it makes a cracking noise every once in awhile. Stupid bugs, always running into the computer fan. Maybe I should clean the computer... or not.

Anyways, I've planned my movie out, mostly. I've scheduled a date with Ryan for the Saturday of this week. A interview scene he has to act out. I hope he has a shred of talent, or else he's dead. Not really. No... really. Some school teacher or some hippie is going to find me and then say that I wanted to kill Ryan and then charge me with conspiracy to murder, and then I'll go to jail. So for the last time, all you hippies, no, I'm not going to kill anyone. I'm starting to share my hippie-disliking thoughts of Oliver.

Oliver... Such an awesome name. Like Cheeseman. Oliver sounds like Olive, so it reminds me of Olive Garden, where they have chicken alfredo which also is the most awesome dish in the world, but it costs 11 bucks, so it sucks if you only have 10 bucks, because chicken alfredo is awesome. Yes, Oliver... mmmm...

I need to think of a thing for my essay. I'm thinking of a more unified world federal government that collects taxes from everyone and distributes the services equally to everyone. Social security, medicare, stuff like that. People would have less kids, and the world wouldn't be big anymore.

Fine, maybe that's not plausible right now, but I'm really sleepy and that's all I can think of. Except maybe, the unified federal government brainwashing everyone to become avatars of the "perfect" human. What an efficient society that would be. No more smokers loitering at the library. No more scary people at school with chains stuck to their pants for some strange odd reason. Yes, no more idiots who pretend to be funny, but are really just morons.

Talking about scary kids with chains stuck to their pants, what are those chains for? I always thought the chains were for self defence, but who are you going to defend yourself from? Plus, it's kind of embarassing to stick chains to your pants. I mean, you can call it "cool" or whatever, but it just looks stupid. It's like sticking a metal straw in your ear and calling it cool. It just doesn't make any sense. You have to drag all that around and for what? Other kids calling you "cool"? I don't think so. I think that is the most dysfunctional thing I see all day. Chains on your pants? Give me a break.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Anger, dispair, envy, sadness... All mixed in today...

I mean, it all started out in supervised study when Janet called me "smart". I mean, she should just shut up and stop judging me by these idiotic things like grades, or that I'm in honors classes. I mean, all you have to do is set your priorities streight in elementary school and middle school, and you're in a good position in high school, which happens to put you in a good position when you're in college, which leads to a good position in your career, and a good retirement. All because of your priorities in 5th grade. Never thought about it that way did you? And now alot of people are stuck in a rut. A rut so hard to get out of, many just drop out of high school. Think about it.

Then came quizbowl. I think I'm the most inarticulate, inactive, inconcivebly dull person on the team. I am quiet to everyone's dismay, and I just purely suck at my questions. I just am a terrible person. That and I have trouble understanding things. Like logarithms. I HAVE to study them tomorow so I can do them. I feel like a failure. That on top of Janet's comments on my so called "smartness".

Next comes Diving. I lack coordination, skill, and flexibility. Thus, I am terrible at anything that is a sport. Tennis, Diving, you name it, I stink at it. I am slowly falling behind Ryan and everyone else. I'm still on my approach and he's on the flips. I'm still on the front dives, he's on the backwards dive. Whenever I come out of the water, my coach tries to say something nice like, "That's better", or "That's ok..." or something like that to try to encourage me. I don't know if it's sincere or he's just feeling sorry for how much I suck at diving.

You know what? I'm feeling really failuristic today. I'm just a total failure.

item.dc:creator: A.Barnett
item.content:encoded:
Hey blog-thing. Sorrow about the delayed update, again. School has been rush, rush rush. I've been loaded with homework, soccer practice, workouts, and memorization of Japanese words and phrases. It's so much fun, Japanese is my favorite class. I can read almost anything written in legible hiragana. Yay me! Anyways, I have the time to update tonight because I am laid up with what feel like a hairline fracture half the time, and numb the other half, of a foot. Yes, I had a soccer game, and we won 3-1. Of course, some idiots decided to water the field before we got there, creating pot holes and slick spots and plenty of mud. As I went to bomb a ball that was coming my way, my foot caught in a pothole, twisted, and hit the rapidly speeding ball wrong, crunching my boot foot. It hurts. Kurt (my stepdad) tried to fix it, and that was ever so painful. But, it helped a bit and the swelling stopped. Yayness.
In other news, I am about to begin work on my book, yet again. I love it. The tension building in it gave me the jumps last night, it was awesome (in some weird sort of way). Anyways, all for now. I hope my foot injury isn't serious, the tournament is just another two weeks away! (one more game to go!) Talk later!
~Amanda

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I'm still brooding over the fact that this 7 year old kid next door called me the "biggest nerd in the neighboorhood". It's really perturbing me because I can't comprehend why a child so young can harbor such a evil comment. I think she's lying about the whole neighboorhood calling me the "biggest nerd in the neighboorhood", but she could be telling me the truth. She's saying that everybody's saying it, to help justify her own comment. That doesn't justify any crap. You can lie in my face that everybody says that, or make up some lame excuse that everybody says that, but it won't justify a personal and malignant comment directed to your neighboor. It's really perplexing me, because I can't get over the fact that that little kid can do something that evil. Just think about what happens when she grows older. She'll probably end up as one of those often naive popular girls who make up every rational (and sometimes irrational) excuse for everything. You know, the kind that giggle and spread rumors at the same time. It's called multitasking to them, I call it a vile anti-social act.

Anyways, tomorow is going to involve serious concentration. I'm coming home at 6PM, which leaves me 3 hours to do my homework. I usually have more than 3 hours of homework, which will mean that I will be ripping my hair out and looking up suicide up in the dictionary. Of course, I'm not going to kill myself because that totally defeats the purpose of doing my homework in the first place. Duh... Anyways, I have to take a bunch of tests tomorow and get all stressed out all day, and probably not have enough time, which will make me explode and then I'll get all angry, and I'll probably start babbling and shaking violently, then you know what happens next. The Explosion. Not just any explosion, it's wall to wall blood-organ frenzy of flesh flying every which way. Ok, maybe being gory won't make me feel any better about it, but it was worth a try.

I have to research cell phones now. I must learn the best deals.... Must learn....

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Sitting in a closed room. Trying to concentrate on something, but your mind wanders away on the squirell that is jumping around outside the window. Later, you see that squirel dead, on the road. You ran over it.

Anyways, I have my projects done and everything is good to go. Tests were taken and everything looks fine... Except my front dive. I am terrible. I lack the skills to do a front dive. Fortunately for me, I have a knack for doing back dives. Yay, I'm good at something for once! Yippilicious.

In other news, those kids with chains on their pants still freak me out. Also, I am invited to the Elmore's halloween party. I'm going to the beach on the day of the party, so I'll have to miss it. I never enjoy parties as much as I do sitting here typing. It seems really anti-social, like something some mentally-scarred, depressed hobo would do, but it comes naturally. Sitting here, just typing away. You really can get off track. It offers a sense of freedom. Like you can talk to yourself about whatever you want. In reality, I have no rights in this country because I am not a citizen. Some psycho killer living in a trailer park has more rights than I do. How can that be? First of all, that psycho killer was born in America. I was not. That is why I have no rights and he does.

Anyways, the outcome of the tests, and my outcome on the diving board will be the crucial determining factors in tomorows mood. Keep an eye out for either, happylicous, or evil-frowning violent exposive mode. Most likely the latter.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Diving has become scary. Thing I fear the most though, is the coach thinking I'm afraid. Yes, I am fearful of fear itself. I almost hit the diving board when I did a back flip, according to Ryan. I seriously don't want to show my fear. I have to mask it. Somehow, I need a way to generate confidence. Generate confidence like Devin generates stalkers and girls. That kind of confidence generation. I may never generate enough confidence to equal Devin's girl generating capacity, but I can try.

Anyways, I lost my Delta Headphones. I really loved them. They cost 2 bucks and lasted me long and true, but today, most likely, they died. Somewhere out in the abyss they are. Waiting to be found. Next time I travel, I'm flying Delta, and I AM going to get some 2$ headphones. I AM.

Also, my English teacher got angry because my printer doesn't work, and she didn't give me any resources off of to write my script with. I don't see how it is fair to be reprimanded for something that... that... is something out of my grasp. I can't use Ryan's printer without alot of time (his floppy drive is dead) and I don't have any other friends who are willing to print for me. I couldn't find any script-writing resources on the internet... UGH. Why do I have to be punished. Why do the people who do the least work, buy the prettiest poster boards, and joke around when presenting get the best grades!? I'm probably going to get a worse grade than everyone else, even though I spent at LEAST 10 hours on planning, thinking, pondering, recording, writing, and debating with myself to put this project together. It's America ain't it? Is that why geniuses die rich, and actors die feverishly, astoundingly, dirty, filthy rich? Does it really make sense? Does it?

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
"Devin generates stalkers and girls"

You make it sound like a I create them in my basement laboratories.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
There was once was a bunch of boys and some girls and a nerd. These boys, girls, and nerd rode the same bus. While on the bus, these boys and girls talked. In the conversations there were outrageous tales, epic quests, and sick accusations. This annoyed the nerd. The nerd then realized that these boys and girls has a perturbed sense of what is "funny as h*ll", "f*cking sh*tty", and "s*cks d*ck". Thus, this nerd ignored them.

It's really funny, but disturbing, when listening to your (I don't want to admit this) peers, because they have this illogical sense of thinking. To them, the more vulgarity you use, the more superior you are. It's funny, because they use vulgarity in stupid locations just to boost their superiority. It's disturbing, because these kids are going to adults someday. Adults that work in the society we call America. Whatever their problem is, I hope they work it out someday. I hope this illogical thinking is just a stage. Just a stage...

I think my presentation was a success. People called it "funny", but I was still confused on if it was a negative "funny" or a positive "funny". I really hope it was a postitive "funny".

Diving ended with a painful moment. A smack on my back while trying to do a front flip. My back feels like it has been smacked with a cricket paddle made for Nazis. Speaking of Nazis, can you believe they still exist. I can see how they seem persecuted (No one likes Nazis, except... well... Nazis) and how they see themselves as a minority, but I don't think that's a valid reason to create summer camps and communes dedicated to the hatred of foreigners and Jews. Questionable behavior...

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Yea,

I'm overburdened, overworked. My feet feel like bricks, and by the way, I stink at diving. My day's been swell. I have a math and french quiz tomorow, not to mention the english character analysis and thesis statement. Just swell... (If you can't tell yet, I'm being sarcastic).

Diving practice today felt like it went so slowly. So undeniably slow, even Ryan felt it. Possibly because 2 people got hurt today, diving. Rachel skinned her leg, and Thomas cut his lip. The fear was searing through my flesh. Not a hot searing, but a cold searing, like dry ice taped to your forehead kind of searing. I suddenly went cold. I couldn't help but shake. The cold. The scratchy diving board. The terribly frightening water. The fear. I couldn't take it. I have to jump. As I land in the water, my thoughts include, "Am I dead?" and "I can't feel my legs". Imagine this scenario repeating itself for an hour. Yes, an hour...

Now it is time for study and sleep, a time for a rush of cramming, and to immagine that this is going to happen tomorow too. I just have to tell myself that I will make it. I can make it to the next day of diving practice. Then, it's smooth cruising from there. Smooth cruising...

I make it to the end of the day today, to study hall, my last class, to find Janet dismayed, as usual. (I know, my commas are everywhere, but live with it.)She called me a genius, which truly disturbed me, because she obviously doesn't know the meaning of "smartness", whatever that means. Seriously, I get good grades. I'm in honors classes. I like to read. But does that mean she can label me something that I obviously am not? I don't think so. Or possibly, maybe, she's being nice to me, a tough question it is.

I read in the newspaper about blogs and such, and something hit me. Not literally, but in my head. I see so many people who start blogs with great enthusiasm. It eventually trickles down to updation every other day... then to updation on the weekends... then updation every month... until they totally forget about their blog, and they just break off. They might have broken off, but their websites and blogs are still taking up server space. Think about it. It's like space junk. It floats out in cyberspace taking up room and having no purpose. I hate it. Internet pollution is what I call it. Absolutely haneous.

Talking about absolutely haneous, I heard someone talk about their friends getting drunk and disoriented. That is such a disgrace. Being intoxicated at such a young age. Destined for a life of little success. How can they accept it? Why did they do it? A question that should be answered.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
If you are going to dramatize, Ryo, do it in the past or present tense. Not in both.

Kids call smart people who make the right choices "geniuses." It's an exaggeration, but you are going to have to live with it.

Internet pollution isn't haneous. Internet pollution is heinous.

Intoxication at such an early age (not to mention, bragging about it) is both haneous and heinous.

Sorry...I felt like commentating on your post today.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Diving is frustrating me. So is everything else I do.

I think I just am terrible at everything I do. It's depressing...

I never have time for anything, I feel like I have no friends. Devin broke my camera. Projects overwhelming me. Intense competiton. Intense fear. Cannot escape.

I just sometimes can't handle it. It's overwhelming me to a point where I forget what I should be writing about. The things I should be writing about are my hassles in life, but when these things start adding up on you, you just forget about the hassles and have to move on. It's crazy, but you have to do it if you're going to make it out of school alive. Overwhelming...

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I suck at diving, but I want to learn more. I'm still ages behind Ryan's awesomeness, and I am probably the worst person at diving, and I also stump the coaches with my illegitimate dives, but I want to do more. Call me the pessimistic optimist, but that's what I feel like. I feel like I hate diving because I suck so much, but I really want to do better. It pushes me farther because I hate myself so much. Odd...

I don't have enough time for anything. I'm forcing myself to try to be in bed by 8:30, but that crunches my free time to practically nothing. I bet tomorow that my english teacher will get angry at me because my printer is broken and I can't print. I find it so frustrating that I am penilized for not doing something that is impossible.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I went to Buffalo Wild Wings for a Quiz Bowl outing. I was the only "freshie" there. Anyways, I thought it was a really smoky place. I can't immagine anyone being able to live in that kind of environment. I was half-gasping after 2 hours. That smoke lingers in your hair, eyes, and clothes. It's so third-world. I can't believe that America is tolerating this, but I guess that's what chemicals do to your brain.

I was talking to my Biology teacher at the Quiz Bowl outing (she's the coach) and we were talking about education systems, public schools, teachers, etc, and I was thinking... If I was stuck in a "average" class back when I was in kindergarten. If I was stuck there, and was stuck in the "average" classes until I graduated, I would miss alot. Think about it. Kid A goes to an "average" class and kid B goes to an "excellerated" class. Let's say that kid B learns twice as much as kid A. That means that by those kid's senior year, kid B would have learned 13 more years worth of material than kid A. It would suck to be kid A, but alot of people are.

Anyways, it's late at night and I can't get to sleep because of a caffine rush that I am on from Buffalo Wild Wings. Too much soda. Plus, it's my sisters birthday party and I'm afraid of going to sleep. 5 little girls. Dangerous...

In other news, I've made a nightstand out of AOL disk cartons. It's rather fashionable. I will post a picture of it someday. I really like it. I think I've collected 140 AOL Cd's. Maybe more. Something like that. Right now, I'm discussing my destroyed camera with Devin. I need it back and he justifies that it isn't his fault because he didn't do anything to it. Even though it wasn't his fault, I can't just ignore the fact that my camera is broken. This is quite a delima.

item.dc:creator: A.Barnett
item.content:encoded:
Hey blogthing. Looks like yours truly, myself, gets to update more often now. Isn't that great? Sorry, I'm trying to be optimistic today. If you must know (or in other words, if I must tell...) I have been quite busy with soccer and my academics lately. I apologize first and foremost for not updating because of those reasons. But now that soccer season is over and I am out of commission, I get to update you on my life! Isn't that so much fun? ha, ha.
Yes, I am bored out of my mind.
Why, might you ask. Well, those particular Monday I was outvoted in my quest for going to school. I had to stay home. Why? Well, because I had a soccer tournament and almost every part of me is aching. We got second place, but at a price. Miss accident prone me tore either a ligament, a tendon, or a muscle. My friend's mom, who just so happens to be a doctor and was on hand, said it was probably one of those. Her claims are supported by my stepfather, Kurt. So, lucky me gets to be on crutches for a couple days, a week at most, and in recuperation for about two weeks. Yah...
Excuse my lack of happiness, I'm hurting really bad right now. I can't believe how hard it is to live right now. I'm relying on people, and it annoys me that I'm not completely self-suficient anymore. I took for granted so many things... I feel so incompetent now. So callous and stupid with a capital S.
But enough of my pity party. I'll try to update later with more news. Alright? Until then, wish me luck at school tomorrow! I really, REALLY hope I don't die...
~Amanda

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
My lack of updating has been caused by wi-fi research, price comparing, and intensive deal negotiations. This lack of updating is also caused by the fact that Devin is trying to ignore that my camera is totalled. He just won't speak to me. I understand it "wasn't his fault" and that he doesn't want to take responsibility, but I'm sure we can just work out something if we just talked. I mean, I called him like a million times, and he just won't listen to me. Grr...

Anyways, I had to miss diving practice and a quizbowl competition in "Indy" (a.k.a. Indianapolis) because of a dentists apointment. I go in and sit down, and the lady checks my teeth for what seems like an eternity. While this seemingly eternal teeth cleaning, I'm staring up at the dentist light that had some name on it. I can't remember what it was. It was like "Procter&Gamble" except there were different names on it. That was what I was thinking of the whole time. If those names on the dentist light were people, those people are now part of history. Their legacy will live on forever. Their names, touching millions of people sitting in bland dentist chairs, looking up at the light, trying to think of something to end the maddening bordom. Those names, that I stupidly forgot.

Anyways, I got a 3-way headphone splitter, with an amplifier, which is awesome, so now Ryan and I can watch Anime in SURROUND SOUND. And listen to music in AMPLIFICATION MODE. Which totally ROXXORS. I need to publish a book called, "Having a bad day? Cuss in French!". I would buy it. I mean, what better way of telling someone their a hairy, one-eyed, smelly, pig-of-a-idiot, than to say, "borgne, smelly, porc-de-un-idiot"? Porc-de-un-idiot. Such a versatile word.

What really sums this week up is, KIRBY HYPER MODE.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: You could have told me it was just the batteries idiot.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
It's one of those times when you're on the computer for the most of the day, but you don't seem to be able to blog. One link leads you to a freeware program, which leads you to a spyware, which you have to uninstall, which gets you to another link that leads you to an mp3 stash, etc., etc. I've gone on a freeware downloading spree that has gone quite well. I've figured out how to get local and up-to-date radar/satellite data via my ipaq. Very handy...

Anyways, I've spent alot of time configuring my wireless network, but unfortunately my wi-fi reciever has not arrived. I'm faithfully awaiting that fedex man to come to my door. I would have preferred a UPS man though. I lean toward UPS for shipping, based on previous experience. They deliver faster and more reliably than fedex and the like. Come on fedex, catch up already!

Today is going to be one of the last clear days of the season. Outside is pristine blue, yellow, red, and orange. The last, nice fall day. And I'm sitting here in front of my computer typing this up. Sad.

Now, let's talk about school. I sit at a table of 4. All the "cool" nerds sit at this other table. This "other" table is always packed, sometimes people are even standing around this table. I have yet to be able to infiltrate this table. My purpose is to sit with my friends and chat. My current table involves little discussion or even semi-logical talk. The usual conversations at this table usually involve vulgar descriptions of random people, insults, and talk about exploding things. It really disturbs me. I think Joe has veered off course a bit. I wish he would stop talking about gliders and boats. If that's his passion, that's great, but instead of talking to me about it, he should go build one. I mean, he also wants to be a game designer. He doesn't even know what goes into making a game. You can't just pour out ideas and get paid for it. It takes hard work. He should understand that before going and charging into unknown territory. I still want to be friends with him, but it still bothers me sometimes.

I'll probably upload some pictures soon. I hope you enjoy them if I do.
