item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
My Linux installing adventure has cost me so much time I have little to update.

Anyways, I have to go to some vacation in Michigan or somewhere. Great, not. Hopefully I'll be able to get back early enough to network my computers more. That's all for now. Expect me back on Sunday afternoon.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I have returned from the elusive "amusement" park called Cedar Point, and amazingly, it was fun. I hate high elevations, large crowds, and insane clowns, but I actually enjoyed it. Pretty amazing...

Anyways, the view from the top of some of those roller coasters was spectacular. You could see for miles. Even though I enjoyed it, there was stress involved. I learned not to go on a log ride on a cold day. I also learned not to go in a haunted house when wanting to go to the bathroom. It was "good" stress, I guess, but it still made me tired.

On top of that I went to join Ryan on his halloween escapade. I gave most of my candy to him since I can't stand candy. It overwhelms me. I ate three "fun" sized candy bars and I felt full. I don't understand how people can stand eating all of that candy. It disturbs me. Ryan called me anorexic once. I think the world is messed up when people start calling fit people "anorexic" and overweight people "normal". It's a screwed up world out there, and I live in it.

While "trick-or-treating" I learned something. I learned that junky cars with teenagers in them will throw fire crackers at you, minivans are good for asking for directions, and jeeps... never mind.

I practiced for my playing test, but I believe I am a failure, so I stopped. I hope "fate" will be nice to me. I practiced though. Hope is a good feeling.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
You know when you've been overworked when you start hallucinating and forgetting to update your blog. I've got tests, worksheets, holidays, practices, tournaments, bla, bla, etc., etc.

It's driving me to a point where I just want to type out everything, but by the time I know it, it's already 9:30PM and you're stuck in a rut and you want to go to sleep. It's like that right now. Alot has gone on that I have to talk about, but there is little time to type it.

I suppose tomorow will enable me to have a bit of extra time on my hands to do things like... Type.

It is frantic, and it is a mad dash of sorts, but what's at the end of the tunnel? What's the reward? I have no idea. I just have to keep traversing the tunnel to figure out the reward for all of this work. Maybe there is no real incentive. Maybe I'm playing tricks on myself. Even if I am, I am going to force myself to trudge on through the endless geometry homework that everyone else thinks is easy, but I don't. Trudge on with my french test that I am so nervous about. I will get through Friday, and I will survive. Over and out.

Now to brush my teeth...

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Linux configurations, hardware drivers, new computer building specifications, RAMs, CPUs, PCMIAs, PSs, and the like are keeping me from updating. It's so frustrating, but I enjoy learning about computers. I've come to occupy the "computer nerd" niche, I guess. I plan to build my first computer soon. Earlier, I have installed Fedora Core (a form of Red Hat Linux) on the crabby beige computer. It has been trying to resist, but I have forced it to work. Luckily, I have not had to mess with the BIOS. For those of you who don't know (or care) about what I'm saying, keep reading.

At school, I get loaded up on homework, upon which I go to diving, and come home at six thirty, upon which I cram and try to get my homework done and ... I have to sleep. Updating will hopefully resume tomorow.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Being demoted to 4th chair as a clarinet in band isn't so bad... is it? I mean, there are plenty of people out there who are worse than me! Ok, fine then, I am just trying to justify my poor performance. So be it. I am a terrible clarinet player, and my poor performance has cost me a niche I loved so dearly, the 1st clarinets... Oh yea...

Anyways, today was hard, but hopefully tomorow will be more laid back with the half day and all. And about the election. Well, better not talk about that. If I side with one side, the others will probably ban me, and vice versa. Politics should be taboo. I mean, open discussion is great, except when you're illegitimately persecuted by your opinions.

One thing I would like to say about CVS's Pharmacy's photo service is this. It streight forwardly sucks. I walk in to the "one hour" photo development area with 29 digital photos. Luckily, the printer is actually working, so I give them my digital photos and they say that their "backed up" so it sucks because the "one hour" photo is really a "48 hour" photo.

I have to go now. I have no time. Seriously, I can't get any work done because I'm typing in my sisters room and she's going to sleep. It stinks.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I'm so frustrated and it's making me angry amd sadistic.

It was a complete misunderstanding when my dad said that he needed a new computer and he wanted me to build it. My hopes and dreams are shattered. All of my weekend research has gone to waste. I am a failure. I can't do anything right now, and I don't even want to think about going to diving practice. I'm so emotional right now. I can't get anything done, like my French homework.

My French homework is to do something happy that brings "joy" to us and others. Our teacher made a point on how we should be happy and help others and charity, and all that other good stuff, but I really don't have time to be "joyful" or make other people happy. I have research to do. Being happy is a waste of time. Why can't you just be sadistic and sad and be more efficient. I type faster, think faster, and physically perform better when I'm in a state of anger or sadness. I can't do that when I'm all happy doody running around in a meadow of flowers and helping homeless people in my meadow of happy flowers with smiling faces that can sing. Plus, we have to write a paragraph on what we did. How am I going to acomplish this when I am so pressed for time, even on a half day? I can't get anything done, nonetheless make myself and others happy for the sake of humanity! I can't do it, and she's grading it. The fact that this is homework makes it even worse. If this is for a grade I am going to have to do it. The next course of action is to find out what to do.

I pry into my mind and I can't think of anything worthy of doing that will both make me happy inside and make others happy. I could walk my dog, but I'm not sure my dog would be happy about that, and I sure wouldn't be happy. Plus, the that is the example my teacher explained to us in class, so it would just be a cheap cop-out, and I would look like a poser. Not a good idea. In the end, I am in a lose-lose situation. I can't get myself to be happy, and I can't do anything to anyone else to make them happy. happy, happy, happy, happy. Who has time to be happy?

I'm so frustrated. I trouble myself.

item.dc:creator: A.Barnett
item.content:encoded:
Blog-thing, in the dreary and often times blissfully unaware set of mind my friends find themselves in, I can't help but wonder if they are totally ignorant of the fact that they are highschoolers and NOT in kindergarten. Ah, what joy it must be to be like them, so blissfully unaware of how childish they look.
Isn't that a nice introspective into the mind? I tend to be doing that a lot these days, desperately trying not to loose myself again, while further fortifying my social walls. My friends are worried about me. Again. I am so pathetic, aren;t I? I worry even my friends.
But, I wonder, who is more pathetic? Me, or my parents? My parents can't even see my slipping sanity, maybe that is because they too are intoxicated by the realm of stupid and foolish things. How dreary, how blaze, and how utterly fruitless. Are these my final moments of sanity? I do not know, all I can say is that I can feel myself slipping back into the place I had so desperately wanted to erase. That little box that had contained my very soul for most of my life.
I guess I was foolish to think of myself as free from such monotonous tyranny. Foolish for thinking that I didn't have to shrink in the halls, and furthermore, I was stupid enough to think that I would never again flinch if someone so much as brushes my shoulder.
I'm sure I look fine to everyone around me, but I guess I haven't let anyone know me well enough to see past this mask of mine, to peer into my eyes and see my cries for help. It is scaring me, and I am at a loss as to how to fix myself again. It seems my sister shunning me is breaking me, and my own withering body is tearing my apart.
My physical existence and spiritual soul are at sake, and no one can hear me screaming. Is it that my facades are actually working against me now? Foolish even the toughest of my critics even now? How I wish I knew these answers, and how to satisfy my brain's lust for knowledge.
Until I can figure these things out, I will ty to fufill my promise and update.
On a note that makes me even happier, I have lost weight yet again, and I am succeeding in my quest to be physcially fit. Yet I can't help but think about this quest, and how sad it is that everyone, no matter what size, race, shape, or color, can not yet be accepted.
In my sanity's plight, my sane voice cries out to me in an anguished cry; 'Is this world we're living in full of three-year-olds, too proud to admit their own faults and accept others?'
Till next time, bog-thing,
~Amanda

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I suppose all fares well today.

I got a free towel thing from Greg, my diving coach, today. I'm really glad about that. I guess that really brightened my day. Also, I used open-office today, which made me feel like a 1337 open-sourcer. That spruced up my day too.

Unfortunately, I'm still griping about the fact that I don't get to build a computer, but I am glad that my dad got a DVD drive to put in my computer that will enable it to rip videos. That is, if I can install it correctly.

According to some people who read this website (I didn't know people even cared about me), I have been too cynical of myself. Well, I have been quite cynical and pessimistic lately, but that's what makes my write interesting things. That's what this whole blog is about. It's about unvented rage, depression, and sometimes subtle feelings.

My classmates in the hallway walk extremely slow. It's like they are supposedly walking, but everything seems to crawl along. I can start to smell the sick, dastardly fumes from the perfume someone is wearing. I can't stand it. If people could just walk a bit faster, and a bit more focused, there wouldn't be a need for detentions and tardys. I hate slow walkers. It really gets to me. Maybe they can't help it, but just make a lane for slow walkers. Like a slow lane where anyone who wants to take it slow can go. It's just so annoying, and it clogs up the school.

Also, in French, we had a birthday. That usually means sweets. The birthday girl brought this cake. It was neon pink colored and was supposedly "chocolate". I'm not saying the cake was bad or anything, but America is seriously obsessed with brightly colored, sugar-dense, highly processed foods, especially sweets. It bothers me that people put such a price on sugar and caffine. They are addicted, and they are puppets controlled by those who manufacture such drugs. That gets to me too. The french teacher said that the birthday-sweet giving would have to stop. She said she had a weight problem. The question is, why can't she just resist the urge to eat the sugar? Why couldn't she just not eat the food that is brought? Is this society so impulsive? So "I'm not going to blame myself for my problems"-ish? It disturbs me. There was this overweight child in the locker room after I was done diving. He said, "I wan't to go home and eat candy". Obviously, this child has some problems. With his weight, he shouldn't be eating unhealty foods, nonetheless candy! It's outrageous. He's probably going to get fatter if he doesn't do something about it. What a society this is. Sugar and Caffine power it, and Fats and Cholesterol destroy it. What a world.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Time flies when you're angry, cynical, depressed, and overworked. I know it.

Anyways, the climax of my day is when I get to sit here in my room listening to classical music on NPR radio and just ranting on about my sucky life that is so great. Actually, the real high point of today will be when I vacuum my room. That's the life. I hope I can go to some places that stock up on AOL cd's. I need some for my desk enlargement I am planning to build with the AOL cd cases. AOL cd cases are a great way to make free furniture.

When I think about it, I really appreciate this peaceful moment in my life where I can just sit and type.

Ryan said that he had "better things to do" than me. I wasn't sure if he was implying that my lifestyle is inferior to his, or implying that my hobbies suck. Either way, it was a very rude comment, but we all make mistakes. I forgive Ryan, obviously because he's my friend. Now that I think about it, I have more contacts now than ever. High School has alienated me and created new contacts at the same time. Wow.

Anyways, I was thinking about school killing rampages today. How could you engineer a school to lessen the damage of killing rampages. Suppose they make all of the corners in the school rounder. Would that effect anything? I just wonder around in my brain about this stuff while I'm walking in the hallway. Usually, there's a cluster of popular talking drones clumping together in the middle of a crucial intersection. While I'm waiting for these idiots to move, or for some angry football player to push them aside for me, I think about the people around me. Sometimes I make up stories about them based on their looks on their faces. You know, everyone has a story, even I.

Today, someone asked me, "are you OK?". I said, "yes". She said that I looked sad. Well, I replied that I'm always sad or angry or insane, and that's what makes me myself. I was surprised someone actually thought about me.

Sometimes I the stress builds up and I can't stand it anymore. Sometimes I think about killing myself. Yes, you probably think I have some kind of problem, but think about it. You have thought about killing yourself, but everyone is smart enough to recognize that this feeling is completely irrational. I agree. After I realize that what I am thinking is stupid, I feel like a poser. Like a person who wants to kill themselves just to get attention, which totally defeats the purpose of killing yourself. I feel like I'm just an attention hog, kind of like Hunley at East Tipp. He did things for the sole purpose of getting attention from others. I don't want to be like him. That's why I always shrug it off. When I read about teenage suicide, I think to myself, did they really mean it? Was it an impulse action? Did they not see that killing yourself is pointless? It won't solve your problems, because you won't exist anymore. I suppose it would carry some purpose if you believed in heaven and all of that, but I don't think suicide is a even remotely rational alternative. If other people have to deal with it, so do you. Maybe the suicidee was just lazy. Too lazy to deal with everything. Or maybe they were bored. It's so interesting prying into these kinds of lives. Trying to figure out what's going on in their minds. I find it facinating to see what's going on in others minds.

Anyways, time flies when you're overworked and despotic. I can't believe tomorow is Friday. I can't remember what true relaxation feels like.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I felt like I was going into shock today.

After a pleasant weekend, the real world feels harsh. This morning, I was wondering what my incentive to wake up was. I was in my bed for an hour trying to figure out a good reason to get out of bed. There wasn't anything special about today, nothing to tease me out of bed so I can function. I just stared at my blue alarm clock for an hour, waiting it to force me out of bed. Waiting for the inevitable disturbance of my peaceful thinking. Eventually, it came and past, I woke up, got on the bus... And I still wondered what my incentive to function was. I couldn't figure it out. By the middle of they day, I got hungry, so I fiugred lunch would be my incentive. Lunch passed and I was still wondering what my incentive was. I wondered while diving practice was going on. What am I working for? I'm still wondering that at this moment. What is my incentive to wake up tomorow? What is my incentive to live?

I suppose the incentive to live for any life-form is to reproduce itself so it, as a species, can dominate the ecosystem. Humans have already achieved that. I guess we've gone past that incentive. The primal urge has been washed away from our superior intellects. We no longer function as an animal, but as completely different entities. Or maybe not. I'm probably standing on biased ground, since there probably are people out there who live for making more of themselves. I guess I'm just speaking for myself.

Anyways, someone told me to ask if Ryan was available for the "Sunshine Dance" thing. It kind of made me feel bad, but I said yes. Now I have to remember to tell him. These dances and other student-council sponsored trash should be abolished. It only results in alienation, depression, and self-hate. These supposed morale-boosters are just making us less socially privelaged folks hate ourselves. It makes me feel bad, but since all of the popular people are happy it is arranged accordingly.

I suppose the "Sunshine Dance" isn't so bad, as long as you are popular. Otherwise, it makes you feel suicidal. Take that student-council!

Anyways, my journalism teacher told me that exclaimation points are very unprofessional looking. I don't think she even knows my name. That's why she never calls on me. That's why she doesn't even pay attention to me. She only pays attention to the older kids. I always feel alone in that class. I hate journalism. There is no real meat to the learning. We read the newspaper for about an hour, then we are instructed to do some kind of writing excercize. This cycle repeats itself every day, except today. We were assigned to do an interview with someone who is not a family member or friend. When I got word of this, I felt like dying. I didn't think I would manage. But, I suppose I have to, being functional and all. I despise journalism. For anyone out there searching for Harrison High School Journalism Classes, it stinks. It is discouraging me from being a journalist. I am disgusted by it.

In other news, I smacked at least ten times in diving today. 3 in the head, 4 in the torso, 2 on the side, and 1 on my knee. This endless torture turned me into one sad, depressed bag of flesh. I was in pain, cold, and mindless. It all started adding up until I started getting really sad. I tried to chanel my sadness into anger, but only resulted in more depressing thoughts. I tried to chanel my sadness into determination, but I just got sadder. I then realized that my thoughts were obsolete. Sadness is a reaction to stress preparing me for an escape. The increased breathing, heartrate, and sensitive perception were obsolete. I didn't need that at the moment, so I just said, "Hey, why get sad? There's no logical reason to it. Your thoughts are obsolete. Forget about it.", and I did forget about it. It was quite a victory. I think that it's a useful skill, knowing when your brain is just running on instinct and not on reason. You can disable the instinct and come to logical terms.

I immagine the humans of the future struggling with primitive mind instincts. I hope we eventually evolve to forget about these instincts. In the future, they will be truely obsolete.

Anyways, I'm stressed out constantly this week, which means that I will be writing alot. Stress/Anger/Depression/Cynicism/Rage=Blog Posting. Simple equation for a blog that makes simple things complicated.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
For the past few hours, I have been trying to configure the DVD/CD drive from hell. Obviously, it won't get set up without a fight, so I've practically blown 3 hours out of my life trying to get it configured. It still doesn't work. There is fresh hope though, even though the warranty for the new computer is now void. I'm trying to forget that. Anyways, the computer freezes and I have to figure out why. I'll probably end up taking the CD drive out since the new DVD/CD drive makes it obsolete. Obviously, I need time, and I don't have time. It stinks. I am probably going to come home late tomorow since I'm going to a diving meet with Ryan, and it all comes down to this...

Time used to mean nothing to me. I used to have hours of time I could just blow off. now I don't have any time. People around me still have time, loads of it on their hands. That's why they make video games you know... Anyways, sooner or later, they'll have to learn to wager their time. I'm already learning. It's already time for me to go to sleep, and I'm typing this out in a last ditch effort to get some blogging time in before I collapse from exhaustion. Good night DVD/CD drive from hell...

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Less sleep, less logic, less cognitive function.

The homework, the stress, the new computer, and the new DVD drive from hell, all take up time. I don't have time anymore. I can't go to sleep like I used to. I have to promise myself that tomorow will be better though. That is the only way I'll get through life tomorow. I'll live for the sake of this blog.

I felt like an outcast today. I guess I'll feel sorry for myself by myself. I mean, I guess I was never "meant" to be sociable. Nerd by trade, writer at heart. I can never be sociable. I try not to show emotion. I cannot express myself in speech. I cannot admit to being happy. I am only an avatar of myself, currently. Once I get more time, I'll start returning to myself. I must get though tomorow.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Mission accomplished.

After five and a half hours of arduous labor, I have finished my homework. Of course, Ryan and his friends are out watching a movie and having diner. Fun. Fun. Unfortunately, my life is devoid of such social activities. I suppose I am the one denying myself of these assets, but I can't help it. I am not a sociable person. I type here at my computer, do homework, and fix computers. How could I be a sociable person? I can present a speech, yet I can't talk to the person next to me on the bus. I pity myself.

I plan to get Sim City 4 someday and play it. Unfortunately, not now. Maybe a year from now, when I have more time. Most likely, I won't have more time a year from now. I suppose this is supposed to be my "golden years". For some reason these years of constant terror, disgust, and absolute distaste for myself and those around me. I am full of stress, overworked, and tired. But I am one of the lucky ones. I am lucky...

Why do I live in a society that scorns self-excellence in knowledge, and encourages the playing of childish games, the wasting of resources, and a bi-lateral system of government? Is this really America? The land of the free? Home of the brave? Is bravery so important, as to sacrifice the Earth's natural resources? Who am I to say...

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
The master of all things last minute, Devin went to the movies with me. Everything seems to be happier with Devin. It's his attitude, his minute gestures, his ideaology. Good things will come to Devin in the future, since people like him are rewarded in "this" society.

Anyways, I have diving practice tomorow, and I'm not sure if I should go or not. I suppose I should, but my lazy self is telling me to put it off, even though I need the practice. Maybe I should quit diving, but then everyone would be mad at me, so now I'm stuck in a rut. I can't quit, I can't complain, I have no choice.

I am sleepy. I still can't find a decent DVD ripper. Frustrating... Panzerwerst!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded: I feel like throwing my books everywhere, overturning my bed, ripping the wallpaper, destroying all of my electronics, screaming insanely, and killing people. Why? I suppose all of these problems either stemie from the fact that I hate my Geometry homework and don't understand it, or because I hate the diving practice that I will have to go to in an hour. It's probably a combination. I hate everything in the world. I feel like torturing innocent woodland creatures, I feel like inflicting damage, pain, and wrath. I want to burn and pillage and destroy. I hate diving and yet I am forcing myself to continue. I hate everyone. Even when I realize my rage is illogical, I am still full of it. Go away, I feel bad.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I look back at myself, at my last post, and wonder what I was thinking. Practice went well, and I think it was a positive experience.

Anyways, tomorow is the last day until Thanksgiving. I'm excited, and so is everyone else.

Now, to talk about Journalism class. I hate it. Everyone is better than me at writing "news". I didn't know what I was getting myself into when I signed up for jounralism. Now I'm stuck in a class that interviews people and writes "news". Any creativity included is stifled by a set of rules that are written in a "stylebook". I would like to announce that Journalism class is a waste of my time. I can't write crap, and I don't want to spend a hour reading newspapers. Sheesh...

Anyways, I plan to submit my MEDIOCRE feature on this sports star I don't even care about. Stupid sports. I hate sports.

So much hate, where is the love? I guess it's not a lovely dovely day. Tomorow will be. I hope.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
It's the beginning of a beutiful Thanksgiving break, and it's snowing. I am very positive about the snow. I enjoy snow.

It's late now. Good night.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
The beginnings of anti-consumerism, Buy Nothing Day.

Unfortunately, the cry of consumer advocates like Adbusters couldn't stop the masses of people from going out to get the "Early Bird" specials this morning. I mean, even I was out there getting me one of those $14 DVD players. Yes, Buy Nothing Day might make a tiny difference, but I suppose that it will never be able to convince the behemoth consumer to change its ways. Buy Nothing Day is like a pebble, and the consumers are the tidal wave.

I'm currently filled with a anarchic wave of euphoric rage and fear. It is Friday night, and there are only two more days until school starts. It is a very stressful time when your free time is spent insanely worrying about the free time ending. I am angry. I don't want it to end. I want to pretend that it will never end, but I can't. It will stop. That is why I am afraid, angry, filled with rage and fear. Vacation is nice, if you can avoid worrying about it ending. For me, it is unbearable. I feel compressed. Compressed and contorted, subjected to high ammounts of stress, like a tennis ball that has been in one too many tennis matches. I feel like a compressed can of air, about to explode.

Help. Sleep might help.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
This is going to be a chaos-bringing, insane, workworkworkwork week.

Thus, updation is going to be harder.

I am going to go to a diving meet tomorow. Very scared. Kind of depressed. I can't sleep. I have to go. no time to write. So hard. Each week so much harder. I don't know how I can keep going...

I'm fading away.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I am to write an opinion article by monday.

I suppose that I could rant on about some absurd topic, like squirels and animal testing, but I can't do that. There are rules in Journalism. Rules that are too restricting. I don't like Journalism. The teacher doesn't know who I am. Note to self: Journalism=Bad.

I went to the diving meet. My heart was imploding and exploding rythmically while my stomach acid sloshed everywhere within my body. I was quite riled. The pool looked fuzzy, and I started getting dizzy. With a crappy twister (kind of dive) put together in 30 minutes, I was ready to go. I got on the diving board. Everything is silent. Fear is overtaking me. Then, I realize that fear is obsolete. What is fear? It is the instinctive reaction to a dangerous scenario. Was this dangerous? No. That means fear is illogical. I overrided the fear function in my brain and I felt a warm euphoria of energy now that the fear was abolished. I made my way toward the end of the diving board and did my crappy twister. 30 minutes later, I was done. Wow, it was very enjoyable. Rather than a embarassing event, the diving meet turned out to be quite fun. Why did I ever propose to quit diving? I change.

Suppose I did quit diving. Where would I be? I would probablly end up depressed since that would mean I would have to go to the gym again. I can't go back there. Tomorow will bring a Biology test, therefore, I will study. Now. No really, I'm starting now. Now.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I've been working on my homework nonstop for the past few hours and I still have hours more ahead of me. I can't help but feel overy jealous of my classmates. I feel the envy. They, at study hall, can talk. Have the life. Have the time. Time, such a zealously precious word. I don't have time. Time to be happy. Do you need time to be happy? I think so, because I'm not happy and I don't have time. Don't you see a correlation? I feel terrible. Like an overworked ox, ready to die. Die for the sake of relief. But relief can't be felt unless you're alive. Catch-22 my friend, catch-22. I don't even know what it means.

Everyone at school seems to be happy. They talk. They talk about things too trivial for real discussion. Talk about nonsense, inefficient talking. Talking that has no purpose. Going on and on. I suppose they do this to occupy their time. The time that they have and I don't. Why do they occupy their precious time with trivial matters? Why are they so carefree and happy? Why am I not?

With two journalism articles ahead of me, I'll probably be up until 10 p.m. or so. They I wake up tomorow at 6 a.m. to go to school to compete in Quizbowl. My weekend is nonexistant. My classmates have so much time. I want to grab it away. Take it in. They have the weekend. A luxurious weekend of doing nothing. I have a weekend filled with stress and work. That isn't even a weekend. It's like the week never ends. It's like it never ended. The envy is turning to anger and rage. They don't deserve the precious time, I loath it. Why do they keep it all to themselves? Why me? I ask all of these questions and they will never be answered to me. Why?

I'm so frustrated. Where is my life? I want it back.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
You can't really say that your weekend was swell, if you had no real weekend at all. Homework was one of my most time-consuming activities this weekend. Everybody else was probably having "fun". I don't remember what "fun" is. It's unreachable for me. Others also have "time". I don't recall what that is either.

My opinion article for journalism just sounds like a elongated rant. My feature for journalism is so bad that I refuse to look at it. My room is a mess, and I can't find my socks for tomorow. What a diabolical state I am in. I can't even find my socks for tomorow...

Over the next week or so, I will be submitting to the great time-hungry demon called "diving meets". He will command me to give him all of my free time. I must obey. I will also have another demon called "homework". He'll torture me until I become suicidally depressed. These two demons come and in hand, for they'll be working together this week. I'm sad.

I can't feel like I'm desperately trapped in a small hole with no top or bottom. I just keep falling until I feel like giving up. I won't give up.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
My days are numbered (view top of screen), but is that really worth working as hard as I am? I come home at 7p.m. if I'm lucky, and I might have 30 minutes of spare time if I'm luckier. Usually I have to stay up just to do my homework or study for a test. It is very frustrating to me. I cannot smile, and any joy at all only lasts for a few seconds, then it melts away into anger, shame, sadness, depression, absentmindedness... etc. I can't concentrate, I can't comprehend, I have problems processing large batches of information, I am slower at math, I can't eat, and I can't be happy. What is happy anyways? Who needs happy when you're hopelessly overworked and despise your existance?

Math class frustrated me today because all of the younger children worked faster and more efficiently than I ever will. I did math at half their speed. I hate myself sometimes. Everyone seems to be better than me at everything. Reading, math, trivia, reflexes, and even playing the clarinet. I can't play my clarinet as good as anyone else. I'm frustrating myself and blaming everyone else for it, and I know, but it's my way of coping with my stress, and as Rachel Cheezedawg always says, "Don't rain on my parade, mister!"

I can't be happy. What is happy?

item.dc:creator: A.Barnett
item.content:encoded:
I'm sorry I haven't updated as of late. I have been too bogged down with work to get on the computer much, let alone you, blog-thing! My Japanese studies have been making me very happy (I know, that sounds so nerdy... Gosh I can't stand that stereotype...)and my other studies have made me wither fusterated or completely and utterly bored.
English is so monotonous, I wish I were in Honors, but they somehow said I refused...Which I didn't. Grr, argh, and argh again. They're reading Shakespeare and I'm stuck with the most monotonous and lethargic and overly descriptive book of the all 'Great Expectations'. I feel I should die if I were to be forced to read such a mundane things one more.
Biology would be interesting if he could actually control the class and teach. Finally we get into a form of genetics (my interest) and he can barely get a word in with Ms. Jabberjaw herself Whitney screeching along with Ms. Perfection Hope. I can't stand that class sometimes, it's full of morons! How hard is it to get that a haploid cell is represented by (n) and a diploid cell is represented by (2n)? Honestly, these people are pathetic wastes of protoplasm!
Then there is art, which with its crazy deadlines has been stressing me out most indefinitely. The teacher herself isn't oo bad...If you push past the fact that she has the most annoying habit of drawing on your works when she comments and seems to like stealing pencils. Sometimes, I realize the pencil theft is by accident.
Then there is math, and I believe the teacher to be....Well, to put it bluntly; a bad teacher. The way he conveys the information required isn't always so clear, and his notes are sometimes very unclear. He can't control the class very much, so it's sometimes hard to accomplish our work. It has definitely stressed me out a lot...
World History is OK, Mr. Martin is actually a very good teacher. He actually seems to acknowledge that I understand things much easier. He treats me as though I were on his level (which I assure you I most likely am not) and that makes me not resent a class most treat with adversion.
I'm not complaining, but I can't help but feel stressed out I guess. I jog over ten miles a week, do over sit ups and push ups every other day, and lift weights on the days I don't work my abs. I guess I'm just tired, and with my mom getting stressed as well, I know it is only a matter of time before we get into another argument.
Hopefully getting back on the blogger track;
~Amanda

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded: Once upon a time, there was a planet called "Average School". On this planet, there were 3 races. One race was the Pops. They like to be deceptive and fool people, allthewhile being traitors. Their beauty is only skin deep, and their evil runs deep into their veins. They are the Pops. The other race is the Dums. The Dums have given up all hope, sadly submitting to the relentless Pops. The Dums have just given up on everything, their grades, their future, their social standing. They are sometimes happy, because they can't understand what real joy is. The Pops tell them what to be happy about, so they are easily manipulated. These are the Dums. The next race is the Nrts. They Nrts like to hide away from the Pops, coming out only to try to understand how the Pops work. The Nrts are intrigued by anything they see. They must understand it if they can. They like to work, alot. This makes them angry and moody sometimes. Other Nrts are always happy, trying to justify their work through funny excuses. The Pops ridicule the Nrts. The Dums immitate the Pops. Then their are the "others". They don't fit in any category, but rather waver between the three. Sometimes, they share characteristics. Whatever suits their fancy, they go. In planet "Average School", there was a big commotion. The Pops were hosting a ritualistic ceremony in the planet capitol. The Pops and the Dums celebrate. The Nrts are confused. Why should they go? They have no friends, nor care to have any. Everyone else ridicules them. And the funny thing is that the Nrts don't even realize it. They just keep living... Just keep walking... Just keep working... And Just keep moving. Who cares about the others when you can have your own little piece of the world in your mind? You have your own priorities, and you don't want others to influence them. You are yourself, so be you. Go out there and do something. The worlds waiting.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I have condemned myself to my room for the past few hours. My "Romeo and Juliet" book card has been finished, after much ado. Check it out on the "Book Cards" link.

Anyways, I've been sitting here trying to figure out what to do next. I don't know where to start. It's like climbing Mt. Everest and not knowing where to set up base camp. I could do my Biology. That would last for hours. I could do my Journalism. I could do... Anyways, like you care about what kind of homework I do. I'll move on for your sake.

I've checked out Devin's blog. It makes me have a feel-good feeling inside of me, it's nice to know that your contacts are alive and well. Anyways, I went to the diving tournament and probably got last place, but I'm not really caring. I did the best I could and that's all that matters. By the way, two liters of Mountain Dew and diving don't mix. Don't try it.

Troy directed me to go to www.rotten.com. It's very graphic,

I have to go. Bye.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Heaven would be so nice now.

What's the point of living a life that sucks?

Why do I... I... exist? Why should I keep going?

My life is a living hell right now, and I expect it to get progressively worse over the next week. Finals and all. Desparation and depression come hand in hand. I hope I can make it.

I am such an idiot. Andrew can do all of the biology worksheet in no time. I've spent the past weekend doing it and I'm on question five. It just goes to show you that I am a retard. I can't work, process, think, and move faster than many of my peers. I just am not supposed to exist. I don't.

Maybe tomorow will treat me better. Probably not.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Nah, I'm a GENIUS and I'm horrible at biology. One test, I studied for three hours. I wrote out a study sheet for myself. I had my parents quiz me on it. I still got an 86. Ugh...I hate biology.

And yes, finals do create a lot of stress, especially my biology and history finals. The Geometry, English, German, and Electronic Music finals shouldn't be too difficult.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
It seems to me that I have spawned some advocates for this site. How surprising. I mean, this ia a wastebasket of misery, and some kid thinks that it's awesome. He wants mention, and now. But... am I going to give it to him? Is he really worth mention on my wastebasket of misery? Who deserves choice mentions? Well, first of all, all of the people I dislike go into that category. Second of all, people who are my close, close, friends go into that category. Zach Hallberg is... kind of in the middle. Oh, I gave him a name mention, well, can't do anything now. It's already written in stone...

Anyways, everything is collapsing. A cascade of concrete and syrup. Enveloping me and everything I have. I feel like I sink everytime I'm walking. Sinking into the ground. The sky is falling, the ground is melting, and the big boys at the big MS are messing themselves up for the upcoming release of Longhorn. What could make my life any better? Anything really...

What is art? You look at art as a sign of "culture" in a society. I can see the correlation (Not many art museums in Ethiopia, if you know what I mean), but is art the pinnacle of society? I think art signifies that a society has enough spare time to make a completely dysfunctional, inanimate piece of nothing. Art, a painting on a wall. Art, a colorful collage. Art, art, art, art, art... You look at a painting. It's really just pigments on a media, like canvas. The pigments are interpretted by your brain. Your brain gives these specifically sequenced pigments a life. You see a face on a painting, you see objects, symbolism. And in the end, when you make sense of it all, you try to figure out what it means. Most of the time it means nothing, but you find a symbol or a reason for it to exist. Art, the creation of life. Art, the wasteful bigotry of a rich society. Art, an extreme of "cultured" society. Art.

Think about it, man.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
"I think art signifies that a society has enough spare time to make a completely dysfunctional, inanimate piece of nothing."

First of all, that's a sort of shallow interpretation of it, don't you think? Second of all, what exactly are you calling art. I mean, a roller-coaster designer could call his roller-coasters art. A composer could call his composition art. Third, think of a world without books, television, movies, games, music. That would be horrible!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I got a high grade on my biology final today, a 98.2%. Unfortunately, Andrew got a 102%, because of the curve. I am now officially a "failure", according to the quizbowl team. Everyone has over 100% in every class (which is supposed to be impossible, you know, kind of because 100% is 100%) and I don't. I only have a measly 97%. Yup, I'm a real failure.

Anyways, Zach asked me a good question today. He said, "If you had to kill one person right now, who would you kill?" My obvious answer was no one, but I had to kill someone. I would probably sacrifice myself. If I killed someone else, that would just make me a failure, in a socialistic sense. I would be a detriment to humankind. It would result in anger, vengeance, sad desperation. Why let anyone else suffer? You know, that's why you don't want to be a hitman, sniper, soldier, or assasin. You are forced to kill people. That's what you're life revolves around. Better to be a con than a killer.

Tomorow is band finals, which means easy bliss for most of the day. I have to get my hair cut tomorow. Getting haircuts always makes me look like an elementary school kid. It really does. People at school think I'm one of those uber-smart 6th graders from a middle school. I hate that.

I searched for "hate" on my blog today and found that I hate alot of things. Maybe I should be less self-concious. Maybe I should give in to... them.

Anyways, my next door neighboor's little sister (1st grade) was pressuring my sister to go to her house so they could play. The only problem is that the kid next door has chickenpox and a skin infection. Guess what she used as an incentive... Popularity. That kid is a degraded mind dubbed TV propagandaized child. Popularity. She doesn't even care about my sister. She's so full of herself. She doesn't care if my sister gets chickenpox and suffers. She doesn't care about the concequences. She doesn't understand that there's something else in the world BESIDES HER. She should relize that before she starts to mature. Absurd and demented kids... sheesh.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Wow, deep thoughts on killing. No one wants to be a failure. Any way, I found your blog via Flickr and it seems pretty cool.

Keep on blogging and if you want to learn more about blogging, or just help other bloggers in general, you should check out the Demo Blog.

Keep up the good work,
Lou
slash Lou-My blog

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I'm amazed. Amazed that the painful final exams are over. Amazed that I won't be having school for the next 2 weeks. Amazed that I've met new people over flickr.com. Amazed that people are actually reading what I'm writing. I'm amazed. Dazed, perhaps.

Anyways, I decided to write a letter to Santa Claus (a.k.a. Saint Nicholas). It goes something like this...

Dear Santa,

I want a de-commercialized Christmas. You are a derivative of a religeous figure. Unfortunately, you have caved into the commercial zealots that now run this world. You have disgraced me. Santa, you are being used. Used by marketers, cons. Santa, you are the cause of enourmous consumer debt. Santa, why have you failed in your mission?

Santa, today I read a letter addressed to you. Sorry for snooping in your mail, but this issue concerns me. The letter I found read, "Dear Santa, I want a Game Boy SP for Christmas. I wish for $100,000,000,000 and a car. I want 2 BB guns. I want a Playstation 3. I want to be rich.-Hector Berumen, 11".

If you look carefully, you see three objectives you, Santa, have spawned. Hector wants to be rich. Hector want guns. Hector wants extravagant electronics. Hector is a corrupted youth. Santa, you have corrupted him.

Santa, why not put some restrictions on your gift-giving? You promise children anything if they are good, but who enforces that law? I haven't heard of a child not getting their gifts on Chrstmas since the Vietnam War. Even Jews and African Americans have their spinoffs to please their envious children. The truth of the matter is, Santa, the rich kids get more, and the poor kids get less. I guess you're not an equal opportunity kind of person...

Santa, why do you sit in a mall? The mall is for people who have money, too much. People pay you to sit on your lap. What ever happened to charity?

You know, Santa, there's a place where you're needed. Stop spending your time taking money from people at a mall and go. Go to the poverty-stricken Ethiopian refugee camps. Go to the starving and dying of war-torn countries. Anywhere but rich and fat America. Santa, stop selling and start caring.

Why are you here Santa? If you give up your real purpose, will you have any true purpose to your existence? Do you exist for the sole purpose of pacifying America's youth, while spoiling them at the same time? Are you there to encourage children to spend, not save? Why, Santa, why?

By the way, Santa, why are you obese? Is food that important to you? Is an obese, red man sitting on a urine-drenched throne in the mall a good role model for children? Try Atkins or something. I've heard carribou meat is quite a delicacy.

Sincerely,

Ryo Chiba
--------------------------

Yea, by the way, I'm going to the beach for a week so, chill. I think you guys can handle life without me. Anyways, I'll be back thursday or so. I'm leaving this Friday. Bye bye!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Merry New Year and a Happy Christmahaunikwanzunica to everyone!

Anyways, this winter break is paining me. I have to sit here for a few more agonizing days contemplating how my winter break "could-have-been" better and stressing over the quickly approaching work days. Days of pain and misery don't feel bad when their constant, but when you're used to joy these days seem disgustingly evil. You see, it's all relative. If my day sucks today, and tomorow sucks, then both of them suck lightly. If today roxxors, and tomorow sucks, then my life is in complete turmoil, I will go bezerk, the earth will stop rotating, volcanos will errupt in New York City, and this blog will get filled with posts. Obviously, if every day was bad, then they wouldn't seem bad at all. Happiness would come in the little things. I have been "happy desensitized". I can no longer feel happy if something little happens. It has to be bigger, better, a million-dollars good. It can't be the little joys, like learning how a humidifier works, or burning a personal CD. It has to really swell to qualify as joyful. Is this winter break all what it is cracked up to be?

Well, one thing that I can say is a total loss for myself is my lamp that my mother bought for me today. It's a really nice chrome lamp. I picked out these nice light bulbs that are supposed to last 2 years. Unfortunately, one of them only lasted for about 5 minutes. Now, that got me ANGRY. It was a nice bulb, it SAID it was supposed to last 2 years. Guess what, I hate "Daylight Plus" bulbs now. What's with the "Plus" anyways? I hate it. Stupid "plus". Ruining my day.

Anyways, I have to go to sleep now. I'm hoping the break will end soon so I can go back to being miserable. That'll bring back my real self. Work is something you love to hate, and hate to love. It's tearing me apart.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
To burst out the new year differently, I've decided to change the site layout. If this site looks the same to you, refresh the page. Anyways, I was fed up with the chaotic, n00bish layout of the previous site, so I decided to clean it up. My inspiration was Google. They support blogger, blogger supports me, so by using the transitive property of equality, Google supports me. Consequently, Google is my friend. Hugs to Google!

Anyways, enjoy my schwete layout!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Winter break is ending, and it it still frustrating me. I just want to squeeze my hate for continuous work into a little ball and vaporize it. I just hate to love to hate work. Shoot, I don't even know what I'm talking about...

Anyways, I'm very tired from living hard. Working hard, playing hard. I want to relax. But, how?

Moving on, remember the lamp issue from a day or two ago? Now I'm having the same love-hate relationship with the door connecting the garage to the house. It was being slowly degraded until it failed to shut. This disabled the main function of the door, which was to keep hot air in. Therefore, I painted and installed a doorknob. The doorknob fell off once installed. Frustrated, I grabbed a hammer and beat that doorknob down into where it belongs. Now the doorknob works, and hopefully the knob will stay in there. It's quite sad when you realize that you have these kinds of relationship with lamps and doors. How am I going to survive in the competitive dating atmosphere when I'm still working on my love-hate relationship with my door?

Anyways, I'm still drooling at my site layout. I want to eat it up, but I'm on a diet. Not really, but saying that I am makes me happier about myself. That's all that matters in American society right? The idea is, as long as you make yourself happy, don't worry about others. Yes, society wants you to go buy that overpriced mocha-latte-java-chino from Starbucks while other people in poor countries starve to death, dreaming of beans for their farm. I wonder who hates Starbucks...

Talking about irrational hate, I hate iPods. I don't know why. Maybe it's because they are rippoffs. Maybe because they are all hype. Maybe because their so friggin' white. I have no idea, I'm just an iPod hater.

Anyways, there is something I have a rational hate about, and that's AOL. I hate them. There's too much to explain, just don't trust them little buggers...

What does schvette mean? Did I make it up?

Good night. I need rest.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
The snapfish ordered pictures are in, and the verdict is...

I HATE THE CVS PHARMACY PHOTO DEPARTMENT FOR RIPPING ME OFF FOR THE PAST TWO YEARS! Online ordered pictures are faster, cheaper, and are of better quality than ANY retailer out there. Therefore, the CVS Pharmacy Photo Deparment has been placed in a special place in my heart. The "I hate you forever no matter what you do to try to win back my patronage" section.

Anyways, a tip to anyone who has any (absolutely any any any) motive to go to one of these con CVS Photo places... well... Those who go there should be inspired by the likes of me to use snapfish or any other online-photo printing shop.

Yea, I hate CVS now. Got it?

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Good morning to myself.

I am supposed to savor every waking moment of today. Every second that I am not at school on a normal school day. Every second breathing free air. Seeing free sights. Savoring the taste of my childhoon.

Tomorow I will return to my school, exposing myself to new hazards. I will be thrust into a defensive position. New scenarios, new people, new harassments. I will have to sit, and talk, to people I do not want to. I will have to be shoved around, anonymously, in the tide of the crowd. I will have to deal with it. It will happen tomorow, and the nexc day, and the next day... Fate has already decided what will happen. If I will be killed in a school shooting, or if I get an A on a test I studied for. Fate is so reassuring. It (If you can even consider it an entity) tells tells you that every thing has already happened. It is no one's fault. In essence, you can blame anything that happens to you on "fate". That is so comforting sometimes.

In reality, I have nothing to fear. School will come and pass.

I've got an idea. I will savor every waking moment while alive. What's so bad about school anyways? I should be grateful that I'm not in a poor African nation. I should celebrate that I get to go to school, and I will.

Anyways, this morning should not be scornful. It should be jubilant.

The final verdict? School is better than Death.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba

PAINTED MY SPEAKERS WHITE!

Anyways, operation "speaker paint" has gone quite well. I'll have to upload photos tommorow. Unfortunately, I'm not quite sure I'll be able to, me being increasingly busy and whatnot. Don't worry, that usually means even more... shall we say, "colorful" posts.

Yup, this is it. Tommorow is school. Wish me good luck... Please.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Wonderful news for myself has saved me from the brink of a terrible day!

There is a two hour delay tomorow for school, but that's just a short term enjoyment. I really don't want to dive anymore. Once I get lazy, I can't deal with doing any work. I'm such a lazy bum. There are two long-term happinesses. Devin is comming back to my high school, where he belonged in the first place. The next class is that I have a class where I get to sit next to Amanda, which totally roxxors because she is the most... I don't know... She's just really easy to talk to... You get started and you keep going and the conversation seems to train on, but still retaining its original integrity. It doesn't fade with Amanda. Mostly because the tangents that are strayed upon are usually crazy.

Anyways, I will be waiting for Devin.

Also, I've heard from many sources that the "Keyboarding" classes HAVE to be taken before the bussiness classes. That is the most illogical thing I've ever heard. What if you can ALREADY type? I find this intriguing since most of the young population already know how to type. Do the teachers think we need a class to teach us how to ride a bike? Give me a break...

Anyways, I am paying more attention to the tsunami effort. I mean, the tsunami has a larger impact to me, morally, than the World Trade Center attacks or the war in Iraq. The question to ask yourself is this... "Which is more important? The lives of hundreds of thousands of poor people or three thousand rich people?"

Good night. Let tommorow bring peace.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded: I went to the movies with Ryan to go see the "Series of Unfortunate Events." The movie isn't important though. The real importance of this post comes from the viewing of a preview for another movie before this movie began. A preview of the Disney movie, called "Ice Princess." I find this movie hilarious and insulting to figure skaters. In the movie, a nerdy girl (Obviously a poser, a real nerd wouldn't act like that), becomes a champion figure skater that competes in the Olympic Games after practicing for a few months. What's so frustrating isn't that she spent a miniscule ammount of time practicing, but it is that the core of the movie is that the nerd discovered "a secret aerodynamic formula" that enabled her to skate well. Because of this "secret aerodynamic formula" this girl can land can land an impressive trick to win. I find this VERY insulting to figure skaters who work VERY HARD for YEARS to land tricks like these and this sad, sad movie states that a "secret formula" can be the solution to instant gratification. Disney has gone too far. First it was "Chitty Chitty Bang Bang" that made things unrealistic, but this "Ice Princess" has crossed the line. I hope this movie crashes and burns. I really do because it's a shame that Disney actually spend money on making this trash film about instant gratification in a "secret aerodynamic formula". Tisk, tisk...

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I spend half of saturday trying to figure out what to get with money that I got from my great aunt. It was a 6 hour, ragged Internet bonanza that tested my wits, but I eventually found something worth getting. I got a radio transmitter. Instead of taking the easy route and buying a game, I got an fm transmitter that expands my audio capabilities. I am proud of myself. Other than that, I went to the local botanical gardens. Clegg Gardens to be precise. I tried looking for this place on the Internet, but I was surprised to find nothing. Anyways, I went to the gardens and it was all fun and joy. Now that a REAL work week is looming ahead, I'm nervous. Fortunately, I've decided to take an optimistic stand to the looming goal ahead of me. Unfortunately, this optimistic stand probably won't last very long.

Good night people.
