I hope I can update fullier tomorow.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Zach told me to post an "ethical" question. I find it more divided.

"If you had a choice, would you choose to be immortal or mortal?"

Obviously, the choice is to be immortal. Everybody thinks it would be so terribly bad to be immortal though. I don't understand. Perhaps everyone likes to say that they wouldn't want to be immortal to justify their mortal existance. Why would you NOT want to be immortal? They say that you would get bored. If a complete idiot was immortal, they would get bored, but you could learn everything in the world, and then some. You could interact with people for... well, forever. If there weren't people, you could travel to different parts of the universe without the fear of death. Without the fear of age. You could humor yourself and others. You could teach, learn, or you could do absolutely nothing. You do absolutely nothing when you are dead. You feel no emotions, you are non-existant. People say that their "souls" become "free" and "relaxed" when they die. I'm pretty sure that this is just a way to cope with the obvious knowledge that humans die, eventually. You feel no emotions and have nothing when you die. Therefore, you can't "relax" or be "free". You don't exist. It's not a hard concept to grasp. And if you do say that you are going to "heaven", then you are just promoting suicidal people to kill themselves. They kill themselves to relieve themselves from the pains of life. Unfortunately, you can't feel relief when you're decomposing 6 feet under ground. Yea, you can say that suicide is a "sin" and they are going to go to "hell", but that is just a cop out of another flaw in the religion system. I know people are going to come up to me and "Jesus" the crap out of me now... Great...

Anyways, everything is happy in my world. I can be happy while knowing that I will die. That amazing optimist club is one of the only things that really mattered in life. It might even qualify for a position higher than my "bike-riding" skills.

By the way, I want the "orientation to life and careers" class to not exist. We have to do a "portfolio" thing, and the problem is that the teacher isn't exactly the most suited for the class. She's an art teacher, and she hasn't "oriented" me toward my "life and career" yet. We've spent the first week doing completely irrelevant "introduction" activities. In these RETARDED STUPID ILLOGICAL "ITS DRIVING ME INSANEO" activities, we have to introduce someone to the whole class. My only question: "Why are we introducing someone when the whole class knows all about them anyways?" My life is being wasted by these IDIOTIC activities. I can't really express my angered sentiment toward these activities very... articulately.

Good night.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Yes, yes, yes...

My mother has bought me a awesome briefcase that I shall cherish and be merry with. Tis a happy moment. Is it weird for a teenager to like briefcases?

Anyways, Amanda gave me a pencil. A "happy easter" pencil. I can't believe she sacrificed a pencil for me. I'm truely grateful. It's a sincere gratefulness you can't deny. A "all hail the chosen one" kind of greatful. You know, you can't thank someone who you admire so much. I admire Amanda, and she gave me a pencil. Am I going insane, or is my world turning upside down?

Anyways, I almost killed a swimmer at a practice on Friday. I jumped, and landed just centimeters from his neck. A potentially fatal blow was avioded by fate. I could have really paralyzed him, but luckily he has something important to do later in life. He was spared from my death blow by a variety of variables. If I had jumped just a hair differently, he would be terribly injured right now. I'm so very lucky, as he...

Anyways, I have to sleep for tomorow. I have to cherish my easter bunny pencil. I have to fill my briefcase. I'll have to update you later.

Goodnight.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I'm terribly exitable right now.

I called Devin earlier and I was really spontaneous. I predict that he will think of me as a drug addict now because he probably isn't used to me being so spontaneous. I started making up stories as I was talking to him to try to improve my spontaneous creativity skills. He became very confused. Maybe this will conflict with him. I don't know the possible outcomes, but I hope good will turn out from my new spontaneous, optimistic outlook.

It's late and I'm studying and I'm listening to Arockalypse and the Amazing TransMetropolitans and my life is like a swirling torrent of information brewing in my head. I feel empowered by my knowledge...

Anyways, think about how many ways being spontaneous would come in handy. Being creative like this could result in new ways of thinking of solutions to problems. Creative problem solving comes in handy in many jobs. As long as speaking more creativity, my Taco Bell Fiesta Bowl and Mountain Dew has caused an increase in my speed of typing. I'm going at least 80 words per minute, and I know it because I'm just whizzing through this post.

I'm feeling spontaneous and empowered. I'm not on drugs. Actually I did have a bit of caffine in the Mountain Dew, so I do take a very common and potent drug, caffine. It's deffinitely working on me right now. I don't feel tired at all. I feel like a crazy lemon bouncing off of fuzzy green walls. Don't ask me where that came from, because I'm still working on my spontaneous creativity skills. I need to get off of this caffine high and go back to my dull state of normality.

I suppose this caffine high is what most Americans experience for most of their lives. I feel so sick when I think of being this excited constantly. How could your circulatory/nervous system handle it? It's like shoving plutonium down your throat and going insane...

Good study night to everyone!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Another diving meet, another day...

Ryan smacked his hand on the diving board while doing a twister. A minor flesh wound (a scratched patch of skin) was caused, but it messed him up. Now, he's not so very happy because he didn't do so well and also because everyone is feeling sorry for him.

Feeling sorry for people isn't going to help them. It is going to be your first instinct if you're talking to someone who has come about lesser luck. If you feel sorry for a disabled person, you are just casting them below you. You are just saying that they are of a lesser "value" than you are. You are feeling sorry for them as if you feel sorry for an underling, or a subordinate. You may have good intentions, but having these kind of feelings toward people isn't going to solve their problems. Look at them as an equal individual, not a subordinate. Focus on what you cause and the after effects of whatever you do. Now, that's something to think about.

Anyways, about people and after effects of what they do, I brought my briefcase to school today. I brought it to lunch, since my locker is a finite space and I had a more or less infinite ammount of stuff I had to fit inside of it. I left it on top of the table I usually sit on and ate lunch. Afterwards, I got up to throw away my trash. As I left, my "friends" grabbed my briefcase and started trying to open it. Luckily, my briefcase is double locked. Unfortunately, those "friends" I was talking about were illogical enough to try to open my briefcase by force. When I returned, I found my briefcase bruised and one of the locks stuck in its position. Luckily, Ryan was able the fix it (Amazing isn't he?) but now the lock makes an annoying clicking sound that isn't supposed to be made and the sides of the case are scratched, lowering its resale value. Obviously, my "friends" aren't really friends. My "friends" are just backstabbing, good for nothing, insignificant pricks. Time to choose another table...

What table should I sit at? Obviously, most tables will reject me for who I am. I am a anti-social type of person if you have just met me. Hopefully, Devin's table will be nice enough to encorporate me into their social structure. It really annoys me that this whole world is full of idiotic pricks. Why have I been sitting with them if they are disrespectful enough to try to break into my locked things and break them? Why have I been sitting with people?

Logically, I would enjoy sitting with robots. I mean, an efficient conversation consisting of the latest news, Internet statistics, and calculus lessons seems enjoyable with a nice steaming styrofoam bowl of chili. Maybe I should stop eating lunch. Or...

I could make my own colony in the corner of the Cafeteria. I mean, with this whole social caste system already in place, a little revolution wouldn't be so bad. Social reform anyone?

Good night.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I"m so de-energized. Three days of pure extracurricular work. I'm not used to this work load. Diving... Quizbowl... At least I have something to write on my resume in the future.

Talking about resumes, I still think the "Orientation to Life and Careers" is one of the most wasted periods of my lifespan. I entered a un-biased student on the first day. I came in, sat down, and listened to what she said. Everyone has been telling me that this class was a load of ... Anyways, I was here to see if it was true. To see of "Orientation to Life and Careers" was really as crappy as everyone has been making it out to be. She explained the rules like all the other classes, on the first day.

Second day... The teacher explains that we will be doing an activity that consists of interviewing another person and then presenting our interview to the rest of the class. This interview consisted of questions already written on a piece of paper that she handed each of us. These questions included, "How many pillows do you sleep with?" and "What is your favorite ice cream flavor?".

Ok, I say to myself... This seems absurd, but I can deal with it. Just one of those ridiculous activities that the teacher uses up at the beginning. I told myself that there would be better things to do in the future for this class.

Thurd day... We present. It seems absurd, but I presented well in front of my peers. I still don't understand why we had to tell everyone about the pillows we sleep with, but I decided to keep my optimistic outlook on the future of this class.

Fourth day... The class is still presenting. I am beginning to realize that this activity is pointless and irrelevant. I don't care about how many pillows some reject in the corner sleeps with. I struggle to retain my optimistic outlook.

Fifth day...The class is STILL presenting. I'm starting to get riled up now. I'm not violent, but my optimistic sense of reality has turned into a Cold War-esque arms race, on the brink of war. I am about to explode because I realize some thing that everyone has been telling me. This class is a TRUE waste of my life. Luckily, the idiotic pillow questions stop and the presentations are over. I win back some of my optimistic outlook on this class, since we were going to the library on the next day to do another "activity".

Sixth and Seventh days... I have realized that "activity" is really a word that is synonymous with "Idiotic and time-consuming worksheet over something that is either unimportant or obvious". We have to do various worksheets that teach us how use search engines. I start to feel like a genius in an asylum. I start to go mad, but being on the computer calms me, even if I'm stuck in a hellhole doing some worksheet about something I learned in 3rd grade.

Eighth day... We spend the hour watching a video on Accountants, Chefs, and another occupation that I don't care to remember. We are forced to do a worksheet on one of these jobs. Unfortunately, these jobs don't interest me. I start to wonder of the teacher knows how to tie her shoes.

Ninth day... The class spends the whole class period doing an irrelevant test to see if we are "audio", "visual", or "tactile" learners. I find this activity frustrating because I feel like I already know who I am. I don't have to take a test to see if I learn better with pictures of audio. I already know how to study. I already know my strengths and weaknesses. I ALREADY KNOW MYSELF! It's like their handing me a worksheet that will test if I am male or female. I ALREADY know the answer!

Today was the ninth day. I have learned the truth. "Orientation to Life and Careers" simply sucks. Everyday will be torture, a living hell. The idiotic teacher will make us do pointless worksheets that don't pertain to me.

The oh so very unfortunate thing is, is that EVERYONE is REQUIRED to take this class.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
You've probably heard the saying, "All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy." Well, I've got a news flash for people who are slackers. When you face reality, the real slogan is, "No work and all play makes Jack a high school reject who can't function, or contribute, in a competitive society." Yes, constantly working might make you dull, but isn't being dull better than being unable to contribute to society? I become quite shaken when I find slackers who justify their "slackeryness" by saying that work is "boring". Everything has to be fun for them. Their only purpose in life is to enjoy it. There are times when you have to NOT have fun in order to do something for your future. School may not be "fun", but sacrifices have to be made. Deal with your "non-fun" homework.

Anyways, Ryan's father did something very demeaning to me yesterday. Ryan and I were just comming back from the library. We were in a small cramped red car. Ryan handed me a book that instructed you on how to draw anime characters. He showed me this fat slob that you could draw called "burger boy" (how original). As I handed back the book back to Ryan, the page turned and Ryan's father happened to glance at the book. He said, "No wonder he was looking at the book, he was looking at the girls." The page that was showing showed you how to draw scantilly-clad females. I was a bit shocked by the comment, but restrained myself. Ryan tried to explain my predicament, but his father interrupted, "I never said that there was anything wrong with looking at girls!"

Now, if you haven't noticed, this all happened in a matter of minutes. I was surprised even more about the second comment. How could he accuse me of such a thing, not let me explain, and then condone something he isn't supposed to? My mind was rushing with frustration and anger, but the car was silent. In my mind, I thought, "How dare he accuse me of such a lurid act?! Why, if only I wasn't a subordinate..."

All this got me riled up, and when I get riled up, I think. The thing that is wrong with religion is that no one follows it. Yes, the lord might forgive your sins, but then what is the point? How can people like Ryan's father call themselves religious when he accuses people, and then condones looking at women in inappropriate ways?

I'm probably exaggerating, but that's because I've been frustrated with this situation ever since I got off of that small red car. I'm frustrated.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
My diving coach wasn't very happy at the end of practice today. Perhaps it was because all three of us (Samantha, Ryan, and I) on the diving team didn't do well at all. He seemed disappointed. That and the best diver on the team didn't show up today. I feel disappointed in myself. I have alot to write about, but I'll have to do it tomorow because I have school tomorow and I have like a trazillion units of homework.

Anyways, I sang in the lockeroom today. I think that helps enrich my spontaneousness that I've been trying to work on. Devin would be proud...

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I remember, I remember....

Wait, no I don't. I had such a great witty parody of a common saying that I wanted to present, but unfortunately, my memory is fading. I assume it is because I don't want to remember what happened today. I am protecting myself by erasing my own memory. I don't think I erased my memory for something very traumatic. I think I erased my own memory because I find the things I supposedly "learn" in some of my classes pointless. The "Orientation to Live and Careers" class is a prime example. I "learned" how to read "better". All she did was point out that you should actually read the things that you study for. Give me a break. No duh, you have to actually read the things that you want to learn. What, now the state of Indiana has to tell me how to "study"!? How absurd!

Anyways, I am being harsh at the OLC teacher and the state of Indiana, since there are some "less talented" people who don't know how to study. I have no idea how they even get through life without learning and studying, but that's beside the point.

The point is that OLC is still on the "I HATE THIS CLASS" list. The only thing that it is teaching me is to be witty. I get so bored in that reject class that I get witty on the worksheets and get witty with my peers to amuse myself. It's like if you locked me in a madhouse with a strict Nazi loyalist. How absurd!

Tomorow I am going to bring disco music to diving. How absurd!

I'm absurd!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I am sorry I'm not updating.

It's just that diving and homework consumes me. My own leisure activities also consume me. I know, this is supposed to be my leisure, but I'm starting to drift around. Everything is consuming me and all I can do is drift!? What am I to do?!

Anyways, once diving is over, my life will become it's peaceful, angry self. Upon which I will update this blog regularly again. Don't expect me to post much in the next week because this and next week are diving weeks. Everything after that should procede roughly to plan. Hopefully...

Anyways, I will post when I can, but don't check like every 30 minutes (like anyone does anyways. I mean, I'm such a mediocre writer....)

Well, I have to sleep and dream about a world without diving.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Amazing...

I have willed myself to wake up an hour early to update my blog. I believe that I try to contradict myself subconciously. Maybe it's because I'm a teenager and teenagers are supposed to be angsty and contradictory. Obviously, all teenagers are angsty and contradictory, just like how all African Americans are basketball stars, and just like how all asians are nerds, and just like all...

Anyways, I woke up groggily this morning, staring at my Pikachu clock. I usually wake up like this. I wake up 30 minutes before I am "supposed" to wake up and periodically stare at my clock. Stare at my clock and wish... plead with my delusioned mind to get more sleep. That's the state I'm in right now. I'm half delusioned.

What is my other half then? If I was just delusioned, why would I even be writing this post? My other side is in a state of fear and helplessness. I am going to go to diving practice today and I am going to have to try the.... "double". This double is dangerous for me because I know that I will smack. It's fated that I will experience extreme pain. That's the problem. As I sit here listening to a Ray Charles CD that my mother got at Target, I feel like a helpless animal. A helpless animal trapped in a cage, to eventually be experimented on and killed. The pain is imminent, and my heart is racing. What am I to do?

Well, I could go to diving and suffer my fate... I'll probably do that. Shoot, I just talked myself into going...

Anyways, Joe said that I'm "rubbing off" on him after he posted something negative. I never knew that I was that negative. Come on, I'm normal... right?

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I just figured something out.

Maybe depressed an suicidal people are really just bored. I mean, now that I'm busy with two extracurricular activities, I'm not really that depressed anymore. There are things that are occupying my time. These things stress me out, but at least I'm not suicidal. Yes, my plan is to incarcerate all of those suicidal and depressed people and make them go to an all-year summer camp where they can enjoy crafts, fishing, and mud. I don't know where all of this money to fund this project will come from, but I'm sure it'll combat their suicidal tendancies.

Anyways, I didn't dive today because it was a 3 team meet, and only 2 divers were allowed per team. That was pretty cool, because it enabled me to become the cameraman. Unfortunately, the pool was so dark that pictures turned out to be a bad idea. I took movies instead.

Anyways, I think my Orientation to Life and Careers book is the most hilarious thing I have ever read. The laughter and short-term joy comes from the obviousness of the things the book says. Chapter titles include, "Good Attitudes", "Punctuality", and "Grooming". The most hilarious part about all of this is that the book treats the reader as if they have no idea what work is. They're like, "If you want to go to work, show up on time!" and I'm like, "No duh." and the book is like, "If you want to get a job, then don't smell like windex and old lunch meat." and I'm like, "No duh." and this cycle goes on for ages until I either get bored of the book, or until I can't stop laughing from the idiocracy of it all.

I really want a CD player, but I'm not sure about buying one. I know it's like $5 to buy one from wal-mart, but $5 for me is a big financial decision. I'll probably just use other people's cd players for now. Maybe, I could invest my money in a boombox. I don't know. I'm just kind of flowing with it all.

Just go with the flow man...

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I spent like an hour making a post that actually mattered and firefox had an error which deleted my whole post.

This is the time when you want to kick the computer into a pond and watch it slowly die in it's own bodily fluids. This is the time when you want to rip the keys off of the keyboard. I hate computers. I HATE EVERYTHINGISWPIgp;aweuio;j......


Ok, calm down. What I do hate is the IOGSDH: BVfbfdbdrg....


Maybe I should go to sleep before I explode from rage and anger.

I suppose I can justify my experience by saying that there was a lesson learned from all of this, but unfortunately there isn't a lesson. I hate myself.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Something has been bothering me.

I was recently watching "Hoosier Millionaire" on the television. This show is a program that showcases people from Indiana competing for cash. As the host introduced each member of the show for its valentines day special, I noticed something very scary. I noticed that three out of the five contestants looked desperately low class citizens. You know, the kind of people you might see in a dingy alleyway, in a drunken stupor. One guy was actually just learned to read and write. To think that one out of five "Hoosiers" are illiterate and that four out of five "Hoosiers" are poverty stricken bothers me. I sure hope that money isn't going to be used for booze...

Anyways, Blogger seems to be having problems so I'm thinking of backing up my writings on a floppy disk, but I'm just too lazy to. I know I'll feel like killing myself when Blogger goes bankrupt and I lose all of my diary, but I don't have the time. This week is going to be the highest stress level of it all. Diving, Diving, Diving, Tests, Diving, QuizBowl, Diving, Tests, Cramming... It'll all end on Sunday. I know I'll make it, but just thinking about my stress just wears me out. That's probably my problem. I think about my hardships and it makes me feel bad. I should probably watch a movie about ethnic purging, a.k.a. Hotel Rawanda, and maybe I would feel better then.

Better to be optimistic than an insane and schitzophrenic lunatic, the voices inside of me always say!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I feel like a battered and wind-eroded house. A house stuffed with cheap pink insulation foam and a house with its lead paint starting to chip off and cause cancer. A house that still stands, even after all of the elements have tried to knock it over.

I have updated the "book cards" webpage that helps those people out there who think that book cards should not be a time-waster. I mean, if you've read the whole story, why doesn't everyone just use my website for studying instead of some stupid card? I'm hoping it catches on soon.

Anyways, Amanda, Josh, and I are planning a mysterious trip to the famed, "Alpaca Shack" in the mall. I have never seen anyone come back out of that store. I know there's some kind of alpaca mafia behind this all. It's all a conspiracy...

I acomplished a great feat today, which is trying, and making, a back one and a half, albiet with water-smack-scars. Pain used to be a giant doberman with a black and red chain collar. Now pain is just a little, harmless, and cute puppy. Not really, but when your back is numb, there aren't many pain cells left to pick up the pain that is being inflicted.

I wonder of Zach is still reading this... You know, I predict that Zach will become some kind of criminal when he grows up. Some kind of... FASHON CRIMINAL! Jeans with a T-shirt? That is SO last year... *cue the hand motion regularly used with homosexual men*. Just kidding...

I'm not gay. Seriously.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Tomorrow is going to be the last diving practice. What in the heck (of what the h*ll, if you're one of those "commoners" who can't refrain themselves from swearing in public areas, mainly the cafeteria), just end already! When diving ends, I'm going to be so relieved. I mean, It's like getting used to sleeping on a bed of coals, and then getting to sleep in a tempur-pedic foam bed. I am quite excited.

Anyways, I got one of those "Computer Fun" sheets. Basically, we took a test earlier in the year and a computer matched me up to 10 opposite sexxed people. The results came out something like this:

1. Krista Howe
2. Julia Branstrator
3. Samantha Yoder
4. Whitney Ketterer
5. Abigail Heath
6. Ashley Gibson
7. Susan Mullen
8. Britny Kelly
9. Berenice Lopez
10. Rachel Cheeseman

Obviously, you probably don't even care about my computer matched love list, so ignore it. I mean, I'm somewhat anti-social when it comes to "parties" and such.

I've always thought of parties as being to chaotic. My social life has to be structured and methodically prepared before execution. I need a schedule to follow. I need set guidelines. Perhaps this is why not every girl out there would like to be near me. I mean, all of those popular kids seem to like chaos and disorder. It's like they live in a third world country. How uncultured.

But, I think to myself, what about Devin? He's one of the most cultured and sophisticated (Not to mention popular) people I know. I'm not joking. Behind his pale, thieving, bony face, he has a deeper look on important issues. Devin is just one of those people who don't fit to my stereotype of popular people, so I'll just forget about him. Stereotyping popular people makes me feel better.

I want tomorrow to end now. Please... I'm going to cry...

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
It's about 9:30 pm and I have finally finished backing up my writings to a floppy disk. 276 pages of emotion over 1.5 years... Geez, I write alot.

Anyways, today started out roughly when I took a French test that just creamed me. I couldn't even answer the last 2 questions, even though I studied adequately. This incident destroyed my self-esteem by force. I was on the edge, the edge where you're about to explode in rage and start weeping at the same time. It didn't help that the French teacher asked me in french, "Who is a cute girl in this school?" in French. I tried to look out of the window, and perhaps she would think that I was to absentminded to answer such a question. My hands started to sweat. I cringed and hoped that she wouldn't call on me.

She did. And just then, I was jolted into red-alert mode. With cognitave sirens blaring in my head, I tried to think of ways to stall for time.

"Uhhh... Ummm..."-me
"Is it the 'dans le ecole' part that is messing you up?"-teacher
"Ummm... No, I understand the question, but..."-me
"What?"-teacher
"It's a bit of a personal question"-me
Just then, the capillaries in my cheeks exploded, making my face red and my body temperature rise steadily.

She then replied that she "never thought of it like that..." and promptly asked another person another question.

What do you mean you've never thought of it like that!?! I think it's a tad bit personal, kinda, since, I'm the anti-socialite. The whole chain of incidents just crushed my self-esteem. Just mashed it into a ball of hate and embarassment. A melting ball, perhaps.


Another event worth noting...
The social studies class was not a happy class for me today (It rarely is, I mean, it's so boring. No, really. The class is just PURE worksheet activities and outdated movies!) because Zach went past the line.

We (the class) was talking about how Internet (Capital 'I', duh) has changed the world (my teacher isn't very intelligent so the discussion was quite offensive to me). Then, we started talking about the downsides of the Internet. When picture sharing was brought up, I grinned at Zach, to signal to him that we both had some experience with this subject and that we are more advanced than the teacher. Unfortunately, this signal somehow provoked him into bursting into how "Cheebs" (me) should be sued because I took pitures of him (That never even were worth keeping because they were always blurry.)I hate being called "Cheebs". I find it very disrespectful when people do so. I have told Zach NUMEROUS times to stop calling me by that name, but he's just a disrespectful nut. The most offensive thing about the whole incident was that Zach was threatening to sue me for taking pictures of him that I promptly deleted and weren't even worth the server space to put on the Internet. How dare he... If he can't call me by my name, then he shouldn't even call me by any name. I shouldn't even respond to his idiotic nonsense, but yet, I do. I do because this "aquaintanceship" might be important for future social conflicts. I will keep being friendly to Zach, however much this angers me so.

Today was the LAST "official" diving practice, HOOAH!

And, that's about it. Alpaca Shack Dreams baby!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Tomorrow is the "Harrison Invitational" which is just a practice for the divers for sectionals. I'm nervous, because I'll be doing a back 1.5 dive. I haven't been able to kick out of it hardly.

Today, I went to a party at Greg's house for the divers. It was fantastic. I got to play Greg in "Super Smash Brothers Melee" and we were about at the same skill level.

Can you believe it that diving ends this weekend?! I'm going to be so relieved. I can't even describe the relief I will feel. It's just going to be so... Overwhelming...

Anyways, I learned calculus in QuizBowl today. The only thing, I know how to derive a derivitave, but what ARE they?

Also, Zach is wishing death upon people, but he says he is Catholic. Does this make any sense? Isn't wishing death against god or something? How can he call himself religious if he's so violent?

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
A major date is today. The first day without diving associated scenarios. Wewt!

Anyways, today I went to an awards ceremony that was organized by the Harrison High School booster club. I found it very much a waste of time and overall had a negative image of it in my mind. I received a certificate (A purposeless piece of paper) which was the actual "award".

The whole ceremony started off with this astronaut called Guy (I forgot his last name.) Guy talked and showed us a DVD about how he wastes his time in space by playing with his food. He told us that space travel was "exciting, fun, meaningful, and awesome". I have no idea how space travel had to do with my high GPA. After his schpeel, Kara, Maria, and I lined up for the handing out of the awards.

Actually, we had to write an introduction that the announcer would read before hand. As they read mine, I was feeling nonchalant. After I sat back into my chair, I listened to other people's introductions. Slowly, I became aware that everyone else had a more witty, meaningful, and professional introduction than me. I started to feel guilt and shame. True shame. True shame that eats at your self-esteem. As I basked in my self-hate, I tried to stay awake. First, I stared at a wooden panel in front of me and tried to memorize it's wood grain. That got boring after awhile, so then I started playing with the light reflections that came from my watch. After that got boring, I started..... Then the ceremony ended. Finally...

After the ceremony, I promptly left. I was not going to bask in my low self-esteem any longer.

And.... That's what happened today. I've been corresponding with Greg, my diving coach via email. My scattered jumble of DVD's needs organization. I need some kind of racking device.

Also, I would like to announce that I HAVE DISCOVERED THE 1337NESS OF "AQUA TEEN HUNGER FORCE"! WEWT!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I'm listening to "Arockalypse and the Amazing Trans-Metropolitains", and it's really distracting me. It's still odd that this is the kind of music that sticks to me. It never gets old. You're just humming it constantly.

Anyways, since diving is over, life is better. Unfortuantly, the debut of this "job shadowing" project in the ill-fated "Orientation to Life and Careers" class (Like I needed someone to teach me how to orient my life, geez). I think that this job shadowing thing is nonsense. I want to be my own person, not to copy some chump off of the street. What's wrong with being individual?

Also, I'm thinking of getting a LED ID badge for my birthday or something. Perhaps I could advertise my 1337ness to the world. Those LED badges make me quiver in my nerdness. I want one. I NEED ONE! Not really. If you look at them, you start to ask yourself if you really need one. Do they actually have a functional part in society? No.

Good night.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Welcome my darlings...

I was watching "Stuart Little 2" on public access television (How nice of the government). Stuart (A pathetic little rat) came home with a pathetic injured bird. When Stuart's parents (humans. Yea, I don't get it either) find the pathetic, injured canary, they question the presence of the hawk that almost killed it. The mother of Stuart even suggested calling city hall to protest this presence.

These humans are a prime example of human nurturing gone wrong. Obviously, the mother feels for the bird. The mother thinks that the poor, little birdy shouldn't be hurt by the larger bird of prey. Well, here's the deal. Birds of prey are at the top of the food chain. That means birds of prey kill smaller birds. If you disrupt this cycle, bad things happen. Too many little birds in the city means a large bird feces contamination problem. Fungus will start growing on these feces and cause disease.And I haven't mentioned the host of other problems that could plague the city. The more little birds in the city, the lower the quality of life is for everyone. The hawks exist for the sole purpose of killing the smaller birds and reproducing. Stupid mindless and overzealous humans. These are the kind of people who make up the general public, and you know what? I feel terribly disturbed by that notion. Aren't you?

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Ages, ages ago I thought my life was collapsing.

The dismemberment of diving was supposed to bring me joy. Now all I focus is on homework. As I focus on this homework, it always seems like everyone is always faster, smarter, more efficient, just plain better than me at doing everything. I don't raise my hand anymore. Perhaps I have become paranoid of making a fool out of myself. I hate myself, because everyone else is better than me. Every waking moment of my school life has been transformed into a self-hate filled hell. Constantly, I am clumsy. Constantly, I am mentally truant. Constantly, I am a failure. I am obsolete. I hate myself so much.

Sometimes it is easier to be angry and frustrated than happy. It's just a matter of convenience. You need strong will power to overcome your own criticism. I'm not strong enough. That's why I'm on a lower tier than you. That is why I am a worthless bag of nothingness and you are.... a worthless bag of something.

I make myself sick. I am disgusting. My disgustingly low test grades and my disgustingly slow math skills make me want to implode within myself. I am constantly perpetuating self hate now. I can't help it. It's such a "vicious" cycle. Grr...

Anyways, I'm planning to sell batteries at school. I'm not sure if it's legal, but the outrageous priced school batteries justifies my capitalistic crusade. The end justify the means...

I'm not so happy right now.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
It is so close to Friday. It's one of the first Friday's worth waiting for. Before, diving had made the weekend just as hard as the week days. Now, my life has become a bit easier. I've been invited to Jordan's surprise party.

Anyways, I'm not sure if I should even go. I mean, I'll probably be alienated and alone, but it's a chance to network. A risk perhaps. But hey, I'm a man of risk.

I did well on my French test, and that's probably why I'm so upbeat today. Plus the fact that Ryan gave me "LUV 2 BLOG" post it notes on the bus. Even though they are purple, I still enjoy using them. It's a big deal to me. Hardly anyone gives me presents, ever. It's touching...

Anyways, why is purple the symbol of homosexuality? Purple is a color of royalty, a color of rich aristocrats. How does this relate to homosexuality? If I wore hot pink to school, would people think I'm a freak? Why do we as humans represent ideas and objects with different wavelengths of light? Enough of my stupid ranting.

I'm tired, again. Time to recharge....

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I'm exhausted.

I just finished a work week, a 3 page biology packet, and an 800 word essay about how the "Odyssey" is related to "Star Wars: Episode IV, A New Hope". I feel like sleeping and not writing. Partially because all of this brain work has left me empty headed and left with nothing to say. I'll think I'll doze off now and wake up in the morning to start a new day.

Good night.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I was recently delighted to communicate to my old friend Kiran again. It was nice remembering childhood experiences and discussing how stupid our peers were. I hope we can talk again sometime.

Anyways, tomorow is the field trip to a seminar and I can't wait. Also, I want to know if my Biology article will be acceptable to do my essay on. I'm not sure that it will be, and if it isn't I'll have to toil away trying to find more articles. At least I don't have diving. Good grief!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Today was a 2 hour delay and tomorow is going to be a half day. Could it get any better than this? I'm so overjoyed!

Anyways, I updated the links to take care of some crappy sites. I replaced them with better links to better places.

Something to note today before going to bed: Ryan thought that a Segway scooter powered itself with its "gyro" mechanism. Note to all of those misinformed people: SEGWAYS HAVE BATTERIES AND MOTORS! RIDE YOUR BIKE!

I don't like it when people come up with expensive and redundant inventions. A safety bicycle has a seat, and you can become healthier with it. It is also faster and more manuverable, not to mention it's inexpensiveness. I'll put that on my hate list. Segways and Ipods...

I've got to sleep man.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
As an 'esample, I've decided t'"dialectize" mah' post today. Slap mah fro! ah' dun did dis by usin' de "dialectizer" link t'yo' left. Man! Try it out. Man! Anyways, today wuz fine standard. De point ah' wanna make today be dis. ah' still hate da damn stupid "Orientashun t'Life and Careers" class. We is watchin' movies which gots hardly nuthin t'do wid careers and da damn wo'k fo'ce. Any info'mashun dey cut is eida' obvious o' outdated. Do we truly need t'be taught dat we need t'be clean and diggin' hot t'make some baaaad fust impression? If Indiana's ya'd needs dis primitive kind'a instrucshun, dese ya'd gots'ta be incredibly. Slap mah fro!.. slow, so cut me some slack, Jack. And da damn scary doodad be dat da damn ya'd uh Indiana probably duz need dese skills.

Anyways, ah' sold all uh my fundraisin' kindy. Slap mah fro! De profits go t'QuizBowl. It's quite rediculous, ah' mean, de kindy be ho'rible and overpriced. You's dig sick uh it afta' de 4d lick, and dey're shaped likes some brain. 'S coo', bro. It's some wonda' dat Zach actually bought dree. I'm still amazed dat everyone bought one. ah' gots'ta be movin' mah' way down de social ladda' o' sump'n. Quite possibly.

Slap mah fro!.. I still hate Ipods. I'm so's incredibly full uh rage against Ipods. ah' plum hate dem. WORD! If ya' wuz carryin' one, it would make some baaaad fust impression uh ya' t'me. It would show dat ya' wuz ripped off fo' sump'n purely vain. 'S coo', bro. If ya' gots bought an Ipod, shame on ya'. If ya' gotsn't, join me in mah' quest t'ban Ipods fum society! Right on!

Also, ah' would likes t'menshun dat "Peace Out" be not fum Mr. Ah be baaad... Rice o' anoda' sucka'. "Peace Out" be an 'espression likes "Chill, Homie G" and be not "owned" by any one sucka'. Snatch dat Ryan. 'S coo', bro.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Typical day, again. That's what makes it typical right?

Endless minutes wasted loathing over products on thinkgeek.com have made me unhappy. My unhappyness is also stimulated by my depressing music of radioheadness...

In French, I've decided I'm an utter failure. I'm just not a French person. Languages don't come easy for me. As I make these excuses up, I realize that doing this is just a sad way of trying to compensate for my failures. I try to justify my failure. That makes me sick.

I was daydreaming in class today and I thought about getting a handgun. You know, in the movies the guy with the gun always wins. If there's an apockalypse, you've got a (temporary) safeguard. A handgun would be a nice commodity. As I daydreamed, I recognized my misjudgement. If I had a handgun, I would probably hurt myself in situations like this. Note to self: don't buy weapons.

I guess that's the lesson of the day. I've just got to stick to my pacifistic morals and everybody will benefit.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I recently got the "T-zones" service for my cell phone which enables it to surf WAP internet sites. It's nice that it only costs $5.

Anyways, my biology cramming really helped me today. When I took the test, the knowledge was there. Cramming must not be all that bad. I mean, people are always like, "Cramming is bad. You have to learn to study a month before a test." The message should be, "Cramming works. Cram."

By the way, I burned another CD today called "Old Stuff that's Kinda New (not really)." I like it.

Also, I was alarmed by a book that my little sister brought home. One of its questions was, "How has the freedom of speech enabled peace flourish?" People can valiantly argue about how the freedom of speech promotes peace, but the thing is, true peace cannot be incurred by freedoms and democracy. Freedom of speech always means someone ranting, complaining, and threatening. Freedom of speech means freedom of conflict. Now, is that peace?

I'm still amazed at the uneducated people in the world today (me being one of them.) I hate selfish, arrogant, and uneducated people. People like those crumbby 96.5 WAZY radio station Disk Jockeys. They were talking about how rising fuel prices were biting into their wallets. Well, stupid idiots, the world isn't revolving around you. Other countries have been paying twice to three times the ammount of us Americans. You are paying more because you continue to use. Hey, here's an idea for you savage disk jockeys. Maybe you should drive a Prius, jerk. WAZY has just earned themselves a disgruntled listeners. Perhaps I should pay them a nice little visit...

Ugh, true disgust.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Today was one of those "bright sunshiney" days that the radio tells me about. There were deadly UV rays everywhere today! It was so exhilarating. I mean, you step out and get free radiation. Step in the car, more cell-deforming sun! Who needs to kill yourself artificially in a tanning salon when you can just get cancer the old fashioned way? Let's go outside and PARTY!

Unfortunately, it was a "bright sunchiney" and cold day. My hopes and dreams utterly shattered. In the meantime, I'll just rant about how stupid tanning is. Bombarding yourself with radiation for the sole purpose of vanity is just absurd. It's about as idiotic as spraying flamable liquid in your kitchen and lighting it on fire, upon which your house catches on fire. Then, you smother your face into the burning toxic fire. As the flesh peels from your skin, you dial 411 and scream in agony. It's at that level. I'm telling you, don't go tanning. It's stupid. Completely illogical.

I hate stupid tanning. I absolutely hate it.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I'm excited since I have much information to write today.

First off, I'm going to take those broken links off of the links section because their making me angry. Those stupid unprofessional broken links. Grr...

Second off, I can't wait to put up some new links to replace the broken ones. Leisure World will be one of them.

Anyways, I was talking to my dad after he asked me if I've ever played the "Grand Theft Auto" line of games. He talked about how some black kid was obsessed with it and killed a police officer after stealing a car. The police officer's family is suing Rockstar Games and Sony.

I believe such blame on an inanimate object is extremely short-sighted. I've played "Grand Theft Auto I", "Grand Theft Auto II", "Grand Theft Auto III".... I've played EVERY SINGLE ONE! Am I going on a killing rampage outside? No. The simple answer is this. A variety of factors probably influenced this child besides "Grand Theft Auto". The effect of this game is absolutely negligent. He either had problems with his cognitave ability or faced instability within his life. GTA did not cause him to kill a police officer. Life did.

Plus, people are killed when using plastic spoons, peanuts, and vacuum cleaners. How is a few deaths by video game so terrible? Is it enough for mass panic, lawsuits, and the banning of fun games? It absolutely is not. It's so extremely irrational. It's one of those things the general public is stupid about. I just want to get some parents and have a "Where To Put Your Blame 101" class.

The reaction with violent video games is just like the irrational reaction of holiday vacationers. If a plane crashes, everybody panics and spends hundreds of hours and millions of dollars investigating the cause. News networks swarm the 10 mile radius. The TV blares menacing warnings. You see a hundred instant replays of the crash and following fire. Everybody is scared. Everybody....

GOES ON A ROAD TRIP! What could be safer than nice pavement. Nice pavement, 2 ton hummers driven by other people just like you! Of course a license for driving a car can be obtained by a person by the likes of me, and a pilot's license takes years of study, diligence, and certification, but that's beside the point! What could be safer than a SUV driven by a drunk teenager? What could be safer than driving behind a 16-wheel mega-truck driven by a drowsy trucker? I'll tell you what could be safer...

Air travel is safer, stupid idiot. It's quite safe to say that riding in a airplane is MUCH safer than in a car. What does the "general public" do? They drive. Stupid, stupid, stupid...

Just like that scenario, it is safe to say that GTA is not killing our youth. I mean, WHO HASN'T played GTA some time or another. I believe that at least %80 of all teens have experienced the awesomeness of GTA and have gone on a week GTA binge. If what the lawyers, parents, and professors say is true, then 80% of teenagers would be going on killing rampages, while the world would end and total anarchy and chaos would ensue. That hasn't happened.

Maybe that kid played GTA, and maybe he killed a police officer. But I know that holding a plastic spoon in my hand is much more dangerous than playing GTA.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I have coined a nickname in QuizBowl. Finally!

This has established roots for me to which I can grow on now. I really hope I can join QuizBowl next year, so I can be the "Sky Captain". I love my nickname. I also live "Sky Captain and the World of Tomorrow". It's just so... artsy...

Well, not much happened today. A typical Thursday. Actually, there was alot that happened today. I'm just too lazy to type this late at night. But, I suppose I'll have a go at it.

Well, in social studies Zach and I were to write about the United States' unifying traits pertaining to nationality, ethics, land, culture, etc. I started half-jokingly half-talkingly speaking about how the United States was obese and used science as a scapegoat. Yes, I believe that, but if Zach told everyone in the class, it wouldn't be so pretty. You know... Indiana is pretty conservative. The lack of knowledge just makes every Hoosier's (A native of Indiana) judgement even worse. Even Ryan, Indiana's tomorrow, thought that stem cells came from humanoid fetuses. NEWS FLASH: Stem cells come from a cluster of 40 cells. Maybe you crazy "Hoosiers" should read up on the subject before trying to debate about an issue. Geez... It makes me sick to think about all of these unknowing, incompetent, plain-dumb people who try to argue about things they don't understand. Perhaps I don't understand what I'm talking about, but that's why I try to keep my opinions hidden (Key word is "try") from others. I try, but it's human nature to argue. I guess all of those dumb people are humans too. I guess I can't blame them. Perhaps... I will anyways.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I went to the "Union" at Purdue University today.

I had fun, but I felt like a rock. I was drifting away. I needed sleep. Actually, I need sleep now, so I'll sleep. Tomorow is class at I don't know.... Ugh...

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Acomplishments this weekend: 1. Watched "Shallow Hal"... 2. Burned a "Beatles" and "Modest Mouse" CD... 3. Well, that's about it.

I've just wasted two CD's trying to create a "Modest Mouse/ The Beatles" compilation mix. Roxio Easy CD Creator has given me too many errors. Wasted too many ruined CD's, or coasters. I am banishing Roxio and it's sick, unacceptable products. It's this simple, Roxio sucks. Use Windows Media Player to rip and burn CD's. Don't use Roxio. It just sucks. I hate Roxio now. Ban their products!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
La de da... La de da...

That "Beatles" music is getting to my head.

A study session for tomorrow's French exam is going very well. Except for the fact that French is actually a black death spiral of doom. I don't know what to say, but needless to say, I'm expecting a low B.

Also, tommorow is the day of the event in my calendar called "the little diving/swimming get together thingie (Warning!1!)". I'm supposed to bring an entree, but I'm too lazy, and Rachel told me not to. I know I'll look like a mooch, but what the hey. I don't care about athletics. I shun athletics.

Tommorow (I'm losing my spelling ability) is a work day. Shoot.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I hate it when Blogger doesn't post.

I wrote a post last night and it didn't post. In the future, I propose to myself that I get my own host. Maybe, with an original url. Oh, sweet dreams.

Talking about dreams, last night I had a dream of the end of the world. But, it wasn't typical "end of the world" type stuff. First of all, it was a cold snowy winter. Second of all, there wasn't any mass looting. Third of all, it was a VERY realistic dream. I distinctly remember checking the "CNN" website to see when the doomsday meteor would land. It was pretty variant depending on when you checked. It was generally around 6:30 p.m. , but the "Chicago Tribune" said that it would land at 5 p.m. That kind of left me guessing. That's the true fear of it all. I didn't know when I would be blown to pieces. I started thinking about life and what would happen after I died. You know, being non-religious and all, I was thinking of just a black abyss of nothingness. Just non-existance. But all of my memories are of existance. It's impossible to feel non-existance, because you wouldn't feel anything. Perhaps that's why religion is so prevalent in current culture. All I know is that I knew I was going to die then, and when I woke up... I was very happy. A swelling, undescribable relief poured into my system. Just pure relief. I'm so glad it was another Tuesday today. Same old Chicken Noodle soup at lunch. Same old Andrew and Ryan. Same insane lunatic flute player. Same stupid OLC videos. That was pure bliss for me the first time in my life today. I hope I don't have one of those dreams again. I'm afraid that I'll get stuck in one, and really die. When it's that realistic, what's the difference between reality and non-reality? I felt, heard, smelled, and touched the apockalypse as if it were real. It could have been real. It makes me cringe.

Anyways, I'm gonig to talk about how much I hate OLC and "gamers" tomorow (I still can't spell) so stay "tuned".

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
In today's news... (elipsis?)

I got a "Dance Dance Revolution" bundle pack for my $15 PS1! W00t! I'm going to aspire to become a DDR lunatic! Thank you Ryan.

Anyways, the pet peeve of today is... People who talk about anything about or related to video games.

Video games conjure up bad memories for me. Yes, they are fun for the moment, but when you look around and you realize that you've been playing all night non-stop, that you need to go to the bathroom and puke, that your eyes are burning from the evil screen, that you've lost feeling in your leg, and that in this whole process, didn't accomplish one thing... It's a bit "traumatic", don't you think? Why would anyone sacrifice such valuable time for something as trivial as a "video game"? Well, the answer is simple. People are dumb. I am dumb. Everyone (Except those privilaged "special" children) has played a video game one time or another. The problem is that video games accomplish nothing. You finish a game... but did that affect reality? Did that make you more financially secure. Did finishing Final Fantasy make you more intelligent? No.

The sad thing is that some people don't understand it until they are 42, and they're starting to suffer from a wasted life of video games. All of those famed "gamers" are nothing more than rubbish. They accomplish nothing, yet they are idols.

Now, moving on to people who talk about video games. People who talk about video games are usually biased, irrational, and unintelligent pricks.

Me: "So, what do you think about ?"

Stupid idiot: "Well, it's like cool. Like, man, it rocks."

Me: "Umm... What's that supposed to mean?"

Me (Inside Head): "Stupid idiot... Why am I even talking to this moron? I suppose that's the price I have to pay for being one of the only rational people at school. I would be so much happier if I were a dumb idiot too... I disgust myself..."

Stupid idiot: "Dude, it's like fun!"

Me: "So, how does this game contribute to your life?"

Stupid idiot: "It, like, helps my thingie. I mean my eye... eye... huh... hah..."

Me: "You mean, 'eye-hand coordination'?"

Stupid idiot: "Stop using big words!"

------------
Obviously, this whole incident occurrs almost everyday. It infuriates me.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
My friend and confiant called me today.

He told me that this site was "worthless and stupid". I agree, but it's fun. We had a good laugh about it.

Anyways, I don't have anything to write about... so...

HAIL KAISER ANDREW!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I went to the park for a bit of a picnic with Ryan and Company today.

It wasn't particularly eventful, besides for some middle school kids who shared the park with us. This one kid called "Kane" was a belligerent and vulgar prick. I really wanted him to be pushed down forcefully, but the key in these situations is to keep the enemy from having a reason to hate you. As long as they have no reason to hate you, anything done against you by them is their fault.

Well, I need my camera back from Devin, so I'll have to badger himi this weekend. Can't wait...

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I have to admit. I'm a brand loyalist. I admire UPS and DHL while I hate FedEx.

I hate FedEx because:
1. Their shipment time is mediocre.
2. Their promises are never kept.
3. They use green and purple on their trucks.
4. They don't make entertaining commercials.
5. They crash their planes into islands and have Tom Hanks play with your shipments.
6. The drivers smell bad.
7. Their website uses too much white.
8. Brown is a cooler color than green and purple.
9. Federal Express is working with the Feds.
10. DHL roxx my soxx.

By the way, Rachel prank called me earlier this weekend. I'm not sure if I should be offended or not. Suppose she was intoxicated. Suppose she was pressured by her peers. Suppose she hates me. I don't know what to take of it. I'm just glad I haven't exploded in rage. I'm usually terribly offended by prank calls. After I get prank calls, I usually kill my self-esteem. I always feel like I'm worthless to other people when my peers prank call me. I'm kind of sad right now. It makes me feel used.

Well, signing out...

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
When I tell people that I strongly dislike video games, they get violent. Go figure...

Anyways, I woke up and felt like a million bucks this morning, but upon reaching English, my delicate self-esteem level came crashing down. My English papers are never that great, but it made me feel terrible when I found out everyone else's success. The whole incident made me like a faceless rice cake. Go figure... again...

And, don't ask me what it feels like to be a faceless rice cake. That is the question that only 1337 p30plz kan k/\/0w.

By the way, the Harrison barn (a barn that my school uses as a billboard) was burnt down. Supposedly, this heart-wrenching incident was caused by Jefferson High School. Hey, that's just a rumor.

It's so intriguing how people go to great lengths to convert Atheists back to religious nuts. My friends Kaiser Andrew and Zach were having a bit of a chat at lunch with me today. We went on to talk about religion and it seems previously rational people turn into some bezerk machine of conversion. It's like talking to insurance salesmen. Oh well, if divine forces advocate the shameless peddling of religion, I suppose it can't be all that bad. Right folks?

I still hate OLC by the way. I hate it. Forever.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
You wouldn't believe what an influence fashion has on high school society. It's a bit too integral, if you ask me.

I walked into school today with a collared overshirt and khakis and everyone asks if the world is ending. You see, I usually wear 2 layers of fleece. This drastic change caused many others who know me to stare, exclaim, and generally panic. The major unanimous consensus was that this change was for the better. Although I don't see myself as a vain person, I enjoyed all of the attention I got. It's only human nature, you know?

Anyways, in this fashion oriented society, vanity should be degraded. In a cultured social class like mine, the thing that really matters is how witty you are. If you're straight, to the point, and not sarcastically comical you'll probably get the boot. Wit can take you a long way. Nice threads can make you look good while getting there.

Well, the question is... is vanity all what it's cracked up to be? I mean, should we be more focused on what someone wears than how witty they are or how rational they are? Is some fab rock star going to manipulate us more than some disfigured genius? Most likely. Judging by appearances and all...

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
My Dance Dance Revolution equipment has come. I've danced my legs to oblivion, and I've enjoyed every bit of it. I can't wait untill tomorrow.

Anyways, I did a bit of tomorrow's math assignment (That I got from an inside source) to assuage the homework given to me over spring break.

I'm going to see what everyone's reaction is tomorrow when I wear a green fluffy t-shirt and sweatpants. I can't wait to see everyone cringe in horror! Oh, for the sake of maniupulation. w00t.

I'm going to sleep. Nothing much has happened today, except that Andrew and Zach tried to convert me to Christianity, again... This is quite.... uhh... interesting. I wonder of they'll ever stop.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
What's been going on?

Well, Blogger hasn't been posting my posts lately, to my dismay (The last one was pretty large.); hopefully, today it'll post.

Well, let me ask that question again.

What's been going on? Well, I went to the local home renovation megastore to get paint. This paint will be applied tomorrow in the bonus room. It's a bit of a cottage theme. Another thing that is happening is that I'm still trying to figure out T-Mobile's policy on picture messaging to emails. If this is considered "data" covered by my "Unlimited t-zones" plan or if it considered an "analog picture message". After much combing through endless pages of miniaturized text, I still can't find anything pertaining to my question. I've already sent them my 2nd email. I'm presuming that they will reply tomorrow.

By the way. I burned a new CD called "Stuffo." It's got some smooth 80's pop. Itz da "shiz nit."

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I'm a bit addicted to a game called "psychobabble" on popcap.com. I know, it's sad that I'm once again being manipulated by corporate giants, but it has to be done, for the sake of the capitalistic economy, or not.

Anyways, painting, painting, and more painting will commence tomorrow. Also, darn. I lost my train of thought. Train... Train... choo choo train! w00t. Ok, sleep is needed, if you can't tell. Uh... can't remember, but I'm going to put shinny stuff in the paint tomorrow. Did you know that my feet are turning purple? I think it's my eyes...

Oh yes, now I remember. I'm sporting a nifty "wolverine" hairstyle. It's a hairstyle where my gigantisimo sideburns stick out of my head at a 90 degree angle while my bangs are formed into two pointly little prongs that stick out of my head. I think it enables the hair to dry faster. Nedd sleep. I'm gettinga drwosyh. SSSSGodnihgt.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Ugh... blogger is getting unresponsive and it's frustrating me.

Anyways, I became so desparate for communication that I entered my email address in every pop-up solicitation I came across. So far, no one has contacted me. Even spammers can't stand to talk with little old me.

Also, I signed up for surveys and get-rich-quick schemes that use your computer to test websites. I've potentially made five cents so far. I'm excited!

Anyways, I talked to Josh today. It was facinating to see the world through his eyes. He's a genius, you know? I really think he's just too awesome for me to be with him, but hey, why not bask in his awesome glow? Maybe some of it will rub off on me...

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
What do you do when you're bored and the only thing you can turn to is the Internet? Well, obviously you turn to spam and "get-rich-quick" schemes. It's day two of my "Inbox Dollars" escapade and my balance is at $17s. I'm over halfway to my goal. My spam is growing exponentially. I think it's time to celebrate. Spam is fun for everyone!

I put a link to the "Inbox Dollars" thing if you are bored and want to see if you can earn some cash (I'm skeptical), but hey, if you sign up in my name, I'm supposed to get cash. If you don't like me or don't want to support me, then don't click the link. Foos.

Anyways, I put Ryan's comic link on (He's estatic about this kind of stuff) so check it out. I'm not liable for any eye injuries.

Maybe I'll get rich quick tomorrow...

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
My parakeet, Vanilla, died today. She was seven years old.

It was pretty traumatic, but I made it through the day. I think that at someone's death, it should be a celebration of what that someone accomplished. It shouldn't be a sadfest of weeping. There's no point in crying over spilled milk. Yes, it's unfortunate that someone died, but they wouldn't want you suffering because of them... unless they were some kind of sadist. Most people aren't sadists. Zach is an exception.

I buried my Vanilla in a little red box. It is in a shallow grave beside the two largest trees in my back yard. There is a little stick where the grave is.

Things die. I just have to deal with it.

item.title: Taken: 04-02-05
item.dc:creator: ryochiba

04-02-05_0941, originally uploaded by Aminalz Rule.

My little birdie in a box.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Am I dead or am I sleeping?

I went to Michigan City, Indiana today. Anyone see the oxymoron? Anyone?

Ok, time to recap. Nothing to recap. Panic.


Tomorrow is the beginning of school. I'm a bit happy. Being back on a routine with other people my age pleases me. And, I get to talk so awesome people. People that I wish were my friends. People who are just fantastic. I can't immagine being like them. Everyday, I strive for the impossible standards set by them.

Enough idolism.

You know what? Dance Dance Revolution brings me great frustration. I've always had that problem. Same thing happened with tennis. I would get frustrated and explode. If anyone's seen the movie "Falling Down", then you know what I mean. It's a good movie. Rent it or something.

That reminds me, I better update my profile.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
The funniest thing happened today, according to Zach anyways.

My English teacher was introducing our "Totalitarianism Paper" to us. This paper had a selection of dictators we could choose from, including the infamous Kim Jong Il. Because of the school corporation's budget printers, the "Il" in "Kim Jong Il" looked like "II", or a Roman 2. Because of this, the teacher called Kim Jong Il "Kim Jong the Second." I just thought that was the most hilarious thing I've heard in the past month. I suppose English teachers only teach English, but you should at least know who KIM JONG IL is!

Anyways, my group consists of Kaiser Andrew, myself, and Russell. Russell didn't want to pick Kim Jong Il (like I wanted too) because it would stir up too much controversey on the Internet. He said that there would be many blogs that would pose too much of a hassle to deal with when we searched the Internet. Absurd. I still think that Kim Jong Il was the better choice.

Oh how I remember of old times... Devin, Karl, and I. Those were the days...

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
You know what? I still don't understand a lot of things in this world.

One of the things I don't understand is why other peoples' email addresses have stupid names.

Take for example Kaiser Andrew's email address. His email is baconboy936@msn.com. Why is his insignia "baconboy936"? Is Andrew truely a "baconboy"? What kind of effect does bacon have in his life? Does he have some kind of bacon fetish, or has bacon inspired him to become so great. The number "936" also stirrs up mystery. Does Andrew have 936 cows and pigs? Does Andrew plan to date 936 women? Does Andrew have 936 marbles that he puts in 936 shot glasses that he picked up on 936 vacations to Disney World in Florida? Perhaps, Andrew has a hidden chamber under his house that is filled with 936 gadgets to thwart morons. Or maybe his computer only has 936 MegaBytes left in the hard drive. Maybe 936 is a anagram for...

Whatever it is, the mysterious number 936 will always be shrouded in conspiracy. Will we ever know what 936 means? And, what is this "baconboy"???


In other news, I'm planning a webcomic (I know, I'm a loser for doing it after Ryan has already done it twice), but hey. Perhaps I'll outdo Ryan just to show that I've got mad skillz too. Maybe it'll impress Amanda. That would be the world for me.

These were the pieces I recovered from the evil printer of doom. Two ink cartriges (You can trade them in for paper at the local office store), an LCD screen/microchip combination (Kind of like scalping a caucasian person's head and hanging it on a stick kind of thing, except for a printer), and finally a heavy, metal rod (For self defence and offense).

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I was never really much of a networker.

I urge myself to take initiative to get people to invite me to places (Which usually involves me making myself seem like a tag-along moocher, but that's besides the point), but I never go. Andrew and Rachel really had me into going to the "Live from Graff" concert, but I never went. I'm not going to make up some silly excuse like I often do. I just don't enjoy thinking about socializing with other people. I relatively enjoy actually doing it, but terrible memories of previous social experiences have caused me to shun myself from the such. I have memories where I have just faded into a corner, no one really trying to integrate me. It was usually me and my camera, or me and my book, or me and my watch... Just looking at everyone having fun. I just sit there, trying to imagine my purpose in all of this. I don't seem to fit in in these memories. It scares me, and makes me sad when I think about it. I suppose that's why I didn't go to "Live from Graff" or other social occasions that I have previously missed. I'm a bit shy. Well, shy wouldn't be the word. I can talk to people fine, but when there's competition with others, it gets to be hectic and I lose hope. The best word to use would be... Hopeless...

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
The highlight of this weekend?

That would probably either mowing the lawn or checking my emails. I'm leading a very counterproductive lifestyle, I suppose. Thus, I have not much to write about. Therefore, I will write tomorrow if something exciting happens.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I just finished drawing a nice Las Vegas sign in my notebook. I know, I'm so productive.

Andrew says he finds comedy in my comments about him being a chick magnet. Well, that shouldn't be so because it's so true. I mean, everything about Andrew makes him a running candidate in most everything, especially the dating scene. He's tall... intelligent... and cleans after himself. Did I mention that he's tall?

Anyways, I'm working on my pathetic drawings, trying to improve my less-than-mad drawing skillz. Hopefully, someday I'll be as good as the "Plugged Nickel" guy. Yea, I should put a link to his site since he's my idol now. That and Andrew.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
The ink in my precious pen is running out. It makes me not so happy. Without the pen ink, I won't be able to illustrate my light pencils, therefore rendering the contrasting emotions useless. A new pen will be needed, and soon.

Guess what I spent an hour on tonight? I spent an hour drawing a 50's-esque drawing. Hehehe. I'm so productive, like I said before.

Kaiser Andrew said that my animal-esque furry characters are obsolete compared to his human creations. And people reading my blog, I have not webcomic nor are planning to release one (Like anyone cares anyways). The flickr pictures were just experimental image hosting... experiments. Also, I suspect that Amanda read my blog. I also suspect that my sister could be possibly read my blog. I'll have to block my sister and become more censorship oriented, I guess.. Or not.

Well, on to learn more about drawing!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
It's amazing that I only watch televison while brushing my teeth. If everyone was like that, dentists would be terrorizing congress like lawyers always are.

My new diet would be a big hit. It's called the mouthwash diet. You wash your mouth in that nasty antiseptic stuff for about 5 minutes and then spit out and rinse. It's that easy. Because you wouldn't be able to taste anything for the next week or so, eating wouldn't be such a pleasure. You don't even have to discipline yourself or anything. Also, this method has no permanent effects. I've done it before and it works. Having everything taste like minty alcohol isn't my defenition of a great culinary experience.

I've figured that I'm going to learn how to drive this summer instead of take economics. It's a bit discouraging when your own guidence counselor calls one of the standardized classes "pointless." Don't you think?

I'm addicted to Marrakesh Express. Please someone get me away from that song.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Yup yup...

I've started drawing incarnations of myself now. I don't know, but I always portray myself as some violent freak in a poorly drawn trenchcoat. And, unfortunately, I can only draw uzis so I'm equipted with two bland uzis. Too bad I can't draw lugers.

Anyways, I suppose it started when Rachel was talking about robbing banks with me. I started daydreaming (Which I do alot of) and made up this little image of myself in a trench coat. he he. I must be mentally ill.

My friend, Kaiser Andrew, has a knack for throwing pencils at me. It's disturbing to know that he is out to get me. I have to watch my back incessantly now. In the bathroom, in the living room, while I'm digging through the system files on my computer. I have to make sure Andrew is not behind me, waiting to throw a pencil at me. I must be cautious at ALL times. He is out to get me.

I suck at drawing.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I've been sick all weekend, so pity me. Please. Pity party!

Anyways, I've been spending the past few hours drawing Fox McCloud. You know what? These "anthro" drawings really grow on you. "Anthro" refers to a personification applied to animals. My throat feels like a bag of soggy grass and sharp wood chips.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
When Kara said, "Do you have a 'Xanga'?" (For refrence, a 'Xanga' is a blog hosted by a company called 'Xanga'. I know, original) I immediately knew something bad happened. Blogging has hit the mainstream at my school. With "AOHell" Instant Messaging, it seems "Xangas" have become the weapon of choice for budding bloggers. Once something hits mainstream, it instantly becomes not so awesome as it was originally. A bit like that "nuba nuba" dance. At first, it was a bit funny, but once those jocks that sit behind you in social studies start humming that tune you know that it's not funny at all. It becomes almost offensive, it brings shame. Mainstream is not good. Mainstream is unacceptable.

Now, since blogging is unacceptable, you would expect me to shut this site down. Well, I KNOW that this "Xangaing" thing is just a shabby fad. I know many, MANY people who have tried blogging. They would last about a month before they quit of boredom or lazyness. I estimate that 98% of my peers will quit "Xangaing" before this month. I can't wait until this fad ends. Until then, I'll be known as, "Mr. Uncool", so call me that. No... really...

I took two tablets of "Tylenol SEVERE Congestion" medication this morning. Needless to say, the side effects were... adverse. Non-drowsy, non-shmousy...

Well, we went to this Convocation in the auditorium this morning. This was when my medication was taking full effect. I sat down, barely understanding anything that was going around me. As I sat down, this tough looking kid with really saggy pants sat down in front of me. Dazed and uncontrolable, I yelled, "Hey, I bet I could find a correlation between how low someone's pants are and their IQ!" to my friend Adam. The tough looking kid looks behind and I say hello. Adam whispers, "I bet I could find a correlation between how loud someone is and how long they live." Luckily, I lived.

Throughout the day, my mind was inactive and woozy. Not good.

Heh Heh... Note to self: No tylenol in the morning.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I still feel like a flogged moose tied to a long tree. In other words, I'm still just as groggy and tired as yesterday. My illness seems to want to stay with me.

I have witnessed yet another example of how propanganda in popular media can create a dull-witted generation. My example today is, "Shark Tales." You know that movie, that movie that stirred up the hullaballoo with those crazy little kids and afterward ended up being a forgotten disk hidden away in the dusty corner of a closet. Yes, that movie.

Well, no one cares about the story, so I'll skip that part. In the end, the sharks and the fish become friends after a vegetarian shark and a poserlicous fish win over the hearts of everyone. Then the party ensues. The party is not the important part, but just another aspect of a inefficient society. Keep that in mind. Actually, you don't have to. Many people can hardy keep what they ate for breakfast in their mind, nonetheless an unorthodox concept.

Well, this movie doesn't explain what would happen afterwards. The sharks would starve. At the same time, the fish population would multiply to an unmaintainable limit. This would lead to the collapse of the ecosystem, the systematical demise of every living organism, and...

A bad story to tell idealistic little kids. I suppose that's why they didn't have an "extended version" and whatnot. But, is a bad story a good enough reason to infer something fictional and untrue? Do we want to teach the leaders of tomorrow something that could eventually lead to the systematic destruction of an ecosystem and its inhabitants? What do you think? The answer is obvious so don't even answer. All of those questions were rhetorical, so don't even try. No, really. Stop debating me in your head. STOP!!!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Oh, woe is me!

My notebook has been left at the lunch table and I assume that it's been KIA (Killed In Action) so I've given up hope on it. Good thing that my sister is obsessed with art and whatnot. I'm sure I can steal some supplies from her without alerting anyone.

Anyways, I'm wondering if anyone has that notebook right now. If I found a notebook like mine, then I would consider it a VALUABLE find since I had so much in it. I had endless rants that made no sense, crappy sketches, and lots of ink. I'm now sure that you would get a lot of revenue from selling this thing, but hey.

Quizbowl for the next 4 days, w00T.

And, for the record, I still feel like a flogged moose tied to a large wooden object.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
