My hate for these "Xangas" grows even stronger because Devin has turned to them. How devilishly evil!

Anyways, I plan on making a movie about obesity and OLC. It's going to be a bit of a mocking of the whole class, but disguised in an informative promotional video for cardiology. I'm sure you don't care so I'll stop talking about it.

Tomorrow is my birthday. I assume that you don't care about that either.

Now, on to rant about how "Xangas" are evil. First of all, "Xanga" starts with a "X." A lot of things that are evil start with X. "X-Rays" are EVIL! They cause cancer and damage cell structure from inside out. You don't feel the damage caused until the cancer has spread throughout your whole body, the tumors are practically falling out of your nose, and your brain is being crushed by pressure from the increased cranial fluid. Perhaps it isn't EXACTLY like that, but let's think about another thing that is evil that starts with the letter "X."

"Xenophobe" starts with X. They are constantly fearful of foriegners. Trust me, I've met a few, and they are either violent or reclusive. The latter would be better if you were me. Personally, I prefer not to be lynched.

"XTRA" starts with X. It is used to lure unsuspecting consumers into a buying trap. Whether it be "XTRA POWER", "XTRA ACTION", or "XTRA JELLY", "XTRA" has led many people into buying insanely worthless objects. "XTRA" is truely evil.

"X-Files" starts with X. It's such a crappy show that I'll just end it at that.

"X-Men" starts with X. They aren't evil, but instead awesomely cool. But, you have to admit that Wolverine's sideburns have a hint of evil in them. I can smell the evil in his sideburns. SMELL THEM!

"XOXOXOXO" starts with X. It has been used to conclude hundreds of thousands of middle school love letters. Unfortunately, these immature romantic escapades usually ended up futile and these X's and O's which were supposed to represent hugs and kisses only brought misery and dispair. I would consider that evil.

"Sharper Image Ionic Breeze" starts with X. Actually, it doesn't, but it is so evil that it qualifies for this list. It claims to "purify" your air by ionizing the air, but it just produces O3, or ozone which can irritate the lungs of the people STUPID enough to buy those things. Serves them right. Stupid Ionic Breeze.

Now, do you see the true evil of "Xangas"? They start with X.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
His eyes are misted. Misted like a waterfall. The blood vessels are dialated. You can see the anger through his eyes. His disappointment, his obvious regret. A regret that he ever met me.

Guilt trip time. It's Biology. The last class and we're already at the three different types of evolution. I'm still on my guilt trip. Adam starts to go into extremo explosive "I don't care about its relevancy, but I will justify by asking anyways" mode. I'm still feeling guilty. I can feel the pain and suffering I have caused, yet he laughs. Is he expecting me to feel this way when he laughs? Am I the unfortunate victim of social torture? No. I have brought this upon myself. I look up at the teacher. I don't know where to put my eyes. I'm on the edge.

Just finished copying my notes and the teacher quits with two minutes on the clock. I start wondering how to pop my apologies. I concentrate on that little dark speck on my desk, trying to think of a socially acceptable way of saying sorry without falling apart. I can't.

Bell rings. Russell comes behind me. I say sorry. He's still not so happy. I'm still tense. I am so right now.

I suppose I could have avoided that tension by not talking about Russell so uncarefully. But, it was fate. I hope Russell is ok. Guilt trip.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I feel terrible.

So terrible that I actually missed school. I live life in fifteen minute increments because that's how long I can sleep before having to either vomit, blow my nose, or having a athsma attack. I have post-viral bronchial hyper-activity. Whatever that's supposed to mean. I'll go sleep now.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
A bout of pneumonia is what has kept me from updating. It's starting to go away after my arduous two week journey through pain and suffering, but the antibiotics are the actual cause of recovery.

I still can't believe that I "lost" an argument with Andrew one day a few days ago at lunch. I absolutely totaled his argument and raised mine to the level of acceptance, but did anyone pay any attention to what we were actually talking about? No, they were too busy laughing at me because I was sick at the time and was having difficulty talking. It's excruciatingly frustrating to try to convince people to agree with you when they can't even conceptualize what you are talking about because they are to busy ridiculing you. How terrible. They automatically assume that Andrew is always right. This is disgusting and vile. How dare they.

Anyways, my band solo is coming along, but you don't care. I suck at clarinet anyways, so let us change the subject. Another thing to note in this little diary of mine would be my re-obsession with "Animal Crossing" which has made me an AC addict again. You probably don't even know what "Animal Crossing" is. Well, let's just say it would probably disgust you with its excentricity and obscene happiness. Everyone my age is supposed to be obsessed with drugs, sex, money, and violence anyways. It makes me feel out of place when playing a happy fun game with fluffy animals and sunny days in it. I suppose that conformity isn't always the answer. Who wants to be obsessed with drugs, sex, money, and violence anyways? Let's all play happy fun games with lots of rainbows. Emphasis on the rainbows.

On Sunday, I decided to log on to my evil, putrid AIM account. Anything associated with American Online smells of filth, but I was testing my wireless connection. All in the name of Wi-Fi! So, I instant messaged this one person named "adancer." This person promply replied with some stupid, idiotic comment on how she was beautiful and blonde and all of that and it made me sick to think that people were this vain, but ,of course, I couldn't say that all since I can only type so fast with a stylus and a keyboard the size of my fingernail. I asked her name.

Instantly, she became overly apprehensive and angry. Obviously technologically illiterate, she thought I could "hack" her computer if I got her name. How absurd. You don't need names to hack computers, idiot. Then, she decided to call her mean posse which consisted of inconsiderate spammers and general nuisances. They IM'ed me, and I openly gave out my name. They said I was a liar (I think I know my own name, people) and they promply started spamming me. Like I give a care. Stupid spammer Americanized wastrels. Absolutely Disgusting Filth.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I'm trying to make up my mind about what to do. How efficient, right? I mean, if you're going to waste time, why do it while elevating blood pressure and pulling out your hair? Well, I like to waste my time worrying because it helps me plan. I'm planning to do my various essays this weekend and do my english project this weekend. I'm also going to study for finals this weekend, go to a QuizBowl thing, and do an OLC project this weekend. Perhaps this "weekend crunch" isn't such a good idea. I hope I can get it done.

Anyways, I have three projects due consecutively next week and it's stressing me out. They are easy, but I like to make myself crazy. I don't know, it's a habit.

Devin still owes me 15 dollars so I'm going to have to go to his house with a bat and start doing some damage. Will he ever pay me back? Someday...

I can dream can't I?

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Finally updated my book cards page. Stupid book cards. You know, I think the ammount of effort wasted on the creation of these book cards is completely absurd. Why don't they photocopy a good book card for us? Well, at least I'm helping the rebellion of people who want to resist like me. I hope my effort pays off and helps other people.

I have found two biology articles. They are practically the same, but let's hope that the biology teacher does not notice.

I don't have anything to say about the normal school day besides that Devin still needs to pay me back, so I'll talk about QuizBowl. I don't feel like a cohesive member of QuizBowl. It seems that whenever I can answer the question, I don't understand what's going on so I don't buzz. I get so confused and I have the tendancy to daydream while I scribble worthless nothings in my notebook. It's really effecting my performance. It makes me feel worthless compared to my peers. How unfortunate for me.

I don't know how to start my OLC project/visual aid. I'm afraid that my controversial video will turn out offensive or look like a sham of pictures. I need software that I don't have. Perhaps I should take the normal approach of constructing a poster. But, constructing a poster is against my principles. It's a waste of paper, effort, and ink. I hate it. I hate posters. I hate posters.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Kaiser Andrew didn't show up to Buffalo Wild Wings to chill' wit' da' QuizBowl homies. How disappointing...

I've been practicing my speech on Mao Zedong, but it's only three minutes. It needs to be about 7 minutes. I feel very pressured. Under pressure.

The air seems hostile today. I don't know how air can feel hostile, but it does. A harsh tone to it. Not the smell, but rather the texture. Yes, air has a texture. I can feel it.

I'm not crazy.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I went to Ryan's birthday ditty and not many people came, but that just made the whole thing more enjoyable for everyone anyways. Who wants to interact with more than 5 people at a time anyways?

On the way there, I had to ride with Ryan's slightly older brother who can drive. It was excruciatingly frustrating. For some reason, the stereotype for teenage drivers held true. He drove fast, dangerously, and loudly. He had complete disregard for the backseat passengers' hearing. For some reason, he couldn't figure out that the speakers were on the back, so politely turning down the volume on already mediocre music would be the most polite thing to do. My teeth were vibrating the whole way, and I didn't like it. I hate teenage drivers. Completely obnoxious.

Anyways, I cut my hair, but I don't value vanity, so I'll just not talk about it. Too many commas in the last sentence. Compton is watching.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
My stereo is making plinking noises. It sounds like there is marble knome who lives in the stereo that randomly spits out marbles. I bet there is a marble knome who lives in my room. Plus, I've got marbles on the desk near the stereo. There is probably a whole commune of socialistic marble knomes who have been guided in the wrong direction by a dictator who claims he is the spawn of god. The dictator rules over the marble knomes by sending out marble knome propaganda, so all of the marble knomes think life is better now. More marbles, more sand for marble making, more knome food (Similar to fish food, except crunchier,) and more cool music that I play. This knome dictator will eventually have a personality cult and have pictures of himself all over the innards of my stereo. By the time you know it, my sony LBT-G1000 will be a heavily industrialized, but highly uncomfortable marble knome breeding ground.

Those darned marble knomes.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
*Note to self: "From Halifax to Hallandale" sounds like a good title for something.

Anyways, I have started to uncover the joys of doodling on my pocket pc. I have almost mastered the gradient tools and am now working on the "carbon pen" feature.

Well, in one of my classes today, my friend was being egged on by some punk kid who I don't even know (he's new to the school) to poke me. I was about to explode, but I remembered my core rules for jerks. Number one rule would have to be to never give in and make a scene like they want you to. Zach seems to defy this rule whenever he has the chance, which makes him a poor candidate for jobs such as, "hostage negotiator," and "heavy alcoholic gambler." Anyways, my supposed "friend" just keeps poking me and I keep asking him to stop. I stare that punk kid I don't know down. He smiles back. I stare him down some more. He tries to ignore me by looking at some undisclosed object in the distance. I decide to back down. I suppose he has had enough. My "friend" pokes me again. I am about to explode, so I defy my rule and loudly exclaim, "Troy, do you LIKE touching me or something?" which is supposed to have innuendo which translates into something like, "Troy, do you enjoy being homosexual?" He stops and threatens to stab me next time. Great friends, eh?

By the way, I heard one of the most hilarious conversations I have ever witnessed on the bus today. These two girls were discussing the advantages of "smoking" (Smoking what, I don't know) over "drinking" (most likely an alcoholic mixture of some sort.) It was hilarious because they sounded so serious in their discussion. I suppose that's what the masses of prolateriat talk about all day. Heh heh.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I've updated my picture page so I'll probably post some pictures directly to this blog in a few minutes. Anyways, I've been doing more doodles. This is helping orient me to drawing on a PDA screen. It's working, I think. I've done my first attempt at shading, which is rather mediocre, but it makes it look better.

Anyways, we have to watch a movie in OLC about a latino singer named "Sabrina" and I still see no relationship between this latino singer and Orientation to Life and Careers.

Josh has invited me to yet another escapade in town. I'm trying to negotiate that and studying for my finals. I don't know how I'll be able to do it.

Oh yea, in other news, people think that anthropomorphic drawings (Personified animals, or 'furries') are weird/dorky so everyone thinks that I'm weird/dorky. I can't handle drawing human beings since they are so... well, filthy. Filthy humans! Well, I've always had an attraction to anthropomorphic drawings and whatnot ever since I laid my eyes on Starfox cartoons and Pokemon. Well, my attraction to 'furries' probably originated in my mind much earlier. Perhaps my stuffed bear had something to do with it. I don't know, anthropomorphic drawings are just... So much more fantastical. Something that can't compare with elves and knomes of the ancient. Something that compare with aliens and robots of the future. It's something much better. Yet, people always stray away from this kind of stuff. That's popular culture negatively influencing the minds and opinions of children for you.

item.title: My Fruitless Attempts in Shading
item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
sun, originally uploaded by Aminalz Rule.

My shading sucks, but you have to admit, it's amazing that I accomplished this on a screen the size of an average computer mouse.

item.title: Color Pen
item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Dothan, originally uploaded by Aminalz Rule.

A happy, fun explosion of optimistic color combined with netspeak has no meaning!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Oh yes,

I forgot one thing. I put up my "Great Map of Guests" that is a bit like a guestbook except you can mark where you are. Please post. I like it when people talk about me. I know, I'm so vain.

Oh yes,

Another thing, I just noticed that the bottom right hand corner of my shading picture is blue. I feel like an idiot. Ok, I'll blame it on the paint tool. EVIL PAINT TOOL!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I have updated my photos with another doodle if you wanted to see, as if you would anyways.

I suppose tomorrow I will be frantic in general since I have to fit in a band concert, a quizbowl practice, and a mayhem biology study session. I can't wait, but as if you care.

I have to relax to prepare myself for tomorrow, so I suppose I'll rant on more about life later. Not now. Now is not so exciting.

But actually, something is exciting in my life. Life in general. My French teacher pointed out to the class that she uses extremely large ammounts of energy to engage us in learning French. She thought that we were all lethargic this morning, so she was in a serious tone and read us a story about a holocaust survivor to get us to appreciate life more. I hate it when she generalizes the feelings of the class like that. I was excited for the day. I was practicing smiling and I wasn't lethargic at all. We aren't emotionless animals that are on cohesive unit, so she can't just get all serious because most of us seem to be supposedly "dazed!" No more generalization! But, I see her point in doing all of this. I suppose reading us a story about a holocaust survivor is much better than the "paddle and whip" method of teaching. It is also much better than Amanda's "chainsaw re-education" method of teaching.

On the note of Amanda, I've packed a laptop briefcase full of about 15 Japanese comics. It looks very similar to some kind of explosive device, so I'm hoping that the school officials will not see the bag. Let's hope.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I had a little speech ditty in English today and the funny thing was, I shook. I was practically vibrating. The tension steadily grew as my teammates presented their part of the project. By the time it was my turn, I was trembling from the knees down. It didn't help that I was wearing dorky shorts and a dorky yellow shirt. I survived though.

I also went to a band concert ditty where I felt bad for myself because many people I knew were already in higher bands. This is where communism would come in handy. Since we are not a communist society, poorly performing individuals are chained down and discouraged from moving up. The good are awarded and paraded around in ceremonies involving trophies and clapping. In communism, we would all be equal and so I wouldn't feel so guilty that I'm not an excellent clarinetist. Communism. Is it a viable alternative? Perhaps in band.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
My cable internet was disabled and everything running on electricity was shot down yesterday, so updating was out of question. Darn thunderstorms.

My English teacher said that I possessed the amazing power of "wit" in my speech about Mao Tse-Tung. This is highly ironic because any "wit" orchestrated in my speech was overly rehearsed and pre-prepared. My kind of "wit" is against true "wit because "wit" is supposed to be spontaneous, but making sense in an appropriate and humorous manner.

I feel like Jell-O (Which is a brand name that I feel like using because I'm a corporate exploit and the government can't even control the brainwashing that is on TV toward young children to get them to buy toxic, sugarized cereals because of the cute little character on the box and the worthless little trinket inside) because I'm so tired from my abysmal pit of nothingness. I looked through an old yearbook. Amanda looked much different, which is a bit funny, but let's not make fun of Amanda since she is like the most skilled person I know for the time being. Am I living in a bubble, or is the bubble living in me?

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Sometimes you figure out that you're a total non-technophile and you feel ashamed but a bit humored. Today was that kind of day.

I was browing through the Sunday newspaper (Sunday newspapers are large and fun to read) when I found the local electronics store's ads. I started flipping through these (which is a bad idea since looking at things you don't want to buy, but your really want to on the inside can cause hypertension and depression) and found a ton of camcorders. I thought, "Going to Japan in a few months+pretty pictures of camcorders on ad=in need of video recording device." Then, I decided to dig up an old camcorder deemed broken ages ago. I "booted" it up (can a camcorder "boot"?) and saw that it was still blurry. Originally, it was speculated that this device had a "messed up" CCD and that is why it is constantly blurry. I looked at the eyepiece and found a little line. This little line pointed to another little line. I found that I could rotate the eyepiece to adjust the blurryness of the image in the eyepiece. So, then it hit me. The diopter adjustment thingy was just turned too far. I guess, back ages ago I was about as technologically illiterate as a lay-person. How sad...

Kids, the moral of the story is that you should go out and learn about electronics in your spare time!

I still hate Ipods. It's a sort of deep, thick hatred. Like a sticky, red, gelatinous substance that just seeps into your inner soul. Yes, I hate Ipods that much.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Devin asked me a question that has come up recently. Why do I hate Xanga? Well, I hate Xanga because... It's a bit like comparing apples and oranges. I find the whole Xanga thing totally absurd because the whole thing is just an extentended and elongated version of IM'ing. The Xanga templates make me want to puke, and about 95% of all people using Xanga are usually literally and socially challenged individuals who are neither articulate nor accurate. With Xanga names like, "IRISHPRANCER81" and "Cold_As_Ice2k" who is going to take anything you say seriously? First of all, all caps just demonstrates that you're an insensitive moron. Numbers also signal that you are not creative to come up with an original name. Blech...

Devin commented that the advantage of Xangas is that your supposed "friends" can comment on them. I find this absolutely horrid. Xangas seem to me like an easy way to lose friends and start a social battle with completely illogical and inarticulate brutes who prefer to write without proper punctuation and style. I don't want people to comment on what I say. If I didn't care, why wouldn't I just ramble on about this nonsense at school? What would be point of this whole blogging escapade!? This kind of media enables me to communicate with control and finesse. Xangas seem dirty, unengaging, absurd, wrong, and too social for me. I would rather sit here and talk to myself and a few other close friends than jump into a violent, turbulent social scene full of higher-ups and uneducated peons. Xangas don't appeal to me. Don't talk about Xangas near me. Don't let me hear the word Xanga. Disgust fills my soul.

Time to study for finals!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Asians seem to be all the rage on the Disney Channel. I don't personally watch these sad, hollow cartoons, but I often do see tidbits of them while flipping through channels. Through these tidbits, I see that Disney is extensively using stereotypes to appeal to children. Unfortunately, these stereotypes are highly misleading.

Most Asians do NOT worship dragons, nor affiliate with them in any sort of ceremonial procession. Most Asians do NOT have wise white-goateed grandfathers who spit back philosophical nonsense whenever you ask them something. Most Asians do NOT have pink highlights. Most Asians are NOT rebellious and crazed. Most Asians do NOT have the last name "Lee." Most Asians do NOT have demented/crazy parents who are "weird" so to speak. Most Asians do NOT eat Asian cuisine for EVERY meal. Most Asians are NOT socially outcast losers. Most Asians are NOT arch enemies with blond cheerleaders. Most Asians do NOT know amazing martial art tricks. Most Asians can NOT turn into dragons. Most Asians do NOT fight evil villains in their spare time.

Obviously, Disney has overlooked these facts. Disney is good at this kind of stuff because they have to be. I mean, they've been working with the government to produce propaganda for years. Isn't that why they are so popular with the American public?

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I'm assuming that all of the final exams will be easy. Plus, I could fail them and still get an "A" in the class.

So, I've preoccupied myself by drawing Fox McCloud and learning random facts.

Yay!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
You can tell a lot about a person by studying how he or she commutes by stair.

I often observe the motions people go through while climbing or descending stairs. I mean, what else are you going to do while you yourself are traversing the stairs? I've even studied myself.

I usually quickly scurry down the stairs with the middle of my foot balancing on the edge of the stair. I suppose I like to get to places on time, so I use this fast, but albeit risky method. This is not the case if my shoes are untied. If they are untied, I usually proceed very carefully. I put the ball of my foot slowly down so that it touches the stair at just the right angle as to not catch my shoelace. Then, I lower my foot so all of it touches the stair and make sure the shoelace has not caught under the shoe. I then repeat these steps with the other foot and so and so forth. When I walk up the stairs, I usually struggle. Many times, I talk with friends and stumble. I can often muster up the strength to climb the stairs at quite a rapid rate, but I usually go moderately fast.

I watched someone climbing the stairs this morning. He walked slowly and boldly. The stairs seemed to be just another obstacle to him. He raised his foot to the third stair as he started his ascent. Next, he slammed his sole on the stair as if to claim superiority. All points of the flat sole contacted the stair at the same time, making a slapping noise. These steps were repeated until the second floor was reached.

I watched another person climbing the stairs this morning. He was carelessly swooning on the stairs like a drunk elephant. This is when his friend came. They started chatting, mocking each other, and finally arguing. The friend pushed this guy down the stairs. 'Nuf said.

Obviously, stair climbing can be revealing. So the moral? Use stairs carefully. First impressions are important.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Devin. Still. Hasn't. Paid. Me. Back. My. Money.

He is infuriating me with his constant debt. I'm sure he'll end up in some kind of hobo on the street. A hobo with an electric guitar, but with no power to play it. A pick made out of his loose teeth. Devin, the new-age hobo, will live in Australia. He will try to mingle with the homeless crowd there, best place to be really since all of those Aussies are good natured and logical. They even have a great "unofficial" national anthem!

Hobo Devin will scrounge the streets, scavenging for half-eaten kangaroo burgers. Overcomming the stench of old garbage, he will venture to the landfills of Sydney and find shelter with rats and birds. Then, after finding shelter he will start conversing with the birds. He will then form a treaty with them and plan a strategic attack on Sydney Harbor. His plan, involving an old Volvo and a shopping cart, goes awry and he starts sinking into the harbor like a shopping cart tied with electrical tape to an old Volvo, except really. He will drown, but be somehow resurrected after the apockalypse and will find the Earth barren and dry. The dirt, red with Earth's elemental nature dissolving before him, will make him cough. Cough as you may, Devin the Hobo, but you will still owe Ryo $15.30.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
My sister got me a "Mary Kate and Ashley" portable CD player today, and I'm excited. I've needed an old-skool CD player of my own for quite some time. It's great that I can finally listen to music without worrying about file corruption and battery drainage.

Anyways, I spent much of my lunch period talking to this girl and how to deal with this supposed "lesbian" who sits behind us during band. This "lesbian" comes up to her and touches her.

I suppose I've studied this "lesbian" and I can see that she is not really a "lesbian" at all. She just wants attention. She is as unintelligent as a dog, only caring about attention and social status. It's disgusting, but there are people like that. The girl I was talking to at lunch suggested that to solve this problem, she should make a scene and get angry. I suggested to politely ask this "lesbian" attention-sucker to move away. If this was not to work, I suggested to contact a teacher or administrator promptly. She stood her ground and said that getting angry would adequately solve her problem. This is wrong. Making a scene is precisely what that "lesbian" wants. She is probably being pressured by her peers to provoke other people. I reasoned, she is the enemy, so you do not want her to get what she wants. Therefore, my method would be the correct route to take. Again, she suggested that getting angry was the best way to go. Some people just can't see that anger solves nothing.

Amanda and I were talking to lunch at school also (wow, I'm talking with many females. Does that make me persay, "cool?" I cringe when I hear that word.) and she told me rumors that were about me. Silly rumors. Silly rumors that made me laugh. Supposedly, in these silly rumors, I "frenched" (Whatever this means, I suppose it refers to "french kissing" which isn't actually French, so 'tis incorrect and therefore invalid) Amanda and that's how she got sick. Hilarious!

Anyways, I'm heading out to South Carolina over the week. I won't be able to update, so chill for a week. I'll be back on Tuesday. Oh yes, kudos to Joe for taking care of the birds!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
After a tiresome and arduous journey, I am finally back.

I'm going to sleep now before I collapse.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I purchased two pairs of glasses today that make me look like a spiffy eccentric nerd. It's great.

Anyways, life seems mixed up when your pupils are taking in too much light. I could hardly read the newspaper.

A combination of the pupil dialation and my new glasses turned my world flashy today. Advertisements popped out at me, minute changes in tint were more noticable, and I could count the bricks on the house next door. This is a big deal for me, and even though you can do this easily, it shocks me every time I put on my glasses that I live in a perfectly clean world. A clean world with crisp lines and vibrant colors. It's different from my blurry, bland world of nearsightedness. I suppose sometimes you have to use outside influences to make things around you seem more significant.

I was thinking, if you're constantly bored (Like SOME people I know) you should start making a list of something absurd. Yes, I know, I must be some kind of genius from another world, right?

For example, you could list all of the reasons you should not stick your head into an oven. Endless possibilities.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I've joined various Forums with the intent of integrating myself into these communities. It's facinating how people can intellectually communicate feelings, emotions, and thoughts through this internet medium. How I love a good, local forum. Those huge, spammy, and flamey forums do not appeal to me. Members are good, but too many results in mass riots and chaos sweeping the virtual streets. This is what led me to indyddr.com which was recommended to me by my friend.

I'm feeling truely worried for one of the first times in my life. It's about my family's visa and green card nonsense. I don't want to go back to Japan.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Yes, somehow I've been able to secure a Dell Optiplex while in this prison-like university I'm staying in for the Washington D.C. Trip.

My supposed "teammates" are going off to watch some pirated movie on a snazzy laptop computer. I assumed that I would either be deterred by the subject of the movie, or would be excluded from the experience since I'm not particularly skilled at conversing and exchanging social cues with other people. Persay, I haven't been able to "warm up" to the people on my team (even though I've been with them for the past year or so.) Plus, I get enough movies at home.

The room I am staying in truly resembles a prison. The unpainted, concrete block walls conjure up correctional facilities almost automatically. They give you an old, stale towel and a tiny bar of soap. The only other "amenities" that are in this dank room are two old desk lamps and a bunk bed. The doors, windows, and the closets are all made of cheap plywood and squeak often. They don't even give you sufficient covering for the beds. An thin blue sheet serves as a "blanket" that has to protect against the worn building's dysfunctional heating/cooling system. Truly, this would be a time when you can say, "Oy Vey."

The matter of the fact is, Zach think's I'm inferior to him. At every witty comment I make, he turns his head solemly, as if saying, "Fool, do not try to be witty since you are already labled as inferior." It frustrates me so I just keep going on with it. I go on with the comments with the hope that someday I'll be as witty as my peers, but Zach doesn't even give me a chance. He constantly "jokes" about wanting to kill or torture me (which is quite disturbing.) To amplify the insanity of it all, he shares a room with me. Being in a prison room with a sinister king would be the description I would label on this whole escapade.

The Gmail servers are down for some time so I can't email all of my friends, which is a shame since I just found the computer labs. It's quite unfortunate. I suppose I'll surf alone. In this lonely computer lab. A lonely, dimly lit, almost silent computer lab. The sound of the keys and the hum of computer fans are the only sounds around me. I wish Andrew or some other non-Zach person would have come. I bet he or she would save me from the insanity of it all.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I'm back in my true home, in the middle of a cornfield. A cornfield in peaceful and aggressively conservative Indiana.

Upon returning from my arduous journey home, I started configuring a TiVo unit that I had recieved for marketing purposes. The situation hasn't been working out so far. First, it refused to connect to the server to pull TV guide information since the telephone connection constantly "interrupted." Now, it consistently freezes, refuses to load, sporadically reboots, and makes scary whirring noises. It still can't connet to the server. I'm sure it's a defect of the TiVo unit. It infuriates me to think that a company would release such a defective product. I've spent all night trying to make the box run, and it can't even boot correctly. I just want to toss it into something hard, perhaps a wall or floor of some kind. I have become anti-TiVo. I'm calling customer service tomorrow to sort this nonsense out. Stupid TiVo. We should all buy ReplayTV's.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I spent my muggy evening relaxing and playing furcadia.

I met up with Amanda and Ryan and we chatted for a full two hours. It was great fun.

Before that though, I was at Ryan's house trying to configure the darned TiVo. I'm really getting agitated by the thing, and am thinking of assassinating it somehow.

I'm tired, so I'll stop before I collapse. About a full week with little sleep, can it go on?

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Yowza!

I'm reclining on the couch. I'm hurt, injured, and bleeding.

Yes, a horrible event has occured! There was a hose behind the lawn tractor I was dragging out of the garage. I noticed it, and I underestimated the friction values of the hose and the concrete. This coupled with the fact that for some strange reason, my lawn tractor has a plate of metal about ankle-high sticking out of the back led to the demise of part of my flesh.

I slipped on the hose, my leg sped under the lawn mower, and what unfortunately stopped me was the metal plate. It tore about a centimeter into the flesh just above my ankle and I hobbled back into the house to get some antibacterial foam and a extra-large band-aid. Now I'm a disabled man sprawled on the couch with a laptop and a wireless tranciever.

Yes, the ice application is starting to kick in. My worst fear in all of this is if I have to get stiches. I've never gotten them before, and I never want to. I can't stand sharp objects. Yes, beat me to a pulp with aluminum bats, but just don't poke me with a pin. That's my philosophy.

Poor cells, they never knew what happened to them.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Guess what I did today with my disabled self?

Oh, you don't seem to care about my life? Well, I'll tell you anyways just for kicks and giggles (oh yes Amanda, I absolutely adore your sayings.)

I played a video game. It doesn't even matter what it's called since it's amazing in itself that I actually played a real video game. A real one! A real video game with real textures with a real video card and a real game studio. A real video game!? Isn't it absurd? It drives me nuts to think I played a video game all day today. I did nothing productive. And to think, millions of hapless children are playing video games right now, not realizing the trap they are entering. Their unproductive hands and minds working to accomplish superficial goals that have no meaning. It's still driving me nuts! Why do children do this? Why do I do this? It's a disgusting human trait that just begs to be eliminated by a higher power! Yet, many church youth groups play these silly games. I'm sure that if Jesus, Mohammed, or even Confucius were here today, they would label gaming as a sin. See, games are the root of all evil.

A perfectly fine society is being dragged down by games, game consoles, gaming networks, game stations, game magazines, game guides, and game cheats. And yet, I'm promoting it.

Situational irony I suppose...

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Abashed once again!

I was checking out silly Xangas to see what the silly children that inhabit my social life were discussing. I was quite amazed to see that Devin is quite witty. Quite a bit more witty than me. Yes, I'm envious. Envy, envy of his hair, his popularity, his outrageous spending of local currency on sugared treats. His silly little witticisms. Oh yes, his parties and his friends. Yes, his pure beliefs, and his not so pure, but oh so powerful, image. Yes, I loathe Devin. He's the perfect person I could never be. How horribly I exist in his amazing shadow. Terrorized constantly by myself, always wanting to be as good as Devin, but never reaching any of my superficial goals. Sometimes, I would rather be a popular genius than a shut-in idiot. Well, maybe always.

How he writes with eloquency that I cannot achieve. How he scripts and composes. His motor skills that are unquestionably better than mine. The perfect person? Quite possibly.

Yes, as I write on and on about how much better he is than me, you're probably thinking, "Stupid idiot, how dare he feel worse than I! His life is perfect and mine isn't! Let us grab pitchforks and storm his house!"

Well, I am anticipating your silly pitchfork raid now, so don't even try. Yes, I am a silly child. A silly, unimaginative child at that.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
It's amusing how life repeats itself over and over for about give or take seventy years, then you die.

Actually it's not all that amusing, now that I think about it.

I'm going to spend my evening downloading StarFox music at 5kbps! Yes, that is five kilobytes per second. Yes, that means it will take hours. Yes, I am a user of bittorrent.

I was at the supermarket. At the supermarket, I wasn't in such a happy/sappy mood since I'm always paranoid that I'll see someone I know working there. Whenever I see someone else who's my age working, I always feel envious and ashamed. Ashamed that they work and slave away, while I buy my lime jello and chick peas.

I entered the supermarket. The aisles were reflective. Squeaky clean! I suppose some teenage slave had to work very hard to scrub the tile and polish them. Guilt starts seeping up my throat, even though things have trouble seeping up, even if you're in space. I look around, and pick up a stray orange resting on the side of the bread counter. I hold it in my hand, as I gaze at it forlornly. Hm... Perhaps this is a misunderstood orange who has been shunned by his community because of obvious social objections (this orange was slightly yellowish.) Perhaps this orange has been living here on the bread counter, in exile, for quite a while. Perhaps this orange was about to kill himself (If an orange had a sex, I assume it would be male, since it's they're always unpredictably sour or sweet.) Perhaps this orange wanted to be part of a community that never accepted him for who he was. So, this orange was sitting there, next to baked goods for all this time. Foreign, oddball rejects these baked goods were to this orange. Poor orange.

Feeling pity for this precious orange, I quickly put it back into the orange bin. Hopefully this once rejected orange will find a new life with his second chance. Good luck Mr. Orange.

Yes, it is quite odd, but I often personify fruits when in supermarket situations. Traversing this large food warehouse is always arduous, so I have to find some way of amusing myself. Please try to understand...

So I wander to the juice. It's pretty hard to personify a liquid (It's been done before in my head, a la flubber) so I quickly look around to find any other noteworthy things about the juice receptacle location. I find that there is about two small refrigeration units full of juice, and two aisles dedicated to soda. I thought that was pretty noteworthy, so I started thinking to myself...

"What's the point of banning vending machines at school when parents just buy soda from the supermarket and bring it home?"

"Isn't it time the government did something productive? Attack the problem at the source!", thinks I.

Pondering my newfound ideas about supermarket soda reform, I waddled myself over to the iced and frozen goods aisle. I find there a scruffy looking biker man wearing a black leather Harley-Davidson outfit and his severely obese girlfriend. She wears a skimpy pink shirt. I silently cringe in disgust. They bicker over their ice cream.

"Double fudge today, come on!"

"But we get double fudge every day! How about Mega Oreo Vanilla?"

"No! Double fudge today!"

I find the conversation slightly amusing, so I move in. I stealthily sneak up, pretending to browse through the sorbet. They soon leave after getting both "Double Fudge" and "Mega Oreo Vanilla" to my dismay. Both the fact that they got both of the flavors, and the fact that they left (so I couldn't be entertained) was what dismayed me.

Ah, I approach the designated payment location. My mother has all of her supplies, and I have my fair share of supermarket musings. I look up. Teenagers. I employ my teenager strategy. No eyecontact.

I browse through the tabloids on the bright yellow basket near the gum. I keep telling myself to make no eye contact. It's difficult. I keep trying to divert my attention with the silly tabloids. I'm itching to just take a quick glance and see who these teenagers are. I forcefully lock my neck in place to prevent myself from doing this. Finally, human nature kicks in and I look up.

I sigh in relief. I do not know these teenagers, but I do notice how they work. They work as if they have no life. As if at any moment at all they could say, "It's not my job" and shrug. I cringe in disgust yet again at their poor work ethic. Disgusting. The teenage girl tosses the eggs into the shopping cart as if she were tossing a few cents to a homeless person. We leave promptly.

Truely, you can find adventures in the supermarket.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Once upon a time, in a galaxy far, far away...

There was a boy. A boy with magical powers and a stereotypical anime script to follow. The boy was named, "Chronoboy" and looked like a grungey, dark version of the popular, astroboy. Chronoboy arduously treked through time and space to infiltrate the faraway planet of Earth.

Upon his arrival to Earth, he was worshiped as an anime character. His supposed "voice actors" were heralded as heroes and he was a regular on such networks as Cartoon Network and the International Channel. Chronoboy was soon enveloped by popular culture and was poisoned by the deep sins of our society. Chrono soon became a morbidly obese shut-in who lived in the ghettos of the Bronx. And that's where the story of my life starts.

Not really, but that is the kind of nonsense I come up while half-sleeping in a crowded airport. Hopefully, my trip to Japan will not incurr such mental damage on myself once again. Please, let me be spared.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I'm doing conceptual prespective practice on the little ditty notepads I got at a warehouse store today. I'm busy drawing Arwings and Landmasters!

Go to: http://www.drawthrough.com/tutorials/index.html

if you want to check out how to draw mecha and industrial objects out of your mind, not off of what you see.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I don't have much time to escape from reality today since I took a last minute Target Superstore escapade. My mother and sister were looking at paper products, while I mingled with fat, fanboys and game-addict smokers in the electronics section. I naturally gravitated toward the cheap acessories aisle. I found some cheap headphones I wanted and seriously considered buying them. I factored in the value, use, and portability variables, and it made sense to buy them, but I pride myself on being paranoid on spending money. In the end, I didn't purchase anything.
Otherwise, I just grabbed a couple (couple meaning seven) AOL CD's and made my escape.

Upon returning home, I grabbed the phone called Ryan, and afterwards started reading "Chicken Noodle Soup for the Teenage Soul II" that my sister rented from the library. I have no idea why my 10 year old sister is reading teenage sap stories, but isn't mystery the spice of life? Or is mystery more like the e. coli of life?

I read through it and scanned through the boring sap stories. They usually have some sort of conflict between being "cool" and being a "dork." In the end, the main characters end up becoming "cool" or learning a lesson by living as a "dork."

These books are misleading to the nth degree! Life isn't a handy-dandy snappy puzzle. It's like a random number generator. The laws of probability? Give me a break. The only law applicable in supposed "teenage" life is Murphy's.

I hate it how everyone in this "Chicken Noodle" book has a happy ending. The writer for the book came to school once to give an inspirational speech. Many people kill themselves and never learn any lesson whether they are a "dork" or "cool" teenager. There are intelligent, caring popular people and dorks who are dumb jerks. I turn my nose up at such rubbishy stories. I find hope in life, not from these silly stories about how your problems will be solved by trudging through them, but from the inevitability of death. Why bother with these silly problems when you can just ignore them? No time to bother with problems.

Silly stories. Someday I'll publish a book called, "Arsenic Soup for Sappy Teenagers."

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I went to a QuizBowl "movie watching" escapade where we watched this old movie called, "The Sting." It was quite good, but this did not keep me from being socially unacceptable. I was forced to sit in torturous positions as I tried to keep from being eaten by ants. The other reason I was constantly tensioned was the fact that the coach's daughter's little sister kept sitting right in front of my sofa and I had to move my legs up and try to keep my feet from touching her. It was a difficult, truely arduous task. As I struggled to memorize key points of the movie, the lactic acid in my legs started to cause incessant pain to shoot up my leg. I persisted for about thirty more minutes (somehow) and managed to finish the movie. Afterward, the QuizBowl people had a mini-discussion about how everyone should know this one director who produced this movie. To my dismay, I did not know this director. I cringed and tried to divert attention away from myself for the time being. Upon returning home, I started drawing an anthropomorphic rock star (In my signature block-eye style.) I can't believe that I still draw with pencil and paper. It's so hard to draw any way else. Perhaps I should get a scanner. I've heard large corporations and consolidating school systems sell scanners wholesale.

I'll look in the newspaper tomorrow.

In other news, Father's Day is comming up, turn off your TV and stop watching those darned Father's Day commercials. I hate how these commercials assume that your father has an obsessive interest in power tools and electronics. Such a tarnished reputation fathers have. What? You can just buy him a machine and make him happy? Can you condition fathers like Pavlov's dogs? According to those silly commercials, you can. If you give father a power tool, he becomes happy. It seems like you're appeasing Thor, the thunder god with a peace offering. Silly power tools.

Go to the park or something.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I'm supposed to be going to sleep earlier. It's part of my summer initiative to get more rest. Unfortunately, I get too caught up in a GIMP tutorial, email, music, a starfox forum, or a combination of the aforementioned events. It's late now, and in two days, I'll be in class. I'm supposed to finish some driving worksheets to help myself study. That isn't happening is it?

On a positive note, I've learned how to selectively color in GIMP. This lets me color only certain parts of the picture and leave the rest in B&W. It's quite artsy and I like it.

There's a large celebration my town is celebrating called, "The Taste of Tippecanoe" and I assume that all of the "in" people as well as "out" people are there mingling with one another. I'm not there. I suppose I'm some kind of social outcast.

You know, I've always thought of jail as a bit romantic. Every good romance/drama has a bit of prison in it. The gruffy inmates, the smelly cells, the dusty concrete blocks, and the razor ribbon make the whole scene so... catchy. Heh, I made a pun. If I ever have to go to jail, I'm glad that I'll be optimistic about it.

Voltaire, such a great guy, albiet French. He said, "Common sense is not so common." which I can relate to. It's funny that it only takes a six word quote to relate two people from different continents from different centuries together. Words, beautiful things, no?

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
The gravel slowly crunches below my feet. The cold, grey gravel. It's a cold, but slightly humid day as I venture forward along the predetermined paths that the state park system has set up for me. I am in Turkey Run State Park.

I hear a beep. My cell phone conveniently informs me of the absence of service. I trudge along. My ankles are starting to ache and I haven't eaten much. My "lunch", if you can even call it that, is a bag of cheese puffs and a sip of water. I feel as if I have consumed styrofoam. I eventually make it to the ladders.

The ladders are short, but there are three of them. To continue along the path, you must climb these ladders. There are no guardrails when you transfer from ladder to ladder along a thin cliff. Visitors are many, and there are about 10 people and a dog on one small cliff. One wrong step will cause all to fall to a perilous death below. I am afraid. I climb the second ladder. I see a spider in front of me. I start shaking. Trying to control myself, I ask the person ahead of me to kill the spider. She kills it. I am relieved.

I reach the top and continue. Another few miles to go...

So, that was what happened today, Father's Day. My ankles still ache. Tomorrow is driving school. I don't think I'm going to have a good week, but it's nice to pretend, so I suppose I'll do that. I'll pretend that this week will be fantastic. Yes, and hopefully my fantasies will come true. No, not that way you sick, dirty, (insert expletive).

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
So, do you know what DEET is? DEET is that stuff that smells like sweet pine trees, if anyone decided to make pine-tree flavoured candy. I don't know how someone would sell such a thing, but let's move on.

DEET is a chemical named, "N-diethyl-meta-toluamide" and it happens to prevent mosquito bites. It works well against ticks too. It looks something like this:





It was made by the Army after they suffered the effects of insect-transmitted disease in the jungle warfare of WWII. DEET entered combat service in 1946 and just 10 years later it was released to the public.

A note of caution: Don't spray DEET on spandex. Bad things will happen.

That's my random teaching of the day.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
It's completely absurd how vocabulary has become so skewed in the past few years. First it was trippy psychedelic slang, then it was ghetto language, and now it's nonsense 1337 speak and other vulgar slang terms.

I mean, I was reading the writings of a peer recently (Via Xanga, eww...) and found that they had met a "shit-load" of people. I'm not quite sure how that word crept into the English language, but many words do. It seems like teens these days have to cram their language with words that have roots in vulgarity. Calling another person a "penis" or "gay fag" is somehow supposed to communicate to others that you do not like them. What if they are gay? I suppose you're stating a fact, but how does that correlate to you not liking them? What's with the anti-homosexual atmosphere? If I called you a "heterosexual", would that be a complement?

Or, if you add "shit" or "crap" to a word, it somehow puts more emphasis on the word you add it to. In this day and age of computers, technology, and spell-checking programs, how do we get this kind of terminology? If you meet a "shitload" of friends, how many friends is that? Is it how many friends can fit in your rectum at a time, or are you making an analogy to manure piles on farms? If people are to use these terms effectively, everyone should have a standard. Suppose we make "shitloads" of people a standard measurement. A standard "shitload" would be 15 people. That way, the term is not so relative. A "shitload" of people for me might be 4 or 5, but a "shitload" of people to a socially active teen might be 15-20. But, wait. What about metric "shitloads"? Is that 2.1 times a standard "shitload?" We must unite to have set protocols for our terms. Yes, calling your peers "fagwads" may be all machoist and all (if you hang out with people of a lower intelligence), but it fails to communicate information effectively. Establish protocols! Workers of the world, unite! The only things you have to lose are the chains of tyranny! A little Marx for you.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Zip codes? Who cares about those? You write them down in countless government forms and surveys at school. A zip code for about every piece of "on the record" material. State tests, and other nonsense always require a zip code.

ZIP stands for "Zoning Improvement Plan" and this code was devised by the USPS (United States Postal Service, for those people like me who are dumb idiots and can't derive United States Postal Service from USPS) in the early 60's. Those crazed, psychedelic postal workers.

Actually postal codes for large cities started appearing in 1943, but they weren't the five digit codes we have all grown to know and love.

The "father" of ZIP codes was this dude called Robert Moon (No relation to Dr. Moon, that corrupt doctor of Redding, CA.) He came up with the first three digits of the zip code. The last two numbers are actually the old "postal codes" of 43'.

In 67', they were required on second and third class bulk mailings, and slowly the ZIP code became standard for all mail. Then, the ZIP codes of the United States started devising a plan to take over the government with a military coup and turn the US we love into a totalitarian state, with ZIP codes at the head of power. Fortunately, it didn't happen quite like that.

ZIP Codes are numbered with the first digit representing a certain group of U.S. states, the second and third digits together representing a region in that group (or perhaps a large city), and the fourth and fifth digits representing more specific areas, such as small towns or regions of that city.

The lowest ZIP codes are in the New England region, just in case if you have a contest with a friend to see if you can count your ZIP codes by region and you're betting your new bubble gun that you can count ZIP codes. You know, it could happen.

Oh yes, we can't forget Mr. ZIP, the ZIP code mascot! He's a 60's/70's character (Psychedelic postal workers can sometimes come up with great ideas, remember that.)

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Today I spent the better part of the day shooting zombies with firearms on a television screen. It's amazing how therapeutic mutilating and burning zombies can be! There should be a whole meditation routine, similar to tai-chi, that involves zombies, a multi-national pharmacutical corporation, and the president's daughter trapped in a crazed foriegn village. It makes so much sense, don't you think?

Well, I figured out that Amanda doesn't live that far from me, which is pretty amazing. Maybe, sometime I'll bike there or something. 4.3 miles? It's possible, maybe if I take steroids for the next few years. Oh yes, the second birthday of my blog is coming up, and it's amazing. Like I always say (I really never do say this), how can I stand writing nonsense? Well, blogging has turned from a "chore" in the beginning to a hobby to a habit. Yes, someday I'll die and I suppose if Google survives long enough, there'll be a bit of me somewhere inside of a disk in a remote server. I would rather be imprinted onto a disk of a server than blasted into space. Those "space funerals" aren't really space funerals anyways since your ashes burn up in the atmosphere and return to Earth anyways. What's the point in that? It's like trying to go around the world on a race track.

Perhaps I will study more driving nonsense now. Good night.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Bad things come out of war, but war inadvertently leads to mass technological advancements for the winning country. If I was to name one major technological advancement of the 20th century that developed from a war, that technology would be duct tape.

Duct tape, or duck tape (marketed by Duck Products), was created during WWII, specifically 1942. It was originally designed to hold shell casings together. It was produced by Permacel (A subsidiary of Johnson and Johnson)and was built to repel water. The soldiers called it "duck tape" since the originally cotton backing or the tape repelled water like the back of a duck. They used it to patch just about anything.

After the war, the housing market and population boomed which led many uses for the new tape. To speed up the production of housing, builders often used the tape to seal ducts, which led to the name "duct tape." Professionals are now restricted from using duct tape since building codes have deemed them ineffective.

NASA was in a dire situation when the carbon dioxide filters failed on a Apollo 13 mission in 1970. If they couldn't fix these filters, all three astronauts would be soon dead. Ironically, NASA resorted to duct tape to fix the filters. Duct tape has saved astronauts. Three to be exact.

Now, don't you want to see a pretty picture of duck/duct tape in good use? Here you go.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
What would happen if all life on Earth suddenly vanished and the only thing left would be the unaltered remains of our civilization? What would an alien race think of our civilization?

They would probably see large banks, guarding a yellowish metal and green rags, they would think that this civilization had some kind of cult fetish about metals and rags. They would see our unoperational electronics, built to run on energy that would eventually run out, and they would criticize our shortsightedness. They would see our lavish cars and pointless lawn decorations, and would point and wonder why someone would create something so useless. They would see our giant warehouses full of unused goods and make fun of our wastefulness. They would see our dilapidated ghettos and ritzy mansions and look down on our social divisions. They would look at our sophisticated books and technology, and then glance back at the poor living conditions and the poor conditions of many ecological habitats and realize that we had skewed priorities. Flaws can be seen better without the people who created them. We only hear what we want to hear. A cure-all pill? We buy it for three easy payments of $19.99, even though we realize that it will not work. A new car that runs on hydrogen? We support it and hype it up, even though anyone with a logical brain can figure out that we'll still have to conjure up massive electricity to convert water into hydrogen. That electricity will come from primarily coal and oil plants. A new wireless router that goes a trazillion bits per second? We buy it, but at the same time realize that our computer ports will not be able to utilize such idealistic protocols.

It's a time to realize that there is no cure-all pill. It's time to realize that making a faster router and wireless adapter won't make your work any more efficient if you fake that sick day. It's time to realize that hydrogen energy will never work. Let's all realize that it only takes living in North Korea for a year to get you back into those high school jeans. As everyone starves themselves to reach idealistic, but pointless and vain goals for their body, I sit here and ponder, is there really logic to this madness?

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Have you ever wondered what a yuppie is? I mean, you hear it in movies and such, but does it have a proper defined meaning?

Yes. Yuppie stands for "Young Urban Professional." Yuppies are usually characterized by their conservative attitudes (opposite from previous hippie generation), their intense value for expensive material goods, their corporate jobs, and their fast paced lifestyle. Yuppies are usually around twenty or thirty and they hold jobs in professional fields. They usually obsess over expensive cars and ritzy houses and they congregate in groups. Yuppies seem casual on the outside, but inside their complicated yuppie culture, they are guided by strict ettiquette. When in groups, they can be found in their natural habitat, trendy cocktail bars and expensive country clubs. Yuppies are selfish, superficial, and can't find true value in things that don't cost lots of money. They often find themselves purchasing convenience goods, because of their fast lifestyle. Yuppies have "bad taste" and buy expensive things for the sake of buying expensive things.

Some extra terminology you might want to remember, just in case a man on the street pulls out a gun and points it to your head, then starts to ask trivia questions.

A buppie is an african american yuppie.

A guppie is a gay yuppie.

A "yuppie food stamp" is a crisp $20 bill fresh from the ATM.

"Yuppicide" is the killing of yuppies. (Preferably with chainsaws, as all horror movies have at least one yuppie in them.)

Vehicular "Yuppicide" is when you collide with a ritzy Lexus and kill the yuppie occupants/occupant.

Picture time!

So now you know your yuppie vocabulary. Why don't you go use it?

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I suppose that I'm in emotional turmoil right now. I got in an argument with my father about his rash personality after work. He's always blaming the governemnt about all his woes. He seeks revenge at every corner. I am afraid he will become some psycho vigilante. Why can't he forgive and forget? Revenge only causes future complication. Revenge can't solve past injustices, but it can easily create new ones for the future.

He says that I don't appreciate him enough for the "bullshit" he goes through. Then, he goes on to use as many expletives he can. Cussing doesn't justify some irrational anger. Be happy with what you have. I'm quite worried that he may develop hypertention and suffer a heart condition. It's ironic because he's always talking about how Japanese people have superior genetics. Doesn't he see that it doesn't matter how long you live if your life is miserable and angry? There's no point in convincing him of anything because everything I do is supposedly, "bullshit" to him. What, my driving courses? Complete bullshit. My stunning grades? Bullshit, bullshit, bullshit.

How am I supposed to be more grateful if he can't see me trying hard? Everyone is better than me to him. He can't be perfect, so he takes it out on me. He says I don't understand. I work so hard to impress him, but I can never succeed in exceeding his expectations. I'm on the verge of tears now, and I don't want to admit it. I snap my fingers when I get nervous. I'm having trouble because my hands are shaking.

If he can't see that I try, he doesn't have to. I'll just keep trying and maybe someday someone will notice. Maybe someone will care about me someday.

Grr... I hate emotions. I get caught up and I can't breathe. Posting and writing about my woes usually calms me down, but it's not helping.

Ok, life is happy. My life is great. If I get angry, or sad, or any way emotional, then he has succeeded in spreading his rash attitude problem. I won't stand for it. I'll force myself to be happy.

I'm happy.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Fads are all around us. Remember that Numa Numa dance? So mainstream, and it faded away so fast. No one even cares to remember it anymore. But, one of my favorite fads are the Tamagotchi things. I absolutely love them. Personally, I've spent hours and hours feeding, playing, scolding, and talking to be Tamagotchi, until I lost it. It was a very sad day for me.

The word "Tamagotchi" comes from the word, for egg in Japanese (tamago), and a ploy on the English word, "watch" pronounced in a Japanese accent (watchi). The "Tamagotchi" units were first introduced in 1996 and were a huge fad for a short time. 40 million were sold in less than a year. Because of their immense popularity, many schools banned the usage of Tamagotchis.

There are three stage for Tamagotchis. Egg, child, teenager, and adult. You must feed, clean, dicipline, and play with your Tamagotchi.

The different kinds of Tamagotchi in chronological order are: Tamagotchi Generation One, Tamagotchi Generation Two (American Release), Digimon Tamagotchi, Tamagotchi Angel, Mesutchi and Osutchi (Mating Tamagotchi), Tamagotchi Garden, Tamagotchi Water, Tamaotchi, Tamagotchi Devil, Easy Tamagotchi, Santaclautch (Santa Themed Tamagotchi, Genjinchi (Caveman Tamagotchi), Mothra Tamagotch (Mothra-Themed Tamagotchi, if you don't know who Mothra is, why don't you watch Godzilla?), Tamagotchi Plus, Tamagotchi ConneXtion (No, that's not a typo.)

Picture Time!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
For now, my posts are stuck down here because of a blogger malfunction (I think), but hopefully it'll resolve itself since I emailed them for help. They can't refuse a plea for help from someone as pitiful as myself.

I was mowing the lawn on a lawn tractor in the dark an hour or two ago.

Cutting to the chase, I strap on my earmuffs to block the jarring noise of the 18 hp kohler engine that my lawn tractor runs on. I suddenly am hit by a nonsense idea. Rushing up the stairs, I retrieve my sister's half-dysfunctional, uncomfortable headphones. I strap them on and then put on my earmuffs. Once those are in place, I cover it all with my trusty NASA hat. I'm ready as I'll ever be. I start heading toward the garage.

Carefully checking for obstacles as I push my mower out, I find a hose. I think to myself, "Not again." With luck, I find myself avoiding the dark green, grass-covered hose successfully. I sit myself on top of the poorly built, vynil seat. It smells funky today.

As the sun sets for this muggy, summer day, I push the clutch pedal, carefully adjust throttle, and turn the key. The engine roars to life as I suddenly realize that I've made a terrible mistake. The headphones jut out at the perfect angle to disrupt my earmuff's noise buffering ability. I'm going to have to suffer from the incessant noise of the mower. How unfortunate.

You know, just as a side note, if I happened to die and saw myself in a third-person view, I would say, "How unfortunate" in a nonchalant manner. Just goes to show you how much I value life. Like you care about my values anyways. This society is so shallow, if you don't have the same values as someone else, you become an automatic enemy. Can't people compromise?

Anyways, I cruise through the young night with my mower, listening to indie rock in one ear and the annoying rumbling of the engine in the other. I find myself bobbing my head up and down in the musty, dusty air. The night is not cool yet, the heat is just starting to subside. It's still muggy. So muggy, in fact, that you just might think that you could quench your thirst by breathing. I can't even see the grass any more. I find myself estimating and approximating my path of travel so I cut uncut grass. Later, I find my estimation has gone horridly wrong, but I'm not sure of my observation since I still can't see the grass. I continue to cruise along, feeling the wind in my hair. I continue to enjoy my "freedom", but it really isn't freedom since I'm restricted to the lawn. Superficial freedoms are better than none, I suppose. It's getting late, so I pull into the garage. My dog is sleeping. I feel wet from the humid air. Grass particles cover every square inch of my body. Game over, I take a shower and get up to my room where I type a stupid little ditty on my lawn mowing experience. And here I am.

Like you care about my lawn adventures anyways.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
So, I walk into my room. With the push of a button, my room springs to life. The lights reflect off of poorly taped posters that sag from the walls. The walls glow with intense, faded eggshell white. Carefully, I tip-toe to my faded plastic/plywood desk, careful not to disturb the inner sanctum, the holiness of this provincial paradise. I sit in my ripped vynil chair and gaze into my 6 year old HP laptop. I flick it on and the sound of a dysfunctional computer fan greets me. After multiple BSOD's and resets, I arrive at my fantastic desktop, in all of it's Windows ME sleekness. The fading grey, laptop plastic creaks as I put my hands on it to type. I continue to admire my desktop, with it's 800 by 600 pixel resolution awesomeness. After staring into my computer for a few minutes, I turn to my right. I push the crooked "POWER" button on my stereo. The CD inside klinks and starts spinning. I hear a plink and a long scratching sound. In all of it's perpetual greatness, the CD drive struggles to read the disk. Distorted music starts to churn out of the poor, old machine. I relax and lean back in my office chair. Smiling, I find myself astounded by the sheer glory and amazingocity that is my room.

That's how most of my evening hours are started. Evenings usually consist of looking up random facts on wikipedia.org, reading about cosplay, or fantasizing about nintendo products. In case of emergency, I break open the glass and check my email. Finally, after arduous hours of toil and effort in following my difficult routine of reading and sneering in my own devilish way, I turn to my blog. I write, but poorly. And, this is why I continue. It is my fate, in this way, I am destined for perpetual and constant writing, in a manner that will never achieve the grandeur of other famous bloggers.

I sigh, but know, deep inside that being famous isn't what it's all about. Improving yourself is. My destiny, unfulfilled. So, I continue my journey. Choose your destiny, eh? I say that fate is what governs what happens. Otherwise, the only other way to choose your destiny is to trek to Burger King and buy a large food item with a little wax tidbit of paper that governs the innards of space and time. The innards of space and time that say if you won a free apple pie. So, go and choose your destiny. Win that apple pie.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
And so the story ends for Mr. Smith. Life was good for him, but he never seemed to see it that way. He saw life as a job, a chore, something that just had to be done while he existed. All he is good for is trudging along in his desk job in some cubicle in the middle of a giant mega-corporate leviathan located in a no-name metropolis in a bland, blank country. He can't find his way around the place, so he mostly wanders. When he was young, he was deemed uneducatable by the "system" and his destiny was now concrete. He was sent to one of the government's corporate giants to work a mindless desk job. As he wanders, he considers suicide. Why exist when my purpose is as meaningless as the computer on the desk, he thinks to himself. Can he not see?

Back in the day, Mr. Smith contemplated taking his life in a "new direction." Now, his spirits are broken and hopes dashed. New directions were now denied. His individuality was masked by the communal caste system. He was just a worker, a part of something bigger. Living for the greater good. He was living and working for a goal that would not improve his life. But, why?

Mr. Smith swallows his pills, and a little extra. The government doctor decided to give him medicine for his aches and pains. Medicine to dull the details in a world where no one cares about one another. So, he inserts pill after pill into his mouth. Suddenly, he realizes that his pill bottle is empty. Perhaps he should go to the communal health department to get more pills. But, on the other hand, he won't need to.

As he sits at the foot of his bed, he thinks of his past. The missed opportunities. The drug starts to amass within his blood in dangerous levels. His neural cells begin to wither away and die. Half-delusional, Mr. Smith begins to see what could have been, what should have been. He decided to skip out on crucial events, and now he pays. Pays for the missed opportunities by carrying the powerful, strangling guilt of underachievement. He feels angry, but as he starts to slip into his drug-induced demise, he realizes that his death was in vain. There was supposed to be more to his life. And, as he sits there, the pile of flesh Mr. Smith has become, we wonder. We wonder what Mr. Smith could have been, but fate had it in for Mr. Smith.

And, so the story ends for Mr. Smith.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I drove with my instructor around the city today. It was very easy. Almost as easy as tying a cat to a stick and injuring anyone within a 3 foot radius with it. Yes it was that easy. Or, it was as easy as eating "funny" mushrooms and jumping off of a bridge, thinking that the water below is really poofy marshmellows. Or, it was as easy as taking that old hard drive that crashed on you while you were downloading your 50 GB file using dial up and destroying it with a blowtorch. Or, it was as easy as pushing the off button on a computer that really is what holds the world together because it's a magical computer of gravity. Whichever scenario you choose, it was quite easy.

I'm tired now, and I was thinking of writing more Mr. Smith stories. Maybe a book. Book deals make me envious. Yes, Amanda, someday when you're a millionaire and I'm living in my cardboard box, I'll have my revenge on something so insignificant that I shouldn't really care about it but I do anyways even though we're friends. Hopefully.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I'm reading a dastardly mature "adult", yet "furry" comic right now. I'm taking a liking for it, but not for the sexually explicit content. No siree... No, seriously. I suppose you can call it "deep", but it's really not that. I just like the way furries are used to portray the dark side of the world. Or maybe I like the comic because of the gore. Hmm... Hard decision.

Warning, this link is not persay, "work safe" or "parents are behind you in the computer room safe", so if you're going to click the link, do it with caution.

www.pholph.com

And, as a side note, I am not a pervert or a nerd, but maybe I'm a furry fan. And yes, I've read all 704 strips at a cost of about 5 hours.

Another side note, I draw like crap, if craps (What is the plural of crap?) were equipped with limbs with opposable thumbs and these craps had easy access to mechanical pencils and cheap notepads from a warehouse.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I'm frustrated over how to get my posts back up to where they are supposed to be. I've tried erasing the sidebar completely, but a lot is on there, you know? I mean, most of you don't even care about my silly links, but I use them sometimes when I'm bored and have forgotten where I've been to in the past. Grr... Maybe it's time to find a new template.

In the mean time, I'll be drawing David Hopkins style, or at least try to. It's great to learn from his style since he uses much more emotion than shallow, gag comics like Plugged Nickel. Lots of anger and angst in his characters. Hmm... Maybe someday I'll be like him, I wish. A lonely nerd who spends his California days and nights toiling over webcomics and furry conventions. What a role model, eh?

You know what? TIME magazine said that 15% of African Americans surveyed believed that AIDS was created to harass blacks. African Americans account for about half of all AIDS diseased people, but only account for 34% of the total population. Half of all African Americans think that the cure for AIDS is being hidden from the poor by the rich. How absurd is this!? If these findings are anything, they are portraying a bad image for African Americans! 15% of African Americans believe that COMPLETE nonsense? If these statistics are accurate, then this African American community must be like some kind of retard cult, in which African Americans are sucked in and led to believe stupid, impossible to comprehend logically, stupid, stupid, stupid things. Oh, woe is me.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I'm progressing with project "CoverAll." In this project, I am trying to cover up my walls with doodles that I scrawl onto cheap notepads. This way, my wall will have things to look at besides National Geographic maps, statistics, predictions, and demographics. I mean, who would want to look at a map of Syria and see how much GDP it has, when you can just look at my silly drawings?

A few hours ago, I found a forum dedicated to fans of JACK, which I am enjoying reading. It seems the furry fandom subculture is just chock full of freaks, rejects, goths, and otherwise minority weirdos. I can't find a single "normal" person who *admits to* like this stuff.
