It's an atrocity to find this subculture riddled with the holes of oversensationalized news that's such a poor representative of such a culture.

Somehow, I think that if I criticize myself enough, people will start to think I'm absolutely horrible at what I'm criticizing and will be impressed with what I do, but I don't think that'll be the case since no one actually looks at the stuff i'm criticizing in the first place. Meh, I've had my fair share of traumatizing social experiences, I'm not risking being overconfident ever again, except when I'm configuring electronics.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
And so the story ends for Mr. Smith. Life was good for him, but he never seemed to see it that way.

That morning, he pulled out the keys from his pocket. Cold, brass keys that were given to him years ago when his car was only barely used. These keys had been everywhere and had done everything with him. Always securely tucked between the folds of fabric inside of his pants, they contained Mr. Smith's destiny. He inserted them inside of the appropriate slot, and opened the door to his old, grey car. He unlocked the door to his death.

Earlier that month, the government had set up a bill to impose strict regulations and certifications religious groups had to follow. Regulations on what to wear, what to say, and what to pray about. Even things as the composition of “holy water” had to be inspected and tested to ensure for maximum efficiency. No, the government didn't want Mr. Smith or his neighbors using faulty “holy water.” Everything had to be perfect for everyone, but it wasn't.

A local religious organization wasn't able to comply to the strict regulatory statues. Thus, government cronies were sent to destroy the religious compound and imprison its members. The head of this group was sent a letter by an insider that they were in grave danger. Something had to be done to ensure that this belief would prevail.

Members of the group were sent out with a divine mission. Hollow iron pipes were packed with explosives and rigged to explode when the door of a car was opened. Unfortunately, Mr. Smith would be a casualty today.

As Mr. Smith slowly freed his key from the hole and creaked the slightly rusted door open, the two wires attached underneath his car connected. This completed the current for the batteries inside of the pipe, which led to sparks. Sparks led to the ignition of the explosive material inside of the pipe. Ignition led to fragments of pipe traveling in excess of 120kmph to Mr. Smith.

Mr. Smith was easily cut into pieces in front of his own house, in front of one of his most prized possessions. The metal tore through his flesh, cutting essential arteries, leading to massive blood loss. The fat, the flesh, the organs, the bone, and back out again. Sprawled out on the sidewalk, Mr. Smith died.

Was it divine fate? Religious crossfire? Collateral damage for the government's insecurities? It didn't matter for Mr. Smith. The life drained away from Mr. Smith quickly as his heart pumped his precious oxygen rich blood onto the sidewalk.

Later, the automated street cleaning droids made quick work of him. His car was melted for scrap, and his body was incinerated. With one swift motion, Mr. Smith's life was taken away. A signature on a bill is all it takes.

And so the story ends for Mr. Smith. Life was good for him, but he never seemed to see it that way.

item.title: FinalCoverall1
item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
FinalCoverall1, originally uploaded by Aminalz Rule.

My escapades in flash have yielded this! It's amazing how far recycled paper, ballpoint pens, a camera, and Flash MX will go.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Yep, total renovations for the site. While everyone was out blowing stuff out of the ground and out of the air, I was sitting here, patiently tweaking code. Isn't that a great way to patriotically celebrate America's independence? Maybe? Maybe not?

Well, I plan to tweak it some more later. It's looking very plain right now. The menu system couldn't handle my weekly archives, so the archives go by the month now. Yep, I'm up later since I'm active in a forum and I have a drawing obsession right now. More tweaking tomorrow!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
For most of the day now, I've been vegetating in front of the Internet, and drawing. My life has sped up drastically. I occupy myself now. I don't play silly games, I create worlds. I am almighty God, with my name capitalized even though I'm not a proper noun so it confuses a lot of people!

Ok, maybe not that far, but I'm delusional right now from sleep deprivation. I'm not in good shape to write so I'm just going to say that they don't sell thin pants anymore because everyone is obese. That is all. I is t3h tired. Meh.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
This morning, I woke up with shortwave dreams in my head. I headed over to my computer at 7am and started to study more about shortwave (A.K.A: world band) radio. I realized it was 10am and went downstairs. I found a radio shack ad inside of the newspaper and started flipping through it. Sure enough, I found a shortwave radio. The cool thing was, it was powered by a dynamo, or hand crank. Rushing up the stairs, I found some spare 20 bills in the hidden compartments scattered around my room, and went to radio shack with my mother at around 1pm.

I wish I was a black guy. The guy who was my "salesperson" at radio shack was a black guy. He was very nice and he laughed constantly. He was a real "people person." I loved his attitude. It was just so spunky. The white people that work at radio shack are usually socially alienated nerds who don't like to talk, or be corteous to customers. They mutter something about being out of stock, and return to the desk to twiddle their thumbs. They seem like angry little white men, which they are. The black guy was friendly, funny, and lively. He made me want to buy stuff. I wish I had taken a picture of him so I could have hung it on my wall and labled it, "Role Model."

Well, about the radio. I'm in love with my new Grundig FR-200 radio. I love listening to BBC. Love it! Oh, and those in London. I hope the situation improves. I love my radio.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I'm listening on my shortwave to some Oakley, California crackpot "priest" who is warning children on his program, "Family Radio", about the "wrath of god." I am alarmed that this kind of programming is allowed to air, but hey, it's shortwave. Sounds really cultist. Makes me think of Waco.

I bought a book about serial killers. I can't wait to read it.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
As we navigate throughout life, we wonder why others are so obnoxious. An obvious example would be when I was minding my own business and biking along the road, a large luxury SUV came roaring up the road and veered just inches from my head. On top of the obviously dangerous and hazardous driving, they opened their windows and screamed at me. I don't understand why, but it makes you think. If they can take the time to come inches from me, carefully coordinate window opening, and precisely calculate vocal projections from said window, then why don't they have the grey matter to understand ethics, or common morality? I'm sure they have enough sense to make a rational decision, but they just decided against it. If people can harass me in such a sophisticated way, then those people should be able to help people, for the good of humanity. But, instead those people take the path of forever shame. Shame in the name of the human race. Shame on them.

I couldn't get their license plate, I'm nearsighted. Darned physical restrictions.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
One of the main household computers are being sluggish. Very frustratingly, excruciatingly sluggish. Every minute or so, it freezes for about fifteen seconds and makes a grinding type noise. Not very reassuring. I'm still not sure if it's a hardware problem or a software problem. Nevertheless, I'll keep trying to tinker my way out of this mess.

I listened to a lecture on television today about "Utilitarian" and "Hippocratic" and "MultiAxial" philosophies pertaining to medical practices today. Do the ends justify the means, or do the rules overpower all outcomes? A question asked by ethics committees all over the world.

Russian scientists always fascinated me. It's almost sort of a romanticism of Russian science. Their stereotypical gruff voices and idealistic views inspire me. Before the collapse of the USSR, and communism, scientists worked for the advancement of science. The common knowledge gained from scientific advancement was what pushed these researchers to work so hard. After the fall of communism, researchers now had to think of ways to market and sell their scientific data, or knowledge. Advancing science does not matter in a capitalistic society if it doesn't make money. Cash cows are the name of the game, and it's ruining how technological advancement should be run. People should work for humanity, not for personal wealth and indulgence. If it's one thing Soviet Russia could do well, it would be innovation.

Like I can make these judgments. I hardly know anything about the subject. Yet, I continue to romanticize Russian scientists. It's like worshiping some obscure music celebrity. Do you really "know" them? Can you really "know" anyone?

No, so that's why we should all be paranoid and live in little underground caves, growing mushrooms for subsistence.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I'm sick of teenagers getting paid outrageous amounts of money to do mundane things. People are getting paid $80 to mow lawns. This operation usually takes about a half hour and basically, you sit in a chair and steer. If adults are perfectly happy blowing continuous money to pay a bunch of rejects to cut vegetative strands, then I'm sure they'll all be just glad to donate a few bucks to their favorite charity. That just doesn't happen though. Kids are getting paid to walk pets, water plants, and even CLEAN THEIR OWN FREAKING HOME! What in the ?!

If you can't clean your own house, then you probably suffer from some unfortunate psychological disease, or you're a fat slob. The latter would be most likely. Houses are now predominantly structured in a capitalistic/adultistic way. Children work, as adults order them. Once the children grow older and become greedy and corrupt, the parents have to bribe them or "pay" them to do "chores." This supposedly teaches the child how to "manage" their money. I think that all it does is get kids to learn how to use their parents as cash cows until they move out. I see people whose parents are paying a monthly paycheck (e.g. "allowance") to teach the child how to "manage" their money. What do they spend this paycheck on? Candy, luxuaries, and convenience goods. "Games" are another wastrel purchase that are common. Are these completely unneeded purchases "teaching" children how to "manage" their money? I don't see how. How the parents can translate "money management" into "buying crap that you don't need with someone else's money." It's absolutely disgusting.

That's why all children should grow up in a communist household. Everyone must work for the common good of the household. Five year plans must be set up for maximum household work efficiency. Civic duty should be why you work. Not because you get to blow your money on nonsense after your "chore." Money would be saved, kids would learn faithful work ethic, and the world would be full of happily prancing unicorns and lots of rainbows if communism was standard fare for the governing systems of American households. Start pasting up posters of an idealistic future, and commence the glorification of science! I'm all for a communist American household.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Swords.

What is the point of swords? They do nothing. Hunks of metal. Obsolete since the day gunpowder was created. Swords. You can throw them at your enemy, and surely miss. Swords. You can romanticize swords, chivalry, and swordsmanship, but end up finding that it's all about watching a bunch of royal pricks prance around and pretend to kill each other. Swords. Can't get any lower than a sword. At least rocks can be thrown effectively. You can't slingshot a sword and pretend to be Robin Hood, but end up hitting your kitchen window, having to explain the mess to your mother, and suffer a life of shame because of your window-breaking escapade, can you? Guns. Kill fast, efficiently. Guns. Shiny and metallic. You can adjust the noise created with a gun. You can kill someone many meters away with a gun. You can kill hundreds of people at a time with guns. Guns. The weapon of today.

Swords. The weapon of the past. The weapon for pointless glorification. The weapon over-hyped to a maddening state. Swords. The weapon of choice for aristocratic yuppies who go to prep schools. Swords.

Don't romanticize swords. Don't draw anime characters holding swords, and think it's cool. Don't talk about swords like you're some kind of amazing swordsman. Don't roleplay sword fights. Don't think swords hold some kind of mystical, holy power to win a battle. Swords. What's the point?

Sponsored by our good friends at the NRA.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Dude, swords > guns, and wooden sticks > swords.

They're a lot less wasteful on those bullets.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Farewell, America.

I will be back from Japan on July 28th.

Internet is scarce. I will not post until then.

If I die, that will be very unfortunate.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I have returned.

Between the excruciating plane rides, rude customs officials, lack of good television, lack of computer, automobile exhaust air, constant awkward moments, language barrier, CD buying binge, mosquitos, jet lag, and polluted water, the trip went well.

But, after going through 13 hours of being strapped into a chair on a 600mph flying metal behemoth, 6 hours of Chicago O'Hare craptactular delays, and 2 hours of customs I'm in no shape to sit here, awake. Especially at this hour.

Blech. Lesson of the day: Don't eat the airplane food.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
What, it's midnight? Has the fact that I am awake on four hours of sleep over a period of 48 hours startling me? Am I hovering between the world of dreams and the world of reality? The answers to all three of those questions are yes.

Basically, I ran errands today. Errands that involved lots of car time. This means that I have lots of time to think, which means later, as in now, I get frustrated because I can't remember what I was thinking about. It's great to type freely, in incomplete blurbs and run-on sentences. I better enjoy it while I can. My English teacher sent me a letter today, ordering me to read the designated summer reading book. School gets closer and I'm still in a summer daze. A daze of stupor, drifting around in a half-awake mental status. Many people continue on to think and act this way for the first few months of school. This results in tedious "review" lessons for half of the year. I don't like it when people take my time away. I don't like "review" lessons. Let those who delay teaching be taught discipline.

There's this little girl who lives next to me. Her age is unknown to me, but I assume she is ten or so. Allegedly, she called the emergency telephone number at a local fast food restaurant as a joke, a silly, trivial prank.

This prank does not seem very trivial to me. Calling the emergency number costs taxpayers and the government large sums of money to maintain. Tracking equipment, sirens, communications equipment, computer navigation systems, and human effort must be consumed to keep such a system up and running. And this little prick decideds to call the number for fun? It makes me want to just whap out my PVC pipe and start whacking an effigy of this idiotic character. Tearing it to shreds and burning it away in the fireplace. I absolutely detest the consumation of taxpayers' money for such a trivial and completely senseless act. This horrid society. Where are our morals and civic duty going? To prank calling 911 to idiotically covering someone's house in toilet paper, it is evident that the young population of suburban communities are quickly being corrupted. Absolutely horrid. Disgusting. Blech.

As my vulgar alternate personality (No, I'm not cursed with MPD) would have said, "WTF!? This MF'er *ssh*le should go to h*ll. G*dd*mn it!"

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
If I could somehow convince the research and development team at the A1 Steak Sauce HQ to change one thing about their product, it would probably be the structure of the bottle. What really is absurd about the A1 Steak Sauce bottle is that it does everything a bottle is supposed to do in the worst possible manner. You might as well get some delerious, drunken hobo to suddenly break into your house and raid the refrigerator to break open the A1 bottle to get the sauce out. The sauce isn't that amazing anyways. It tastes like a sweet worcestershire sauce. I don't really like it that much. I just eat it because the commercials force me to. That and my mother bought it one day and I'm the only one in my family that can tolerate its taste.

About the bottles. Again, I would like to restate the fact that these bottles are terrible, horrible things. Yes, there are plenty of fantastic designs for bottles out there in the market right now that reduce spilling, dripping, leaking, crusty sauce stuff on the bottle cap, sauce clumping, time-to-sauce output ratio, and general frustration. The A1 Steak Sauce bottle looks like this:



This bottle looks like a normal, friendly bottle at first, but as you use it, you discover it's hidden dark side. Then, the bottle becomes your enemy. Every day, as you try to extract the valuable saucy goods trapped within, the bottle struggles against you. Every waking moment becomes a conflict. A frustrating, excruciating, and expletive-filled conflict. A conflict that can be solved, by killing your enemy. With the bottle half full, the only way to get the sauce out is with a nice hard counter, and a large mallet. Voila! Instant sauce release. If only life weren't as messy.

A1 bottles posses powers. Powers to keep a sauce that you righteously bought at the local grocery away from you. Powers to punish the extractor after the sauce is released. Powers to keep this sauce on grocery store shelves next time you make a trek to the store. The long neck of the bottle keeps the flow of air and sauce from travelling side-by-side. This results in a sauce that is always "stuck" inside of the bottle. When the sauce does come out, it is always in a rapid spitfire fashion. Sauce is splatted onto your salad, your rice, your gelatin, and your drink. The poorly designed rim does not keep itself clean. It stays as clean about as much as an autistic baby trapped inside of a septic tank. Cleaning the rim with a paper towel is a must to keep the rim of the bottle reasonably clean of hazardous sauce-crust.

Why must I suffer such toil and wrath at the hand of a sauce bottle?! Why!?

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I hate it when I have to go into a topic that's actually being discussed and debated. A topic that, as of now, has no official answer, but a logical one. One that some people might disagree on. The subject pertains to violence and nudity in video games, and crackpot Miami attorney Jack Thompson. And don't forget about Hilary Clinton.

Everyone who's even caught a glimpse of a news medium has seen it. People walking into game stores all over the nations have been horrified to find their favorite American past time to be missing from store shelves. Recalled all over the US, Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas has been tagged as hazardous to our children. It's almost as absurd as Pope Benedict considering Harry Potter a possible threat to Christianity.

And the absurdity of it all is the timing.

The first game came out ages ago with carjacking, prostitutes, drugs, gang warfare, copicide, and other various articles of crime. Now, on the seventh GTA game, politicians and their evil little demons (lawyers) decide to go bonkers about some obscure sex scene that requires a code to unlock. The shots have been fired and here come the lawyers. Suing for pixelated sex scenes? What's next? The graphics are so poor anyways that you can't tell if the guy is just dancing or trying to do a backflip. Yes, if you have a nipple that consists of a pixel that's slightly darker than the pixels around it, then you know this isn't hi-res, youth-corrupting material.

And the hullaballoo results in A RATING CHANGE! What, now you have to be 18 to buy the game? How old did you have to be to buy the game before? SEVENTEEN! That's a one year difference. I'm sure all of those 17 and a half year olds were mentally traumatized and forever scarred when they saw two poorly shaded and modeled collections of polygons rythmically moving back and forth. What kind of kid doesn't know what sex is by the age of 17?! The only person I can think of is Karl Rove. Michael Jackson is another story.

So, after almost a decade of playing a game, let's finally ban it because of a few flesh colored pixels moving about! Yes, forget about the copicide and drugs. We politicians tolerate that nonsense. But, DON'T YOU REALIZE!? A SEX SCENE!

Let's all go to Mr. Thompson's website, www.stopkill.com, and protest his retarded greedyness. Power to gamers!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
It bothers me how lay people are idealistic about hydrogen fuel.

The hydrogen fuel economy will never work because of a simple law. No, not Mr. Thompson again, he's a simple lawyer. This law is actually the first law of thermodynamics. The conservation of energy. To create hydrogen to perpetuate such a future society, enormous ammounts of energy are needed to produce hydrogen via electrolysis. Yes, hydrogen powered vehicles are clean, only produce a byproduct of water, and are probably less smelly than conventional cars, but it'll take the same ammount of energy to run your car than before. It'll just be concentrated more heavily in certain areas. I believe coal power plants will churn out soot for many years to come. The huge hullabaloo over GM's and others' new hydrogen car prototypes does not demonstrate the manufacturer's ability to be clean. It demonstrates how they can manipulate the public into thinking this or that car manufacturer is cleaner.

The United Nations' Food and Agriculture Association estimates that 25,000 people die of starvation every day. If we continue to spend so much effort on this "War On Terrorism" and continue to push more important priorities aside, I believe there is absolutely no chance that this kind of society can count on itself to have enough effort to generate a reliable alternative energy source.

A terrorist kills 1,000 people in a spectacular train or plane crash every quarter of the year or so. The same thing happens 25 times every day. But, everyone in the industrialized world agrees. We are better than them. We must protect our things. They can deal with their problems. How can society tolerate starvation, but not Michael Jackson, a plane crash, or a dirty Earth? It's simple. We are better than them, or so we say.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Insulting someone by calling them "gay" must be the most politically incorrect saying that I've encountered to this day. Not just politically incorrect, but just plain wrong.

Def of Gay:adj 1: bright and pleasant; promoting a feeling of cheer; "a cheery hello"; "a gay sunny room"; "a sunny smile" [syn: cheery, sunny]

Well, and then the homosexual community started using the word to refer to themselves. This led to the use of "gay" as "homosexual."

For some odd reason, people seem to hate homosexual people. And it's hilarious how they try to explain it. They say, "It's just plain wrong." What? Wrong? Wrong compared to what? Wrong compared to Mr. Thompson suing Rockstar and its associates? Wrong compared to 14 year olds having pregnancies? Wrong compared to my little toe? Wrong compared to 25,000 people dieing every day from malnutrition? If people continue to explain themselves so vaguely and so undefinitively, I believe that proper debates among people will be reduced to mere bickering. Not that they weren't bickering in the first place.

If you are uncomfortable when near a homosexual, fine. Being uncomfortable near, or even being religiously against someone doesn't mean you go out brandishing campaign posters and picket signs. People have been homosexual for centuries now. Deal with it. If you want to "cure" something, go cure AIDS, or cancer. Homosexuality doesn't kill anyone. They are not a threat to you. If something as unimportant homosexuality and its "righteousness" can attract national debate and discussion, then I'm sure AID packages to Africa could be discussed every day. And don't get me started on Bosnia. Bosnians aren't even "black" and Americans ignore them. Everyone ignores the people who really need the attention. They need the help that we refuse to deal. But, alas. Even after the one.org campaign and the Live8 concerts, only 250,000 Americans signed the petition asking for more aid to poverty stricken nations. That's a slap in the face to both the dying nations and the reputation of this "superpower" that we all live in. What is this "superpower" doing? What's so "super" about a nation that rants on and on about the "wrongness" of homosexuality while people are starving overseas?

There are alot of things "that are just plain wrong" in this country. Being homosexual isn't one of them.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
RIGHT ON!
i can believe you just said that...you officially have my utmost repects now. thank god for people like you.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded: School is approaching, and fast. But, are we all actually going to use all of the information taught at school in daily life? Unless there's a criminal takes you hostage and demands include an explanation of allegory in Animal Farm, there isn't really a need for such vocabulary. Who analyzes these novels so intently anyways? It might sound "uncultured," but I believe that novels are only as good as they are enjoyable. Picking apart a novel bit by bit, only to find an abstract idea isn't my way of spending an enjoyable afternoon. Yes, these stories have a message, but so does every Joe Schmo. What makes anyone think that the message of this story will be more important than anyone else's? So what if there's a tiny tidbit of a sentence lurking in the depths of chapter 3 that foreshadows important events further. It doesn't matter if I read the whole book does it? Well, English class is going to follow me around for quite a bit, but I'm still unappreciative of such a nitpicky subject. When I think of English class, I think of finding a needle in the haystack, and you find out later that you have a sewing machine. Numerology is like that too, except more irrational. Blech, numerology.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
For the past few days, I've lacked a decent sleep schedule. My biological clock has gone haywire from the intense, 13 hour jet lag. I go to sleep at two in the morning and get up at eleven. It's not like me to have such a distorted sleep schedule. So, I'm planning to go to sleep around now tonight. Not like you care or anything, so let me spare you from the monotony of myself ranting on about how I sleep.

I check my email more than I check the time. Whenever I find my inbox empty, I find myself disappointed. I always seem to find my silicon relationship with other netizens unrendered. Feelings like this sometimes make a big impact on how I look at the day. You're probably like, "WTF, y iz h3 l1ke s00 3m0?" Well, think about it. I don't get much social interaction. I've stayed in my house for weeks at a time. Email is basically my form of a social life.

And to think, my feelings won't matter the next day, or five bajillion years into the future. That's why feelings shouldn't matter now. Outlook on life should be always pleasant, because feelings are primal. In the future, everyone will be drugged up so badly by the government that there will be no feelings. And you know what? It'll be all for the better.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Once again, I have recieved a letter to a pageant show. A pageant show to supposedly, "meet new friends, boost your self-confidence, and win prizes." I'm supposed to meet with other "young women" at a hotel down in Indianapolis. I'm assumimg that this contest is for "young women." I am not a "young woman." I have called this pageant company before, requesting removal from their mailing list. I guess they haven't removed me. So I suppose I'll just keep getting these invitations to beauty pageants. Their letters sure aren't helping my self-esteem. That's for sure.

If this company really wanted to help people, they wouldn't spam male teenagers and invite them to beauty pageants. They would send the money to underdeveloped countries to help starving children. If stupid stinking rich corporations and sponsors want beautiful teenaged girls to be awarded cash, then no wonder people just keep on starving, this country keeps falling deeper and deeper into debt, and meth is a national problem. It's because this culture is shallow. Shallow like a puddle. A big puddle seems like a lake until you jump in and you realize that the people that the puddle represents are too shallow to even give a/an (INSERT EXPLETIVE HERE.) Such shallow morals, shallow ethics, shallow life. People bickering with each other about Terry Schaivo. Bickering over a brain-dead vegetable, while people are killing each other everywhere. Look at your dirtied hands, you rascals. Set your priorities straight.

But, alas. Like many high-school adolescents, adults fail to recognize that some things are worth more merit and effort than others. Whether it be a teenager playing GTA instead of working on homework, or some adult bickering about Terry Schaivo, there is always a person somewhere doing something that isn't exactly up to par with reason. Is there no reason?

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I was sketching something out on a sketch pad, which was pretty amazing.

Before, I've only used itty-bitty note pads to showcase my doodles. I found a sketchpad under my desk and I just started scrawling on it. Who knows how it got there. So I get a nice reference picture and kick back. Put the laptop in fullscreen browser mode (f8) and start hacking away with my mechanical pencil that I stole from my sister ages ago. After awhile, the sketch starts looking nice(by my crappy art standards) and I start to ink. Big mistake. Art paper sucks, in that it doesn't like gel pens. The ink just won't be absorbed by the paper. Too bad I didn't notice that until I get to the end of the picture and notice my hand covered in ink smears. The actual sketch isn't really that damaged, but I have learned a valuable lesson today. My sketchpad doesn't like ink, or my prized G2's. My note pad just drinks it all up with pizazz, but no... the expensive art paper just spits it back out at me like some rich yuppie in a Cadillac. Some yuppie that likes to golf, drink cocktails, and has a waterfall bar. It doesn't help that the yuppie has some corporate job and a taste for caviar. And not just any caviar. Beluga caviar. Stupid yuppie. I'm just going to have to settle for notepads. They love my G2's.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded: Updated my template to something more tasteful. It took an hour and thirty minutes, and some time with my favorite program, GIMP.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
When you combine a gasoline powered blade and dry grass, you create grass dust. That's what I learned today as I mowed my lawn today. Because of the lack of any rain and additional dried grass clumps from a week ago, the grass dust was quite a problem today. As I tediously cut the grass, meter by meter, I started to become enveloped and coated in a flying cloud of grass dust. It got into my hair, my eyes, my clothes, and my throat. I could feel the grass start to clump onto the fabric while I tried to shield my eyes from the cloud of sheer cellulose terror. Just to let you know, it didn't help. By the end of the half hour of coughing and wheezing, I was expecting hazard pay. It didn't happen. What did happen was that I coughed up little grass and soot particles. It wasn't pretty. The lesson for today is, "Haz-Mat suit required when cutting dry grass."

I still feel like a tree.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
After this incident, I decided to send Jacko (a.k.a. Jack Thompson) an email. His email is at "jackpeace@comcast.net"

This is the email I sent to Mr. LawyerPig (a.k.a. Jack Thompson)
------------
From: billforcet@gmail.com
To: jackpeace@comcast.net
Reply | Reply to all | Forward | Print | Trash this message | Show original
Stop bullying Scott. He's my role model. I feel offended when greedy,
capitalistic pigs like you take such a stance on mere games for the
sake of your own fiscal gain. You truely define the word "greedy,
lawyer pig." Every night, the world laughs and mocks you, yet you
continue on your false crusade. Don't bother Scott, because we have
every right to bother you, you sick pig.

-Bill Forcet
------------

And the amazing thing is that he replied to little old me.

This is his reply email.

------------

From: Jack Thompson
To: Bill Forcet
Reply | Reply to all | Forward | Print | Trash this message | Show original
I'm not bullying him. I pointed out that Killer 7 is not about hidden or
embedded violence. I was a critic of GTA for the patent violence for years.
Scott wasn't paying attention. he needs to stop sending me emails. it's
harassment. same with you, bucko
-----------

Obviously this nonsense lawyer pig thinks he can get away with harassing the Scott Ramsoomair. Not the case. He also thinks he can get away with bad grammar. Well, that's not the case either, since he is sure sounding like he has autism or some other mental disease. Well, you heard me. I bothered him, so why don't you? Maybe he'll threaten you with his lawyer pig fat. Stupid pig.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Today was a day of great achievement. I completed five drawings on full sized sketch paper. They are inked, colored, and shaded. It's a great feeling when you create a world. It's even better when you get to see it. These five drawings are basically just a character doing action poses and bubble letters. But, the fact that I did it presentably makes me happy. Not to gloat or anything, but I'm pretty proud of what I did today. I put, what, six hours into five pieces of paper. I'm sure you wouldn't be proud, but I sure am.

The characters are "Socialist Dog" and "Dusty the Robot", new characters that were created by yours truly. Basically, they are a crime, and capitalist, fighting duo with a color scheme reminiscent of USSR propaganda, travelling the world to industrialize nations and unite workers for a better tomorrow. The duo enjoys science, but fights to destroy religion. SD's weakness is lawyers, and the Robot's weakness is, well robots aren't supposed to be weak, so I guess he doesn't have a weakness. But, characters must always have a weakness. Superman wouldn't be so interesting if he could just do anything, now would he?

But, alas, maybe when I can develop these two, they'll be ready for release to the public. Then you can check out "The Commie-Tastic Adventures of Socialist Dog and Dusty the Robot!"

I can relate with these two imaginary beings. It figures, a socialist superhero being my make-believe idol.

You know, a red colored pencil goes a long way when you are working with a socialist character.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Where's the Flickr? I want to see these pictures!
I don't have a scanner. Pictures wouldn't do my sketches justice. If you want to see them, come over sometime.
I saw the pictures, you should be a cartoonist, your style is very unique and appealing.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
During today's routine medical check-up, I was vaccinated. With a needle. A needle is a sharp object. I don't like sharp objects.

But, surprisingly, all went well. The needle went through me like it was coated in lard, but it wasn't, you see? The pain was not in vain. I will be invulnerable from tetanus for ten more years. Unfortunately, that isn't the case for the pain incurred from diving.

The pain from diving was high. Physical pain, mental pain, imaginary pain, pain in all of the wrong places, and I mean ALL of the WRONG places. But, when you smack the water after attempting that double-flip, you aren't cured from some disease or protected from a virus. The smack results in you, reluctantly, going up to the board to bullshit (for a lack of a better word) your way out of smacking the water. You know what I did when I was stuck on the diving board with a coach breathing down my neck, expecting me to do some insane trick? Well, basically...

...It's all in the entrance. You must look like you are actually committed to what you are doing. Focus, and look ahead. Take a practice jump. Then, "loose balance" all of a sudden so you fall in the water. After you resurface, put on a grimace and take a quick glance at the coach to see his/her reaction. If the reaction is tolerable, sulk to the diving board to await your turn. Rinse and repeat.

Diving isn't a pretty sport. It's only like that on the outside. Finesse and masculine beauty on the outside, pain and suffering on the inside. I suppose diving is a bit like Windows Longhorn. A technological advancement and engineering marvel on the outside, prepackaged, old-news, post-Macintosh features on the inside. And diving is also like war. Idealized and heroic on the outside, but a bloody, pointless hellhole on the inside. Diving can be put in the category of "Activities That Look Cool To Do But Actually Suck When You Get Suckered Into Doing Them." That's why being a diver isn't fun.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Dude you weren't suckered in you decided to join
You're right. I shouldn't blame anyone.
Well, you were as close to being suckered in as you could be, without actually being suckered in.
HEY RYO!!!!!! u rock my world and i know diving sucks! but i wish u would do it this year cause u are superb!!!!! **sam yoder

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Some strange cyberkinetic force led me to become a "resident" of a game called "Second Life." It's a bit like the "metaverse" from "Snow Crash", if you know what I mean. If you've never read Snow Crash, then you should. Otherwise, let me explain to you this amazingly laggy social software.

Basically, it's a bit like an MMORPG, except without the tedious leveling up and item collecting. It's an online universe in which people can customize their avatars, blah blah blah...

But, here's the thing. You pay a flat fee of $10 and can build stuff. If a regular MMORPG was a game, then Second Life is a canvas. A canvas filled with opportunities.

Enough about my stupid game. Games are stupid.

I finished two comics today. I'm not pleased with the second one. It's heading toward the trash. Hopefully, I can draw some more tommorow.

Enough about my stupid drawings. My drawings are pretty stupid.

So, like always, let me wish you all a safe night (or day, or whatever). A decent sleep schedule must be established, and so I now, I bade you farewell.

Farewell.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I'm starting to transmorglify from a timid noob "SL'er" or "Second Lifer" to a hardcore online community geek. Just fantastic. If I follow the footsteps of the lineage of Everquest users, then my future is doomed. This game will overrun my life and I will slowly sink into the depths of obesity and nutrition deprivation. Eventually, I will become delusional and the line between fantasy world and real life will start to fade away. In the end, I will kill myself after losing a not-really-so-rare item and my parents won't want to blame themselves so they'll blame it on the game. The media will bounce the story hard and I will become just another statistic, another reason for Mr. Thompson to fight harder. Well, isn't that spectacularly cliche?

Basically, today was a mix of both worlds. While I spent time with my friend today, I also did a lot of online socializing. I went to some cyberspace parties with my furry fandom friends and partied for awhile. I made quite a few friends. Then, I decided to buy a vehicle, so I went comparison shopping. After a few recommendations, I was sent to R&M Engineering, where they built me a hovercraft, their most basic model. I was soon well into the atmosphere, driving around my neat, little aircraft. Later, I picked up some stranger and went flying around. I dropped her off at her workplace and was invited to some party. Unlike in real life, I went to the party.

Well, Second Life is so eventful, it really can seem plausible that some people can lose grasp on reality and kill themselves. This whole universe really is like a "metaverse", a digital, cyberspace world with physics, rules, and housing complexes. I wished for it when I read Snow Crash, and now I've got it. Absolutely smashing! Wacco! Wizard!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I have to see this hover craft in actiong. The picture was so cool!

Ryo, I have more of a life than this.... (not to mention, I was more important in the online world... most feared military commander on Chilastra, Bloodfin, Eclipse, and Tempest, four most militaristically inclined role-playing galaxies in Star Wars Galaxies, for 3 years... then I quit it. I'd love to go back, but my beloved character's been deleted, and I'd have to face the fact that I left my guild(s), which I of course, again, was head of the online tribunal of guilds in 3 galaxies, and also was 3rd person to attain rank of Jedi Master... And I only played the game an hour a day. TAKE THAT YOU LEET GAMERS!!!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I've always wanted to be the best at something. The best painter, the best writer, the best thinker. The fastest, the smartest, the most witty. Unfortunately, the only thing I'm the best at is sleeping very quietly. Ever since my friend's little sister told me that I slept quietly, I've seen myself as the best at being a silent slumberer. Isn't it great to think that you're the best at something? I mean, even if you aren't the best at what you think you're good at, thinking that you are the best is as empowering as stocking the Vatican City with nukes.

In other news, I was overwhelmed by the intellectuality of the Second Life furry fans. They are all just so darn witty. It makes me feel like some white trash hick who watches "West Coast Choppers" and "WWF." And it seems like everyone is from Seattle. What's the deal? WHY IS EVERYONE IN SEATTLE!?

Fruit, I've lost my mind. Did you know that I've always wanted to be the bes...

Oh.. Yes... I've already said that haven't I. I must really be not getting enough sleep. My quality of life is being influenced by the metaverse. Must succumb to the amazing metaverse. Derr...

Like I said, sleep...

or something like that.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
With little time to spare, I have finally finished the creation of my new moblog about my new life, in a little universe called Second Life. If you have trouble understanding what Second Life is all about, or what a Metaverse is, check out this wiki about Second Life, or this wiki about the Metaverse.

It's time to lead a double life, folks. And I'm the one to start the revolution.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Once you get involved with a virtual community too much, reality becomes distorted. The reality distortion phase is starting to come on. As I was heading toward Indianapolis today, I looked out of the window. I looked at the road signs, the stripes on the road, the other cars, billboards. I became to break each little thing into a set of primitives, or primitive shapes used in computer assisted design. I thought of ways to use textures to create the realism. Light settings to emphasis metal parts. Position and rotation parameters that had to be set. Joints that had to be programmed in, and scripts to be contained within each object to govern it's behavior.

Then it hit me. This is the real world. A real highway. The stuff on the sign is ink, not a texture that's been uploaded to some server. The light settings on that chrome trim is correct because there really is light that's bouncing off of that chrome. The road is moving smoothly, not because I have a fast computer and a nice graphics card, but because my eyes can see. I can't jump out of the car and fly away. I could die at any time. A crash doesn't result in a BSOD. In reality, it results in death and fire. Scripts and physics engines don't govern time, space, and gravity. Time, space, and gravity govern themselves.

The line between my second life and my first is starting to blur. And it's facinating.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I was never a very musical person.

From the beginning, I was opposed to music. I ignored and tried to dismiss all music throughout my middle school life. My thought was, music was distracting and ate up time. I mean, after all, music is just coordinated noise. What's the big deal? Finding music to be a trivial matter, I focused my efforts on writing and creation. Last year, my friend gave me a taste of a few good bands. He gave me a CD and I put it in the portable CD player. The CD, spinning like some hypnotic wheel of doom.

Euphoria and joy started pulse throughout my mind. It's unbelievable how amazing something is until you try it out for yourself.

So, I went home and thought about it. Let's try this music thing out. I mean, it's just coordinated noise, how bad could it be? I bought a few CD's and listened to them constantly. Every second was bliss. It wasn't noise anymore. The music was being absorbed by me, and I savored every second of it.

With that in mind, I find myself sitting here in front of a stack of about 18 CD's on my desk, a locked suitcase beside me holding about 50 of these things, a hard drive chock full of oldies, and 2 stereos in my room. Not to mention the six speakers and countless headphones that are scattered all over the room. I believe that music is an addiction. You buy a CD and you just can't get enough. You go to the store or download some more music. Constantly clashing feelings overwhelm you as you get bored and the euphoric rhythm starts to wear out. Sometimes it wants to make me start at the beginning, and forget about music.

I thought I was wrong when I put that fateful CD in my friend's CD player, and I still do. Music is overwhelming my life. And so, from beginning to end, I'm still stubborn as a mule. Unwilling to appreciate the euphoria of such a flowing and natural drug.

I was never a musical person, and I don't think I ever will be.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: If you like music or liked music, whatever, why don't you listen to it. You should do ehat you think is fun. It isn't really an unhealthy addiction at all. Music can be a healthy addiction, feeding your ears with the longed entertaiment they crave. Feed your ears, love music.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I lost three pencils, a brand new rubber eraser, a protractor, a bunch of post it notes, and a cell phone today at school. If this keeps up, I'll be bankrupt from school supplies in no time. I'm disgruntled. I always feel like I'm some worthless prick when I lose things because I feel like I've thrown away what was given to me, which is what basically happened today. I can't help but feel negative. No one is in my lunch, the teachers are rude, and I was piled with homework today. The only respite I was given today was these twenty minutes in my room alone.

I really can't help but feel negative. Negative and helpless, like a typical angsty teenager. You know?

It's just so frustrating when you lose a piece of perfectly functional electronic equipment. I feel like I'm going nuts!

Blah, blah, blah... Like you care about my angsty teenger rantings. I mean, I don't really have a reason to be so negative. I'm perfectly fine here, not about to die in some straw hut in Niger. Dying from malaria because I couldn't pay for a two dollar mosquito net. That's how it is. A life is worth two dollars in Niger, and conditions are horrible.

Thinking about Africa always makes me a positive person, so I guess we've learned something. When you suicidal angsty teengers start to go nuts, just think of Africa.

There's a bright side to every single little thing, no matter how brutal it may be. Lessons can be learned, and technology can be improved. We're all in this together, folks, and we will be until the end.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
I hope you find your cell phone soon!
It sucks untill then. <'/\'>

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
My parents pushed a tough question on me today.

"What do you want to do when you're older?"

Well, the problem with this is that I have no idea. I have experimented in sketching, and it has been merited "hobby" status. I'm not sure if it could ever result in a career. I like computers, but any job involving computers is as stable as a one-legged 'Nam veteran. And plus, I know like a trillion other kids who are much more into computers than I am. Same with my sketching. There will always be more than a handful of kids who are better than me at that. I was thinking about a career in journalism. Journalism class last year made me realize that journalism is a hardcore toughie. Needless to say, I struggled. Struggled lots.

How about a career in science? I was never excellent at that either. I am a very imprecise person. My handwriting looks like some elementary school kid puked on the page after eating tainted food at "snack time." Grape juice and oatmeal cookies. Not pretty when regurgitated.

How about medicine? Well, that would be the easiest path to take, but I really don't have a "passion" about healthcare. I mean, helping people is just fantastic, but I don't have the supposed "passion" that people are supposed to have with their jobs. My father knows the ins and outs of healthcare, so I would have a one-up over the competition with that. He's always talking about how easy it is to be a doctor these days. Sounds do-able when he talks about it. Medicine and healthcare is a very stable job since people will be always hurting, or getting hurt.

What else is there? I suppose there are limitless opportunities, but none of these "opportunities" really drives me. I'm on a highway to life, without a trusty GPS system to navigate me. Just a bunch of billboards.

On the other hand, I could just become a runaway and live an illegitimate life on the streets. Maybe in a boxcar. Scrounging what I can from a local office supply shop and convenience store. The advantage with that is...

I suppose there isn't an advantage. Time to rethink all of this.

What could I be?

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Just DIVE in...

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I've gotten my hands on a neat graphing calculator. I instinctivly hate Texas Instruments because of my hardcore Casio loyalty, but hey, Casio isn't standard is it?

Well, I haven't got the time to mess with it much yet. I've basically gone along with the fantastic 209 page manual.

The manual is a blessing in itself. I've always fancied myself reading manuals. This will make for great reading. I'm already on page 15 or so. I can't wait until I get to the good parts. And I'm totally serious about this. I enjoy manuals and tutorials, so I suppose I can merit them "hobby" status. I've got a stack of manuals in a hidden drawer in my desk so I can read them if I get bored. It's great stuff.

Well, the worst thing is that I had no time to tinker with my new pride and joy. I spent all of my afternoon on my "Milk, Dye, and Detergent Interaction Lab" for chemistry. That and buying my calculator.

If I could buy a "Furry Pride" shirt, I would. I can't find any. That's why I should sell them.

I put some new links up for webcomics and whatnot. I really like "Bad Rabbit." The creator's style is just fantastic. I've been using her stuff for refrence art for a few days now.

Check it out. Or check yourself out. Or check that hot girl behind you out. Oh yes, you tell me that you're some pathetic, blog obsessed, socially inept, visually handicapped loser that doesn't have a hot girl behind you? Well, we're in the same boat.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I have a Casio! It is actually standard believe it or not! Well, I guess you probably wanted to know that earlier.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I discovered that my hardcore SSBM gaming skills were no match for four handicap points and a witty blonde girl.

I had an intense gaming session with Rachel an hour or so ago. I haven't had a gaming session as engaging as that since... Well, since never. I went nuts and started going all "Beavis & Butthead" on everyone. It's pretty stupid, the stuff I can say when I'm screaming at the TV and laughing at how I said "lug nut", or something of that nature. My hands, face, and arms were numb after the hour long match. It was grueling work. It was a tie 'till the very end. The last kill went to Rachel though. Yes, I lost. Sadly, my mad asian gamer skills failed me.

I will sulk in shame now.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Lack of sleep makes me loony.

When become loony, I want to read webcomics. My voracious webcomic appetite keeps me from going to sleep, and thus, my loonyness exponentially increases, eventually terminating in complete shutdown. Comics and gags are so much funny when you're half-awake and in a dark room. I find that to be true. I can't play the clarinet worth feces, and it's making me loony too. I'm having a loony weekend. Loony all the way to the bank.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
It's funny how you can look at your watch and find yourself speeding through time.

Actually, it's not that funny, because it means that you're speeding toward your ultimate demise. Death by fire, cancer, car accident, or cat on a stick. Isn't it terrible? Well, let's hope time isn't going fast for you. Because speed isn't an advantage in time.

Derr... This weekend was full of learning experiences. I'm using my life in the metaverse as a tool to learn how to communicate better. Be a better socializer. As you must all know by now, because of both my ranting and my description of my social life, I'm quite shy. Hopefully the metaverse will be able to help me experiment and learn social cues. I know I'm not the only one in there trying to do that. I mean, me being in the furry fandom, I'm a "freak" and you know it. I mean, it's set in stone, but hey. Why not make the best of it?

Now, time to read some furry webcomics and get some sleep.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I keep telling myself that homework is fun, and I keep telling myself that English class will be fun today, and I keep telling myself that I'll get through the day, but sometimes it just doesn't happen.

Sometimes, everything is so rushed and mixed that nothing seems plausible. Reason is thrown out the window as I rush from class to class on a supposedly "normal" school day. I have to shove and force my way to my locker, and just getting inside of the classroom isn't going to save you. There's constant class antagonism and there's always someone who's answering more questions right than you. The pressure mounts as you try to impress the teacher, but end up just using pronouns in the wrong way. Or mumbling. I mumble lots. I can't help it, but I feel disrespectful when raising my voice or making eye contact with a superior. It's all out of place, and social cues are yet again missed, my reputation on the line.

I get home and do homework for a bit. Realizing that I suck at everything I do, I turn on the music and try to forget that I have a life to maintain. You know, I can sometimes make myself feel like I'm not there. If I focus and sit completely still, I can have an "out of body" sensation. It feels fantastic. I try to move, but I can't. It's self-incurred paralysis, I suppose. All I know is that it feels like floating. After de-focusing, motor control doesn't kick in for a few minutes. Then I get dizzy. It's all over in a matter of 10 minutes.

Oh, yes, homework. After my self-incurred paralysis session, I focus on more important things. Focus for more important things for about four hours. Bah, homework isn't important, is it? It's just tedious nonsense. I still do it. I still do it like some little child who doesn't know who to believe, just imitating other's actions. Dreaming that someday he could make something of his life.

It sure hasn't happened yet. I'll just keep on drawing anthropomorphic nonsense and try to make the best of it.

Homework, school, drawing, electronics, network maintainance, socializing, extracurricular activities, music, etc.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
OfficeMax Adventures.

So one day I decided that a scanner would be nice to have. Well, what really got me to think about it was the fact that my friend's brother got a scanner. This friend asked me if I wanted to have things scanned. The answer to this question is no, because I have transportation issues.

A quick search landed me at OfficeMax demanding a $29.99 scanner. Well, the folks there said that I had to have "proof" of this "instant rebate" that I found online. Come on, this is from their own online store, and they can't even sell me a scanner for the same price as their website. They say that I have to go home and print off the page from the website. They suck.

I'm fuming, and rushing back home. I get home, print off the bloody page, and I rush back off to OfficeMax. I get there and a guy name "Kyle" tells me that I could have just picked up the advertising pamphlet at the door, and show them the "proof" that the scanner was actually thirty dollars. Mr. Manager decided not to tell me that earlier, who knows why... Three gallons of gas later, I'm back home with my precious.

I hate OfficeMax.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I'm sick.

But, I'm happy.

Because I drew something neat today.

I'm proud of it.

In a few days, I'll hate it.

I'm sick.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Why do people play instruments anyways.

Everyone should become a robot and live in a fabricated world with nothing to motivate them, but nothing to neagate their tasks, not like these robots had minds anyways. Or not.

Back to the instruments thing. Well, what I'm trying to do is justify the fact that I did not pick up my clarinet and practice my music, like I was "supposed" to do for today. It's pretty sad that I try to justify my procrastination by writing about it. I mean, most people just do it. They have guts. I have to go out and complain and whine about it to myself to get myself to feel better. It's absolutely disgusting.

About the instruments. People try to make music, but why make music when you can just let others make it for you. It's not like I'm going to make a living from playing my clarinet. It's not like I derive any pleasure from playing it either. Then, you're probably wondering why even continue band. Well, I'm just trying to justify the purchase of my expensive clarinet. The thing is, I just can't let something so expensive go so easily. I hate playing, I hate being worse than everyone else, I hate practicing, I would hate to let the money go to waste, so I trudge along, trying to justify the existance of my clarinet.

My clarinet rules my world. It's not fun.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I'm sick of all of the genre of noise that popular culture calls "rap".

I think Rap is just another dirty streak that human kind has to deal with it. The fact that most Rap supporters are African American just makes it worse. Ethnic diversity is needed in music genres. I don't see how African Americans can be proud of dancing to, reviewing, complementing, or otherwise supporting rap. The disgusting, pornographic nature of rap makes me cringe in disgust. The constant focus for existance for the people in these putred songs always seems to be related to sexual intercourse, drugs, partying, or... well, sexual intercourse.

The thing is, the bus I ride to and from school plays rap. This in itself is not really a problem. The fact that little children ride this bus is what is a problem.

With lines such as, "I want your dress to come down", "shake your body like a belly dancer" and "Don't you wish that your girlfriend was as fun as me" is sure to conjure up disturbing images of poverty-stricken, drug-addicted, alcoholic, violent African Americans taking part in public sexual intercourse. I'm not saying that all African Americans are like this. Although, the music the majority of the African American population supports reflects this stereotypical image.

Noise pornography is the "in" thing these days, I suppose. With catchy beats to ensnare you in its irrational lust. It's techno beats to the constant whine of heavy breathing and disgusting lyrics. I think this genre of "music" is so distasteful, it should be erased from society forever. Erased from the past, present, and future. Save the children from the rap that infests our radio stations, webcasts, and public transportation vehicles.

Call me conservative, but I believe that rap is worthless noise.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Wow, I only ate one meal today. A meal consisting of a meager ration of rice and a few tofu cubes.

I'm not exactly hungry. You can't be hungry when you've been working on homework for a five hours. There are some things that you just have to do. You can do without eating for a few weeks. You can't do without mowing the lawn or homework for a few weeks.

I'm nodding off and I can't focus. Performance will be affected tomorrow. All in the name of chemistry and integrity.

I feel like a dead carcass. I don't care what kind of carcass anymore. Motor control, iffy at best. Can't really remember things. Mind is woozy. Dizzyness ensuing. Hunger strike? More like "Hunger is not on my list of things to pay attention to"-ike. Derr...

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
My peers must write "pet peeve" speeches for their speech class. I take speech next semester, but like always, I want to rant on about my own "pet peeves."

People who don't take the time to understand the things you are saying infuriate me. I suppose you can call that a "pet peeve", right? Well, what I mean by not taking the time, I mean people who say, "English please?" or, "That word is too complicated for me." Alone, these phrases are harmless questions. But, this changes soon after proper context is applied.

For example, I could say, "fraudulent" and Joe Schmo would say, "That word is too complicated for me." This just makes me so angry that I want to whip out an aluminum bat and start smashing Joe Schmo's head in until cranial fluid gushes out and the rest of his body is a bloody pulp. A bloody pulp of organs, bodily fluid, and ripped skin. The word is three syllables for sake! If you can't learn the vocabulary of your first language, move to Mexico. I mean, how can I, a non-citizen, know more freaking English than Joe Schmo of the USA? It's a real "WTF" moment. At the risk of sounding extremely elitist, I want to say that there are many people who are unworthy of existance in this country. If I can't even be a citizen, why can complete morons continue to breed and pull down society in this way?

Not to mention how derrogatory these comments are to me. I mean, it says to me that Joe Schmo thinks that what I'm saying is too unimportant for him to understand. This hightens my sense of anger and visions of future retribution.

If another imbicile walks up to me and can't understand my lingo, I'm going to bash his/her head in.

*Note: The above threat was not meant to be directed at anyone in particular. All are equally considered as possible candidates for future head bashing ins.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Not sure what you're saying here...

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
The following is the rough draft for my English paper. I felt that it was non-Englishy enough to post here.

-------------------------------------
I'm a wreck when it comes to writing papers. A typical pre-assignment week consists of panic, terror, and self-incurred procrastination. Every single detail has to be perfect, but the details never are. So, it's no surprise that the very moment the rubric to another Lord of the Flies paper contacted my hands, I started worrying. Dread is a student's worst enemy, especially when dealing with the heavy symbolism and allegory William Golding put in his timeless novel. What was surprising though, was the convenient location of a topic involving irrational, rampant fear.
Soon, the topic of fear was bushed aside and forgotten. I was busy trying to brainstorm ideas, sort though events in the plot in a logical manner, and set a time frame for myself to accomplish this task. This hasty analysis of the paper was a “back of the mind” type of thought process at first, but soon the attention directed at the movie being played in class receded and my mind was filled with thoughts about this paper. My delicate insecurities about my writing skills and my place in class did not help with this. This quickly lead to rationalization and self-assurance. I eventually combated these thoughts and returned to watching the wonderfully monochrome film. Although I thought these paranoid thoughts seemed to be out of my head, there lurked a hidden fear of the unwritten word.
In time, I got home. The noise pandemic from the chaotic bus ride continued to buzz through my head. Along with the noise, I started to feel dread for the paper that I was planning to type that night. That night, I pushed my books and various writing utensils aside in an unfriendly gesture. The scheduled planning session was canceled. My mind seethed with hostility toward the paper. Although my rebellious attitude kept me from writing my paper, it didn't keep me from thinking of it. While in bed, the dreadful paper seemed to loom above me, as if I was possessed by a wicked spirit that happened to curse paranoid adolescents.
On Saturday, I began to ponder my state of affairs. With Labor Day weekend ahead, my sights were set on the joy of inactivity. Unfortunately, my mind was set on the paper. Three days of mental torture ensued. There were times where I was in my bedroom trying to think of a possible experience of mine to compare events in the Lord of the Flies. My mind would go in circles trying to chase after a non-existent idea. Attempted outlines and supposedly helpful “graphic organizers” ended up as crumpled balls of paper in my wastebasket. Hostility toward the paper grew as I tried to find the perfect topic. My nights were filled with fears of mediocre scores and ultimate academic failure.
Tuesday was another usual day of panic. There were labs, social cues, and worksheets to be accounted for. Regrettably, my day was sprinkled with a bit of extra educational terror. The English paper still brooded in my head. By the end of school, the blaring sirens were going off in my head. So, there I was, sitting in front of a clean sheet of notebook paper. I blankly stared at my wall, as if the answer would be written on it. Like magic, an idea popped into my head. I put two and two together and started writing about my incessant school fears.
Thinking about how all of this happened made me realize that my thought process was strikingly similar to how the boys on the island responded to “the Beast.” In the beginning, the small child with a birthmark mentions a “snake-thing” and fear is instilled in all of the boys. Although Ralph assures the boys of their safety, fear is still embedded within their small, insecure society. Like the boys, fear was infused into my mind once the paper was revealed. No matter how much I rationalized, the overwhelming intimidation of writing a paper remained. In their microcosm, the fear grew. A meeting is held in Chapter 5 to decide on the identity of “the Beast.” A conflict between Jack and Ralph ensues. Later, this conflict results in the death of Simon and Piggy. These are severe consequences for their irrational fear, just as my irrational fear created hours of unnecessary hypertension. The lesson illustrated both in my life, and in the novel is obvious. Fear is a hazard to be avoided. Efficiency cannot be achieved if fear rules life. Just as Ralph failed to maintain unity among the boys, I almost failed to find a topic for this paper. Do not let fear rule life.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Next, you will be submitting a blog entry for an English assignment...

RS

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Oh the golden ages of cartoons.

A few year back, we had Ren & Stimpy, Rocko's Modern Life, Swat Kats, and Captain Planet.

When I think back to all of those cartoons, one sticks out in my mind. Captain Planet was the most messed up show ever created.

There were obvious flaws in Captain Planet's theories and objectives. If everyone was to obey him and become his eco-slaves, then world economies would collapse, thousands more poverty stricken third world country residents would starve to death, and the societies and civilizations would collapse. Think about if we all decided to not to pollute for one day. Power plants would shut down, and life-sustaining electricity would evaporate away. Motors would churn to their silent stop. Life would halt, and people in hospitals, elevators, and the south and north would all be in risk of dying. Without pumps, there would be no water. Without electricity, there would be no respirators. Without pollution, we, as a civilization, would not be able to function. The people, deprived of their bells and whistles would revolt, society would collapse. A revolution would take place, and casualties would be in the hundreds of thousands. The end result would be a battlefield/wasteland of dead corpses and silent machinery.

Captain Planet and his Planeteers should be labeled as terrorists.

And what's with Ma-Ti, anyways? He's that South American Planeteer that has the power of "heart." Heart!? What kind of power is that? Somehow, his heart, a muscle used to push blood throughout the body, was able to telepathically send messages and tame animals. His power should be called, "Freakishly distorted anatomy from South America." Or, "Fight Badies with Cardiac Muscle." Or alternatively, "Freak, stoner-hippie from South America." Let me give you a picture of this dastardly absurd kid. Pft.


This is Ma-Ti. He has the power of heart.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I will now try to emulate the intricate and mysterious language patterns of an ordinary proletariat in today's society.
-----------------------------------
Fuckin' Ay'! Today was gay as a faggot fucktard that fucks. My homie, JJ, tried to crap out on a shitty deal on some fucking Mary Jane, but some kike took our fucking stash and fucked it all up. Shit! That was some fucked up stuff, man. Lata, we was pimpin' some ass-hoe some shit and shit happened! Fuck! We ran to like, our 'hood and chilled at JJ's crib, who's a ass fuck who can't fuck shit! Shit happens when you fuck shit up, but, shit, my gay lesson is that some faggot gays can fuck stuff up, so shut the hell up and don't be gay, fucker. Signing the fuck out...

Your fuckin' awesome as hell homie,

-M.K. Daddy<----OMG! Shit! I can't even speell my fucking first name! Fuckin' shit!
------------------------------------

Oh how dearly we need Marx and his crew to educate these poor proletariats.

Enough about communism and whatnot. More about other things.

Finding people who parallel the intelligence demonstrated above is easy, but exterminating them from society is hard. First of all, any economy needs these people. By ripping them off, cleverly hiding small print on credit card contracts, and by selling them services and products, we all profit. If we were to exterminate this corrupted strain of people, we would all suffer price hikes and increased competition in the job market. I suppose it would be beneficial for me to let these folks live their simple, debt-filled lives, but why not eliminate a few for future purposes? I mean, in the future, money will be obsolete and everyone will coincide together in ultimate harmony. On the other hand though, we could just create a devastating nuclear winter that slowly kills off our species and others. Well, for now, let's pretend that we won't all kill each other. The following are options for eliminating inferior strains of people: bridge pushing, car hitting, cannon shooting, mustard gassing, food poisoning, water poisoning, microwaving, brick throwing, mech crushing, stick impaling, KGB, scalpel slicing, laser cutting, cloth formaldehyding, blade dicing, hammer whomping, boulder rolling, grenade exploding, flag burning, bat whacking, face slapping, building jumping, snipers, and dish soap.

Of course, there's ethics to be taken into consideration. There's also supply and demand. We demand lots of lower-strained people, but we also have a large supply of them. I suppose by keeping them where they are, balance in the universe is achieved. Thus, we can all continue to practice fung shuei and meditate in zen gardens. So there I go again. I reasoned out my irrational ideas. Pft, my ideas are always stupid.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Bah.

I feel like melting into my seat, into a puddle of liquid flesh.

I don't feel like complaining about how much homework I have today because whenever I complain about how much homework I have, the whole complaining schpeel always seems to become more pointless. Plus, you probably have lots of homework too, so what's there to complain about?

Well, I gave my English paper to Erin to look at. She laughed at it, in a positive way.

You don't know how much making someone laugh means to me. I mean, if it's a joke, a cheap chuckle is happy doody, but entertaining someone with written words, well, it's just so fulfilling. It makes my whole life worth living to see someone else take pleasure in reading what I have to say. Erin may not have thought her action to be so deep, but it really is. I've felt good all day because of that tiny, little, inconceivably minute action. It's driven me into a state of euphoria. Well, perhaps not euphoria, but it sure has brightened up my day. I have purpose.

So, I suppose the lesson for today is, do a little something and get a lot back. Humanity repeats itself, and to be included in the ring of fulfillment you must do your share. Be nice to someone because it means so much.
