Having low workload usually works against me, as a test grade means the difference between failing and getting an A++.

Whatever this week has in store for me, I'll take it and move on.

Bring it.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
My schedule has been driving me up a wall, so to speak.

This afternoon, I hurriedly walk toward the cafeteria after gathering my large stack of books. Upon entering the cafeteria, I quickly find my seat, sit down, and open my Chemistry book. A pang of hunger hits me. Unfortunately, I had started to eat lunch again over the weekend. Thus, I was not as conditioned to non-lunch-eating as I was before this weekend. To satisfy my primal urge for food, I put down my books and adventured to the lunch line.

After waiting approximately 15 minutes in line, I realize that the end is near. Taking a tray and a fork, I ask the person serving the food for a bowl of pasta. She says there is none. I look down into the stainless steel containers and realize that there is indeed no more food left.

After a moment, I think to myself, "Just a salad. Not that bad. Could be worse..."

I take a few more steps forward to find the bin where they store salads empty. There is no yogurt either.

Empty.

Except for the lone bottle of water in the corner of the bin.

Figuring that I can stave off my hunger by drinking the water and pretending to eat food, I buy the sixty cent bottle of water. I put the bottle of water on my tray, next to the now obsolete fork, and walk back to my seat. The water helps me feel better, but the fact that I am locked into a position where I cannot get food even if I wanted to bothers me.

The window of opportunity is nonexistent for me now. This afternoon, my hopes and dreams of having a real lunch were shattered, ground into a million pieces, incinerated, and put in concrete containers buried deep beneath the surface of Yucca Mountain.

So there's my day for you. Full of angst, just like I like it.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I talk to myself too much.

I noticed this a few hours ago, as I sat on a cold, abandoned seat in front of the school. The air was dry and crisply cold. Snow was falling and collected on my clothes, books, and hat. I was sitting there because my parents hadn't picked me up from Robotics yet.

An hour passes. The snow is up to the top of the soles on my shoes. The cold is beginning to really bother me. My face is numb, and my bare khakis are frozen to the seat, making it very difficult to move. The tips of my fingers are as cold as what they are touching, the cold steel bars that make up the seat.

Time passes. Thirty more minutes. Then I really start talking to myself. The conversation proceeds in short little quips. Back and forth arguments between myself. These arguments start out sane and bi-lateral, but soon, all the views are one sided. My procrastinating, depressed, angry side triumphs in this time of cold. My shaking intensifies as my body tries to warm itself.

Fifteen more minutes pass. By this time, I absolutely hate myself. I'm trying to talk myself into running into the forest near the school and hiding somewhere until I either die or am found. I begin to convince myself that today is "the day" that something different is going to happen, something so inconceivable that no one will expect it of me. I tell myself that the fact that my parents haven't come to get me is a sign that they have "abandoned" me. I sit there in a frozen stupor, not making much sense at all, but all the while believing.

My transportation finally arrives.

And now I'm sitting at home, still awake at this ungodly hour with a speech to write, a book to read, and a worksheet to complete. Today is tuesday. This means that I have more than half the week to go through. I'm exhausted, and I already know that I'll be even more exhausted tomorrow. For the first time in my life, I am waking up to every "morning" (It feels like night, it's pitch black outside at 5:45am) a bleary mess. For the first time, I am just not functioning correctly. But, not for the first time am I thinking absurd thoughts. I've been doing that for ages.

I hate myself. Andrew said that I do this all to get attention. This may be true. If it is, I hate myself. Then this hate perpetuates sympathy for myself. This sympathy perpetuates self-contempt. It's a vicious cycle.

I hate myself.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
there is no need to hate yourself. you have friends and seem to know a lot of people. you are smart and seem to be well rounded, so if i ever hear you say that again i'm going to attack you at school with a hug, dammit!

-sam

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Wednesday, the middle day. Some even call it by the name of "hump day".

I think of it as "Chemistry homework is burning gaping holes in my corneas" day.

For now, the gaping holes are slowly repairing themselves. I've finished what I've got to have finished, but I don't have time to work ahead like I would like to. At the moment, I'm typing up a speech, and am getting ready to go downstairs to turn on the network printer so I can print out all my junk.

The hard drive came today. Pretty routine installation. But, I realized that I only have one SATA cable, but now have two hard drives. It was truely a "Doh!" moment for me. So, I'm planning to go out and get a cable sometime this week. Not that it would matter. I'm so overwhelmed with homework and other school-related things that I hardly have time to even touch the big computer downstairs.

But, to tell you the truth, I touched my big computer downstairs a lot today. I wonder how many people just read that and thought... never mind.

Today, I took the desktop to school so Alex could install 3dsMax on it. Hopefully, he'll send me a key to the program soon. I also hope that someday I'll have the time to work on the animation. But then again, being the only one really "into" the animation, I've got the added responsibility to "make time". If that means staying up until midnight (like I am going to have to tonight), then so be it. I'm willing to suffer to better the team.

Bah. My mind is suffering. I can't even remember what I learned in French today. It should be noted that I failed another of the pop French quizzes that happen to come up every once in awhile. Those things always shred me, in terms of my grade. Because there is never any homework in French, I'm probably failing the class due to that quiz. The whole "boo-hoo, woe is me" schpeel is getting too old. I guess I'm becoming desensitized to my abysmal French grades. Eventually, I'll end up being some failure that lives on the streets in a tattered nightgown.

It'll be midnight in a few more minutes. Then, I'll start thinking of sleeping. I can't let myself think of sleep or else I'll get tired. Work, work, work.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
My eyes hurt from all the light I've seen this week.

The hours that have been severed from my sleeping time are now spent staring into this computer screen or on homework. My room contains eight light sources. Thusly, my room is very bright. All the time I spend in the room I spend looking at brightly lighted objects.

I tried to call a number of stores today to see if they had SATA cables. To my misfortune, they were all closed.

Russell spent the whole time after school explaining to me how he always got the BEST results Chemistry class, and how it was ALL HIS PARTNER'S fault that he obtained faulty data for his lab. Not to mention how he has the FASTEST flash drive that he got for the CHEAPEST price. Man, can that kid brag. I absolutely hated it. I wanted to pull out a bat and whack him to a bloody pulp. I mean, I can understand calling your partner distracted, but to go out of your way to tell everyone that you "always obtain the best results" is a bit too arrogant.

Oddly enough, when a superior comes in, he suddenly becomes "Mr. Nice", and becomes a humble, generous, and modest student. He always asks questions and uses as much jargon as he can to impress the superior. Personally, his tactics to gain social turf infuriate me, but I guess I'm giving him a hard time. I have to understand that there will always be people who push down their subordinates to boost their own ego, and will lie about "who" they really are to reach to the top. I guess I should be thanking Russell for helping me realize that the world is a mean, cutthroat place.

But, something positive he did today, he complemented my Blender hotkey usage. That made me smile a little.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
My "to-do" list for the weekend:

1) Get some sleep. (This goal is going to be the most difficult)
2) Get more art up.
3) Start the Robotics animation modeling.
4) Finish homework.
5) Study for tests.

Blah. I really don't think I'll get them all done. Since goal number five is the most important, I really should be focused on that the most. I've got three hard "I've been waiting two months reviewing in class" tests that are going to include lots of knowledge. I hope to regain this lost knowledge this weekend so I can get good grades on the tests.

In other news, I'm a raving lunatic that lacks the capacity to come up with text. It's a few minutes before midnight, and I'm telling myself that I'm supposed to be tired, but I'm jazzed. My mind is blank, but my body can't stop moving around and fidgeting. I guess this is what happens to individuals that are subjected to stress, excitement, and mundane routine all at the same time.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I can sleep and do my work later, or do my work later and sleep little. The choice is mine to make and I figure that the first choice is the most efficient.

Although, doing my work later bothers me. The stress from having a pile of work to do sitting on the couch next to my bed usually keeps me from having a good night's sleep. On the other hand, if I went out of my way and did not sleep to get all the work done, I would be tired as well. I see it as a lose-lose situationf or me. Either way, I end up hating myself, humming the "I want to shoot myself in the leg" (alternatively called the "Jump off a cliff" song), and complaining to someone that doesn't exist (the readers of this). Even now, I'm seething with anger, resentment, and self-hate. Partially because I have spent about thirty minutes looking for a CD that I still haven't found. It's driving me nuts. My "Asian Kung-Fu Generation" CD has gone missing. I really want to listen to it. I absolutely hate it when I have an opportunity to use something I own, but can't due to my own stupidity. I suppose that's why I'm in this mood right now.

I look at the little post-it note on my desk with tomorrow's to-do list on it. It's bothering me. Like a festering wound in my black-hole of a soul, the to-do list sits in my face, uncompleted. I only have one day to do it. I easily get distracted. It is imperative that I get it all done. It'll be a hit-or-miss situation.

Please make me hit.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I was able to cross out three out of the seven goals for today on my postie that I have stuck to my desk. It's crucial for me to complete the other four tasks in the next thirty minutes or so.

Right now, I'm trying to solve the delima of somehow being able to take my very small flash drive to school without losing it. The flash drive itself is the size of half of my thumb, and my thumb is statistically smaller than average. I figure that the only solution to this problem is either duct taping the darned thing to my arm, or putting a string through the little hole on the top of it and wearing it around my neck. Luckily for my arm, I've chose the later option.

Usually, I turn my stereo on and that's how I listen to music when I'm in my room. This is because the stereo has three large speakers that surround my room, compared to two built-in speakers for my laptop, and two weak speakers for my alarm-clock radio. Today, I decided to change it up a bit by playing my music through the speakers on my laptop. Through this change, I have discovered something very facinating. The speakers for my laptop are located beneath the plastic that I rest my wrists on while I type. The neat thing about this is that the music vibrates through the plastic so I can "feel" the music. Although the bass is weak, its a brand new experience. Something new, I guess. I'm not sure if it's worth mentioning, but who cares?

I have overcome a major hurdle for my rendering endeavors. I can now get a model in Blender to import as a model in 3ds Max. Although, I still despise 3ds for some reason. I'm trying to keep an open mind, but it's hard. I find myself squinting to make out the poorly laid out, wigety user interface. I guess a 3ds Max user could say the same thing about Blender, so I suppose beauty (or in this case, UI perfection) is in the eye of the beholder.

I just realize that I don't dream anymore.

Am I supposed to be scared?

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Inside my mind:

What if...

Time stopped, and I was trapped in a period of very slow time?

Whenever I think of this, I imagine the world around me turn grey, and sound stop. I view it as if it were an old film that crawls through the projector of the universe. The whole fantasy starts out in band class, as I look out the window, music becomes noise, and noise becomes a whisper, eventually being swallowed by the depths of eternity. Silence, and the colors around me go away, leaving only monochrome shells of once moving people. And I ask myself, what would I do?

For a time, I usually walk around and think to myself, is this really happening? And occasionally, I see something interesting, like a family gathered around a dinner table, or a man throwing a coin into a Salvation Army container. I travel the world, as there are no more limits to space, traveling to random locations on Earth. The world lacks life, and as the color slowly fades from myself, I find myself drifting toward the band room again. I sit back down in my chair and think to myself of all the things that could have happened, but didn't. And I think of the people I could have met, but didn't. And I think of all kinds of things like this. Over time, I realize that maybe it really doesn't all matter anymore. If it ends, it ends. The world moves on.

And when I finally realize this, color returns to the world and I again see the beige walls and the peachy tones of my peers. The sky turns a brilliant blue, and the ground a earthy tone of brown. And motion returns. The flick of the wrist returns to the band director, and slowly the Earth begins to again rotate. Sound returns, and the once empty air is now filled with pleasing vibrations.

Life comes back, and I wake up.

Was the whole scene created by my delusional mind, or is it a message to myself?

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
It's Tuesday.

I'm tired.

There are lots more days to go.

My chemistry test made me sad.

I can't give up.

Please, I can't let myself give up.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I finish talking to my friends at the east corner of the school. Andrew's locker shuts, we all say our temporary farewells, and part. Alone, I arrive to my own locker. I mumble a few incoherent words, pack my backpack with more books than it can hold, mumble some more, take a few books by hand, and get all my equipment strapped on. With hat on head and Chemistry book in hand, I attack the hallways with the shuffle of my loose feet. My legs barely make it up the stairs, and the linoleum floors gleam back at me, smiling.

I don't smile back.

Opening the door to the robotics study room, I find myself alone. I sit down, mumble some more absurdity, and unload all my troubles and frustrations on my desk. After a few hard smacks on the desk, I feel a little better, and start to pile my books one on top of the other, making a nice pseudo-symetrical pyramid on the desk. A stack of papers as thick as my hand sit in front of me, waiting to be sorted, written on, and finished. I start.

After what seems like three math problems later, Rus walks through the door and offers his greetings. I reply with a quip salutation. He sits down with a quaint whine of the desk on the beige floor. We talk.

Talk about things about character, what makes a person, and for a limited time, politics. We settle in the studying atmosphere and I get my math done in reasonable time. Rus stays on his math assignment while I pull my Chemistry out. He says something. I don't catch it and asked him for what he said. He says something about personal ego problems, and characterizes my tendancy to insult myself a primitive coping mechanism. This does not bother me. For quite some time, I've subconsciously understood my reasons behind my idiotic behavior.

He mentions that people talk behind my back about how I make other feel bad through insulting myself.

It hits me like a moose that just realized that it really doesn't need a hat rack. I am exactly like Rus. And it wrenches my stomach the wrong way. My mind grinds to a halt as I realize my failure to comprehend my selfishness.

All this time, just like Rus. Shooting myself in the foot to get people to turn and look. Making people feel bad. And it makes me want to crawl up in a ball and die.

All this time, just like Rus. Hating myself to make others like me. Selfish, foolish, idiotic.

All this time, just like Rus. Denouncing myself in a desperate attempt to compensate for my own troubles. It disgusts me.

All this time, why?

The previous thoughts, all come together to form one big, cohesive mesh.

So, I suppose the course of action I take now is all dependent on myself. I must stop being such an self-denouncing imbecile. Inside, I know it's a sick, twisted, irrational attempt to make myself feel better through the power of pity. This is bad. According to my sources, I hurt other people.

Maybe someday, I won't be a failure at life. Someday, I hope to do less damage than good.

If that day comes, this paradox will end and I will feel better.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
My new initiative to be more positive has been attempted today.

With what strength I could muster, I was positive for a total of thirty minutes in Chemistry today. And was it an experience. The sensation of being happy after being assigned more work was exhilarating. The paper that once cued disappointment now cued joy. Although my grades were sub-par, I saw the world as still being very much the same. Things were dandy, my mind was clear, life was happy, and Andrew smiled at me.

And I smiled back.

Wonderful. Marvelous. But, the rush was soon to end.

School ends with a bang. But, more like a gripping, striking, monotone, synthetic noise. I walk down the stairs to get my things, go to the QuizBowl meeting room, and am ignored. This doesn't really bother me until I'm about fifteen minutes into the bus ride to some faceless, faraway high school. My peers ignore me, so I decide to ignore myself. I go into stand-by mode and fall asleep. An hour, a banana, and some miles later, I'm awakened by someone shaking my shoulder. I get off the bus.

At this point, I'm fuming from who knows what. Really, my anger had no reason at all to exist. So there I am, fuming, drowzy, frustrated, and glum, walking down some hallway in a godforsaken school in the middle of a cornfield to play some silly game involving trivia and buzzers. Who the hell am I?

The whole incident seems like a dream to me right now. And to think, the world moves on as I ponder how to elongate my positivism.

Maybe I'll aim for 45 minutes tomorrow.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
The window is dark, but the room is bright.

It's an hour from being midnight, and I'm supposed to be sleeping right now. This, right now, this time that I have sitting on my desk with me, is the time that I am supposed to be using for making up for lost sleeptime. Sleeping 5 hours a day for the past week has worn me down, so why am I sitting in my office chair with the oldies radio station blaring from my stereo?

Well, the fact of the matter is that my biological clock has been skewed. Now, I begin to feel sleepy only at 11PM, start falling asleep at midnight, but still awake at 5AM each day. The long-term effects of this behavior has yet to be determined. I'm sure that it will be determined by the end robotics season.

My english essay has yet materialized from thin air. I'm still waiting for it to come into being. It's not doing so. This frustrates me.

Recently, I think someone told me that I broke 7,000 visitors or something. And occasionally, people will mention this site when I'm talking to them. Normally, this bothers the hell out of me. But, now I've accepted the inevitable. I've accepted the fact that people will read the words that I type out and publish. Right now, at this very moment, I realize that there will come a time when my words will be used against me, but who really cares? I really shouldn't even censor or pay attention to what I say. What I have to say is what I have to say. If I hate someone, why shouldn't I say so? It's *other* peoples' decision to read this nonsense. The responsibility lay not with me.

So, my plan of action for this weekend will be this.

1) Obsess over the completion of my English essay.
2) Worry about the possibility of grammatical errors in my essay.
3) Muddle my way through words to finally get a rough draft of my essay.
4) Finish the essay.
5) Shred the essay to pieces in a blinding rage against English class.
6) Feel stupid after realizing that I wasted paper.
7) Go to robotics feeling stupid after realizing that I wasted paper.
8) Print out my essay again.
9) Feel guilty about the paper wasting incident.
10) Delete and restart english essay after realizing that it sucks.
11) Go back to step one.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Like magic, the English essay appeared before my eyes. Before it disappeared, I was able to snatch it from the air and print it out.

Success.

I still have a lot of things to do though. These things include the Robotics animation, reading ten chapters of "A Tale of Two Cities", studying for chemistry, drawing random things, and Blendering.

Other news, other news...

I tried to decide on my schedule for next year a few minutes ago. I look at the list of classes, and it's daunting. Wrong choices mean a year's worth of misery, or a year's worth of paradise. I've learned to never again take the Business classes or Technology classes. My ultimate goal of never taking an art class in high school limits my selection further. Agriculture and Family and Consumer Science classes are out of the question. That gives me a very limited selection of classes, them being science, math, english, and history. The cores of education, so to speak.

I've heard about the "MySpace.com" episode of today's Dateline NBC. The article can be found here:

http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/11064451/

I think it talked about how myspace.com is dangerous, and how kids end up being corrupted by such a dangerous tool, pedophiles end up killing the kids, blah, blah, blah. The usual, stuff, you know? Well, my personal opinion is that those kids who are stupid enough to not realize that other people are reading what they post should be stalked down and brutally murdered. A la natural selection. So, for this reason, I do not sympathize with such victims. I hope they died a horrible death. They deserve it for using such inferior netware.

But, other than my silly little viewpoints on this issue, what bothers me is that this is exactly the kind of stuff that gets technologically-challenged parents riled up, scared, and enraged. I know that there are thousands of parents who are using their AOL parental controls to tighten up security because of this episode of Dateline. I am absolutely against parental controls. I would have NEVER learned all the things I know about computers and computer-affiliated things if my parents were sticklers about what could and couldn't be accessed. Through trial and error, downloading lots of crap that I shouldn't have, messing around in menus, talking to strangers on forums, chatting away with strangers in tech chat rooms, I now manage all the computers in my house. Full control is mine. But, where would I be today if my parents were early adopters of the "Net Nanny" software? I would probably be much more ignorant than I am now. I would not have discovered my hobbies, I would not have discovered who I am and what I like to do. What a horrible thing it would be if the future I live today was destroyed. But, it's happening to kids all around the country. America is about freedom, right? Parental controls belong in China.

I guess parent advocates could defend their case by calling parental controls a wall of "security". But, I would rather have a slightly risky, but intelligent child, rather than an ignorant, protected one. I mean, with parental controls, the freedom does not exist to learn. I know so many people that haven't been able to grasp the computer because their parents cripple the potential of the computer because of irrational fear. The fear comes from shows like these that are meant to boost ratings and get more people to watch the network. This purpose is accompished well, but a byproduct is fear.

I am rather grateful for being such an "unprotected" youth.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
So like.. you're saying that if a 12 year old girl is killed by a petifile who convinced her that he was a 12 year old girl who went to the same school and they were just gonna meet after school to play some soccer, than the 12 year old girl is an idiot and should die. And this petifiles not a scumbag at all? He's just helping natural selection.. I grow confused Ryo...


PS I'm going to burn your sweatpants and replace them with khakis, is that cool with you?
I clutch my sweatpants dearly.

I guess it all differs from situation to situation. Although, if we're talking a 17 year old dumba** jock, oh, by all means.

Let's not threaten the Holy Sweatpants, please.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Note: Weekend project (Public Transportation) for this weekend has been completed. Check the "my Art" link to see it.

On a positive note, I'm updating for the first time in a long time before 9PM. This is a big step for me, to get my biological clock closer to normal.

The new hard drive I installed a bit ago is working flawlessly. Right now, I'm voraciously putting multimedia content on it as I type.

Other than that, today was mostly a work-day. Working on random Robotics things, working on homework, working on my weekend project, working on resetting my biological clock, working on my schedule for next year, work, work, work.

And to think, not "real" work. Not one of my friends is going to do summer school classes. Many are not because they are going to get jobs. I kind of feel left out, but I guess that my first job is school. I'm sure some place would hire me, but I guess I'm too good for them. That and me not being a citizen and all. Yeah, that thing.

I'm going to draw something now.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I presented my speech today in *gasp* speech class today. I think I did pretty well, considering that everyone had positive comments on it.

But, as I sat down after the speech, and the class clapped, and some people voicing their positive comments at me, I somehow felt like a plastic toy. An artificial plaything that is being manipulated by those who come near me. I speak so strongly in front of a crowd, but in small groups, I'm usually quiet. Or, at least that's how I see myself. For all I know, I might be the loudest person in my class and I'm just too shortsighted to realize this. I sometimes look at myself, and what I see is completely different from how I really am. I guess the details of life are in the eye of the beholder.

And so, after giving my speech, I sit down in the dinky, plastic desk, and people are still making comments about my speech, and people keep talking, and I feel selfish for getting all the attention, and feel bad for all the unprepared people sitting in the corner who are going to have to go after me. So, the general roar of the class starts to meld into a thick, but acceptable whisper. And life goes on.

I walk out of class, light headed from the rush of giving a speech, voice hoarse from speaking louder than I normally do, hands shaking from the excitement of giving a good speech. And as I walk out of class and dissipate into the crowd, I feel like s plastic toy that just ran out of batteries.

For the next few hours, I spend my mundane day murmuring to myself about how the day is going to get better.

It doesn't.

It never does.

But, Chemistry ended my day with a dull slap. I get a quiz over a chapter that is very easy. I turn it in, with a bit of doubt. The quiz itself is very small, five multiple-choice questions. After taking the quiz, Tif lets me read her poems, which is a big step for her, she's usually shy about that kind of thing. But, this action is quite an important one for me too. Life's all about trust, and if people trust me, it enables me to feel just a little bit better about myself, as a person. Tif showing me her poems says that she has a tiny inkling of trust given to me, like a gift. To me, it's like a little, shiny present that's always growing. That moment, right then in Chemistry class, was my highlight of the day. Another cherished present to take care of.

As I talk to friends, I unfortunately realize that I missed a few questions on my quiz, thus causing me to fail (missing "a few" questions on a five question quiz=failure). My failure causes me to get angry, act stupid, and make a fool of myself by making such a big deal out of it. Afterwards, like now, I feel very self-centered for caring that much and expressing my misery to other people. Who do I think I am, the center of the universe? It disgusts me how I still do this. I should accept the fact that I am an eternally failing, always-wrong human being.

I must to begin familiarizing myself with this fact.

But, I'll hold onto my presents for the time being.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I'm afraid of something I shouldn't be afraid of. Something that's going to come about no matter what I do, no matter how much I cower in the corner.

Minutes, days, months, they pass by, uncountable in numbers, in endless varieties and flavors. Each one, being logged, but they still seem to disappear into nothingness. Nothing matters anymore besides the fact that my watch is still changing it's display, and that every second that I ponder the next word for this sentence has just slipped from my weak grip on reality. Think about it, every second, it's closer to the end. Life is just one big countdown until decomission, upon which, you are burned to ashes, remaining elements scattered onto the Earth, mourned for a few months, and then forgotten about. The thing that you thought was important. The thing that you've planned out, worked so hard for. The very thing that has driven humanity from its humble beginnings to where it is now is so very short. It's easy for me to understand that in the future, there will be no trace of me, physical or mental, but it is hard for me to accept this. So very hard.

And it's a wonder why there aren't cluster suicides every other day at school.

I read about them in my health book, while suffering from the wrath of stereotypical, poorly-structured public education. To alleviate my boredom, I turned to the chapter on suicide and depression. Ironically, the whole chapter makes me a tad bit worse off, emotionally. But, cluster suicides, you can guess what they are.

So, I'm sitting there in health class and a group of girls are talking about how they are going to get their driver's licenses and drive to Florida for spring break, or something like that. After reading about the depression and whatnot, I was feeling kind of bad, and even though I knew that such a plan to go to Florida without parents was sure to fail, absurd as it is, it still made me feel even worse, that I couldn't go too. Somewhere deep inside of me, I wanted to go somewhere else too. But, I *knew* in my head that this was not a rational decision. But, still. A trace of passion to be free.

A passion and want to be free, free from humdrum schedules, free from the structured routine of every day, of every week, of every month. Free from French class, free from grades, free from social conformity, free from what I now know so well as "life". My dream, to just drift around the world as an ethereal being, carrying no worries, no appointments, and no obligations. And so I escape from my perfect world, my idealistic universe of fantasy, and my dream remains a dream for the time being,

as it's not reasonable for such a dream to ever come true.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Rage. Rage against society, rage against work, rage against play, rage against life, rage against death, rage against the conformist, and rage against the nonconformist.

It's general rage. The kind of rage that slowly attaches itself to your innards and grows. The kind of rage that drains your energy, while instilling more into a delusional mind. The kind of rage that hinders homework. More specifically, my English homework.

Reading the book assigned to me for English and answering the questions sounds easy. It really does. Just reading text, and answering straightforward questions about so-and-so character right? Well, it's not so easy if one is stuck in a mental rut, unable to escape the grasp of one's own troubled mind. Troubled with an unknown anger against something that doesn't exist. Irrational anger against nothing. But, it still frustrates me. I'm not angry at my English homework. I understand why it has to be done. I'm not mad at any person, not mad at an idea or concept, not mad against an institution, or a place, or a even a tangible thing. I have no idea what I'm angry about, but all I know is that I walked into my house an hour ago with the intent to finish my English homework. It's not getting done. I have a math test on Friday too. If I put off my English for another day, I don't think I'll be able to sleep tomorrow. And my Algebra grade was devastated by the last test I took.

Ok, it's decided. I'm going to finish my English no matter how late I have to stay up. This means that I may not sleep tonight.

Wait, I'm not so angry anymore. No more rage.

I guess I was angry at myself the whole time.

Figures.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Happy Thursday!

I looked at my watch and just realized that it changed to a new day. It's really weird to get no sleep, because one just continues one giant day with the same thing happening twice. Currently, I see white blotches in my eye every once in awhile, and I can't type right very well. I also can't do thinking and whatnot. I think the longest recorded time of not sleeping was 11 days, with no drugs. How difficult. So, one night of lost sleep doesn't hurt, right?

The window in my room is a giant sea of black with lots of pretty dots and sometimes I feel like I'm falling even though I'm standing up. And words, I forget what things are called. I stared at my pencil for a few minutes because I forgot what it was called.

Humans are versatile, right? So what's a nights really worth in the 21st century?

I'm droozy.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Is 'droozy' another word for high?
Hm... I think that with all the taxes in place a night used to be about $39.48 before the war. But now that gas prices are up, it's now about $53.92.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I think there is a time to work, and a time to not work. Right now would be a time to work, specifically allocated in my schedule for working, and what am I doing? I'm sitting here typing this, browsing the multitudes of forums that I lurk, checking the news of subcultures and topics I am interested in, and refreshing web browser windows like crazy. My homework sits beside me right now, not finished. The books stagnantly occupy space in my backpack, not being opened for studying. My watch display is changing rapidly. To top it all off, my mind is fritzed from the no-sleep thing I've got going on. My response time is supposedly comparable, or worse than, a drunken git, according to a number of articles I"ve read on the Internet about sleep deprivation. I think that I'll recover once I collapse at school sometime next week.

But, surprisingly, I can think coherent thoughts right now even though my sleep has been severely restricted. I still know how to type, still know how to create sentences.

This not sleeping thing is working out better than I thought. Maybe I should do it more often. Productivity is limited, but any productivity is better than none, as it is when one is sleeping.

I turn my head to the left and realize that my homework is staring me in the face.

I turn my head to the right and see the display on my radio show me how late it is.

I turn my head up, and realize that I've got to get work done.

Leaning back in the chair, I figure out that maybe, instead of typing this out, I should do my homework so I don't fail school.

Great. Now that I've written it here, I have to do it.

I feel like a slave to my own words.

So be it.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Happy Friday!

Great, pulling yet another all-nighter.

I guess that means I've been awake since the day before yesterday. That's a long time, don't you think?

I can't think anymore.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I've got less than half an hour before this day, Friday the third of the second month, will end. This means that I have less than half an hour to post, my deadline.

Right now, I don't know how I'm awake. In the past few days, I haven't slept. And so my sleep debt grows larger and larger. I really can't figure out how I'm still moving right now. One would figure that something as essential as sleep is... well, essential.

Will I challenge a fourth day? A fifth? My lifetime?

But, it seems like I have no choice. So the answer would be the last one. I have to say, my purist work ethic will be the end of me.

Now, there's a speech to be written, a book to be finished, a worksheet to be written upon, a test to be studied for, and an animation to render.

But, am I getting anything done if I can't feel emotions anymore? What is reality but what one feels? My mind is dull with time. My hands shake even more than they usually do. I can't focus my eyes on one spot and do things efficiently anymore.

So, my life's a cycle of doom. I have to get things done, so I stay up. Staying up makes me get things done at a slower pace, so I have to stay up even longer. So on and so forth. Blah. Not good.

Or is it?

I can't even tell anymore

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
I have been reading your blog for a few weeks now. Come and check mine out,

http://spaces.msn.com/frankthedaddy

its worth checking if you can't sleep.
Ryo, you REALLY need to get some sleep. I will physically knock you out if I have to.
got SLEEEEEEPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPP??????????zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz if not, get it!

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
My instrument never did grow on me.

The magic of creating noise from a vibrating reed strapped to a narrow wooden tube only lasted a few months for me. Starting seventh grade, I began to neglect my clarinet practice. By eigth, I didn't take my clarinet home at all. The magic wore off, like a lost hope. I had first chair for a bit, then second, and then third. My grip on musical superiority slipped, and I've never regained the friction needed to sustain my interest in such things.

So today, at this "Solo & Ensemble" dealie that's at my school, everything went as planned, the thing our band has rehearsed for for the past few months, the very thing that has probably consumed more of my life than reading A Tale of Two Cities, was practically worthless. The time, flittered into the darkest reaches of nothingness. Because, the performance was over in a matter of minutes, we got the rating that the judges always give, gold. The whole practicing for months for the performance was a bunch of nonsense. The judges give out gold medals to any team that doesn't look like terrorists.

Great, now I said terrorists. I might as well say "bomb". Now the NSA is going to flag this site and I'm going to be taken away to Gitmo. Just my cup of tea, I'm telling ya'. Good thing I have no problems with religious scriptures being flushed down toilets. That's one thing that I can safely say that I will not get upset about in such a place.

And so, my clarinet playing is done for. Next year, I'm not taking band, and I say, "Good riddance!" Because I will never again enjoy making music, and I will never take pleasure in extracting a beat from random-ish patterns of dots on paper. The way I see it, the world should exterminate all high school bands in existance and turn them into synthesizer and guitar classes. People see classical music as well, "classy". But, what is class but an illusion set up by society, and our culture. In three hundred years from now, country music could be "classy", or techno could be "classy". Music is just a pattern of waves that the brain puts back together and interprets. And, I'm sure that many people listen to classical music only because it's "classy". Just like people who carry big books around and pretend to read them, just to seem smart. Or people who just buy the books and put them on their shelves as "decoration".

Personally, I don't think classical music is all that "classy". It's all so primitive. Mallets, hammers, strings, human lung exhaust, reeds. They're all ages old. And yet people treasure them so. For what reason? It could be the fact that we are born and raised to see this kind of music to be very rich. The romantic-seeming, or expensive setting scenes in movies and television always have the signature jazz or classical music. In an ideal world, pianos come with men in tuxedos. But, the ideal world is what we tell ourselves, the stereotypes we create, the generalizations that are broadcast to every corner, every crevice, and every nook of society.

Maybe I should give up music again. The whole subject just makes me just a bit confused, angry, and tired. Plus, I heard that music slows down reading, and I seriously have to get through my English literature book reading assignment this weekend.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Actually it speeds up reading. You can always keep it as a past-time and not take it seriously in any way, shape, or form. That always works.

Just remember the words of Severus Snape: "I'm too sexy for your party."

Flash cartoons WILL ruin your soul.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
My demonstration speech is coming up, a much more challenging speech than my previous two. My previous two speeches, my "introduction speech" (which wasn't even a real speech), and my "pet peeve" speeches have been easy because they involve something that can be discussed as long as needed, or as short as needed. I could rant for hours about my life, or just give you the basic facts. On the other hand, my demonstration speech involves something that takes a long time to explain to the layperson. It took me two weeks to get into the spin of Blender and 3d computer graphics. It took me another few weeks to purchase, read, re-read, and notate my Blender Guide book. Now, I'm trying to paraphrase those countless hours into about eight minutes. I have to make it understandable to the layperson as well, not to mention presenting it without technical difficulties (classroom situations usually don't bode well for electronics, school just has a bad aura). So, as I scan the speech that I wrote this weekend, I realize that I'm going to have to read like a maniac to get through it before the 8 minute maximum time limit.

But, I'm grateful that I've garnered enough trust from Alex and the crew that I can borrow and use the robotics team laptop for my presentation. However, I must be very careful with it. If something goes wrong, the blame falls on me, and with it goes the trust.

In other news, my robotics team animation is taking a *long* time to render. One scene took about 26 hrs. I have 6 scenes. I'm pretty sure it's because I made everything ultra smooth (which means thousands of unneeded vertices), and also have antialiasing set to 16 (which means 16 "passes", or pre-renders before the final rendered frame comes about). I hope to have all the scenes rendered by this tuesday, upon which I can work on audio.

In other news, my sister doesn't understand the intricacies of Windows Media Player. How pitiful... Maybe I should help her.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
There was a scheduled outage for Blogger servers at 10PM tonight, lasting an hour. Because of this, I am now tired and up too late to write a long article about how my life is horrible, etc.

The animation must be re-rendered, and because of this I am slightly frustrated. I'm sure that in the future, hardware will not be the issue. When hardware becomes so fast that it poses no restriction on human productivity, the next issue will be software. Then, the only thing that would restict work would be the human mind itself. How would one conquer such a restriction. With computers clocking in at thousands of terrahertz, and software designed by millions of open-source programmers, the world would be quite a place, wouldn't it?

Once one is their only restriction, life suddenly becomes a big puzzle to figure out one's self. Without knowing yourself, how are you going to beat yourself at something?

I'm tired. Pay no heed to my incoherent thoughts.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I just want to cry or jump off of a high building, or both at the same time.

For the last hour or so, I have stared at one chemistry problem trying to understand it. I have yet to do so. And I continued on for an hour, in a desperate attempt to comprehend the words that sat in front of me.

The words taunt me.

And I tell myself that if I stare at it long enough that the answer will appear before me. But, that's never how it works. An hour. Of my sleep. Or my life. Gone. Because I'm incompetent and have defective critical thinking.

And allthewhile knowing that I'll come to school tomorrow and everyone besides me will have figured it out, saying that the worksheet is easy. And every time someone does that to me tomorrow, I'll feel like a part of me just withered away and died. Because every second of that hour I spent staring aimlessly at the stupid problem could have been an hour working on my endless amounts of other homework, or the seconds could have been spent cleaning my room, or spent drawing, or spent sleeping, or spent preparing for my tests.

But, that's not how it happened.

Now, I will forever have to live with the fact that I wasted that hour of my life. Dedicated it to a lost cause. Dedicated it to something that should be very easy and that everyone will understand, except me.

And still, I sit here and get angrier and more frustrated about that one hour. And my frustration gets me frustrated even further. To think that the time I spend here typing this out could be time spent typing my English paper out, or a number of other things that have to be done tonight, besides sleeping. And usually, I feel better about things after I type them out, but right now I'm just feeling helpless and angry and confused and lost and disappointed and sad. For that one hour, I will feel guilty for five hours. For that one hour, it is not only an hour lost, but hours off of my life from the inevitability that my death will be instigated by myself.

It's futile really. The whole thing. The whole thing that surrounds me. The thing that I would like to call reality. I'm a mess. I could see myself killing myself at some point in my life. Eventually. Probably during middle age, or something like that. If I get this mind-racketed from a chemistry problem, think about how I would respond to a deadline for thousands of such problems.

Things seem like big mess. Things sometimes clean themselves up, but entropy rules my life. Right now at least. And I still have to finish that one chemistry question.

It sits there. On my table. That question makes me feel bad.

It watches me.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I find it an exciting challenge to get through the day. I'm crossing the finish line right now. In the last twenty minutes of today, I'm typing up this post to quantify today in a string of words. Without this string, there would be no record that today even happened, and if too many days that aren't recorded come to pass, it's like life isn't worth living anymore. Because where is the future if there was no past?

And so I return to reality. From the eternal lethargy that cannot escape me. It's a chronic thing now. No use trying to make up for the lost sleep. I'm planning to do that over the summer. That's the only time I'll be able to do it. My workload is too much of a burden to justify sleeping more than five hours each night. I reserve the weekend to practice speeches, study, and finish English projects, as well as some quick personal renders and Robotics. The weekdays are for obsessing over homework, QuizBowl, filling out forms, obsessing over homework, and Robotics. Did you see sleeping in those lists?

I glance down at my watch, stained yellow by the dim bulb that lights my room, as well as my life. But, such dim lighting sets a wonderful atmosphere. That and the modern jazz. It makes me feel like I belong somewhere. I suppose that means that I feel that I "belong" in my room.

Now that I think about it, I only started to stay in my room for extended periods of time ever since I obtained a successful Internet connection in my room. I suppose that the dim lighting, jazz, various trinkets, bed, and random gadgets have nothing to do with me "belonging" in my room. It's the sheer fact that my room has access to an alternate universe of information and interactivity, sometimes known as the Internet, that propels me to enjoy my room so much. The atmosphere is just icing on the cake, so to speak.

I have a thing for dim lightbulbs.

I relate to them.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Tomorrow is going to be killer. And it'll be tomorrow in 30 minutes now.

Why is it going to be as such? I have deemed tomorrow to be "killer" status mostly because of the tests I'm going to take. Tests have played many different roles in my mind throughout my life. In elementary school, tests were something that didn't need to be payed any attention to. In middle school, tests became more important, but only the ones for core classes, like math. Now that I'm in high school, every test counts, except the health class and speech class tests. My French test tomorrow is especially important, as my high grade in that class is very weak. My French class has almost no homework ever, no in-class assignments either. Although this creates a sense of security that one will never fail a day-to-day assignment, it also causes grades to become very structurally weak. There are so little points that one soiled test will result in a gun to the head of one's GPA.

Alas, for this reason, I attempt to study. But, my mind never stops wandering, faltering, getting distracted. I figure that my unfocused consciousness exists because of the little sleep I have gotten this week. I've been clocking in about four to five hours a night. Weekends are no exception.

Another thing about lost sleep is that it causes me to be erratic. At times, I can be really zipped up on life, and a few minutes later, I'll be crying on the inside because I've realized that I've done something wrong. Right now, I'm just confused. Studying is difficult when words start to dance on the page.

My eyes fail me.

And to think, I've still got three more tests to study for. I haven't even studied French thoroughly yet. So, I guess that makes it three and a half more tests to study for.

Every night, it's the same routine. This week has gone by so quickly. Partially because the week has felt like one giant day. The little sleep I do get seem like little naps that I'm allowed as a break between work. The things I have to do occupy my mind, fill it to the brim, and so I have no real time to sit down and think, or enjoy life at a standstill. So life just speeds by, and a piece of me dies with every second that passes without being noticed.

I wish my life was just one eternal Thursday. On Friday, I know that Monday is coming soon. And the days that follow Friday are just pure torture, to know impending doom is headed my way. Thursday is crazy enough in itself to help me forget about future Mondays.

Looking down at my watch, I find that tomorrow is within a few minutes. My tests. My tests.

I really feel like collapsing.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I can never sleep, even on the weekends.

Right now, I'm on the downstairs machine, practicing my speed modelling. As of now, I can get from start to finish of modelling of my tank in 7 minutes and 43 seconds. I'm aiming for something like 5 minutes, or maybe 4 minutes, if possible. I've got to work on my eye-hand-monitor coordination, as well as my vertice selecting abilities.

I have ten minutes from typing this very sentence to finish the post, as tomorrow will begin in that time. Now it's nine minutes. I hate not being able to sleep. It just frustrates me, but I have to trudge on like a good soldier. At school today, I was falling apart. Sometimes, I would stare at the wall and not be able to stop. Other times, I would be on the verge of a mental breakdown, lump in the throat, panic in the mind, water in the eyes, hightened senses, the whole bit. And other times I would want to kill myself.

Not being able to go to sleep is like a container of month-old mixed berry yogurt. Mind you, this yogurt has not been kept refrigerated, but instead has been sitting in a warm, humid environment, opened up. I would imagine such a thing would have many unpleasant lumps and colonies of organisms in it. My mind felt like this container of yougurt today. Old, musty, infected, and malignant with tainted thoughts. That's all I can think back to. With this week being like a giant day and all, it's just like all I can think of is myself feeling bad. 100% memory consumption. All of it. Every single recollection of the past five days.

I'm sick of it all. I just want everything to stop for just a second. A fleeting moment.

But, I can't. I have to keep moving forward.

And, I tell myself that progress is a good thing.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Lunesta

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I'm trying to get to sleep earlier on the weekends to recover for my sleepless weekdays, but time seems to fly by due to the fact that my mind is used to functioning in the latest of nights. It's just so hard to walk to bed and start sleeping.

But, actually, to tell you the truth, I'm in bed right now. As a new "bonding" experience of sorts with my old laptop, I've decided to move it about four feet from the desk to my bed. Now, I'm lying in bed, listening to oldies music, updating my blog, and rewriting my speech. I love my old laptop, in all of its PavilionN5130-ness. Computers usually don't age well, but this computer is an exception. I use it very often, it has never failed, is still as snappy as it was they day I got it, and the built-in speakers on it are absolutely marvelous. Back in the day (six years ago), this machine was bought on eBay as a refurb. Now it's sitting with me in bed, dutifully accomplishing tasks and doing its functions. Back in the day, this machine was a "Media Center" themed computer. It's pretty obvious when you see that it has nice, big speakers and an analog video out port. The screen is a meager 800x600, and it's a old-model Celeron, but it does its job, and does it quite well.

Enough about me ranting on about how much I love my laptop. More about today.

Robotics made time pass fast, but nothing like how it is rushing by me right now. The build season is quickly getting nearer and nearer to the end. School never ends. During the summer, it's not going to end. It's not going to end next year, or the year after that. Robotics makes me feel like my life is just one long strip of life, never stopping to let me stop to take a breather. I'm not quite sure if this is a good thing or if it is a bad thing.

I wish I could go back in time and steal time from my past self. I remember in middle school, I had so much time to do just nothing. It was the Age of Boredom, because I had time to be bored.

And how I wish such a time would reappear for just a moment. A day maybe, or perhaps a week.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
It's the end of the week already, and my procrastinating self has yet again put off all important tasks to the last hour.

Before I go to sleep, I must practice my speech, study for my French test, practice my English presentation, and practice my clarinet.

In all honesty, I should have done all of these things earlier. Unfortunately, I have not. Thus, I must rush to accomplish these tasks in the next 55 mins.

Wish me good luck.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
It's going to be one of *those* weeks.

It's midnight, and I've hardly scratched the surface of all the homework and school-affiliated work that is due tomorrow.

If you see me tomorrow, expect me to be either a fritzed lunatic, or zombified.

BANG.

It's officially Tuesday.

Happy Tuesday.

To tell you the truth, I'm not really feeling too happy.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
My computer mouse is frustrating me because the main left button has been responding only sporadically.

By sheer coincidence, this girl who sits in front of me in my AlgebraII class has a broken "." key on her calculator. Her key was only working sporadically also. It makes me begin to think... is it really just a coincidence, or is the government secretly trying to disable our computer input devices in some sort of secret ploy to buy more Microsoft mice.

At least maybe I've found out a use for all of my stashed lunch money. Maybe I can buy a nice mouse or something. Or a nice keyboard. Either would be just fantastic. And it would affect my daily life, as I use both interface devices very often. Such a purchase would surely be a justified one.

Right now, I feel dead. I'll feel dead until the weekend, and then I'll go back to feeling dead again. My life is one long humdrum routine that just keeps getting crazier and crazier.

And I still can't sleep due to my chemistry homework. Bleh.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I'll join you in your sleep-deprived misery. "Misery loves company." they say.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
French class always makes me feel left out.

Today was stage two of the sleep deprivation sequence. I'm not quite sure what happens on stage two, I don't quite remember, but all I know that it made me felt odd all day. Spurts of intense drowsyness hit me around every three hours, while the rest of the time I functioned at a slightly below optimum level.

Wait, I think I was talking about French class.

I begin to wander when my mind is so drenched in the muck of time, mood swings, entropy, etc.

So I walk in. The room is chilling for me. People around me begin to converse with each other. Occasionally, someone will have a quip about how the room is too warm for them. For awhile, I sit there in my chair, dazed, staring at the wall, facinated by the fact that the room is different temperatures for different people. As I stare into the empty reaches of my field of vision, someone's rear end stops in my direct line of sight. A few seconds or so pass before I notice. My reaction time takes even longer. After half a minute, I respond, and shift my eyes away, trying to avert the possible attention that staring at someone's rear end could garner.

My eyes finally respond to my command and move. Attention averted.

Noise begins to slowly filter into my consciousness. The noise slowly becomes sound, then the sounds begin to mutate into words, that begin to clump together to form phrases. My comprehension ends there. In my early-morning dazed state, phrases cannot become sentences, nonetheless paragraphs.

So the phrases formulate thoughts. I realize the conversation is between the teacher and the student in front of me. The student happens to be three years younger than me and in the same class.

I'm too tired to be envious or resentful.

But, I hear them talking about how she knows that people hate her. She's complaining to the teacher. I start to think to myself, "What a suck up.", but then I get hit by a wave of lethargy...

And I think back to this website, that started around three years ago.

And I think back to the things I've written in it.

And I begin to realize that I was rather unintelligent three years ago.

I sit in my desk, slouched over a pile of random French papers and writing utensils, and think to myself, "Who cares?"

And it all made sense to me. Who cares if people hate you? Who cares of there is conflict in the world? Who cares about relationships? Who cares?

And at that infinitesimally mundane, but powerful moment, a little part of my soul was freed. I felt better about all those years of stored anger, resentment, ill-will, rage. I realized that there will always be things that I don't like. So, I accepted. I accepted the fact that happiness isn't normal, accepted the fact that I'll never get enough sleep, accepted the fact that there will always be people better than me, and accepted the fact that my death is inevitable.

I figured it out, and I felt a warm, pure, happy sensation.

And the rest of the day, I was happy on the inside.

So, why did I start off this post with "French class always makes me feel left out."?

Everyone else just kept talking about how the room was too hot.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
I thought you seemed slightly happier than normal when I saw you after lunch.

So, maybe you weren't only happy on the inside. It must have spread to the outside.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Is the week finally over? Or, am I hallucinating again?

For me, nothing is ever over, because the sequence of events that consumes my life continues without stop, no matter how I feel.

The next few weeks will be allocated for rest. Rest so I can tolerate the next week.

Rest... What a joke.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
The room is filled with smoke, noise, and Torino. The scent of artificial muck that the workers of the culinary establishment lather on the wings of dead animals intrigues me. The senseless chatter swells and dies away, like forlorn ocean waves crashing into concrete tide blocks. People around me sit at small, informal groups, eating chicken off of flimsy, cardboard containers, talking of a number of topics ranging from mundane daily events to the latest gossip pertaining to topics that I have no intent to divulge. And allthewhile we are surrounded by large television screens, projected video of various sporting events. But, who is "we"?

Tonight, I attended an informal meeting between QuizBowl members at a local sports and alcohol establishment. I got there early, being transported by a friend. We get there, like I said, early. And the place isn't as crowded as usual, which is surprising to me. We reserve a table, and then grab some handheld game consoles from the counter. The place lets customers use them to play games on the television. A few hours pass while my friend and I tap away on the consoles, trying to figure out how to get past the infuriatingly complex and unfriendly user interface. Time passes. Fifteen minutes pass.

We both finally figure out how to get past the first dialogue box, where one enters a individualized PIN number. The dialogue box discovery fades away into the nothingness of abstract mind space as other fellow quizbowl team members begin to stream into the building. Because of our early arrival, the table is allocated in very little time, 15 minutes.

The team sits down at a table and everyone orders. I don't. Food is of no concern to me. All the talk goes through one ear and comes out of the other, and I feel so distant from my peers, the world, the table I sit at, the flimsy cardboard containers, and my own dinky chair. So very distant, like reality is not actually reality, but a dream.

And everyone talks, smiles, talks, smiles, cracks a joke, eats, smiles, and talks.

I don't.

And it feels distant.

This goes on for hours until the informal gathering is over and it becomes socially acceptable to leave. So I do, running to the local bookstore with my friends. But, even there, I feel cut off, connections not attached, communication difficult, social cues missed. Even the books feel unreadable, my mind detached from the stable ground of the Earth, my body stuck in a depressed stupor.

This was the event I was looking forward to all week.

The fact that I can no longer enjoy such things bothers me so.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Do not worry. It shall pass. Social acceptance is near impossible to master, or even to gain.

Alas, I ought to have made my presence known.

-Fuhe

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
After all of these years, I've found a freeware program that converts .mov files to any flavor of movie file under the sun.

Link: http://www.radgametools.com/bnkmain.htm

And to think, I had been using shareware that put watermarks on all converted videos all this time. Now I know that all of my digital imaging devices are interoperable and fully compatible with each other, and my software. For the first time in a long time, success.

I'm supposed to give a little speech in front of a crowd of people tomorrow at a local high school about my animation. I have no clue what I'm going to say. To tell you the truth, I don't think there's much at all to say. Basically, they gave me a topic, I came up with a storyboard, animated it, and submitted it.

What I'm thinking of doing is just to give the crowd a bit of background of myself, explaining the animation storyboard, and... well, that's all I can think of right now. Because two other animation teams are going to present before me, I believe that they will cover many technical aspects of the animation. Thus, I don't want to plan to explain something that will most likely end up being explained by other people.

But, I think life is a matter of making sure that as many people are pleased as possible. Tomorrow, I will show my animation and the robots will be revealed, and the attendees will be pleased. I work hard to please myself and other people, whether that be my schoolwork or working on posting to this website. All around me, people push themselves, to make the world happy. Really, it's not about accomplishing things, because, what's the point of accomplishing anything if it doesn't impact an individual? There is no point. But, that is not usually the problem as any accomplishment usually results in at least one person being pleased.

Will I conjure up enjoyment in the crowd tomorrow? Will I even escape alive?

Tune in next time for the idiotic self-instigated soap opera of my mundane life.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I had a little bit of spare time this afternoon, so I spent the 70% of the time modelling random things that I pull up from www.imageafter.com and spent 30% of the time re-reading my favorite webcomics.

Re-reading the webcomics really felt like re-entering a comfy, old dream. An ethereal world that disappeared for a few months because of my lack of time. With the bulk of robotics build season winding down, I think I'll spend my newly founded time engaging myself in my old hobby of drawing. As I've found out this afternoon, my drawing skills are surprisingly at the same level as before. That isn't saying much though, I'm a rather poor artist (if I can even call myself that), poor meaning poor in skill. But, I realized that getting into 2d art before 3d CG art really helped accelerate my love and familiarization of both. The best part is that both involve the computer in one way or another. There is a strong connection between 2d and 3d creation skill. It's all about visualization.

But, isn't everything?

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
It's their world, we just live in it.

The matrix has you...

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
In speech class today, the introductory information for the next speech, an impromptu speech, was shoved in our faces.

To come up with information, we were asked to write five general topics, five current events, and a witty quotation.

And it got me thinking all day.

But, in all actuality, half of my school day was spent in either a vegetative state, or in a raving mad state. I half-remember health class. Right now, it seems like a dream. The class is full of rejects anyways. Sleeping helps me blend in with the crowd. The teacher passed out random papers and ranted on about "stress" and a bunch of other information that we learned in preschool. The usual.

Currently, I'm in a love-hate relationship with health class. I hate it with a passion, as I sit between two mentally handicapped lads and a bunch of 2-year algebra flunkers.

I understand that I'm supposed to be sensitive when it comes to mentally handicapped people, but I can't lie. They drive me nuts. Their state of mind is coherent enough to fluently converse with other humans, but they both have control issues. One lad has an issue with anger, which he controls though religion. I heard him today in class about how he had to "repent for his sins". I found it facinating that religion is omnipotent in society, no matter what state of mind one is in. When people do not listen to him, he gets loud and starts to yell. The fact that his voicebox is constantly within three feet of my ears bothers me in these times of crisis.

The other lad also has a problem controlling his voice. During the beginning of the period, announcements are played from the television in the classroom. Because the general population of the class is of a lower intelligence, talking usually covers up the voices coming from the television. When this happens, the lad I mentioned earlier begins to scream. The fact that his voicebox is constantly within two feet of my ears bothers me. Not to mention the fact that he does this every day. He also obsessively loves sports. This irritates me so very much.

Like I said, I'm being an insensitive bastard by complaining about how these handicapped people bother me, and I understand that they cannot physically control themselves due to their modified anatomy, but sometimes, I want to pull out a gun or a bat and whack them senseless to a fucking bloody pulp.

So, I suppose the last sentence accurately sums up how I usually feel like in health class. But, today, I mostly slept. So this is where the "love" part of the "love-hate" relationship comes in. I love the fact that the teacher has been desensitized to all negative behavior that she tolerates it. I sleep, and she doesn't even notice. So, I can get my daily 40 minutes of sleep every day. Definitely a positive aspect to an otherwise negative class.

Then comes English class, where the teacher is a bastard social reformist.

She attempted to force-feed her viewpoint on the words "poignant" and "pungent" today. According to her, "poignant" has nothing to do with taste or smell. Because of this "definitive information", she decided to count off points on our vocabulary exam if we mentioned taste or smell in a question involving using "poignant" in a sentence.

I completely disagree with her teachings, as taste and smell are distinctly mentioned in our vocabulary book and Merriam-Webster's Collegiate® Dictionary Eleventh Edition.

The real question to ask in this situation is, "Should I trust Merriam-Webster, or infuriating English teacher?"

The answer to this question is clear, but how she handled disagreements was what riled me up the most.

A student politely walked up to her, after she stated that "If anyone has any questions, don't be afraid to come up to me." The student showed her the textbook definitions, as well as his exam, trying to explain that the textbook mentions taste and smell. The teacher bluntly told the student that he was wrong, and that his sentence was unacceptable. The student tried to explain again, but the teacher firmly stood her ground and finally asked, "Is it clear to you now?" Finally understanding that he was a subordinate, the student nodded and sat back down.

This kind of bullshit in our education system absolutely disgusts me.

What kind of teacher doesn't accept a mistake in their logic, even after textbook evidence is shown? What kind of asshole teacher can't even comprehend the fact that they can be wrong too? What kind of motherfucking, bastard teacher won't listen to the voice of reason?

Unfortunately, the answer to those questions is all too obvious for me.

My English teacher.

When she said, "If anyone has any questions, don't be afraid to come up to me.", she really meant, "I am always right. You are always wrong. My judgement is non-negotiable."

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Today my English teacher was absent.

Thus, today's mood improved tenfold.

The rumor is that she had a mental breakdown at "the Academy" that she teaches at before she comes to my school. I heard from a friend that she supposedly cursed at her students and went bonkers.

I hope she doesn't come back.

But, I know she will.

Besides my English teacher's temporary demise, I've encountered a number of high-tension social situations today.

One such situation was when I was rude to someone before lunch. Due to my unacceptable order to leave me alone (which can be attributed to Health class, which I have right before lunch) caused a girl that I know to hate me for the day.

The following hours were full of heavy guilt and self-hate. That made my day worse by tenfold.

But, a few hours ago, I sent an apology email to her explaining my situation and pleading for forgiveness.

Luckily, I just recieved an email from her that stated her acceptance of my apology.

Such a happy ending to a rather odd situation. The whole scenario demonstrates the importance of proper apologies. If I hadn't taken the time to write her my apology email, she would still hate me right now. Because I had taken evasive action to avoid future conflicts (by apologizing), I have secured a relationship that may or may not positively affect my life in the future.

And now, I realize the importance of having other people "on your side" so to speak. No matter how weak, no matter how unimportant seeming, everyone is a contribution to the big pool of power that one must continuously harvest to survive in a cutthroat world. The philosophy is, the more people that you are on "good terms" with, the more people that can help you in a time of crisis. I find this concept facinating, as it seems to me like a sort of social insurance. All people should take great care in keeping relationships favorable. That's my two cents involving relationships, anyways. It's a rare thing to see me giving out relationship advice.

Another thing that I've realized...

Just like in books, people have distinct character roles that can either be flat or round. I know plenty of "shallow" people that seem rather lacking in depth, whether it be mental depth, emotional depth, social depth, or physical depth. Then again, I know quite a few people who are very "deep", so to speak. The people I attach onto so dearly and dependently are these people. Depth adds so much quality to one's overall human persona.

In middle school, depth was difficult to find. Now that I'm in high school, I know so many more complicated, sophisticated, intelligent, and deep people. I think middle school was a bad experience because of this fact.

Just something to be thankful about.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: with "the more people that you are on 'good terms' with, the more people that can help you in a time of crisis" you could look at as "the more people you are in 'good terms' with, the more people you torture --*ahem* I mean help in their time of crisis" 0;)

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I look at the watch and I realize that it's already the next day.

But, I take to heart my core philosophy, "Life isn't worth living if you're not making one". "Making a living" in the sense of earning money is not what I mean, but I mean the act of doing something.

To make a short story even shorter, I started modelling and couldn't stop. Now it's Thursday and I haven't gotten any sleep yet.

Not sleeping is supposedly a treatment for depressed people. I think it's working, because I'm too loopy to be angry or sad at anything at the moment.

So, I guess not sleeping has its pros as well as its cons. Or perhaps I'm just trying to justify my messed up biological clock.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful.

The pressures of life melt away during sleep deprivation mode. All the things that have been plaguing my mind, distorting my emotions, destroying my self-esteem, all of those things have ceased to exist for this very short moment.

And the most wonderful thing about it is that I know that I can sleep in three periods at school tomorrow. French, Health, and Lunch are open periods in which I can sleep. Sleep feels better at school anyways. Why sleep when you have access to a kickin' computer and the Internet?

For the longest time, I was a purist about sleep and getting enough of it. Now I've come to see that sleep can be brushed off the schedule, and things still get done. The world doesn't come to a crashing halt. My organs don't shrivel up and die. All throughout life, health educators have inferred to children that the "recommended" daily amount of sleep is actually the "required" daily amount of sleep. At least, that's how I felt when those silly health teachers lectured about things involving sleep.

For me, less sleep results in more work getting done, more recreational time, less stress, a better mindset, and being more up-to-date on tech news. Side effects are drowsyness, occasional vomiting, and dry eyes. Lack of sleep sounds to me like just another anti-depressant. Except I don't need the FDA's express approval to apply this solution.

There will be a day when sleep is obsolete.

item.dc:creator: ryochiba
item.content:encoded:
I read a wonderful manifesto by Cory Doctorow that informed me further about the future of digital rights management. It was so marvelous that I printed it out (all 34 pages of it).

I don't usually copy and paste a whole address in one post, but I think everyone should read it. So, here begins my pasteage.

*Note: PDF can be found here: http://www.changethis.com/4.DRM


----------------------------------------
Microsoft Research DRM talk
Cory Doctorow (cory@eff.org), June 17, 2004

This talk was originally given to Microsoft's Research Group and other interested parties from within the company at their Redmond offices on June 17, 2004. (See public domain notice.)

EFF website: EFF (Donate)
